    13. 
          
          
          # = mutex_m.rb
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
          #
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
          # When 'mutex_m' is required, any object that extends or includes Mutex_m will
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
          # be treated like a Mutex.
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          #
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
          # Start by requiring the standard library Mutex_m:
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
          #
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
          #   require "mutex_m.rb"
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
          #
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
          # From here you can extend an object with Mutex instance methods:
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
          #
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
          #   obj = Object.new
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
          #   obj.extend Mutex_m
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
          #
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
          # Or mixin Mutex_m into your module to your class inherit Mutex instance
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
          # methods --- remember to call super() in your class initialize method.
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
          #
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
          #   class Foo
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
          #     include Mutex_m
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
          #     def initialize
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
          #       # ...
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
          #       super()
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
          #     end
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
          #     # ...
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
          #   end
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
          #   obj = Foo.new
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
          #   # this obj can be handled like Mutex
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
          #
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          1
          
          module Mutex_m
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
          
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          1
          
            VERSION = "0.1.0"
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
          
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          1
          
            def Mutex_m.define_aliases(cl) # :nodoc:
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          1
          
              cl.module_eval %q{
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                alias locked? mu_locked?
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                alias lock mu_lock
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                alias unlock mu_unlock
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                alias try_lock mu_try_lock
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                alias synchronize mu_synchronize
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
              }
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
            end
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
          
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          1
          
            def Mutex_m.append_features(cl) # :nodoc:
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          1
          
              super
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          1
          
              define_aliases(cl) unless cl.instance_of?(Module)
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
            end
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
          
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          1
          
            def Mutex_m.extend_object(obj) # :nodoc:
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
              super
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
              obj.mu_extended
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
            end
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
          
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          1
          
            def mu_extended # :nodoc:
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
              unless (defined? locked? and
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                      defined? lock and
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                      defined? unlock and
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                      defined? try_lock and
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                      defined? synchronize)
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                Mutex_m.define_aliases(singleton_class)
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
              end
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
              mu_initialize
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
            end
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
          
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
            # See Mutex#synchronize
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          1
          
            def mu_synchronize(&block)
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
              @_mutex.synchronize(&block)
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
            end
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
          
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
            # See Mutex#locked?
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          1
          
            def mu_locked?
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
              @_mutex.locked?
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
            end
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
          
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
            # See Mutex#try_lock
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          1
          
            def mu_try_lock
        
      88.

      89.

            end
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
          
        
      91.

            # See Mutex#lock

            end

      97.

            end
        
      100.

      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
            # See Mutex#sleep
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          1
          
            def sleep(timeout = nil)
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
              @_mutex.sleep(timeout)
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
            end
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
          
        
      106.

            def mu_initialize # :nodoc:
        
      109.

          3
          
              @_mutex = Thread::Mutex.new
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
            end

    3. 
          
          
          # = net/http.rb
        
      4.

      5.

      6.

      10. 
      
        
    10.

      11. 
      
        
    11.

      12.

          # This file is derived from "http-access.rb".
        
      13.

      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
          # Documented by Minero Aoki; converted to RDoc by William Webber.
        
      15.

      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
          # This program is free software. You can re-distribute and/or

      18.

      19.

      20.

          # See Net::HTTP for an overview and examples.

          1
          
          require_relative 'protocol'
        
      24.

          1
          
          require 'uri'

      26.

          1
          
          module Net   #:nodoc:
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
          
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
            # :stopdoc:
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          1
          
            class HTTPBadResponse < StandardError; end
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          1
          
            class HTTPHeaderSyntaxError < StandardError; end
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
            # :startdoc:
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
          
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
            # == An HTTP client API for Ruby.
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
            #
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
            # Net::HTTP provides a rich library which can be used to build HTTP
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
            # user-agents.  For more details about HTTP see
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
            # [RFC2616](http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2616.txt).
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
            #
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
            # Net::HTTP is designed to work closely with URI.  URI::HTTP#host,
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
            # URI::HTTP#port and URI::HTTP#request_uri are designed to work with
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
            # Net::HTTP.
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
            #
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
            # If you are only performing a few GET requests you should try OpenURI.
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
            #
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
            # == Simple Examples
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
            #
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
            # All examples assume you have loaded Net::HTTP with:
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
            #
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
            #   require 'net/http'
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
            #
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
            # This will also require 'uri' so you don't need to require it separately.
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
            #
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
            # The Net::HTTP methods in the following section do not persist
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
            # connections.  They are not recommended if you are performing many HTTP
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
            # requests.
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
            #
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
            # === GET
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
            #
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
            #   Net::HTTP.get('example.com', '/index.html') # => String
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
            #
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
            # === GET by URI
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
            #
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
            #   uri = URI('http://example.com/index.html?count=10')
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
            #   Net::HTTP.get(uri) # => String
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
            #
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
            # === GET with Dynamic Parameters
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
            #
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
            #   uri = URI('http://example.com/index.html')
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
            #   params = { :limit => 10, :page => 3 }
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
            #   uri.query = URI.encode_www_form(params)
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
            #
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
            #   res = Net::HTTP.get_response(uri)
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
            #   puts res.body if res.is_a?(Net::HTTPSuccess)
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
            #
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
            # === POST
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
            #
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
            #   uri = URI('http://www.example.com/search.cgi')
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
            #   res = Net::HTTP.post_form(uri, 'q' => 'ruby', 'max' => '50')
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
            #   puts res.body
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
            #
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
            # === POST with Multiple Values
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
            #
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
            #   uri = URI('http://www.example.com/search.cgi')
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
            #   res = Net::HTTP.post_form(uri, 'q' => ['ruby', 'perl'], 'max' => '50')
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
            #   puts res.body
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
            #
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
            # == How to use Net::HTTP
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
            #
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
            # The following example code can be used as the basis of an HTTP user-agent
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
            # which can perform a variety of request types using persistent
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
            # connections.
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
            #
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
            #   uri = URI('http://example.com/some_path?query=string')
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
            #
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
            #   Net::HTTP.start(uri.host, uri.port) do |http|
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
            #     request = Net::HTTP::Get.new uri
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
            #
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
            #     response = http.request request # Net::HTTPResponse object
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
            #   end
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
            #
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
            # Net::HTTP::start immediately creates a connection to an HTTP server which
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
            # is kept open for the duration of the block.  The connection will remain
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
            # open for multiple requests in the block if the server indicates it
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
            # supports persistent connections.
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
            #
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
            # If you wish to re-use a connection across multiple HTTP requests without
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
            # automatically closing it you can use ::new and then call #start and
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
            # #finish manually.
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
            #
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
            # The request types Net::HTTP supports are listed below in the section "HTTP
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
            # Request Classes".
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
            #
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
            # For all the Net::HTTP request objects and shortcut request methods you may
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
            # supply either a String for the request path or a URI from which Net::HTTP
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
            # will extract the request path.
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
            #
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
            # === Response Data
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
            #
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
            #   uri = URI('http://example.com/index.html')
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
            #   res = Net::HTTP.get_response(uri)
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
            #
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
            #   # Headers
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
            #   res['Set-Cookie']            # => String
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
            #   res.get_fields('set-cookie') # => Array
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
            #   res.to_hash['set-cookie']    # => Array
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
            #   puts "Headers: #{res.to_hash.inspect}"
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
            #
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
            #   # Status
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
            #   puts res.code       # => '200'
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
            #   puts res.message    # => 'OK'
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
            #   puts res.class.name # => 'HTTPOK'
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
            #
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
            #   # Body
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
            #   puts res.body if res.response_body_permitted?
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
            #
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
            # === Following Redirection
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
            #
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
            # Each Net::HTTPResponse object belongs to a class for its response code.
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
            #
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
            # For example, all 2XX responses are instances of a Net::HTTPSuccess
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
            # subclass, a 3XX response is an instance of a Net::HTTPRedirection
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
            # subclass and a 200 response is an instance of the Net::HTTPOK class.  For
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
            # details of response classes, see the section "HTTP Response Classes"
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
            # below.
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
            #
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
            # Using a case statement you can handle various types of responses properly:
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
            #
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
            #   def fetch(uri_str, limit = 10)
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
            #     # You should choose a better exception.
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
            #     raise ArgumentError, 'too many HTTP redirects' if limit == 0
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
            #
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
            #     response = Net::HTTP.get_response(URI(uri_str))
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
            #
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
            #     case response
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
            #     when Net::HTTPSuccess then
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
            #       response
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
            #     when Net::HTTPRedirection then
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
            #       location = response['location']
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
            #       warn "redirected to #{location}"
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
            #       fetch(location, limit - 1)
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
            #     else
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
            #       response.value
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
            #     end
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
            #   end
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
            #
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
            #   print fetch('http://www.ruby-lang.org')
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
            #
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
            # === POST
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
            #
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
            # A POST can be made using the Net::HTTP::Post request class.  This example
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
            # creates a URL encoded POST body:
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
            #
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
            #   uri = URI('http://www.example.com/todo.cgi')
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
            #   req = Net::HTTP::Post.new(uri)
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
            #   req.set_form_data('from' => '2005-01-01', 'to' => '2005-03-31')
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
            #
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
            #   res = Net::HTTP.start(uri.hostname, uri.port) do |http|
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
            #     http.request(req)
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
            #   end
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
            #
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
            #   case res
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
            #   when Net::HTTPSuccess, Net::HTTPRedirection
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
            #     # OK
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
            #   else
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
            #     res.value
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
            #   end
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
            #
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
            # To send multipart/form-data use Net::HTTPHeader#set_form:
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
            #
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
            #   req = Net::HTTP::Post.new(uri)
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
            #   req.set_form([['upload', File.open('foo.bar')]], 'multipart/form-data')
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
            #
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
            # Other requests that can contain a body such as PUT can be created in the
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
            # same way using the corresponding request class (Net::HTTP::Put).
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
            #
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
            # === Setting Headers
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
            #
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
            # The following example performs a conditional GET using the
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
            # If-Modified-Since header.  If the files has not been modified since the
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
            # time in the header a Not Modified response will be returned.  See RFC 2616
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
            # section 9.3 for further details.
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
            #
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
            #   uri = URI('http://example.com/cached_response')
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
            #   file = File.stat 'cached_response'
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
            #
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
            #   req = Net::HTTP::Get.new(uri)
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
            #   req['If-Modified-Since'] = file.mtime.rfc2822
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
            #
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
            #   res = Net::HTTP.start(uri.hostname, uri.port) {|http|
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
            #     http.request(req)
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
            #
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
            #   open 'cached_response', 'w' do |io|
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
            #     io.write res.body
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
            #   end if res.is_a?(Net::HTTPSuccess)
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
            #
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
            # === Basic Authentication
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
            #
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
            # Basic authentication is performed according to
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
            # [RFC2617](http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2617.txt).
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
            #
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
            #   uri = URI('http://example.com/index.html?key=value')
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
            #
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
            #   req = Net::HTTP::Get.new(uri)
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
            #   req.basic_auth 'user', 'pass'
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
            #
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
            #   res = Net::HTTP.start(uri.hostname, uri.port) {|http|
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
            #     http.request(req)
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
            #   puts res.body
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
            #
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
            # === Streaming Response Bodies
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
            #
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
            # By default Net::HTTP reads an entire response into memory.  If you are
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
            # handling large files or wish to implement a progress bar you can instead
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
            # stream the body directly to an IO.
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
            #
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
            #   uri = URI('http://example.com/large_file')
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
            #
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
            #   Net::HTTP.start(uri.host, uri.port) do |http|
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
            #     request = Net::HTTP::Get.new uri
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
            #
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
            #     http.request request do |response|
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
            #       open 'large_file', 'w' do |io|
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
            #         response.read_body do |chunk|
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
            #           io.write chunk
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
            #         end
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
            #       end
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
            #     end
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
            #   end
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
            #
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
            # === HTTPS
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
            #
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
            # HTTPS is enabled for an HTTP connection by Net::HTTP#use_ssl=.
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
            #
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
            #   uri = URI('https://secure.example.com/some_path?query=string')
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
            #
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
            #   Net::HTTP.start(uri.host, uri.port, :use_ssl => true) do |http|
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
            #     request = Net::HTTP::Get.new uri
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
            #     response = http.request request # Net::HTTPResponse object
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
            #   end
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
            #
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
            # Or if you simply want to make a GET request, you may pass in an URI
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
            # object that has an HTTPS URL. Net::HTTP automatically turns on TLS
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
            # verification if the URI object has a 'https' URI scheme.
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
            #
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
            #   uri = URI('https://example.com/')
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
            #   Net::HTTP.get(uri) # => String
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
            #
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
            # In previous versions of Ruby you would need to require 'net/https' to use
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
            # HTTPS. This is no longer true.
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
            #
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
            # === Proxies
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
            #
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
            # Net::HTTP will automatically create a proxy from the +http_proxy+
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
            # environment variable if it is present.  To disable use of +http_proxy+,
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
            # pass +nil+ for the proxy address.
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
            #
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
            # You may also create a custom proxy:
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
            #
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
            #   proxy_addr = 'your.proxy.host'
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
            #   proxy_port = 8080
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
            #
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
            #   Net::HTTP.new('example.com', nil, proxy_addr, proxy_port).start { |http|
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
            #     # always proxy via your.proxy.addr:8080
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
            #
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
            # See Net::HTTP.new for further details and examples such as proxies that
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
            # require a username and password.
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
            #
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
            # === Compression
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
            #
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
            # Net::HTTP automatically adds Accept-Encoding for compression of response
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
            # bodies and automatically decompresses gzip and deflate responses unless a
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
            # Range header was sent.
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
            #
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
            # Compression can be disabled through the Accept-Encoding: identity header.
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
            #
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
            # == HTTP Request Classes
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
            #
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
            # Here is the HTTP request class hierarchy.
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
            #
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
            # * Net::HTTPRequest
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
            #   * Net::HTTP::Get
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          
          
            #   * Net::HTTP::Head
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
            #   * Net::HTTP::Post
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
            #   * Net::HTTP::Patch
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
            #   * Net::HTTP::Put
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
            #   * Net::HTTP::Proppatch
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
            #   * Net::HTTP::Lock
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
            #   * Net::HTTP::Unlock
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
            #   * Net::HTTP::Options
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
            #   * Net::HTTP::Propfind
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
            #   * Net::HTTP::Delete
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
            #   * Net::HTTP::Move
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
            #   * Net::HTTP::Copy
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
            #   * Net::HTTP::Mkcol
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
            #   * Net::HTTP::Trace
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
            #
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
            # == HTTP Response Classes
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
            #
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
            # Here is HTTP response class hierarchy.  All classes are defined in Net
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
            # module and are subclasses of Net::HTTPResponse.
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
            #
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
            # HTTPUnknownResponse:: For unhandled HTTP extensions
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
            # HTTPInformation::                    1xx
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
            #   HTTPContinue::                        100
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
            #   HTTPSwitchProtocol::                  101
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
            # HTTPSuccess::                        2xx
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
            #   HTTPOK::                              200
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
            #   HTTPCreated::                         201
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
            #   HTTPAccepted::                        202
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
            #   HTTPNonAuthoritativeInformation::     203
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
            #   HTTPNoContent::                       204
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
            #   HTTPResetContent::                    205
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
            #   HTTPPartialContent::                  206
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
            #   HTTPMultiStatus::                     207
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
            #   HTTPIMUsed::                          226
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
            # HTTPRedirection::                    3xx
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
            #   HTTPMultipleChoices::                 300
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
            #   HTTPMovedPermanently::                301
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
            #   HTTPFound::                           302
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
            #   HTTPSeeOther::                        303
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
            #   HTTPNotModified::                     304
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
            #   HTTPUseProxy::                        305
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          
          
            #   HTTPTemporaryRedirect::               307
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
            # HTTPClientError::                    4xx
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
            #   HTTPBadRequest::                      400
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
            #   HTTPUnauthorized::                    401
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
            #   HTTPPaymentRequired::                 402
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
            #   HTTPForbidden::                       403
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
            #   HTTPNotFound::                        404
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
            #   HTTPMethodNotAllowed::                405
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
            #   HTTPNotAcceptable::                   406
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          
          
            #   HTTPProxyAuthenticationRequired::     407
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
            #   HTTPRequestTimeOut::                  408
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
            #   HTTPConflict::                        409
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
            #   HTTPGone::                            410
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
            #   HTTPLengthRequired::                  411
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
            #   HTTPPreconditionFailed::              412
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          
          
            #   HTTPRequestEntityTooLarge::           413
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
            #   HTTPRequestURITooLong::               414
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          
          
            #   HTTPUnsupportedMediaType::            415
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          
          
            #   HTTPRequestedRangeNotSatisfiable::    416
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
            #   HTTPExpectationFailed::               417
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          
          
            #   HTTPUnprocessableEntity::             422
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
            #   HTTPLocked::                          423
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
            #   HTTPFailedDependency::                424
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          
          
            #   HTTPUpgradeRequired::                 426
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          
          
            #   HTTPPreconditionRequired::            428
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
            #   HTTPTooManyRequests::                 429
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
            #   HTTPRequestHeaderFieldsTooLarge::     431
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
            #   HTTPUnavailableForLegalReasons::      451
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
            # HTTPServerError::                    5xx
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
            #   HTTPInternalServerError::             500
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
            #   HTTPNotImplemented::                  501
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          
          
            #   HTTPBadGateway::                      502
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
            #   HTTPServiceUnavailable::              503
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
            #   HTTPGatewayTimeOut::                  504
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
            #   HTTPVersionNotSupported::             505
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
            #   HTTPInsufficientStorage::             507
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
            #   HTTPNetworkAuthenticationRequired::   511
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          
          
            #
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
            # There is also the Net::HTTPBadResponse exception which is raised when
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          
          
            # there is a protocol error.
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
            #
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          1
          
            class HTTP < Protocol
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
          
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
              # :stopdoc:
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          1
          
              Revision = %q$Revision: 66401 $.split[1]
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          1
          
              HTTPVersion = '1.1'
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
              begin
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          1
          
                require 'zlib'
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          1
          
                require 'stringio'  #for our purposes (unpacking gzip) lump these together
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          1
          
                HAVE_ZLIB=true
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          
          
              rescue LoadError
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
                HAVE_ZLIB=false
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          
          
              end
        
      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          
          
              # :startdoc:
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          
          
          
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          
          
              # Turns on net/http 1.2 (Ruby 1.8) features.
        
      403. 
      
        
    403. 
          
          
              # Defaults to ON in Ruby 1.8 or later.
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          1
          
              def HTTP.version_1_2
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          
          
                true
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
              end
        
      407. 
      
        
    407. 
          
          
          
        
      408. 
      
        
    408. 
          
          
              # Returns true if net/http is in version 1.2 mode.
        
      409. 
      
        
    409. 
          
          
              # Defaults to true.
        
      410. 
      
        
    410. 
          1
          
              def HTTP.version_1_2?
        
      411. 
      
        
    411. 
          
          
                true
        
      412. 
      
        
    412. 
          
          
              end
        
      413. 
      
        
    413. 
          
          
          
        
      414. 
      
        
    414. 
          1
          
              def HTTP.version_1_1?  #:nodoc:
        
      415. 
      
        
    415. 
          
          
                false
        
      416. 
      
        
    416. 
          
          
              end
        
      417. 
      
        
    417. 
          
          
          
        
      418. 
      
        
    418. 
          1
          
              class << HTTP
        
      419. 
      
        
    419. 
          1
          
                alias is_version_1_1? version_1_1?   #:nodoc:
        
      420. 
      
        
    420. 
          1
          
                alias is_version_1_2? version_1_2?   #:nodoc:
        
      421. 
      
        
    421. 
          
          
              end
        
      422. 
      
        
    422. 
          
          
          
        
      423. 
      
        
    423. 
          
          
              #
        
      424. 
      
        
    424. 
          
          
              # short cut methods
        
      425. 
      
        
    425. 
          
          
              #
        
      426. 
      
        
    426. 
          
          
          
        
      427. 
      
        
    427. 
          
          
              #
        
      428. 
      
        
    428. 
          
          
              # Gets the body text from the target and outputs it to $stdout.  The
        
      429. 
      
        
    429. 
          
          
              # target can either be specified as
        
      430. 
      
        
    430. 
          
          
              # (+uri+), or as (+host+, +path+, +port+ = 80); so:
        
      431. 
      
        
    431. 
          
          
              #
        
      432. 
      
        
    432. 
          
          
              #    Net::HTTP.get_print URI('http://www.example.com/index.html')
        
      433. 
      
        
    433. 
          
          
              #
        
      434. 
      
        
    434. 
          
          
              # or:
        
      435. 
      
        
    435. 
          
          
              #
        
      436. 
      
        
    436. 
          
          
              #    Net::HTTP.get_print 'www.example.com', '/index.html'
        
      437. 
      
        
    437. 
          
          
              #
        
      438. 
      
        
    438. 
          1
          
              def HTTP.get_print(uri_or_host, path = nil, port = nil)
        
      439. 
      
        
    439. 
          
          
                get_response(uri_or_host, path, port) {|res|
        
      440. 
      
        
    440. 
          
          
                  res.read_body do |chunk|
        
      441. 
      
        
    441. 
          
          
                    $stdout.print chunk
        
      442. 
      
        
    442. 
          
          
                  end
        
      443. 
      
        
    443. 
          
          
                }
        
      444. 
      
        
    444. 
          
          
                nil
        
      445. 
      
        
    445. 
          
          
              end
        
      446. 
      
        
    446. 
          
          
          
        
      447. 
      
        
    447. 
          
          
              # Sends a GET request to the target and returns the HTTP response
        
      448. 
      
        
    448. 
          
          
              # as a string.  The target can either be specified as
        
      449. 
      
        
    449. 
          
          
              # (+uri+), or as (+host+, +path+, +port+ = 80); so:
        
      450. 
      
        
    450. 
          
          
              #
        
      451. 
      
        
    451. 
          
          
              #    print Net::HTTP.get(URI('http://www.example.com/index.html'))
        
      452. 
      
        
    452. 
          
          
              #
        
      453. 
      
        
    453. 
          
          
              # or:
        
      454. 
      
        
    454. 
          
          
              #
        
      455. 
      
        
    455. 
          
          
              #    print Net::HTTP.get('www.example.com', '/index.html')
        
      456. 
      
        
    456. 
          
          
              #
        
      457. 
      
        
    457. 
          1
          
              def HTTP.get(uri_or_host, path = nil, port = nil)
        
      458. 
      
        
    458. 
          
          
                get_response(uri_or_host, path, port).body
        
      459. 
      
        
    459. 
          
          
              end
        
      460. 
      
        
    460. 
          
          
          
        
      461. 
      
        
    461. 
          
          
              # Sends a GET request to the target and returns the HTTP response
        
      462. 
      
        
    462. 
          
          
              # as a Net::HTTPResponse object.  The target can either be specified as
        
      463. 
      
        
    463. 
          
          
              # (+uri+), or as (+host+, +path+, +port+ = 80); so:
        
      464. 
      
        
    464. 
          
          
              #
        
      465. 
      
        
    465. 
          
          
              #    res = Net::HTTP.get_response(URI('http://www.example.com/index.html'))
        
      466. 
      
        
    466. 
          
          
              #    print res.body
        
      467. 
      
        
    467. 
          
          
              #
        
      468. 
      
        
    468. 
          
          
              # or:
        
      469. 
      
        
    469. 
          
          
              #
        
      470. 
      
        
    470. 
          
          
              #    res = Net::HTTP.get_response('www.example.com', '/index.html')
        
      471. 
      
        
    471. 
          
          
              #    print res.body
        
      472. 
      
        
    472. 
          
          
              #
        
      473. 
      
        
    473. 
          1
          
              def HTTP.get_response(uri_or_host, path = nil, port = nil, &block)
        
      474. 
      
        
    474. 
          
          
                if path
        
      475. 
      
        
    475. 
          
          
                  host = uri_or_host
        
      476. 
      
        
    476. 
          
          
                  new(host, port || HTTP.default_port).start {|http|
        
      477. 
      
        
    477. 
          
          
                    return http.request_get(path, &block)
        
      478. 
      
        
    478. 
          
          
                  }
        
      479. 
      
        
    479. 
          
          
                else
        
      480. 
      
        
    480. 
          
          
                  uri = uri_or_host
        
      481. 
      
        
    481. 
          
          
                  start(uri.hostname, uri.port,
        
      482. 
      
        
    482. 
          
          
                        :use_ssl => uri.scheme == 'https') {|http|
        
      483. 
      
        
    483. 
          
          
                    return http.request_get(uri, &block)
        
      484. 
      
        
    484. 
          
          
                  }
        
      485. 
      
        
    485. 
          
          
                end
        
      486. 
      
        
    486. 
          
          
              end
        
      487. 
      
        
    487. 
          
          
          
        
      488. 
      
        
    488. 
          
          
              # Posts data to the specified URI object.
        
      489. 
      
        
    489. 
          
          
              #
        
      490. 
      
        
    490. 
          
          
              # Example:
        
      491. 
      
        
    491. 
          
          
              #
        
      492. 
      
        
    492. 
          
          
              #   require 'net/http'
        
      493. 
      
        
    493. 
          
          
              #   require 'uri'
        
      494. 
      
        
    494. 
          
          
              #
        
      495. 
      
        
    495. 
          
          
              #   Net::HTTP.post URI('http://www.example.com/api/search'),
        
      496. 
      
        
    496. 
          
          
              #                  { "q" => "ruby", "max" => "50" }.to_json,
        
      497. 
      
        
    497. 
          
          
              #                  "Content-Type" => "application/json"
        
      498. 
      
        
    498. 
          
          
              #
        
      499. 
      
        
    499. 
          1
          
              def HTTP.post(url, data, header = nil)
        
      500. 
      
        
    500. 
          
          
                start(url.hostname, url.port,
        
      501. 
      
        
    501. 
          
          
                      :use_ssl => url.scheme == 'https' ) {|http|
        
      502. 
      
        
    502. 
          
          
                  http.post(url, data, header)
        
      503. 
      
        
    503. 
          
          
                }
        
      504. 
      
        
    504. 
          
          
              end
        
      505. 
      
        
    505. 
          
          
          
        
      506. 
      
        
    506. 
          
          
              # Posts HTML form data to the specified URI object.
        
      507. 
      
        
    507. 
          
          
              # The form data must be provided as a Hash mapping from String to String.
        
      508. 
      
        
    508. 
          
          
              # Example:
        
      509. 
      
        
    509. 
          
          
              #
        
      510. 
      
        
    510. 
          
          
              #   { "cmd" => "search", "q" => "ruby", "max" => "50" }
        
      511. 
      
        
    511. 
          
          
              #
        
      512. 
      
        
    512. 
          
          
              # This method also does Basic Authentication iff +url+.user exists.
        
      513. 
      
        
    513. 
          
          
              # But userinfo for authentication is deprecated (RFC3986).
        
      514. 
      
        
    514. 
          
          
              # So this feature will be removed.
        
      515. 
      
        
    515. 
          
          
              #
        
      516. 
      
        
    516. 
          
          
              # Example:
        
      517. 
      
        
    517. 
          
          
              #
        
      518. 
      
        
    518. 
          
          
              #   require 'net/http'
        
      519. 
      
        
    519. 
          
          
              #   require 'uri'
        
      520. 
      
        
    520. 
          
          
              #
        
      521. 
      
        
    521. 
          
          
              #   Net::HTTP.post_form URI('http://www.example.com/search.cgi'),
        
      522. 
      
        
    522. 
          
          
              #                       { "q" => "ruby", "max" => "50" }
        
      523. 
      
        
    523. 
          
          
              #
        
      524. 
      
        
    524. 
          1
          
              def HTTP.post_form(url, params)
        
      525. 
      
        
    525. 
          
          
                req = Post.new(url)
        
      526. 
      
        
    526. 
          
          
                req.form_data = params
        
      527. 
      
        
    527. 
          
          
                req.basic_auth url.user, url.password if url.user
        
      528. 
      
        
    528. 
          
          
                start(url.hostname, url.port,
        
      529. 
      
        
    529. 
          
          
                      :use_ssl => url.scheme == 'https' ) {|http|
        
      530. 
      
        
    530. 
          
          
                  http.request(req)
        
      531. 
      
        
    531. 
          
          
                }
        
      532. 
      
        
    532. 
          
          
              end
        
      533. 
      
        
    533. 
          
          
          
        
      534. 
      
        
    534. 
          
          
              #
        
      535. 
      
        
    535. 
          
          
              # HTTP session management
        
      536. 
      
        
    536. 
          
          
              #
        
      537. 
      
        
    537. 
          
          
          
        
      538. 
      
        
    538. 
          
          
              # The default port to use for HTTP requests; defaults to 80.
        
      539. 
      
        
    539. 
          1
          
              def HTTP.default_port
        
      540. 
      
        
    540. 
          
          
                http_default_port()
        
      541. 
      
        
    541. 
          
          
              end
        
      542. 
      
        
    542. 
          
          
          
        
      543. 
      
        
    543. 
          
          
              # The default port to use for HTTP requests; defaults to 80.
        
      544. 
      
        
    544. 
          1
          
              def HTTP.http_default_port
        
      545. 
      
        
    545. 
          
          
                80
        
      546. 
      
        
    546. 
          
          
              end
        
      547. 
      
        
    547. 
          
          
          
        
      548. 
      
        
    548. 
          
          
              # The default port to use for HTTPS requests; defaults to 443.
        
      549. 
      
        
    549. 
          1
          
              def HTTP.https_default_port
        
      550. 
      
        
    550. 
          
          
                443
        
      551. 
      
        
    551. 
          
          
              end
        
      552. 
      
        
    552. 
          
          
          
        
      553. 
      
        
    553. 
          1
          
              def HTTP.socket_type   #:nodoc: obsolete
        
      554. 
      
        
    554. 
          
          
                BufferedIO
        
      555. 
      
        
    555. 
          
          
              end
        
      556. 
      
        
    556. 
          
          
          
        
      557. 
      
        
    557. 
          
          
              # :call-seq:
        
      558. 
      
        
    558. 
          
          
              #   HTTP.start(address, port, p_addr, p_port, p_user, p_pass, &block)
        
      559. 
      
        
    559. 
          
          
              #   HTTP.start(address, port=nil, p_addr=:ENV, p_port=nil, p_user=nil, p_pass=nil, opt, &block)
        
      560. 
      
        
    560. 
          
          
              #
        
      561. 
      
        
    561. 
          
          
              # Creates a new Net::HTTP object, then additionally opens the TCP
        
      562. 
      
        
    562. 
          
          
              # connection and HTTP session.
        
      563. 
      
        
    563. 
          
          
              #
        
      564. 
      
        
    564. 
          
          
              # Arguments are the following:
        
      565. 
      
        
    565. 
          
          
              # _address_ :: hostname or IP address of the server
        
      566. 
      
        
    566. 
          
          
              # _port_    :: port of the server
        
      567. 
      
        
    567. 
          
          
              # _p_addr_  :: address of proxy
        
      568. 
      
        
    568. 
          
          
              # _p_port_  :: port of proxy
        
      569. 
      
        
    569. 
          
          
              # _p_user_  :: user of proxy
        
      570. 
      
        
    570. 
          
          
              # _p_pass_  :: pass of proxy
        
      571. 
      
        
    571. 
          
          
              # _opt_     :: optional hash
        
      572. 
      
        
    572. 
          
          
              #
        
      573. 
      
        
    573. 
          
          
              # _opt_ sets following values by its accessor.
        
      574. 
      
        
    574. 
          
          
              # The keys are ca_file, ca_path, cert, cert_store, ciphers,
        
      575. 
      
        
    575. 
          
          
              # close_on_empty_response, key, open_timeout, read_timeout, write_timeout, ssl_timeout,
        
      576. 
      
        
    576. 
          
          
              # ssl_version, use_ssl, verify_callback, verify_depth and verify_mode.
        
      577. 
      
        
    577. 
          
          
              # If you set :use_ssl as true, you can use https and default value of
        
      578. 
      
        
    578. 
          
          
              # verify_mode is set as OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_PEER.
        
      579. 
      
        
    579. 
          
          
              #
        
      580. 
      
        
    580. 
          
          
              # If the optional block is given, the newly
        
      581. 
      
        
    581. 
          
          
              # created Net::HTTP object is passed to it and closed when the
        
      582. 
      
        
    582. 
          
          
              # block finishes.  In this case, the return value of this method
        
      583. 
      
        
    583. 
          
          
              # is the return value of the block.  If no block is given, the
        
      584. 
      
        
    584. 
          
          
              # return value of this method is the newly created Net::HTTP object
        
      585. 
      
        
    585. 
          
          
              # itself, and the caller is responsible for closing it upon completion
        
      586. 
      
        
    586. 
          
          
              # using the finish() method.
        
      587. 
      
        
    587. 
          1
          
              def HTTP.start(address, *arg, &block) # :yield: +http+
        
      588. 
      
        
    588. 
          
          
                arg.pop if opt = Hash.try_convert(arg[-1])
        
      589. 
      
        
    589. 
          
          
                port, p_addr, p_port, p_user, p_pass = *arg
        
      590. 
      
        
    590. 
          
          
                p_addr = :ENV if arg.size < 2
        
      591. 
      
        
    591. 
          
          
                port = https_default_port if !port && opt && opt[:use_ssl]
        
      592. 
      
        
    592. 
          
          
                http = new(address, port, p_addr, p_port, p_user, p_pass)
        
      593. 
      
        
    593. 
          
          
          
        
      594. 
      
        
    594. 
          
          
                if opt
        
      595. 
      
        
    595. 
          
          
                  if opt[:use_ssl]
        
      596. 
      
        
    596. 
          
          
                    opt = {verify_mode: OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_PEER}.update(opt)
        
      597. 
      
        
    597. 
          
          
                  end
        
      598. 
      
        
    598. 
          
          
                  http.methods.grep(/\A(\w+)=\z/) do |meth|
        
      599. 
      
        
    599. 
          
          
                    key = $1.to_sym
        
      600. 
      
        
    600. 
          
          
                    opt.key?(key) or next
        
      601. 
      
        
    601. 
          
          
                    http.__send__(meth, opt[key])
        
      602. 
      
        
    602. 
          
          
                  end
        
      603. 
      
        
    603. 
          
          
                end
        
      604. 
      
        
    604. 
          
          
          
        
      605. 
      
        
    605. 
          
          
                http.start(&block)
        
      606. 
      
        
    606. 
          
          
              end
        
      607. 
      
        
    607. 
          
          
          
        
      608. 
      
        
    608. 
          1
          
              class << HTTP
        
      609. 
      
        
    609. 
          1
          
                alias newobj new # :nodoc:
        
      610. 
      
        
    610. 
          
          
              end
        
      611. 
      
        
    611. 
          
          
          
        
      612. 
      
        
    612. 
          
          
              # Creates a new Net::HTTP object without opening a TCP connection or
        
      613. 
      
        
    613. 
          
          
              # HTTP session.
        
      614. 
      
        
    614. 
          
          
              #
        
      615. 
      
        
    615. 
          
          
              # The +address+ should be a DNS hostname or IP address, the +port+ is the
        
      616. 
      
        
    616. 
          
          
              # port the server operates on.  If no +port+ is given the default port for
        
      617. 
      
        
    617. 
          
          
              # HTTP or HTTPS is used.
        
      618. 
      
        
    618. 
          
          
              #
        
      619. 
      
        
    619. 
          
          
              # If none of the +p_+ arguments are given, the proxy host and port are
        
      620. 
      
        
    620. 
          
          
              # taken from the +http_proxy+ environment variable (or its uppercase
        
      621. 
      
        
    621. 
          
          
              # equivalent) if present.  If the proxy requires authentication you must
        
      622. 
      
        
    622. 
          
          
              # supply it by hand.  See URI::Generic#find_proxy for details of proxy
        
      623. 
      
        
    623. 
          
          
              # detection from the environment.  To disable proxy detection set +p_addr+
        
      624. 
      
        
    624. 
          
          
              # to nil.
        
      625. 
      
        
    625. 
          
          
              #
        
      626. 
      
        
    626. 
          
          
              # If you are connecting to a custom proxy, +p_addr+ specifies the DNS name
        
      627. 
      
        
    627. 
          
          
              # or IP address of the proxy host, +p_port+ the port to use to access the
        
      628. 
      
        
    628. 
          
          
              # proxy, +p_user+ and +p_pass+ the username and password if authorization
        
      629. 
      
        
    629. 
          
          
              # is required to use the proxy, and p_no_proxy hosts which do not
        
      630. 
      
        
    630. 
          
          
              # use the proxy.
        
      631. 
      
        
    631. 
          
          
              #
        
      632. 
      
        
    632. 
          1
          
              def HTTP.new(address, port = nil, p_addr = :ENV, p_port = nil, p_user = nil, p_pass = nil, p_no_proxy = nil)
        
      633. 
      
        
    633. 
          
          
                http = super address, port
        
      634. 
      
        
    634. 
          
          
          
        
      635. 
      
        
    635. 
          
          
                if proxy_class? then # from Net::HTTP::Proxy()
        
      636. 
      
        
    636. 
          
          
                  http.proxy_from_env = @proxy_from_env
        
      637. 
      
        
    637. 
          
          
                  http.proxy_address  = @proxy_address
        
      638. 
      
        
    638. 
          
          
                  http.proxy_port     = @proxy_port
        
      639. 
      
        
    639. 
          
          
                  http.proxy_user     = @proxy_user
        
      640. 
      
        
    640. 
          
          
                  http.proxy_pass     = @proxy_pass
        
      641. 
      
        
    641. 
          
          
                elsif p_addr == :ENV then
        
      642. 
      
        
    642. 
          
          
                  http.proxy_from_env = true
        
      643. 
      
        
    643. 
          
          
                else
        
      644. 
      
        
    644. 
          
          
                  if p_addr && p_no_proxy && !URI::Generic.use_proxy?(p_addr, p_addr, p_port, p_no_proxy)
        
      645. 
      
        
    645. 
          
          
                    p_addr = nil
        
      646. 
      
        
    646. 
          
          
                    p_port = nil
        
      647. 
      
        
    647. 
          
          
                  end
        
      648. 
      
        
    648. 
          
          
                  http.proxy_address = p_addr
        
      649. 
      
        
    649. 
          
          
                  http.proxy_port    = p_port || default_port
        
      650. 
      
        
    650. 
          
          
                  http.proxy_user    = p_user
        
      651. 
      
        
    651. 
          
          
                  http.proxy_pass    = p_pass
        
      652. 
      
        
    652. 
          
          
                end
        
      653. 
      
        
    653. 
          
          
          
        
      654. 
      
        
    654. 
          
          
                http
        
      655. 
      
        
    655. 
          
          
              end
        
      656. 
      
        
    656. 
          
          
          
        
      657. 
      
        
    657.
