          1
          
            def exec(sock, ver, path)   #:nodoc: internal use only
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
              if @body
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                send_request_with_body sock, ver, path, @body
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
              elsif @body_stream
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                send_request_with_body_stream sock, ver, path, @body_stream
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
              elsif @body_data
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                send_request_with_body_data sock, ver, path, @body_data
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
              else
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                write_header sock, ver, path
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
              end
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
            end
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
          
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          1
          
            def update_uri(addr, port, ssl) # :nodoc: internal use only
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
              # reflect the connection and @path to @uri
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
              return unless @uri
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
          
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
              if ssl
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                scheme = 'https'.freeze
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                klass = URI::HTTPS
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
              else
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                scheme = 'http'.freeze
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                klass = URI::HTTP
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
              end
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
          
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
              if host = self['host']
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
                host.sub!(/:.*/s, ''.freeze)
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
              elsif host = @uri.host
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
              else
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
               host = addr
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
              end
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
              # convert the class of the URI
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
              if @uri.is_a?(klass)
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                @uri.host = host
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                @uri.port = port
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
              else
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                @uri = klass.new(
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                  scheme, @uri.userinfo,
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
                  host, port, nil,
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                  @uri.path, nil, @uri.query, nil)
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
              end
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
            end
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
          
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          1
          
            private
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
          
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          1
          
            class Chunker #:nodoc:
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          1
          
              def initialize(sock)
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                @sock = sock
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                @prev = nil
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
              end
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
          
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          1
          
              def write(buf)
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                # avoid memcpy() of buf, buf can huge and eat memory bandwidth
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                rv = buf.bytesize
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                @sock.write("#{rv.to_s(16)}\r\n", buf, "\r\n")
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                rv
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
              end
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
          
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          1
          
              def finish
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                @sock.write("0\r\n\r\n")
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
              end
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
            end
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
          
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          1
          
            def send_request_with_body(sock, ver, path, body)
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
              self.content_length = body.bytesize
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
              delete 'Transfer-Encoding'
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
              supply_default_content_type
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
              write_header sock, ver, path
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
              wait_for_continue sock, ver if sock.continue_timeout
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
              sock.write body
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
            end
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
          
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          1
          
            def send_request_with_body_stream(sock, ver, path, f)
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
              unless content_length() or chunked?
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
                raise ArgumentError,
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
                    "Content-Length not given and Transfer-Encoding is not `chunked'"
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
              end
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
              supply_default_content_type
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
              write_header sock, ver, path
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
              wait_for_continue sock, ver if sock.continue_timeout
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
              if chunked?
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
                chunker = Chunker.new(sock)
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
                IO.copy_stream(f, chunker)
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
                chunker.finish
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
              else
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
                # copy_stream can sendfile() to sock.io unless we use SSL.
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
                # If sock.io is an SSLSocket, copy_stream will hit SSL_write()
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
                IO.copy_stream(f, sock.io)
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
              end
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
            end
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
          
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          1
          
            def send_request_with_body_data(sock, ver, path, params)
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
              if /\Amultipart\/form-data\z/i !~ self.content_type
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
                self.content_type = 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded'
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
                return send_request_with_body(sock, ver, path, URI.encode_www_form(params))
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
              end
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
          
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
              opt = @form_option.dup
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
              require 'securerandom' unless defined?(SecureRandom)
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
              opt[:boundary] ||= SecureRandom.urlsafe_base64(40)
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
              self.set_content_type(self.content_type, boundary: opt[:boundary])
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
              if chunked?
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
                write_header sock, ver, path
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
                encode_multipart_form_data(sock, params, opt)
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
              else
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
                require 'tempfile'
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
                file = Tempfile.new('multipart')
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
                file.binmode
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                encode_multipart_form_data(file, params, opt)
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
                file.rewind
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
                self.content_length = file.size
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
                write_header sock, ver, path
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
                IO.copy_stream(file, sock)
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
                file.close(true)
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
              end
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
            end
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
          
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          1
          
            def encode_multipart_form_data(out, params, opt)
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
              charset = opt[:charset]
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
              boundary = opt[:boundary]
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
              require 'securerandom' unless defined?(SecureRandom)
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
              boundary ||= SecureRandom.urlsafe_base64(40)
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
              chunked_p = chunked?
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
          
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
              buf = ''
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
              params.each do |key, value, h={}|
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
                key = quote_string(key, charset)
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
                filename =
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
                  h.key?(:filename) ? h[:filename] :
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
                  value.respond_to?(:to_path) ? File.basename(value.to_path) :
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
                  nil
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
          
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
                buf << "--#{boundary}\r\n"
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
                if filename
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
                  filename = quote_string(filename, charset)
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
                  type = h[:content_type] || 'application/octet-stream'
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
                  buf << "Content-Disposition: form-data; " \
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
                    "name=\"#{key}\"; filename=\"#{filename}\"\r\n" \
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
                    "Content-Type: #{type}\r\n\r\n"
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
                  if !out.respond_to?(:write) || !value.respond_to?(:read)
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
                    # if +out+ is not an IO or +value+ is not an IO
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
                    buf << (value.respond_to?(:read) ? value.read : value)
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
                  elsif value.respond_to?(:size) && chunked_p
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
                    # if +out+ is an IO and +value+ is a File, use IO.copy_stream
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
                    flush_buffer(out, buf, chunked_p)
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
                    out << "%x\r\n" % value.size if chunked_p
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
                    IO.copy_stream(value, out)
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
                    out << "\r\n" if chunked_p
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
                  else
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
                    # +out+ is an IO, and +value+ is not a File but an IO
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
                    flush_buffer(out, buf, chunked_p)
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
                    1 while flush_buffer(out, value.read(4096), chunked_p)
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
                  end
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
                else
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
                  # non-file field:
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
                  #   HTML5 says, "The parts of the generated multipart/form-data
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
                  #   resource that correspond to non-file fields must not have a
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
                  #   Content-Type header specified."
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
                  buf << "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"#{key}\"\r\n\r\n"
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
                  buf << (value.respond_to?(:read) ? value.read : value)
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
                end
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
                buf << "\r\n"
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
              end
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
              buf << "--#{boundary}--\r\n"
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
              flush_buffer(out, buf, chunked_p)
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
              out << "0\r\n\r\n" if chunked_p
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
            end
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
          
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          1
          
            def quote_string(str, charset)
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
              str = str.encode(charset, fallback:->(c){'&#%d;'%c.encode("UTF-8").ord}) if charset
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
              str.gsub(/[\\"]/, '\\\\\&')
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
            end
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
          
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          1
          
            def flush_buffer(out, buf, chunked_p)
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
              return unless buf
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
              out << "%x\r\n"%buf.bytesize if chunked_p
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
              out << buf
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
              out << "\r\n" if chunked_p
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
              buf.clear
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
            end
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
          
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          1
          
            def supply_default_content_type
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
              return if content_type()
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
              warn 'net/http: Content-Type did not set; using application/x-www-form-urlencoded', uplevel: 1 if $VERBOSE
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
              set_content_type 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded'
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
            end
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          
          
          
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
            ##
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
            # Waits up to the continue timeout for a response from the server provided
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
            # we're speaking HTTP 1.1 and are expecting a 100-continue response.
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
          
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          1
          
            def wait_for_continue(sock, ver)
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
              if ver >= '1.1' and @header['expect'] and
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
                  @header['expect'].include?('100-continue')
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
                if sock.io.to_io.wait_readable(sock.continue_timeout)
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
                  res = Net::HTTPResponse.read_new(sock)
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
                  unless res.kind_of?(Net::HTTPContinue)
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
                    res.decode_content = @decode_content
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
                    throw :response, res
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
                  end
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
                end
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
              end
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
            end
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
          
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          1
          
            def write_header(sock, ver, path)
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
              reqline = "#{@method} #{path} HTTP/#{ver}"
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
              if /[\r\n]/ =~ reqline
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
                raise ArgumentError, "A Request-Line must not contain CR or LF"
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
              end
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
              buf = ""
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
              buf << reqline << "\r\n"
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
              each_capitalized do |k,v|
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
                buf << "#{k}: #{v}\r\n"
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
              end
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
              buf << "\r\n"
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
              sock.write buf
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
            end
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
          
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
          end
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
          
        
      340.

    /usr/lib/ruby/2.6.0/net/http/header.rb

    23.5 % covered

    200 relevant lines. 47 lines covered and 153 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          
          
          # frozen_string_literal: false
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          # The HTTPHeader module defines methods for reading and writing
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
          # HTTP headers.
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
          #
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          # It is used as a mixin by other classes, to provide hash-like
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
          # access to HTTP header values. Unlike raw hash access, HTTPHeader
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          # provides access via case-insensitive keys. It also provides
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
          # methods for accessing commonly-used HTTP header values in more
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
          # convenient formats.
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
          #
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          1
          
          module Net::HTTPHeader
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          1
          
            def initialize_http_header(initheader)
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
              @header = {}
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
              return unless initheader
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
              initheader.each do |key, value|
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
                warn "net/http: duplicated HTTP header: #{key}", uplevel: 1 if key?(key) and $VERBOSE
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
                if value.nil?
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                  warn "net/http: nil HTTP header: #{key}", uplevel: 1 if $VERBOSE
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
                else
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
                  value = value.strip # raise error for invalid byte sequences
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
                  if value.count("\r\n") > 0
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                    raise ArgumentError, "header #{key} has field value #{value.inspect}, this cannot include CR/LF"
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                  end
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
                  @header[key.downcase.to_s] = [value]
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
                end
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
              end
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
            end
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
          
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          1
          
            def size   #:nodoc: obsolete
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
              @header.size
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
            end
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
          
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          1
          
            alias length size   #:nodoc: obsolete
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
          
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
            # Returns the header field corresponding to the case-insensitive key.
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
            # For example, a key of "Content-Type" might return "text/html"
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          1
          
            def [](key)
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
              a = @header[key.downcase.to_s] or return nil
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
              a.join(', ')
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
            end
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
          
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
            # Sets the header field corresponding to the case-insensitive key.
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          1
          
            def []=(key, val)
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
              unless val
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                @header.delete key.downcase.to_s
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                return val
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
              end
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
              set_field(key, val)
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
            end
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
          
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
            # [Ruby 1.8.3]
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
            # Adds a value to a named header field, instead of replacing its value.
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
            # Second argument +val+ must be a String.
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
            # See also #[]=, #[] and #get_fields.
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
            #
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
            #   request.add_field 'X-My-Header', 'a'
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
            #   p request['X-My-Header']              #=> "a"
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
            #   p request.get_fields('X-My-Header')   #=> ["a"]
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
            #   request.add_field 'X-My-Header', 'b'
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
            #   p request['X-My-Header']              #=> "a, b"
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
            #   p request.get_fields('X-My-Header')   #=> ["a", "b"]
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
            #   request.add_field 'X-My-Header', 'c'
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
            #   p request['X-My-Header']              #=> "a, b, c"
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
            #   p request.get_fields('X-My-Header')   #=> ["a", "b", "c"]
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
            #
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          1
          
            def add_field(key, val)
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
              stringified_downcased_key = key.downcase.to_s
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
              if @header.key?(stringified_downcased_key)
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                append_field_value(@header[stringified_downcased_key], val)
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
              else
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                set_field(key, val)
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
              end
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
            end
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
          
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          1
          
            private def set_field(key, val)
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
              case val
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
              when Enumerable
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                ary = []
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                append_field_value(ary, val)
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                @header[key.downcase.to_s] = ary
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
              else
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                val = val.to_s # for compatibility use to_s instead of to_str
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                if val.b.count("\r\n") > 0
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                  raise ArgumentError, 'header field value cannot include CR/LF'
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                end
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                @header[key.downcase.to_s] = [val]
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
              end
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
            end
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
          
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          1
          
            private def append_field_value(ary, val)
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
              case val
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
              when Enumerable
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                val.each{|x| append_field_value(ary, x)}
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
              else
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                val = val.to_s
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                if /[\r\n]/n.match?(val.b)
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                  raise ArgumentError, 'header field value cannot include CR/LF'
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                end
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                ary.push val
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
              end
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
            end
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
          
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
            # [Ruby 1.8.3]
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
            # Returns an array of header field strings corresponding to the
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
            # case-insensitive +key+.  This method allows you to get duplicated
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
            # header fields without any processing.  See also #[].
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
            #
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
            #   p response.get_fields('Set-Cookie')
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
            #     #=> ["session=al98axx; expires=Fri, 31-Dec-1999 23:58:23",
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
            #          "query=rubyscript; expires=Fri, 31-Dec-1999 23:58:23"]
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
            #   p response['Set-Cookie']
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
            #     #=> "session=al98axx; expires=Fri, 31-Dec-1999 23:58:23, query=rubyscript; expires=Fri, 31-Dec-1999 23:58:23"
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
            #
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          1
          
            def get_fields(key)
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
              stringified_downcased_key = key.downcase.to_s
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
              return nil unless @header[stringified_downcased_key]
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
              @header[stringified_downcased_key].dup
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
            end
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
          
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
            # Returns the header field corresponding to the case-insensitive key.
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
            # Returns the default value +args+, or the result of the block, or
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
            # raises an IndexError if there's no header field named +key+
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
            # See Hash#fetch
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          1
          
            def fetch(key, *args, &block)   #:yield: +key+
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
              a = @header.fetch(key.downcase.to_s, *args, &block)
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
              a.kind_of?(Array) ? a.join(', ') : a
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
            end
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
          
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
            # Iterates through the header names and values, passing in the name
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
            # and value to the code block supplied.
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
            #
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
            # Returns an enumerator if no block is given.
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
            #
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
            # Example:
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
            #
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
            #     response.header.each_header {|key,value| puts "#{key} = #{value}" }
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
            #
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          1
          
            def each_header   #:yield: +key+, +value+
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
              block_given? or return enum_for(__method__) { @header.size }
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
              @header.each do |k,va|
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                yield k, va.join(', ')
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
              end
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
            end
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
          
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          1
          
            alias each each_header
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
          
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
            # Iterates through the header names in the header, passing
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
            # each header name to the code block.
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
            #
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
            # Returns an enumerator if no block is given.
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          1
          
            def each_name(&block)   #:yield: +key+
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
              block_given? or return enum_for(__method__) { @header.size }
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
              @header.each_key(&block)
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
            end
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
          
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          1
          
            alias each_key each_name
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
          
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
            # Iterates through the header names in the header, passing
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
            # capitalized header names to the code block.
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
            #
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
            # Note that header names are capitalized systematically;
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
            # capitalization may not match that used by the remote HTTP
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
            # server in its response.
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
            #
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
            # Returns an enumerator if no block is given.
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          1
          
            def each_capitalized_name  #:yield: +key+
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
              block_given? or return enum_for(__method__) { @header.size }
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
              @header.each_key do |k|
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                yield capitalize(k)
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
              end
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
            end
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
          
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
            # Iterates through header values, passing each value to the
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
            # code block.
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
            #
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
            # Returns an enumerator if no block is given.
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          1
          
            def each_value   #:yield: +value+
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
              block_given? or return enum_for(__method__) { @header.size }
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
              @header.each_value do |va|
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                yield va.join(', ')
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
              end
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
            end
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
          
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
            # Removes a header field, specified by case-insensitive key.
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          1
          
            def delete(key)
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
              @header.delete(key.downcase.to_s)
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
            end
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
          
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
            # true if +key+ header exists.
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          1
          
            def key?(key)
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
              @header.key?(key.downcase.to_s)
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
            end
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
          
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
            # Returns a Hash consisting of header names and array of values.
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
            # e.g.
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
            # {"cache-control" => ["private"],
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
            #  "content-type" => ["text/html"],
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
            #  "date" => ["Wed, 22 Jun 2005 22:11:50 GMT"]}
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          1
          
            def to_hash
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
              @header.dup
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
            end
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
          
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
            # As for #each_header, except the keys are provided in capitalized form.
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
            #
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
            # Note that header names are capitalized systematically;
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
            # capitalization may not match that used by the remote HTTP
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
            # server in its response.
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
            #
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
            # Returns an enumerator if no block is given.
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          1
          
            def each_capitalized
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
              block_given? or return enum_for(__method__) { @header.size }
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
              @header.each do |k,v|
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
                yield capitalize(k), v.join(', ')
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
              end
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
            end
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
          
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          1
          
            alias canonical_each each_capitalized
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
          
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          1
          
            def capitalize(name)
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
              name.to_s.split(/-/).map {|s| s.capitalize }.join('-')
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
            end
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          1
          
            private :capitalize
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
          
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
            # Returns an Array of Range objects which represent the Range:
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
            # HTTP header field, or +nil+ if there is no such header.
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          1
          
            def range
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
              return nil unless @header['range']
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
          
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
              value = self['Range']
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
              # byte-range-set = *( "," OWS ) ( byte-range-spec / suffix-byte-range-spec )
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
              #   *( OWS "," [ OWS ( byte-range-spec / suffix-byte-range-spec ) ] )
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
              # corrected collected ABNF
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
              # http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-httpbis-p5-range-19#section-5.4.1
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
              # http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-httpbis-p5-range-19#appendix-C
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
              # http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-httpbis-p1-messaging-19#section-3.2.5
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
              unless /\Abytes=((?:,[ \t]*)*(?:\d+-\d*|-\d+)(?:[ \t]*,(?:[ \t]*\d+-\d*|-\d+)?)*)\z/ =~ value
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
                raise Net::HTTPHeaderSyntaxError, "invalid syntax for byte-ranges-specifier: '#{value}'"
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
              end
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
          
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
              byte_range_set = $1
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
              result = byte_range_set.split(/,/).map {|spec|
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
                m = /(\d+)?\s*-\s*(\d+)?/i.match(spec) or
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
                        raise Net::HTTPHeaderSyntaxError, "invalid byte-range-spec: '#{spec}'"
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
                d1 = m[1].to_i
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
                d2 = m[2].to_i
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
                if m[1] and m[2]
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
                  if d1 > d2
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
                    raise Net::HTTPHeaderSyntaxError, "last-byte-pos MUST greater than or equal to first-byte-pos but '#{spec}'"
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
                  end
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
                  d1..d2
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
                elsif m[1]
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
                  d1..-1
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
                elsif m[2]
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
                  -d2..-1
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
                else
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
                  raise Net::HTTPHeaderSyntaxError, 'range is not specified'
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
                end
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
              }
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
              # if result.empty?
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
              # byte-range-set must include at least one byte-range-spec or suffix-byte-range-spec
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
              # but above regexp already denies it.
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
              if result.size == 1 && result[0].begin == 0 && result[0].end == -1
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
                raise Net::HTTPHeaderSyntaxError, 'only one suffix-byte-range-spec with zero suffix-length'
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
              end
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
              result
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
            end
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
          
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
            # Sets the HTTP Range: header.
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
            # Accepts either a Range object as a single argument,
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
            # or a beginning index and a length from that index.
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
            # Example:
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
            #
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
            #   req.range = (0..1023)
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
            #   req.set_range 0, 1023
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
            #
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          1
          
            def set_range(r, e = nil)
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
              unless r
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
                @header.delete 'range'
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
                return r
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
              end
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
              r = (r...r+e) if e
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
              case r
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
              when Numeric
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
                n = r.to_i
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
                rangestr = (n > 0 ? "0-#{n-1}" : "-#{-n}")
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
              when Range
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
                first = r.first
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
                last = r.end
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
                last -= 1 if r.exclude_end?
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
                if last == -1
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
                  rangestr = (first > 0 ? "#{first}-" : "-#{-first}")
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
                else
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
                  raise Net::HTTPHeaderSyntaxError, 'range.first is negative' if first < 0
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
                  raise Net::HTTPHeaderSyntaxError, 'range.last is negative' if last < 0
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
                  raise Net::HTTPHeaderSyntaxError, 'must be .first < .last' if first > last
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
                  rangestr = "#{first}-#{last}"
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
                end
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
              else
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
                raise TypeError, 'Range/Integer is required'
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
              end
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
              @header['range'] = ["bytes=#{rangestr}"]
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
              r
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
            end
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
          
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          1
          
            alias range= set_range
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
          
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
            # Returns an Integer object which represents the HTTP Content-Length:
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
            # header field, or +nil+ if that field was not provided.
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          1
          
            def content_length
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
              return nil unless key?('Content-Length')
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
              len = self['Content-Length'].slice(/\d+/) or
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
                  raise Net::HTTPHeaderSyntaxError, 'wrong Content-Length format'
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
              len.to_i
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
            end
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
          
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          1
          
            def content_length=(len)
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
              unless len
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
                @header.delete 'content-length'
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
                return nil
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
              end
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
              @header['content-length'] = [len.to_i.to_s]
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
            end
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
          
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
            # Returns "true" if the "transfer-encoding" header is present and
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
            # set to "chunked".  This is an HTTP/1.1 feature, allowing the
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
            # the content to be sent in "chunks" without at the outset
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
            # stating the entire content length.
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          1
          
            def chunked?
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
              return false unless @header['transfer-encoding']
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
              field = self['Transfer-Encoding']
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
              (/(?:\A|[^\-\w])chunked(?![\-\w])/i =~ field) ? true : false
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
            end
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
          
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
            # Returns a Range object which represents the value of the Content-Range:
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
            # header field.
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
            # For a partial entity body, this indicates where this fragment
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
            # fits inside the full entity body, as range of byte offsets.
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          1
          
            def content_range
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
              return nil unless @header['content-range']
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
              m = %r<bytes\s+(\d+)-(\d+)/(\d+|\*)>i.match(self['Content-Range']) or
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
                  raise Net::HTTPHeaderSyntaxError, 'wrong Content-Range format'
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
              m[1].to_i .. m[2].to_i
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
            end
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
          
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
            # The length of the range represented in Content-Range: header.
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          1
          
            def range_length
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
              r = content_range() or return nil
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
              r.end - r.begin + 1
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
            end
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
          
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
            # Returns a content type string such as "text/html".
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
            # This method returns nil if Content-Type: header field does not exist.
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          1
          
            def content_type
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
              return nil unless main_type()
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          
          
              if sub_type()
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
              then "#{main_type()}/#{sub_type()}"
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
              else main_type()
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
              end
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
            end
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
          
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          
          
            # Returns a content type string such as "text".
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
            # This method returns nil if Content-Type: header field does not exist.
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          1
          
            def main_type
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          
          
              return nil unless @header['content-type']
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
              self['Content-Type'].split(';').first.to_s.split('/')[0].to_s.strip
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          
          
            end
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
          
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
            # Returns a content type string such as "html".
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          
          
            # This method returns nil if Content-Type: header field does not exist
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          
          
            # or sub-type is not given (e.g. "Content-Type: text").
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          1
          
            def sub_type
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
              return nil unless @header['content-type']
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
              _, sub = *self['Content-Type'].split(';').first.to_s.split('/')
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
              return nil unless sub
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
              sub.strip
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
            end
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          
          
          
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
            # Any parameters specified for the content type, returned as a Hash.
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
            # For example, a header of Content-Type: text/html; charset=EUC-JP
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
            # would result in type_params returning {'charset' => 'EUC-JP'}
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          1
          
            def type_params
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
              result = {}
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          
          
              list = self['Content-Type'].to_s.split(';')
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
              list.shift
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          
          
              list.each do |param|
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
                k, v = *param.split('=', 2)
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          
          
                result[k.strip] = v.strip
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
              end
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
              result
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
            end
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
          
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
            # Sets the content type in an HTTP header.
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          
          
            # The +type+ should be a full HTTP content type, e.g. "text/html".
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          
          
            # The +params+ are an optional Hash of parameters to add after the
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          
          
            # content type, e.g. {'charset' => 'iso-8859-1'}
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          1
          
            def set_content_type(type, params = {})
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
              @header['content-type'] = [type + params.map{|k,v|"; #{k}=#{v}"}.join('')]
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          
          
            end
        
      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          
          
          
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          1
          
            alias content_type= set_content_type
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          
          
          
        
      403. 
      
        
    403. 
          
          
            # Set header fields and a body from HTML form data.
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          
          
            # +params+ should be an Array of Arrays or
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          
          
            # a Hash containing HTML form data.
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
            # Optional argument +sep+ means data record separator.
        
      407. 
      
        
    407. 
          
          
            #
        
      408. 
      
        
    408. 
          
          
            # Values are URL encoded as necessary and the content-type is set to
        
      409. 
      
        
    409. 
          
          
            # application/x-www-form-urlencoded
        
      410. 
      
        
    410. 
          
          
            #
        
      411. 
      
        
    411. 
          
          
            # Example:
        
      412. 
      
        
    412. 
          
          
            #    http.form_data = {"q" => "ruby", "lang" => "en"}
        
      413. 
      
        
    413. 
          
          
            #    http.form_data = {"q" => ["ruby", "perl"], "lang" => "en"}
        
      414. 
      
        
    414. 
          
          
            #    http.set_form_data({"q" => "ruby", "lang" => "en"}, ';')
        
      415. 
      
        
    415. 
          
          
            #
        
      416. 
      
        
    416. 
          1
          
            def set_form_data(params, sep = '&')
        
      417. 
      
        
    417. 
          
          
              query = URI.encode_www_form(params)
        
      418. 
      
        
    418. 
          
          
              query.gsub!(/&/, sep) if sep != '&'
        
      419. 
      
        
    419. 
          
          
              self.body = query
        
      420. 
      
        
    420. 
          
          
              self.content_type = 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded'
        
      421. 
      
        
    421. 
          
          
            end
        
      422. 
      
        
    422. 
          
          
          
        
      423. 
      
        
    423. 
          1
          
            alias form_data= set_form_data
        
      424. 
      
        
    424. 
          
          
          
        
      425. 
      
        
    425. 
          
          
            # Set an HTML form data set.
        
      426. 
      
        
    426. 
          
          
            # +params+ is the form data set; it is an Array of Arrays or a Hash
        
      427. 
      
        
    427. 
          
          
            # +enctype is the type to encode the form data set.
        
      428. 
      
        
    428. 
          
          
            # It is application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data.
        
      429. 
      
        
    429. 
          
          
            # +formopt+ is an optional hash to specify the detail.
        
      430. 
      
        
    430. 
          
          
            #
        
      431. 
      
        
    431. 
          
          
            # boundary:: the boundary of the multipart message
        
      432. 
      
        
    432. 
          
          
            # charset::  the charset of the message. All names and the values of
        
      433. 
      
        
    433. 
          
          
            #            non-file fields are encoded as the charset.
        
      434. 
      
        
    434. 
          
          
            #
        
      435. 
      
        
    435. 
          
          
            # Each item of params is an array and contains following items:
        
      436. 
      
        
    436. 
          
          
            # +name+::  the name of the field
        
      437. 
      
        
    437. 
          
          
            # +value+:: the value of the field, it should be a String or a File
        
      438. 
      
        
    438. 
          
          
            # +opt+::   an optional hash to specify additional information
        
      439. 
      
        
    439. 
          
          
            #
        
      440. 
      
        
    440. 
          
          
            # Each item is a file field or a normal field.
        
      441. 
      
        
    441. 
          
          
            # If +value+ is a File object or the +opt+ have a filename key,
        
      442. 
      
        
    442. 
          
          
            # the item is treated as a file field.
        
      443. 
      
        
    443. 
          
          
            #
        
      444. 
      
        
    444. 
          
          
            # If Transfer-Encoding is set as chunked, this send the request in
        
      445. 
      
        
    445. 
          
          
            # chunked encoding. Because chunked encoding is HTTP/1.1 feature,
        
      446. 
      
        
    446. 
          
          
            # you must confirm the server to support HTTP/1.1 before sending it.
        
      447. 
      
        
    447. 
          
          
            #
        
      448. 
      
        
    448. 
          
          
            # Example:
        
      449. 
      
        
    449. 
          
          
            #    http.set_form([["q", "ruby"], ["lang", "en"]])
        
      450. 
      
        
    450. 
          
          
            #
        
      451. 
      
        
    451. 
          
          
            # See also RFC 2388, RFC 2616, HTML 4.01, and HTML5
        
      452. 
      
        
    452. 
          
          
            #
        
      453. 
      
        
    453. 
          1
          
            def set_form(params, enctype='application/x-www-form-urlencoded', formopt={})
        
      454. 
      
        
    454. 
          
          
              @body_data = params
        
      455. 
      
        
    455. 
          
          
              @body = nil
        
      456. 
      
        
    456. 
          
          
              @body_stream = nil
        
      457. 
      
        
    457. 
          
          
              @form_option = formopt
        
      458. 
      
        
    458. 
          
          
              case enctype
        
      459. 
      
        
    459. 
          
          
              when /\Aapplication\/x-www-form-urlencoded\z/i,
        
      460. 
      
        
    460. 
          
          
                /\Amultipart\/form-data\z/i
        
      461. 
      
        
    461. 
          
          
                self.content_type = enctype
        
      462. 
      
        
    462. 
          
          
              else
        
      463. 
      
        
    463. 
          
          
                raise ArgumentError, "invalid enctype: #{enctype}"
        
      464. 
      
        
    464. 
          
          
              end
        
      465. 
      
        
    465. 
          
          
            end
        
      466. 
      
        
    466. 
          
          
          
        
      467. 
      
        
    467. 
          
          
            # Set the Authorization: header for "Basic" authorization.
        
      468. 
      
        
    468. 
          1
          
            def basic_auth(account, password)
        
      469. 
      
        
    469. 
          
          
              @header['authorization'] = [basic_encode(account, password)]
        
      470. 
      
        
    470. 
          
          
            end
        
      471. 
      
        
    471. 
          
          
          
        
      472. 
      
        
    472. 
          
          
            # Set Proxy-Authorization: header for "Basic" authorization.
        
      473. 
      
        
    473. 
          1
          
            def proxy_basic_auth(account, password)
        
      474. 
      
        
    474. 
          
          
              @header['proxy-authorization'] = [basic_encode(account, password)]
        
      475. 
      
        
    475. 
          
          
            end
        
      476. 
      
        
    476. 
          
          
          
        
      477. 
      
        
    477. 
          1
          
            def basic_encode(account, password)
        
      478. 
      
        
    478. 
          
          
              'Basic ' + ["#{account}:#{password}"].pack('m0')
        
      479. 
      
        
    479. 
          
          
            end
        
      480. 
      
        
    480. 
          1
          
            private :basic_encode
        
      481. 
      
        
    481. 
          
          
          
        
      482. 
      
        
    482. 
          1
          
            def connection_close?
        
      483. 
      
        
    483. 
          
          
              token = /(?:\A|,)\s*close\s*(?:\z|,)/i
        
      484. 
      
        
    484. 
          
          
              @header['connection']&.grep(token) {return true}
        
      485. 
      
        
    485. 
          
          
              @header['proxy-connection']&.grep(token) {return true}
        
      486. 
      
        
    486. 
          
          
              false
        
      487. 
      
        
    487. 
          
          
            end
        
      488. 
      
        
    488. 
          
          
          
        
      489. 
      
        
    489. 
          1
          
            def connection_keep_alive?
        
      490. 
      
        
    490. 
          
          
              token = /(?:\A|,)\s*keep-alive\s*(?:\z|,)/i
        
      491. 
      
        
    491. 
          
          
              @header['connection']&.grep(token) {return true}
        
      492. 
      
        
    492. 
          
          
              @header['proxy-connection']&.grep(token) {return true}
        
      493. 
      
        
    493. 
          
          
              false
        
      494. 
      
        
    494. 
          
          
            end
        
      495. 
      
        
    495. 
          
          
          
        
      496. 
      
        
    496. 
          
          
          end
        
      497.

    /usr/lib/ruby/2.6.0/net/http/request.rb
