    1. 
          
          
          # frozen_string_literal: false
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          # HTTP request class.
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
          # This class wraps together the request header and the request path.
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
          # You cannot use this class directly. Instead, you should use one of its
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          # subclasses: Net::HTTP::Get, Net::HTTP::Post, Net::HTTP::Head.
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
          #
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          1
          
          class Net::HTTPRequest < Net::HTTPGenericRequest
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
            # Creates an HTTP request object for +path+.
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
            #
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
            # +initheader+ are the default headers to use.  Net::HTTP adds
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
            # Accept-Encoding to enable compression of the response body unless
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
            # Accept-Encoding or Range are supplied in +initheader+.
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
          
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          1
          
            def initialize(path, initheader = nil)
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
              super self.class::METHOD,
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
                    self.class::REQUEST_HAS_BODY,
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
                    self.class::RESPONSE_HAS_BODY,
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
                    path, initheader
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
            end
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
          end
        
      21.

    /usr/lib/ruby/2.6.0/net/http/response.rb

    26.51 % covered

    166 relevant lines. 44 lines covered and 122 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          
          
          # frozen_string_literal: false
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          # HTTP response class.
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
          #
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
          # This class wraps together the response header and the response body (the
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          # entity requested).
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
          #
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          # It mixes in the HTTPHeader module, which provides access to response
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
          # header values both via hash-like methods and via individual readers.
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
          #
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
          # Note that each possible HTTP response code defines its own
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
          # HTTPResponse subclass.  These are listed below.
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          #
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
          # All classes are defined under the Net module. Indentation indicates
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
          # inheritance.  For a list of the classes see Net::HTTP.
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
          #
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
          #
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          1
          
          class Net::HTTPResponse
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          1
          
            class << self
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
              # true if the response has a body.
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          1
          
              def body_permitted?
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
                self::HAS_BODY
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
              end
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
          
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          1
          
              def exception_type   # :nodoc: internal use only
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
                self::EXCEPTION_TYPE
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
              end
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
          
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          1
          
              def read_new(sock)   #:nodoc: internal use only
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                httpv, code, msg = read_status_line(sock)
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                res = response_class(code).new(httpv, code, msg)
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                each_response_header(sock) do |k,v|
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                  res.add_field k, v
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                end
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                res
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
              end
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
          
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          1
          
              private
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
          
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          1
          
              def read_status_line(sock)
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                str = sock.readline
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                m = /\AHTTP(?:\/(\d+\.\d+))?\s+(\d\d\d)(?:\s+(.*))?\z/in.match(str) or
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                  raise Net::HTTPBadResponse, "wrong status line: #{str.dump}"
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                m.captures
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
              end
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
          
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          1
          
              def response_class(code)
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                CODE_TO_OBJ[code] or
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                CODE_CLASS_TO_OBJ[code[0,1]] or
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                Net::HTTPUnknownResponse
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
              end
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
          
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          1
          
              def each_response_header(sock)
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                key = value = nil
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                while true
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                  line = sock.readuntil("\n", true).sub(/\s+\z/, '')
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                  break if line.empty?
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                  if line[0] == ?\s or line[0] == ?\t and value
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                    value << ' ' unless value.empty?
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                    value << line.strip
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                  else
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                    yield key, value if key
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                    key, value = line.strip.split(/\s*:\s*/, 2)
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                    raise Net::HTTPBadResponse, 'wrong header line format' if value.nil?
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                  end
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                end
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                yield key, value if key
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
              end
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
            end
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
          
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
            # next is to fix bug in RDoc, where the private inside class << self
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
            # spills out.
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          1
          
            public
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          
        
      74.

          1
          
            include Net::HTTPHeader
        
      75.

            def initialize(httpv, code, msg)   #:nodoc: internal use only
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
              @http_version = httpv
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
              @code         = code
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
              @message      = msg
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
              initialize_http_header nil
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
              @body = nil
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
              @read = false
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
              @uri  = nil
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
              @decode_content = false
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
            end
        
      86.

            # The HTTP version supported by the server.
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          1
          
            attr_reader :http_version

    89. 
          
          
          
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
            # The HTTP result code string. For example, '302'.  You can also
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
            # determine the response type by examining which response subclass
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
            # the response object is an instance of.

      96.

      97.

          1
          
            alias msg message   # :nodoc: obsolete

            # The URI used to fetch this response.  The response URI is only available
        
      100.

            # if a URI was used to create the request.
        
      101.

          1
          
            attr_reader :uri

            # Set to true automatically when the request did not contain an

            def inspect

            def error!   #:nodoc:
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
              message = @code
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
              message += ' ' + @message.dump if @message
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
              raise error_type().new(message, self)
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
            end
        
      124.

            # Raises an HTTP error if the response is not 2xx (success).
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          1
          
            def value
        
      131.

              error! unless self.kind_of?(Net::HTTPSuccess)

    132. 
          
          
            end

            def read_header   #:nodoc:

          1
          
            def reading_body(sock, reqmethodallowbody)  #:nodoc: internal use only
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
              @socket = sock
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
              @body_exist = reqmethodallowbody && self.class.body_permitted?
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
              begin
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                yield
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                self.body   # ensure to read body
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
              ensure
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                @socket = nil
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
              end
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
            end
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
          
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
            # Gets the entity body returned by the remote HTTP server.
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
            #
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
            # If a block is given, the body is passed to the block, and
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
            # the body is provided in fragments, as it is read in from the socket.
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
            #
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
            # Calling this method a second or subsequent time for the same
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
            # HTTPResponse object will return the value already read.
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
            #
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
            #   http.request_get('/index.html') {|res|
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
            #     puts res.read_body
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
            #
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
            #   http.request_get('/index.html') {|res|
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
            #     p res.read_body.object_id   # 538149362
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
            #     p res.read_body.object_id   # 538149362
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
            #
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
            #   # using iterator
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
            #   http.request_get('/index.html') {|res|
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
            #     res.read_body do |segment|
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
            #       print segment
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
            #     end
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
            #
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          1
          
            def read_body(dest = nil, &block)
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
              if @read
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
                raise IOError, "#{self.class}\#read_body called twice" if dest or block
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
                return @body
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
              end
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
              to = procdest(dest, block)
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
              stream_check
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
              if @body_exist
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
                read_body_0 to
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
                @body = to
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
              else
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
                @body = nil
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
              end
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
              @read = true
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
          
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
              @body
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
            end
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
          
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
            # Returns the full entity body.
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
            #
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
            # Calling this method a second or subsequent time will return the
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
            # string already read.
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
            #
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
            #   http.request_get('/index.html') {|res|
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
            #     puts res.body
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
            #
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
            #   http.request_get('/index.html') {|res|
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
            #     p res.body.object_id   # 538149362
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
            #     p res.body.object_id   # 538149362
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
            #
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          1
          
            def body
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
              read_body()
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
            end
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
          
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
            # Because it may be necessary to modify the body, Eg, decompression
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
            # this method facilitates that.
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          1
          
            def body=(value)
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
              @body = value
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
            end
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
          
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          1
          
            alias entity body   #:nodoc: obsolete
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
          
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          1
          
            private
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
          
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
            ##
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
            # Checks for a supported Content-Encoding header and yields an Inflate
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
            # wrapper for this response's socket when zlib is present.  If the
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
            # Content-Encoding is not supported or zlib is missing, the plain socket is
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
            # yielded.
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
            #
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
            # If a Content-Range header is present, a plain socket is yielded as the
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
            # bytes in the range may not be a complete deflate block.
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
          
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          1
          
            def inflater # :nodoc:
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
              return yield @socket unless Net::HTTP::HAVE_ZLIB
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
              return yield @socket unless @decode_content
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
              return yield @socket if self['content-range']
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
          
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
              v = self['content-encoding']
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
              case v&.downcase
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
              when 'deflate', 'gzip', 'x-gzip' then
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
                self.delete 'content-encoding'
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
          
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
                inflate_body_io = Inflater.new(@socket)
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
          
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
                begin
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
                  yield inflate_body_io
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
                ensure
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
                  orig_err = $!
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
                  begin
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
                    inflate_body_io.finish
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
                  rescue => err
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
                    raise orig_err || err
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
                  end
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
                end
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
              when 'none', 'identity' then
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
                self.delete 'content-encoding'
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
          
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
                yield @socket
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
              else
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
                yield @socket
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
              end
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
            end
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
          
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          1
          
            def read_body_0(dest)
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
              inflater do |inflate_body_io|
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
                if chunked?
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
                  read_chunked dest, inflate_body_io
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
                  return
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
                end
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
          
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
                @socket = inflate_body_io
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
          
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
                clen = content_length()
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
                if clen
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
                  @socket.read clen, dest, true   # ignore EOF
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
                  return
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
                end
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
                clen = range_length()
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
                if clen
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
                  @socket.read clen, dest
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
                  return
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
                end
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
                @socket.read_all dest
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
              end
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
            end
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
          
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
            ##
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          
          
            # read_chunked reads from +@socket+ for chunk-size, chunk-extension, CRLF,
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
            # etc. and +chunk_data_io+ for chunk-data which may be deflate or gzip
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
            # encoded.
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
            #
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
            # See RFC 2616 section 3.6.1 for definitions
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
          
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          1
          
            def read_chunked(dest, chunk_data_io) # :nodoc:
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
              total = 0
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
              while true
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
                line = @socket.readline
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
                hexlen = line.slice(/[0-9a-fA-F]+/) or
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
                    raise Net::HTTPBadResponse, "wrong chunk size line: #{line}"
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
                len = hexlen.hex
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
                break if len == 0
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
                begin
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
                  chunk_data_io.read len, dest
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
                ensure
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
                  total += len
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
                  @socket.read 2   # \r\n
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
                end
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
              end
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
              until @socket.readline.empty?
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
                # none
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
              end
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
            end
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
          
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          1
          
            def stream_check
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
              raise IOError, 'attempt to read body out of block' if @socket.closed?
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
            end
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
          
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          1
          
            def procdest(dest, block)
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
              raise ArgumentError, 'both arg and block given for HTTP method' if
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
                dest and block
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
              if block
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
                Net::ReadAdapter.new(block)
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
              else
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
                dest || ''
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
              end
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
            end
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
          
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
            ##
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          
          
            # Inflater is a wrapper around Net::BufferedIO that transparently inflates
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
            # zlib and gzip streams.
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
          
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          1
          
            class Inflater # :nodoc:
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
          
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
              ##
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
              # Creates a new Inflater wrapping +socket+
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
          
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          1
          
              def initialize socket
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          
          
                @socket = socket
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
                # zlib with automatic gzip detection
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
                @inflate = Zlib::Inflate.new(32 + Zlib::MAX_WBITS)
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
              end
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
          
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
              ##
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          
          
              # Finishes the inflate stream.
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
          
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          1
          
              def finish
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          
          
                return if @inflate.total_in == 0
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
                @inflate.finish
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          
          
              end
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
          
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
              ##
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          
          
              # Returns a Net::ReadAdapter that inflates each read chunk into +dest+.
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          
          
              #
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
              # This allows a large response body to be inflated without storing the
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
              # entire body in memory.
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
          
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          1
          
              def inflate_adapter(dest)
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
                if dest.respond_to?(:set_encoding)
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
                  dest.set_encoding(Encoding::ASCII_8BIT)
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          
          
                elsif dest.respond_to?(:force_encoding)
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
                  dest.force_encoding(Encoding::ASCII_8BIT)
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
                end
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
                block = proc do |compressed_chunk|
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
                  @inflate.inflate(compressed_chunk) do |chunk|
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
                    compressed_chunk.clear
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          
          
                    dest << chunk
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
                  end
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          
          
                end
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
          
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          
          
                Net::ReadAdapter.new(block)
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
              end
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
          
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
              ##
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
              # Reads +clen+ bytes from the socket, inflates them, then writes them to
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
              # +dest+.  +ignore_eof+ is passed down to Net::BufferedIO#read
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          
          
              #
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          
          
              # Unlike Net::BufferedIO#read, this method returns more than +clen+ bytes.
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          
          
              # At this time there is no way for a user of Net::HTTPResponse to read a
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          
          
              # specific number of bytes from the HTTP response body, so this internal
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
              # API does not return the same number of bytes as were requested.
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          
          
              #
        
      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          
          
              # See https://bugs.ruby-lang.org/issues/6492 for further discussion.
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          
          
          
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          1
          
              def read clen, dest, ignore_eof = false
        
      403. 
      
        
    403. 
          
          
                temp_dest = inflate_adapter(dest)
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          
          
          
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          
          
                @socket.read clen, temp_dest, ignore_eof
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
              end
        
      407. 
      
        
    407. 
          
          
          
        
      408. 
      
        
    408. 
          
          
              ##
        
      409. 
      
        
    409. 
          
          
              # Reads the rest of the socket, inflates it, then writes it to +dest+.
        
      410. 
      
        
    410. 
          
          
          
        
      411. 
      
        
    411. 
          1
          
              def read_all dest
        
      412. 
      
        
    412. 
          
          
                temp_dest = inflate_adapter(dest)
        
      413. 
      
        
    413. 
          
          
          
        
      414. 
      
        
    414. 
          
          
                @socket.read_all temp_dest
        
      415. 
      
        
    415. 
          
          
              end
        
      416. 
      
        
    416. 
          
          
          
        
      417. 
      
        
    417. 
          
          
            end
        
      418. 
      
        
    418. 
          
          
          
        
      419. 
      
        
    419. 
          
          
          end
        
      420. 
      
        
    420. 
          
          
          
        
      421.

    /usr/lib/ruby/2.6.0/net/http/responses.rb

    149 relevant lines. 149 lines covered and 0 lines missed.

          # :stopdoc:

          # https://www.iana.org/assignments/http-status-codes/http-status-codes.xhtml

          class Net::HTTPUnknownResponse < Net::HTTPResponse

          1
          
          class Net::HTTPNotModified < Net::HTTPRedirection        # 304
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          1
          
            HAS_BODY = false

          1
          
          module Net # :nodoc:
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
          
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          1
          
            class Protocol   #:nodoc: internal use only
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          1
          
              private
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          1
          
              def Protocol.protocol_param(name, val)
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                module_eval(<<-End, __FILE__, __LINE__ + 1)
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                  def #{name}
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                    #{val}
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                  end
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                End
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
              end
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
          
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          1
          
              def ssl_socket_connect(s, timeout)
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                if timeout
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                  while true
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                    raise Net::OpenTimeout if timeout <= 0
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                    start = Process.clock_gettime Process::CLOCK_MONOTONIC
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                    # to_io is required because SSLSocket doesn't have wait_readable yet
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
                    case s.connect_nonblock(exception: false)
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                    when :wait_readable; s.to_io.wait_readable(timeout)
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                    when :wait_writable; s.to_io.wait_writable(timeout)
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                    else; break
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                    end
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                    timeout -= Process.clock_gettime(Process::CLOCK_MONOTONIC) - start
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                  end
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                else
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                  s.connect
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                end
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
              end
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
            end
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
          
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
          
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          1
          
            class ProtocolError          < StandardError; end
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          1
          
            class ProtoSyntaxError       < ProtocolError; end
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          1
          
            class ProtoFatalError        < ProtocolError; end
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          1
          
            class ProtoUnknownError      < ProtocolError; end
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          1
          
            class ProtoServerError       < ProtocolError; end
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          1
          
            class ProtoAuthError         < ProtocolError; end
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          1
          
            class ProtoCommandError      < ProtocolError; end
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          1
          
            class ProtoRetriableError    < ProtocolError; end
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          1
          
            ProtocRetryError = ProtoRetriableError
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
          
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
            ##
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
            # OpenTimeout, a subclass of Timeout::Error, is raised if a connection cannot
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
            # be created within the open_timeout.
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
          
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          1
          
            class OpenTimeout            < Timeout::Error; end
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
          
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
            ##
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
            # ReadTimeout, a subclass of Timeout::Error, is raised if a chunk of the
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
            # response cannot be read within the read_timeout.
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
          
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          1
          
            class ReadTimeout < Timeout::Error
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          1
          
              def initialize(io = nil)
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                @io = io
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
              end
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          1
          
              attr_reader :io
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
          
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          1
          
              def message
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                msg = super
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                if @io
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                  msg = "#{msg} with #{@io.inspect}"
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                end
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                msg
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
              end
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
            end
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
          
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
            ##
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
            # WriteTimeout, a subclass of Timeout::Error, is raised if a chunk of the
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
            # response cannot be written within the write_timeout.  Not raised on Windows.
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
          
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          1
          
            class WriteTimeout < Timeout::Error
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          1
          
              def initialize(io = nil)
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                @io = io
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
              end
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          1
          
              attr_reader :io
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
          
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          1
          
              def message
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                msg = super
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                if @io
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                  msg = "#{msg} with #{@io.inspect}"
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                end
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                msg
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
              end
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
            end
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
          
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
          
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          1
          
            class BufferedIO   #:nodoc: internal use only
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          1
          
              def initialize(io, read_timeout: 60, write_timeout: 60, continue_timeout: nil, debug_output: nil)
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                @io = io
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                @read_timeout = read_timeout
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                @write_timeout = write_timeout
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                @continue_timeout = continue_timeout
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                @debug_output = debug_output
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                @rbuf = ''.b
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
              end
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
          
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          1
          
              attr_reader :io
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          1
          
              attr_accessor :read_timeout
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          1
          
              attr_accessor :write_timeout
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          1
          
              attr_accessor :continue_timeout
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          1
          
              attr_accessor :debug_output
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
          
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          1
          
              def inspect
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                "#<#{self.class} io=#{@io}>"
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
              end
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
          
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          1
          
              def eof?
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                @io.eof?
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
              end
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
          
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          1
          
              def closed?
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                @io.closed?
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
              end
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
          
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          1
          
              def close
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                @io.close
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
              end
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
          
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
              #
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
              # Read
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
              #
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
          
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          1
          
              public
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
          
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          1
          
              def read(len, dest = ''.b, ignore_eof = false)
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                LOG "reading #{len} bytes..."
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                read_bytes = 0
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                begin
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                  while read_bytes + @rbuf.size < len
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                    s = rbuf_consume(@rbuf.size)
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                    read_bytes += s.size
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
                    dest << s
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                    rbuf_fill
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                  end
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                  s = rbuf_consume(len - read_bytes)
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                  read_bytes += s.size
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                  dest << s
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                rescue EOFError
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                  raise unless ignore_eof
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                end
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                LOG "read #{read_bytes} bytes"
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                dest
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
              end
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
          
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          1
          
              def read_all(dest = ''.b)
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                LOG 'reading all...'
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                read_bytes = 0
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                begin
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                  while true
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                    s = rbuf_consume(@rbuf.size)
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                    read_bytes += s.size
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
                    dest << s
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                    rbuf_fill
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
                  end
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                rescue EOFError
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
                  ;
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                end
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                LOG "read #{read_bytes} bytes"
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                dest
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
              end
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
          
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          1
          
              def readuntil(terminator, ignore_eof = false)
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                begin
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
                  until idx = @rbuf.index(terminator)
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                    rbuf_fill
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
                  end
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
                  return rbuf_consume(idx + terminator.size)
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
                rescue EOFError
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
                  raise unless ignore_eof
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
                  return rbuf_consume(@rbuf.size)
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
                end
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
              end
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
          
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          1
          
              def readline
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
                readuntil("\n").chop
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
              end
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
          
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          1
          
              private
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
          
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          1
          
              BUFSIZE = 1024 * 16
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
          
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          1
          
              def rbuf_fill
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
                tmp = @rbuf.empty? ? @rbuf : nil
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                case rv = @io.read_nonblock(BUFSIZE, tmp, exception: false)
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
                when String
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
                  return if rv.equal?(tmp)
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
                  @rbuf << rv
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
                  rv.clear
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
                  return
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
                when :wait_readable
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
                  (io = @io.to_io).wait_readable(@read_timeout) or raise Net::ReadTimeout.new(io)
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                  # continue looping
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
                when :wait_writable
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
                  # OpenSSL::Buffering#read_nonblock may fail with IO::WaitWritable.
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
                  # http://www.openssl.org/support/faq.html#PROG10
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
                  (io = @io.to_io).wait_writable(@read_timeout) or raise Net::ReadTimeout.new(io)
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
                  # continue looping
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
                when nil
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
                  raise EOFError, 'end of file reached'
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
                end while true
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
              end
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
          
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          1
          
              def rbuf_consume(len)
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
                if len == @rbuf.size
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
                  s = @rbuf
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
                  @rbuf = ''.b
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
                else
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
                  s = @rbuf.slice!(0, len)
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
                end
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
                @debug_output << %Q[-> #{s.dump}\n] if @debug_output
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
                s
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
              end
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
          
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
              #
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
              # Write
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
              #
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
          
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          1
          
              public
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
          
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          1
          
              def write(*strs)
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
                writing {
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
                  write0(*strs)
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
                }
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
              end
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
          
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          1
          
              alias << write
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
          
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          1
          
              def writeline(str)
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
                writing {
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
                  write0 str + "\r\n"
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
                }
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
              end
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
          
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          1
          
              private
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
          
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          1
          
              def writing
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
                @written_bytes = 0
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
                @debug_output << '<- ' if @debug_output
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
                yield
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
                @debug_output << "\n" if @debug_output
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
                bytes = @written_bytes
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
                @written_bytes = nil
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
                bytes
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
              end
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
          
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          1
          
              def write0(*strs)
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
                @debug_output << strs.map(&:dump).join if @debug_output
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
                orig_written_bytes = @written_bytes
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
                strs.each_with_index do |str, i|
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
                  need_retry = true
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
                  case len = @io.write_nonblock(str, exception: false)
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
                  when Integer
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
                    @written_bytes += len
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
                    len -= str.bytesize
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
                    if len == 0
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
                      if strs.size == i+1
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
                        return @written_bytes - orig_written_bytes
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
                      else
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
                        need_retry = false
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
                        # next string
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
                      end
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
                    elsif len < 0
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
                      str = str.byteslice(len, -len)
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
                    else # len > 0
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
                      need_retry = false
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
                      # next string
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
                    end
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
                    # continue looping
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
                  when :wait_writable
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
                    (io = @io.to_io).wait_writable(@write_timeout) or raise Net::WriteTimeout.new(io)
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
                    # continue looping
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
                  end while need_retry
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
                end
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
              end
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
          
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
              #
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
              # Logging
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
              #
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
          
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          1
          
              private
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
          
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          1
          
              def LOG_off
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
                @save_debug_out = @debug_output
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
                @debug_output = nil
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
              end
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
          
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          1
          
              def LOG_on
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
                @debug_output = @save_debug_out
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
              end
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
          
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          1
          
              def LOG(msg)
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
                return unless @debug_output
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
                @debug_output << msg + "\n"
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
              end
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
            end
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
          
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
          
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          1
          
            class InternetMessageIO < BufferedIO   #:nodoc: internal use only
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          1
          
              def initialize(*)
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
                super
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
                @wbuf = nil
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
              end
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
          
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
              #
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
              # Read
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
              #
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
          
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          1
          
              def each_message_chunk
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
                LOG 'reading message...'
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
                LOG_off()
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
                read_bytes = 0
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
                while (line = readuntil("\r\n")) != ".\r\n"
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
                  read_bytes += line.size
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
                  yield line.delete_prefix('.')
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
                end
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
                LOG_on()
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
                LOG "read message (#{read_bytes} bytes)"
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
              end
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
          
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
              # *library private* (cannot handle 'break')
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          1
          
              def each_list_item
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
                while (str = readuntil("\r\n")) != ".\r\n"
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
                  yield str.chop
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
                end
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
              end
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
          
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          1
          
              def write_message_0(src)
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
                prev = @written_bytes
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
                each_crlf_line(src) do |line|
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          
          
                  write0 dot_stuff(line)
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
                end
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
                @written_bytes - prev
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
              end
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
          
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
              #
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          
          
              # Write
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
              #
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          
          
          
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          1
          
              def write_message(src)
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
                LOG "writing message from #{src.class}"
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          
          
                LOG_off()
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
                len = writing {
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
                  using_each_crlf_line {
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          
          
                    write_message_0 src
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          
          
                  }
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
                }
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
                LOG_on()
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
                LOG "wrote #{len} bytes"
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
                len
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
              end
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
          
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          1
          
              def write_message_by_block(&block)
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
                LOG 'writing message from block'
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
                LOG_off()
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
                len = writing {
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
                  using_each_crlf_line {
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
                    begin
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          
          
                      block.call(WriteAdapter.new(self, :write_message_0))
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
                    rescue LocalJumpError
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          
          
                      # allow `break' from writer block
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
                    end
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          
          
                  }
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
                }
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
                LOG_on()
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
                LOG "wrote #{len} bytes"
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
                len
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
              end
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          
          
          
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          1
          
              private
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          
          
          
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          1
          
              def dot_stuff(s)
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
                s.sub(/\A\./, '..')
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          
          
              end
        
      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          
          
          
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          1
          
              def using_each_crlf_line
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          
          
                @wbuf = ''.b
        
      403. 
      
        
    403. 
          
          
                yield
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          
          
                if not @wbuf.empty?   # unterminated last line
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          
          
                  write0 dot_stuff(@wbuf.chomp) + "\r\n"
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
                elsif @written_bytes == 0   # empty src
        
      407. 
      
        
    407. 
          
          
                  write0 "\r\n"
        
      408. 
      
        
    408. 
          
          
                end
        
      409. 
      
        
    409. 
          
          
                write0 ".\r\n"
        
      410. 
      
        
    410. 
          
          
                @wbuf = nil
        
      411. 
      
        
    411. 
          
          
              end
        
      412. 
      
        
    412. 
          
          
          
        
      413. 
      
        
    413. 
          1
          
              def each_crlf_line(src)
        
      414. 
      
        
    414.
