                buffer_filling(@wbuf, src) do
        
      415. 
      
        
    415. 
          
          
                  while line = @wbuf.slice!(/\A[^\r\n]*(?:\n|\r(?:\n|(?!\z)))/)
        
      416. 
      
        
    416. 
          
          
                    yield line.chomp("\n") + "\r\n"
        
      417. 
      
        
    417. 
          
          
                  end
        
      418. 
      
        
    418. 
          
          
                end
        
      419. 
      
        
    419. 
          
          
              end
        
      420. 
      
        
    420. 
          
          
          
        
      421. 
      
        
    421. 
          1
          
              def buffer_filling(buf, src)
        
      422. 
      
        
    422. 
          
          
                case src
        
      423. 
      
        
    423. 
          
          
                when String    # for speeding up.
        
      424. 
      
        
    424. 
          
          
                  0.step(src.size - 1, 1024) do |i|
        
      425. 
      
        
    425. 
          
          
                    buf << src[i, 1024]
        
      426. 
      
        
    426. 
          
          
                    yield
        
      427. 
      
        
    427. 
          
          
                  end
        
      428. 
      
        
    428. 
          
          
                when File    # for speeding up.
        
      429. 
      
        
    429. 
          
          
                  while s = src.read(1024)
        
      430. 
      
        
    430. 
          
          
                    buf << s
        
      431. 
      
        
    431. 
          
          
                    yield
        
      432. 
      
        
    432. 
          
          
                  end
        
      433. 
      
        
    433. 
          
          
                else    # generic reader
        
      434. 
      
        
    434. 
          
          
                  src.each do |str|
        
      435. 
      
        
    435. 
          
          
                    buf << str
        
      436. 
      
        
    436. 
          
          
                    yield if buf.size > 1024
        
      437. 
      
        
    437. 
          
          
                  end
        
      438. 
      
        
    438. 
          
          
                  yield unless buf.empty?
        
      439. 
      
        
    439. 
          
          
                end
        
      440. 
      
        
    440. 
          
          
              end
        
      441. 
      
        
    441. 
          
          
            end
        
      442. 
      
        
    442. 
          
          
          
        
      443. 
      
        
    443. 
          
          
          
        
      444. 
      
        
    444. 
          
          
            #
        
      445. 
      
        
    445. 
          
          
            # The writer adapter class
        
      446. 
      
        
    446. 
          
          
            #
        
      447. 
      
        
    447. 
          1
          
            class WriteAdapter
        
      448. 
      
        
    448. 
          1
          
              def initialize(socket, method)
        
      449. 
      
        
    449. 
          
          
                @socket = socket
        
      450. 
      
        
    450. 
          
          
                @method_id = method
        
      451. 
      
        
    451. 
          
          
              end
        
      452. 
      
        
    452. 
          
          
          
        
      453. 
      
        
    453. 
          1
          
              def inspect
        
      454. 
      
        
    454. 
          
          
                "#<#{self.class} socket=#{@socket.inspect}>"
        
      455. 
      
        
    455. 
          
          
              end
        
      456. 
      
        
    456. 
          
          
          
        
      457. 
      
        
    457. 
          1
          
              def write(str)
        
      458. 
      
        
    458. 
          
          
                @socket.__send__(@method_id, str)
        
      459. 
      
        
    459. 
          
          
              end
        
      460. 
      
        
    460. 
          
          
          
        
      461. 
      
        
    461. 
          1
          
              alias print write
        
      462. 
      
        
    462. 
          
          
          
        
      463. 
      
        
    463. 
          1
          
              def <<(str)
        
      464. 
      
        
    464. 
          
          
                write str
        
      465. 
      
        
    465. 
          
          
                self
        
      466. 
      
        
    466. 
          
          
              end
        
      467. 
      
        
    467. 
          
          
          
        
      468. 
      
        
    468. 
          1
          
              def puts(str = '')
        
      469. 
      
        
    469. 
          
          
                write str.chomp("\n") + "\n"
        
      470. 
      
        
    470. 
          
          
              end
        
      471. 
      
        
    471. 
          
          
          
        
      472. 
      
        
    472. 
          1
          
              def printf(*args)
        
      473. 
      
        
    473. 
          
          
                write sprintf(*args)
        
      474. 
      
        
    474. 
          
          
              end
        
      475. 
      
        
    475. 
          
          
            end
        
      476. 
      
        
    476. 
          
          
          
        
      477. 
      
        
    477. 
          
          
          
        
      478. 
      
        
    478. 
          1
          
            class ReadAdapter   #:nodoc: internal use only
        
      479. 
      
        
    479. 
          1
          
              def initialize(block)
        
      480. 
      
        
    480. 
          
          
                @block = block
        
      481. 
      
        
    481. 
          
          
              end
        
      482. 
      
        
    482. 
          
          
          
        
      483. 
      
        
    483. 
          1
          
              def inspect
        
      484. 
      
        
    484. 
          
          
                "#<#{self.class}>"
        
      485. 
      
        
    485. 
          
          
              end
        
      486. 
      
        
    486. 
          
          
          
        
      487. 
      
        
    487. 
          1
          
              def <<(str)
        
      488. 
      
        
    488. 
          
          
                call_block(str, &@block) if @block
        
      489. 
      
        
    489. 
          
          
              end
        
      490. 
      
        
    490. 
          
          
          
        
      491. 
      
        
    491. 
          1
          
              private
        
      492. 
      
        
    492. 
          
          
          
        
      493. 
      
        
    493. 
          
          
              # This method is needed because @block must be called by yield,
        
      494. 
      
        
    494. 
          
          
              # not Proc#call.  You can see difference when using `break' in
        
      495. 
      
        
    495. 
          
          
              # the block.
        
      496. 
      
        
    496. 
          1
          
              def call_block(str)
        
      497. 
      
        
    497. 
          
          
                yield str
        
      498. 
      
        
    498. 
          
          
              end
        
      499. 
      
        
    499. 
          
          
            end
        
      500. 
      
        
    500. 
          
          
          
        
      501. 
      
        
    501. 
          
          
          
        
      502. 
      
        
    502. 
          1
          
            module NetPrivate   #:nodoc: obsolete
        
      503. 
      
        
    503. 
          1
          
              Socket = ::Net::InternetMessageIO
        
      504. 
      
        
    504. 
          
          
            end
        
      505. 
      
        
    505. 
          
          
          
        
      506. 
      
        
    506. 
          
          
          end   # module Net
        
      507.

    /usr/lib/ruby/2.6.0/open3.rb

    16.58 % covered

    187 relevant lines. 31 lines covered and 156 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          
          
          # frozen_string_literal: true
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
          #
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
          # = open3.rb: Popen, but with stderr, too
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          #
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
          # Author:: Yukihiro Matsumoto
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          # Documentation:: Konrad Meyer
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
          #
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
          # Open3 gives you access to stdin, stdout, and stderr when running other
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
          # programs.
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
          #
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
          #
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
          # Open3 grants you access to stdin, stdout, stderr and a thread to wait for the
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
          # child process when running another program.
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
          # You can specify various attributes, redirections, current directory, etc., of
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          # the program in the same way as for Process.spawn.
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
          #
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
          # - Open3.popen3 : pipes for stdin, stdout, stderr
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
          # - Open3.popen2 : pipes for stdin, stdout
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
          # - Open3.popen2e : pipes for stdin, merged stdout and stderr
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
          # - Open3.capture3 : give a string for stdin; get strings for stdout, stderr
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
          # - Open3.capture2 : give a string for stdin; get a string for stdout
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
          # - Open3.capture2e : give a string for stdin; get a string for merged stdout and stderr
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
          # - Open3.pipeline_rw : pipes for first stdin and last stdout of a pipeline
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
          # - Open3.pipeline_r : pipe for last stdout of a pipeline
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
          # - Open3.pipeline_w : pipe for first stdin of a pipeline
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
          # - Open3.pipeline_start : run a pipeline without waiting
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
          # - Open3.pipeline : run a pipeline and wait for its completion
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
          #
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
          
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          1
          
          module Open3
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
          
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
            # Open stdin, stdout, and stderr streams and start external executable.
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
            # In addition, a thread to wait for the started process is created.
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
            # The thread has a pid method and a thread variable :pid which is the pid of
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
            # the started process.
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
            #
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
            # Block form:
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
            #
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
            #   Open3.popen3([env,] cmd... [, opts]) {|stdin, stdout, stderr, wait_thr|
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
            #     pid = wait_thr.pid # pid of the started process.
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
            #     ...
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
            #     exit_status = wait_thr.value # Process::Status object returned.
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
            #
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
            # Non-block form:
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
            #
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
            #   stdin, stdout, stderr, wait_thr = Open3.popen3([env,] cmd... [, opts])
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
            #   pid = wait_thr[:pid]  # pid of the started process
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
            #   ...
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
            #   stdin.close  # stdin, stdout and stderr should be closed explicitly in this form.
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
            #   stdout.close
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
            #   stderr.close
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
            #   exit_status = wait_thr.value  # Process::Status object returned.
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
            #
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
            # The parameters env, cmd, and opts are passed to Process.spawn.
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
            # A commandline string and a list of argument strings can be accepted as follows:
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
            #
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
            #   Open3.popen3("echo abc") {|i, o, e, t| ... }
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
            #   Open3.popen3("echo", "abc") {|i, o, e, t| ... }
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
            #   Open3.popen3(["echo", "argv0"], "abc") {|i, o, e, t| ... }
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
            #
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
            # If the last parameter, opts, is a Hash, it is recognized as an option for Process.spawn.
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
            #
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
            #   Open3.popen3("pwd", :chdir=>"/") {|i,o,e,t|
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
            #     p o.read.chomp #=> "/"
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
            #
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
            # wait_thr.value waits for the termination of the process.
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
            # The block form also waits for the process when it returns.
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
            #
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
            # Closing stdin, stdout and stderr does not wait for the process to complete.
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
            #
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
            # You should be careful to avoid deadlocks.
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
            # Since pipes are fixed length buffers,
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
            # Open3.popen3("prog") {|i, o, e, t| o.read } deadlocks if
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
            # the program generates too much output on stderr.
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
            # You should read stdout and stderr simultaneously (using threads or IO.select).
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
            # However, if you don't need stderr output, you can use Open3.popen2.
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
            # If merged stdout and stderr output is not a problem, you can use Open3.popen2e.
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
            # If you really need stdout and stderr output as separate strings, you can consider Open3.capture3.
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
            #
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          1
          
            def popen3(*cmd, &block)
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
              if Hash === cmd.last
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                opts = cmd.pop.dup
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
              else
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                opts = {}
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
              end
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
          
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
              in_r, in_w = IO.pipe
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
              opts[:in] = in_r
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
              in_w.sync = true
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
          
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
              out_r, out_w = IO.pipe
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
              opts[:out] = out_w
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
          
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
              err_r, err_w = IO.pipe
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
              opts[:err] = err_w
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
          
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
              popen_run(cmd, opts, [in_r, out_w, err_w], [in_w, out_r, err_r], &block)
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
            end
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          1
          
            module_function :popen3
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
          
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
            # Open3.popen2 is similar to Open3.popen3 except that it doesn't create a pipe for
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
            # the standard error stream.
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
            #
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
            # Block form:
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
            #
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
            #   Open3.popen2([env,] cmd... [, opts]) {|stdin, stdout, wait_thr|
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
            #     pid = wait_thr.pid # pid of the started process.
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
            #     ...
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
            #     exit_status = wait_thr.value # Process::Status object returned.
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
            #
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
            # Non-block form:
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
            #
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
            #   stdin, stdout, wait_thr = Open3.popen2([env,] cmd... [, opts])
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
            #   ...
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
            #   stdin.close  # stdin and stdout should be closed explicitly in this form.
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
            #   stdout.close
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
            #
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
            # See Process.spawn for the optional hash arguments _env_ and _opts_.
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
            #
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
            # Example:
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
            #
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
            #   Open3.popen2("wc -c") {|i,o,t|
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
            #     i.print "answer to life the universe and everything"
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
            #     i.close
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
            #     p o.gets #=> "42\n"
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
            #
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
            #   Open3.popen2("bc -q") {|i,o,t|
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
            #     i.puts "obase=13"
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
            #     i.puts "6 * 9"
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
            #     p o.gets #=> "42\n"
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
            #
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
            #   Open3.popen2("dc") {|i,o,t|
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
            #     i.print "42P"
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
            #     i.close
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
            #     p o.read #=> "*"
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
            #
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          1
          
            def popen2(*cmd, &block)
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
              if Hash === cmd.last
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                opts = cmd.pop.dup
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
              else
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                opts = {}
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
              end
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
          
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
              in_r, in_w = IO.pipe
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
              opts[:in] = in_r
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
              in_w.sync = true
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
          
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
              out_r, out_w = IO.pipe
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
              opts[:out] = out_w
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
          
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
              popen_run(cmd, opts, [in_r, out_w], [in_w, out_r], &block)
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
            end
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          1
          
            module_function :popen2
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
          
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
            # Open3.popen2e is similar to Open3.popen3 except that it merges
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
            # the standard output stream and the standard error stream.
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
            #
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
            # Block form:
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
            #
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
            #   Open3.popen2e([env,] cmd... [, opts]) {|stdin, stdout_and_stderr, wait_thr|
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
            #     pid = wait_thr.pid # pid of the started process.
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
            #     ...
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
            #     exit_status = wait_thr.value # Process::Status object returned.
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
            #
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
            # Non-block form:
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
            #
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
            #   stdin, stdout_and_stderr, wait_thr = Open3.popen2e([env,] cmd... [, opts])
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
            #   ...
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
            #   stdin.close  # stdin and stdout_and_stderr should be closed explicitly in this form.
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
            #   stdout_and_stderr.close
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
            #
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
            # See Process.spawn for the optional hash arguments _env_ and _opts_.
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
            #
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
            # Example:
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
            #   # check gcc warnings
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
            #   source = "foo.c"
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
            #   Open3.popen2e("gcc", "-Wall", source) {|i,oe,t|
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
            #     oe.each {|line|
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
            #       if /warning/ =~ line
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
            #         ...
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
            #       end
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
            #     }
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
            #
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          1
          
            def popen2e(*cmd, &block)
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
              if Hash === cmd.last
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
                opts = cmd.pop.dup
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
              else
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
                opts = {}
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
              end
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
          
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
              in_r, in_w = IO.pipe
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
              opts[:in] = in_r
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
              in_w.sync = true
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
          
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
              out_r, out_w = IO.pipe
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
              opts[[:out, :err]] = out_w
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
          
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
              popen_run(cmd, opts, [in_r, out_w], [in_w, out_r], &block)
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
            end
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          1
          
            module_function :popen2e
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
          
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          1
          
            def popen_run(cmd, opts, child_io, parent_io) # :nodoc:
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
              pid = spawn(*cmd, opts)
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
              wait_thr = Process.detach(pid)
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
              child_io.each(&:close)
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
              result = [*parent_io, wait_thr]
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
              if defined? yield
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                begin
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
                  return yield(*result)
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
                ensure
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
                  parent_io.each(&:close)
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
                  wait_thr.join
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
                end
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
              end
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
              result
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
            end
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          1
          
            module_function :popen_run
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          1
          
            class << self
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          1
          
              private :popen_run
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
            end
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
          
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
            # Open3.capture3 captures the standard output and the standard error of a command.
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
            #
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
            #   stdout_str, stderr_str, status = Open3.capture3([env,] cmd... [, opts])
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
            #
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
            # The arguments env, cmd and opts are passed to Open3.popen3 except
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
            # <code>opts[:stdin_data]</code> and <code>opts[:binmode]</code>.  See Process.spawn.
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
            #
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
            # If <code>opts[:stdin_data]</code> is specified, it is sent to the command's standard input.
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
            #
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
            # If <code>opts[:binmode]</code> is true, internal pipes are set to binary mode.
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
            #
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
            # Examples:
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
            #
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
            #   # dot is a command of graphviz.
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
            #   graph = <<'End'
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
            #     digraph g {
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
            #       a -> b
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
            #     }
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
            #   End
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
            #   drawn_graph, dot_log = Open3.capture3("dot -v", :stdin_data=>graph)
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
            #
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
            #   o, e, s = Open3.capture3("echo abc; sort >&2", :stdin_data=>"foo\nbar\nbaz\n")
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
            #   p o #=> "abc\n"
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
            #   p e #=> "bar\nbaz\nfoo\n"
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
            #   p s #=> #<Process::Status: pid 32682 exit 0>
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
            #
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
            #   # generate a thumbnail image using the convert command of ImageMagick.
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
            #   # However, if the image is really stored in a file,
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
            #   # system("convert", "-thumbnail", "80", "png:#{filename}", "png:-") is better
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
            #   # because of reduced memory consumption.
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
            #   # But if the image is stored in a DB or generated by the gnuplot Open3.capture2 example,
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
            #   # Open3.capture3 should be considered.
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
            #   #
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
            #   image = File.read("/usr/share/openclipart/png/animals/mammals/sheep-md-v0.1.png", :binmode=>true)
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
            #   thumbnail, err, s = Open3.capture3("convert -thumbnail 80 png:- png:-", :stdin_data=>image, :binmode=>true)
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
            #   if s.success?
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
            #     STDOUT.binmode; print thumbnail
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
            #   end
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
            #
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          1
          
            def capture3(*cmd)
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
              if Hash === cmd.last
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
                opts = cmd.pop.dup
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
              else
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
                opts = {}
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
              end
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
          
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
              stdin_data = opts.delete(:stdin_data) || ''
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
              binmode = opts.delete(:binmode)
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
          
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
              popen3(*cmd, opts) {|i, o, e, t|
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
                if binmode
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
                  i.binmode
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
                  o.binmode
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
                  e.binmode
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
                end
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
                out_reader = Thread.new { o.read }
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
                err_reader = Thread.new { e.read }
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
                begin
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
                  if stdin_data.respond_to? :readpartial
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
                    IO.copy_stream(stdin_data, i)
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
                  else
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
                    i.write stdin_data
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
                  end
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
                rescue Errno::EPIPE
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
                end
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
                i.close
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
                [out_reader.value, err_reader.value, t.value]
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
              }
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
            end
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          1
          
            module_function :capture3
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
          
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
            # Open3.capture2 captures the standard output of a command.
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
            #
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
            #   stdout_str, status = Open3.capture2([env,] cmd... [, opts])
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          
          
            #
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
            # The arguments env, cmd and opts are passed to Open3.popen3 except
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
            # <code>opts[:stdin_data]</code> and <code>opts[:binmode]</code>.  See Process.spawn.
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
            #
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
            # If <code>opts[:stdin_data]</code> is specified, it is sent to the command's standard input.
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
            #
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
            # If <code>opts[:binmode]</code> is true, internal pipes are set to binary mode.
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
            #
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
            # Example:
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
            #
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
            #   # factor is a command for integer factorization.
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
            #   o, s = Open3.capture2("factor", :stdin_data=>"42")
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
            #   p o #=> "42: 2 3 7\n"
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
            #
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
            #   # generate x**2 graph in png using gnuplot.
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
            #   gnuplot_commands = <<"End"
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
            #     set terminal png
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
            #     plot x**2, "-" with lines
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
            #     1 14
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
            #     2 1
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
            #     3 8
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
            #     4 5
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
            #     e
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
            #   End
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
            #   image, s = Open3.capture2("gnuplot", :stdin_data=>gnuplot_commands, :binmode=>true)
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
            #
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          1
          
            def capture2(*cmd)
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
              if Hash === cmd.last
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
                opts = cmd.pop.dup
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
              else
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
                opts = {}
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
              end
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
          
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
              stdin_data = opts.delete(:stdin_data)
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
              binmode = opts.delete(:binmode)
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
          
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
              popen2(*cmd, opts) {|i, o, t|
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
                if binmode
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
                  i.binmode
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
                  o.binmode
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
                end
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          
          
                out_reader = Thread.new { o.read }
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
                if stdin_data
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
                  begin
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
                    if stdin_data.respond_to? :readpartial
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
                      IO.copy_stream(stdin_data, i)
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
                    else
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
                      i.write stdin_data
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
                    end
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
                  rescue Errno::EPIPE
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          
          
                  end
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
                end
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
                i.close
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
                [out_reader.value, t.value]
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
              }
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
            end
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          1
          
            module_function :capture2
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
          
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          
          
            # Open3.capture2e captures the standard output and the standard error of a command.
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          
          
            #
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
            #   stdout_and_stderr_str, status = Open3.capture2e([env,] cmd... [, opts])
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          
          
            #
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
            # The arguments env, cmd and opts are passed to Open3.popen3 except
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
            # <code>opts[:stdin_data]</code> and <code>opts[:binmode]</code>.  See Process.spawn.
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          
          
            #
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          
          
            # If <code>opts[:stdin_data]</code> is specified, it is sent to the command's standard input.
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
            #
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
            # If <code>opts[:binmode]</code> is true, internal pipes are set to binary mode.
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
            #
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
            # Example:
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
            #
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
            #   # capture make log
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          
          
            #   make_log, s = Open3.capture2e("make")
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
            #
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          1
          
            def capture2e(*cmd)
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
              if Hash === cmd.last
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
                opts = cmd.pop.dup
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
              else
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          
          
                opts = {}
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
              end
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          
          
          
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
              stdin_data = opts.delete(:stdin_data)
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          
          
              binmode = opts.delete(:binmode)
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
          
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
              popen2e(*cmd, opts) {|i, oe, t|
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
                if binmode
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
                  i.binmode
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
                  oe.binmode
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          
          
                end
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          
          
                outerr_reader = Thread.new { oe.read }
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          
          
                if stdin_data
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          
          
                  begin
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
                    if stdin_data.respond_to? :readpartial
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          
          
                      IO.copy_stream(stdin_data, i)
        
      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          
          
                    else
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          
          
                      i.write stdin_data
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          
          
                    end
        
      403. 
      
        
    403. 
          
          
                  rescue Errno::EPIPE
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          
          
                  end
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          
          
                end
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
                i.close
        
      407. 
      
        
    407. 
          
          
                [outerr_reader.value, t.value]
        
      408. 
      
        
    408. 
          
          
              }
        
      409. 
      
        
    409. 
          
          
            end
        
      410. 
      
        
    410. 
          1
          
            module_function :capture2e
        
      411. 
      
        
    411. 
          
          
          
        
      412. 
      
        
    412. 
          
          
            # Open3.pipeline_rw starts a list of commands as a pipeline with pipes
        
      413. 
      
        
    413. 
          
          
            # which connect to stdin of the first command and stdout of the last command.
        
      414. 
      
        
    414. 
          
          
            #
        
      415. 
      
        
    415. 
          
          
            #   Open3.pipeline_rw(cmd1, cmd2, ... [, opts]) {|first_stdin, last_stdout, wait_threads|
        
      416. 
      
        
    416. 
          
          
            #     ...
        
      417. 
      
        
    417. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      418. 
      
        
    418. 
          
          
            #
        
      419. 
      
        
    419. 
          
          
            #   first_stdin, last_stdout, wait_threads = Open3.pipeline_rw(cmd1, cmd2, ... [, opts])
        
      420. 
      
        
    420. 
          
          
            #   ...
        
      421. 
      
        
    421. 
          
          
            #   first_stdin.close
        
      422. 
      
        
    422. 
          
          
            #   last_stdout.close
        
      423. 
      
        
    423. 
          
          
            #
        
      424. 
      
        
    424. 
          
          
            # Each cmd is a string or an array.
        
      425. 
      
        
    425. 
          
          
            # If it is an array, the elements are passed to Process.spawn.
        
      426. 
      
        
    426. 
          
          
            #
        
      427. 
      
        
    427. 
          
          
            #   cmd:
        
      428. 
      
        
    428. 
          
          
            #     commandline                              command line string which is passed to a shell
        
      429. 
      
        
    429. 
          
          
            #     [env, commandline, opts]                 command line string which is passed to a shell
        
      430. 
      
        
    430. 
          
          
            #     [env, cmdname, arg1, ..., opts]          command name and one or more arguments (no shell)
        
      431. 
      
        
    431. 
          
          
            #     [env, [cmdname, argv0], arg1, ..., opts] command name and arguments including argv[0] (no shell)
        
      432. 
      
        
    432. 
          
          
            #
        
      433. 
      
        
    433. 
          
          
            #   Note that env and opts are optional, as for Process.spawn.
        
      434. 
      
        
    434. 
          
          
            #
        
      435. 
      
        
    435. 
          
          
            # The options to pass to Process.spawn are constructed by merging
        
      436. 
      
        
    436. 
          
          
            # +opts+, the last hash element of the array, and
        
      437. 
      
        
    437. 
          
          
            # specifications for the pipes between each of the commands.
        
      438. 
      
        
    438. 
          
          
            #
        
      439. 
      
        
    439. 
          
          
            # Example:
        
      440. 
      
        
    440. 
          
          
            #
        
      441. 
      
        
    441. 
          
          
            #   Open3.pipeline_rw("tr -dc A-Za-z", "wc -c") {|i, o, ts|
        
      442. 
      
        
    442. 
          
          
            #     i.puts "All persons more than a mile high to leave the court."
        
      443. 
      
        
    443. 
          
          
            #     i.close
        
      444. 
      
        
    444. 
          
          
            #     p o.gets #=> "42\n"
        
      445. 
      
        
    445. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      446. 
      
        
    446. 
          
          
            #
        
      447. 
      
        
    447. 
          
          
            #   Open3.pipeline_rw("sort", "cat -n") {|stdin, stdout, wait_thrs|
        
      448. 
      
        
    448. 
          
          
            #     stdin.puts "foo"
        
      449. 
      
        
    449. 
          
          
            #     stdin.puts "bar"
        
      450. 
      
        
    450. 
          
          
            #     stdin.puts "baz"
        
      451. 
      
        
    451. 
          
          
            #     stdin.close     # send EOF to sort.
        
      452. 
      
        
    452. 
          
          
            #     p stdout.read   #=> "     1\tbar\n     2\tbaz\n     3\tfoo\n"
        
      453. 
      
        
    453. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      454. 
      
        
    454. 
          1
          
            def pipeline_rw(*cmds, &block)
        
      455. 
      
        
    455. 
          
          
              if Hash === cmds.last
        
      456. 
      
        
    456. 
          
          
                opts = cmds.pop.dup
        
      457. 
      
        
    457. 
          
          
              else
        
      458. 
      
        
    458. 
          
          
                opts = {}
        
      459. 
      
        
    459. 
          
          
              end
        
      460. 
      
        
    460. 
          
          
          
        
      461. 
      
        
    461. 
          
          
              in_r, in_w = IO.pipe
        
      462. 
      
        
    462. 
          
          
              opts[:in] = in_r
        
      463. 
      
        
    463. 
          
          
              in_w.sync = true
        
      464. 
      
        
    464. 
          
          
          
        
      465. 
      
        
    465. 
          
          
              out_r, out_w = IO.pipe
        
      466. 
      
        
    466. 
          
          
              opts[:out] = out_w
        
      467. 
      
        
    467. 
          
          
          
        
      468. 
      
        
    468. 
          
          
              pipeline_run(cmds, opts, [in_r, out_w], [in_w, out_r], &block)
        
      469. 
      
        
    469. 
          
          
            end
        
      470. 
      
        
    470. 
          1
          
            module_function :pipeline_rw
        
      471. 
      
        
    471. 
          
          
          
        
      472. 
      
        
    472. 
          
          
            # Open3.pipeline_r starts a list of commands as a pipeline with a pipe
        
      473. 
      
        
    473. 
          
          
            # which connects to stdout of the last command.
        
      474. 
      
        
    474. 
          
          
            #
        
      475. 
      
        
    475. 
          
          
            #   Open3.pipeline_r(cmd1, cmd2, ... [, opts]) {|last_stdout, wait_threads|
        
      476. 
      
        
    476. 
          
          
            #     ...
        
      477. 
      
        
    477. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      478. 
      
        
    478. 
          
          
            #
        
      479. 
      
        
    479. 
          
          
            #   last_stdout, wait_threads = Open3.pipeline_r(cmd1, cmd2, ... [, opts])
        
      480. 
      
        
    480. 
          
          
            #   ...
        
      481. 
      
        
    481. 
          
          
            #   last_stdout.close
        
      482. 
      
        
    482. 
          
          
            #
        
      483. 
      
        
    483. 
          
          
            # Each cmd is a string or an array.
        
      484. 
      
        
    484. 
          
          
            # If it is an array, the elements are passed to Process.spawn.
        
      485. 
      
        
    485. 
          
          
            #
        
      486. 
      
        
    486. 
          
          
            #   cmd:
        
      487. 
      
        
    487. 
          
          
            #     commandline                              command line string which is passed to a shell
        
      488. 
      
        
    488. 
          
          
            #     [env, commandline, opts]                 command line string which is passed to a shell
        
      489. 
      
        
    489. 
          
          
            #     [env, cmdname, arg1, ..., opts]          command name and one or more arguments (no shell)
        
      490. 
      
        
    490. 
          
          
            #     [env, [cmdname, argv0], arg1, ..., opts] command name and arguments including argv[0] (no shell)
        
      491. 
      
        
    491. 
          
          
            #
        
      492. 
      
        
    492. 
          
          
            #   Note that env and opts are optional, as for Process.spawn.
        
      493. 
      
        
    493. 
          
          
            #
        
      494. 
      
        
    494. 
          
          
            # Example:
        
      495. 
      
        
    495. 
          
          
            #
        
      496. 
      
        
    496. 
          
          
            #   Open3.pipeline_r("zcat /var/log/apache2/access.log.*.gz",
        
      497. 
      
        
    497. 
          
          
            #                    [{"LANG"=>"C"}, "grep", "GET /favicon.ico"],
        
      498. 
      
        
    498. 
          
          
            #                    "logresolve") {|o, ts|
        
      499. 
      
        
    499. 
          
          
            #     o.each_line {|line|
        
      500. 
      
        
    500. 
          
          
            #       ...
        
      501. 
      
        
    501. 
          
          
            #     }
        
      502. 
      
        
    502. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      503. 
      
        
    503. 
          
          
            #
        
      504. 
      
        
    504. 
          
          
            #   Open3.pipeline_r("yes", "head -10") {|o, ts|
        
      505. 
      
        
    505. 
          
          
            #     p o.read      #=> "y\ny\ny\ny\ny\ny\ny\ny\ny\ny\n"
        
      506. 
      
        
    506. 
          
          
            #     p ts[0].value #=> #<Process::Status: pid 24910 SIGPIPE (signal 13)>
        
      507. 
      
        
    507. 
          
          
            #     p ts[1].value #=> #<Process::Status: pid 24913 exit 0>
        
      508. 
      
        
    508. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      509. 
      
        
    509. 
          
          
            #
        
      510. 
      
        
    510. 
          1
          
            def pipeline_r(*cmds, &block)
        
      511. 
      
        
    511. 
          
          
              if Hash === cmds.last
        
      512. 
      
        
    512. 
          
          
                opts = cmds.pop.dup
        
      513. 
      
        
    513. 
          
          
              else
        
      514. 
      
        
    514. 
          
          
                opts = {}
        
      515. 
      
        
    515. 
          
          
              end
        
      516. 
      
        
    516. 
          
          
          
        
      517. 
      
        
    517. 
          
          
              out_r, out_w = IO.pipe
        
      518. 
      
        
    518. 
          
          
              opts[:out] = out_w
        
      519. 
      
        
    519. 
          
          
          
        
      520. 
      
        
    520. 
          
          
              pipeline_run(cmds, opts, [out_w], [out_r], &block)
        
      521. 
      
        
    521. 
          
          
            end
        
      522. 
      
        
    522. 
          1
          
            module_function :pipeline_r
        
      523. 
      
        
    523. 
          
          
          
        
      524. 
      
        
    524. 
          
          
            # Open3.pipeline_w starts a list of commands as a pipeline with a pipe
        
      525. 
      
        
    525. 
          
          
            # which connects to stdin of the first command.
        
      526. 
      
        
    526. 
          
          
            #
        
      527. 
      
        
    527. 
          
          
            #   Open3.pipeline_w(cmd1, cmd2, ... [, opts]) {|first_stdin, wait_threads|
        
      528. 
      
        
    528. 
          
          
            #     ...
        
      529. 
      
        
    529. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      530. 
      
        
    530. 
          
          
            #
        
      531. 
      
        
    531. 
          
          
            #   first_stdin, wait_threads = Open3.pipeline_w(cmd1, cmd2, ... [, opts])
        
      532. 
      
        
    532. 
          
          
            #   ...
        
      533. 
      
        
    533. 
          
          
            #   first_stdin.close
        
      534. 
      
        
    534. 
          
          
            #
        
      535. 
      
        
    535. 
          
          
            # Each cmd is a string or an array.
        
      536. 
      
        
    536. 
          
          
            # If it is an array, the elements are passed to Process.spawn.
        
      537. 
      
        
    537. 
          
          
            #
        
      538. 
      
        
    538. 
          
          
            #   cmd:
        
      539. 
      
        
    539. 
          
          
            #     commandline                              command line string which is passed to a shell
        
      540. 
      
        
    540. 
          
          
            #     [env, commandline, opts]                 command line string which is passed to a shell
        
      541. 
      
        
    541. 
          
          
            #     [env, cmdname, arg1, ..., opts]          command name and one or more arguments (no shell)
        
      542. 
      
        
    542. 
          
          
            #     [env, [cmdname, argv0], arg1, ..., opts] command name and arguments including argv[0] (no shell)
        
      543. 
      
        
    543. 
          
          
            #
        
      544. 
      
        
    544. 
          
          
            #   Note that env and opts are optional, as for Process.spawn.
        
      545. 
      
        
    545. 
          
          
            #
        
      546. 
      
        
    546. 
          
          
            # Example:
        
      547. 
      
        
    547. 
          
          
            #
        
      548. 
      
        
    548. 
          
          
            #   Open3.pipeline_w("bzip2 -c", :out=>"/tmp/hello.bz2") {|i, ts|
        
      549. 
      
        
    549. 
          
          
            #     i.puts "hello"
        
      550. 
      
        
    550. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      551. 
      
        
    551. 
          
          
            #
        
      552. 
      
        
    552. 
          1
          
            def pipeline_w(*cmds, &block)
        
      553. 
      
        
    553. 
          
          
              if Hash === cmds.last
        
      554. 
      
        
    554. 
          
          
                opts = cmds.pop.dup
        
      555. 
      
        
    555. 
          
          
              else
        
      556. 
      
        
    556. 
          
          
                opts = {}
        
      557. 
      
        
    557. 
          
          
              end
        
      558. 
      
        
    558. 
          
          
          
        
      559. 
      
        
    559. 
          
          
              in_r, in_w = IO.pipe
        
      560. 
      
        
    560. 
          
          
              opts[:in] = in_r
        
      561. 
      
        
    561. 
          
          
              in_w.sync = true
        
      562. 
      
        
    562. 
          
          
          
        
      563. 
      
        
    563. 
          
          
              pipeline_run(cmds, opts, [in_r], [in_w], &block)
        
      564. 
      
        
    564. 
          
          
            end
        
      565. 
      
        
    565. 
          1
          
            module_function :pipeline_w
        
      566. 
      
        
    566. 
          
          
          
        
      567. 
      
        
    567. 
          
          
            # Open3.pipeline_start starts a list of commands as a pipeline.
        
      568. 
      
        
    568. 
          
          
            # No pipes are created for stdin of the first command and
        
      569. 
      
        
    569. 
          
          
            # stdout of the last command.
        
      570. 
      
        
    570. 
          
          
            #
        
      571. 
      
        
    571. 
          
          
            #   Open3.pipeline_start(cmd1, cmd2, ... [, opts]) {|wait_threads|
        
      572. 
      
        
    572. 
          
          
            #     ...
        
      573. 
      
        
    573. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      574. 
      
        
    574. 
          
          
            #
        
      575. 
      
        
    575. 
          
          
            #   wait_threads = Open3.pipeline_start(cmd1, cmd2, ... [, opts])
        
      576. 
      
        
    576. 
          
          
            #   ...
        
      577. 
      
        
    577. 
          
          
            #
        
      578. 
      
        
    578. 
          
          
            # Each cmd is a string or an array.
        
      579. 
      
        
    579. 
          
          
            # If it is an array, the elements are passed to Process.spawn.
        
      580. 
      
        
    580. 
          
          
            #
        
      581. 
      
        
    581. 
          
          
            #   cmd:
        
      582. 
      
        
    582. 
          
          
            #     commandline                              command line string which is passed to a shell
        
      583. 
      
        
    583. 
          
          
            #     [env, commandline, opts]                 command line string which is passed to a shell
        
      584. 
      
        
    584. 
          
          
            #     [env, cmdname, arg1, ..., opts]          command name and one or more arguments (no shell)
        
      585. 
      
        
    585. 
          
          
            #     [env, [cmdname, argv0], arg1, ..., opts] command name and arguments including argv[0] (no shell)
        
      586. 
      
        
    586. 
          
          
            #
        
      587. 
      
        
    587. 
          
          
            #   Note that env and opts are optional, as for Process.spawn.
        
      588. 
      
        
    588. 
          
          
            #
        
      589. 
      
        
    589. 
          
          
            # Example:
        
      590. 
      
        
    590. 
          
          
            #
        
      591. 
      
        
    591. 
          
          
            #   # Run xeyes in 10 seconds.
        
      592. 
      
        
    592. 
          
          
            #   Open3.pipeline_start("xeyes") {|ts|
        
      593. 
      
        
    593. 
          
          
            #     sleep 10
        
      594. 
      
        
    594. 
          
          
            #     t = ts[0]
        
      595. 
      
        
    595. 
          
          
            #     Process.kill("TERM", t.pid)
        
      596. 
      
        
    596. 
          
          
            #     p t.value #=> #<Process::Status: pid 911 SIGTERM (signal 15)>
        
      597. 
      
        
    597. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      598. 
      
        
    598. 
          
          
            #
        
      599. 
      
        
    599. 
          
          
            #   # Convert pdf to ps and send it to a printer.
        
      600. 
      
        
    600. 
          
          
            #   # Collect error message of pdftops and lpr.
        
      601. 
      
        
    601. 
          
          
            #   pdf_file = "paper.pdf"
        
      602. 
      
        
    602. 
          
          
            #   printer = "printer-name"
        
      603. 
      
        
    603. 
          
          
            #   err_r, err_w = IO.pipe
        
      604. 
      
        
    604. 
          
          
            #   Open3.pipeline_start(["pdftops", pdf_file, "-"],
        
      605. 
      
        
    605. 
          
          
            #                        ["lpr", "-P#{printer}"],
        
      606. 
      
        
    606. 
          
          
            #                        :err=>err_w) {|ts|
        
      607. 
      
        
    607. 
          
          
            #     err_w.close
        
      608. 
      
        
    608. 
          
          
            #     p err_r.read # error messages of pdftops and lpr.
        
      609. 
      
        
    609. 
          
          
            #   }
        
      610. 
      
        
    610. 
          
          
            #
        
      611. 
      
        
    611. 
          1
          
            def pipeline_start(*cmds, &block)
        
      612. 
      
        
    612. 
          
          
              if Hash === cmds.last
        
      613. 
      
        
    613. 
          
          
                opts = cmds.pop.dup
        
      614. 
      
        
    614. 
          
          
              else
        
      615. 
      
        
    615. 
          
          
                opts = {}
        
      616. 
      
        
    616. 
          
          
              end
        
      617. 
      
        
    617. 
          
          
          
        
      618. 
      
        
    618. 
          
          
              if block
        
      619. 
      
        
    619. 
          
          
                pipeline_run(cmds, opts, [], [], &block)
        
      620. 
      
        
    620. 
          
          
              else
        
      621. 
      
        
    621. 
          
          
                ts, = pipeline_run(cmds, opts, [], [])
        
      622. 
      
        
    622. 
          
          
                ts
        
      623. 
      
        
    623. 
          
          
              end
        
      624. 
      
        
    624. 
          
          
            end
        
      625. 
      
        
    625. 
          1
          
            module_function :pipeline_start
        
      626. 
      
        
    626. 
          
          
          
        
      627. 
      
        
    627. 
          
          
            # Open3.pipeline starts a list of commands as a pipeline.
        
      628. 
      
        
    628. 
          
          
            # It waits for the completion of the commands.
        
      629. 
      
        
    629. 
          
          
            # No pipes are created for stdin of the first command and
        
      630. 
      
        
    630. 
          
          
            # stdout of the last command.
        
      631. 
      
        
    631. 
          
          
            #
        
      632. 
      
        
    632. 
          
          
            #   status_list = Open3.pipeline(cmd1, cmd2, ... [, opts])
        
      633. 
      
        
    633. 
          
          
            #
        
      634. 
      
        
    634. 
          
          
            # Each cmd is a string or an array.
        
      635. 
      
        
    635. 
          
          
            # If it is an array, the elements are passed to Process.spawn.
        
      636. 
      
        
    636. 
          
          
            #
        
      637. 
      
        
    637. 
          
          
            #   cmd:
        
      638. 
      
        
    638. 
          
          
            #     commandline                              command line string which is passed to a shell
        
      639. 
      
        
    639. 
          
          
            #     [env, commandline, opts]                 command line string which is passed to a shell
        
      640. 
      
        
    640. 
          
          
            #     [env, cmdname, arg1, ..., opts]          command name and one or more arguments (no shell)
        
      641. 
      
        
    641. 
          
          
            #     [env, [cmdname, argv0], arg1, ..., opts] command name and arguments including argv[0] (no shell)
        
      642. 
      
        
    642. 
          
          
            #
        
      643. 
      
        
    643. 
          
          
            #   Note that env and opts are optional, as Process.spawn.
        
      644. 
      
        
    644. 
          
          
            #
        
      645. 
      
        
    645. 
          
          
            # Example:
        
      646. 
      
        
    646. 
          
          
            #
        
      647. 
      
        
    647. 
          
          
            #   fname = "/usr/share/man/man1/ruby.1.gz"
        
      648.
