    648. 
          
          
            #   p Open3.pipeline(["zcat", fname], "nroff -man", "less")
        
      649. 
      
        
    649. 
          
          
            #   #=> [#<Process::Status: pid 11817 exit 0>,
        
      650. 
      
        
    650. 
          
          
            #   #    #<Process::Status: pid 11820 exit 0>,
        
      651. 
      
        
    651. 
          
          
            #   #    #<Process::Status: pid 11828 exit 0>]
        
      652. 
      
        
    652. 
          
          
            #
        
      653. 
      
        
    653. 
          
          
            #   fname = "/usr/share/man/man1/ls.1.gz"
        
      654. 
      
        
    654. 
          
          
            #   Open3.pipeline(["zcat", fname], "nroff -man", "colcrt")
        
      655. 
      
        
    655. 
          
          
            #
        
      656. 
      
        
    656. 
          
          
            #   # convert PDF to PS and send to a printer by lpr
        
      657. 
      
        
    657. 
          
          
            #   pdf_file = "paper.pdf"
        
      658. 
      
        
    658. 
          
          
            #   printer = "printer-name"
        
      659. 
      
        
    659. 
          
          
            #   Open3.pipeline(["pdftops", pdf_file, "-"],
        
      660. 
      
        
    660. 
          
          
            #                  ["lpr", "-P#{printer}"])
        
      661. 
      
        
    661. 
          
          
            #
        
      662. 
      
        
    662. 
          
          
            #   # count lines
        
      663. 
      
        
    663. 
          
          
            #   Open3.pipeline("sort", "uniq -c", :in=>"names.txt", :out=>"count")
        
      664. 
      
        
    664. 
          
          
            #
        
      665. 
      
        
    665. 
          
          
            #   # cyclic pipeline
        
      666. 
      
        
    666. 
          
          
            #   r,w = IO.pipe
        
      667. 
      
        
    667. 
          
          
            #   w.print "ibase=14\n10\n"
        
      668. 
      
        
    668. 
          
          
            #   Open3.pipeline("bc", "tee /dev/tty", :in=>r, :out=>w)
        
      669. 
      
        
    669. 
          
          
            #   #=> 14
        
      670. 
      
        
    670. 
          
          
            #   #   18
        
      671. 
      
        
    671. 
          
          
            #   #   22
        
      672. 
      
        
    672. 
          
          
            #   #   30
        
      673. 
      
        
    673. 
          
          
            #   #   42
        
      674. 
      
        
    674. 
          
          
            #   #   58
        
      675. 
      
        
    675. 
          
          
            #   #   78
        
      676. 
      
        
    676. 
          
          
            #   #   106
        
      677. 
      
        
    677. 
          
          
            #   #   202
        
      678. 
      
        
    678. 
          
          
            #
        
      679. 
      
        
    679. 
          1
          
            def pipeline(*cmds)
        
      680. 
      
        
    680. 
          
          
              if Hash === cmds.last
        
      681. 
      
        
    681. 
          
          
                opts = cmds.pop.dup
        
      682. 
      
        
    682. 
          
          
              else
        
      683. 
      
        
    683. 
          
          
                opts = {}
        
      684. 
      
        
    684. 
          
          
              end
        
      685. 
      
        
    685. 
          
          
          
        
      686. 
      
        
    686. 
          
          
              pipeline_run(cmds, opts, [], []) {|ts|
        
      687. 
      
        
    687. 
          
          
                ts.map(&:value)
        
      688. 
      
        
    688. 
          
          
              }
        
      689. 
      
        
    689. 
          
          
            end
        
      690. 
      
        
    690. 
          1
          
            module_function :pipeline
        
      691. 
      
        
    691. 
          
          
          
        
      692. 
      
        
    692. 
          1
          
            def pipeline_run(cmds, pipeline_opts, child_io, parent_io) # :nodoc:
        
      693. 
      
        
    693. 
          
          
              if cmds.empty?
        
      694. 
      
        
    694. 
          
          
                raise ArgumentError, "no commands"
        
      695. 
      
        
    695. 
          
          
              end
        
      696. 
      
        
    696. 
          
          
          
        
      697. 
      
        
    697. 
          
          
              opts_base = pipeline_opts.dup
        
      698. 
      
        
    698. 
          
          
              opts_base.delete :in
        
      699. 
      
        
    699. 
          
          
              opts_base.delete :out
        
      700. 
      
        
    700. 
          
          
          
        
      701. 
      
        
    701. 
          
          
              wait_thrs = []
        
      702. 
      
        
    702. 
          
          
              r = nil
        
      703. 
      
        
    703. 
          
          
              cmds.each_with_index {|cmd, i|
        
      704. 
      
        
    704. 
          
          
                cmd_opts = opts_base.dup
        
      705. 
      
        
    705. 
          
          
                if String === cmd
        
      706. 
      
        
    706. 
          
          
                  cmd = [cmd]
        
      707. 
      
        
    707. 
          
          
                else
        
      708. 
      
        
    708. 
          
          
                  cmd_opts.update cmd.pop if Hash === cmd.last
        
      709. 
      
        
    709. 
          
          
                end
        
      710. 
      
        
    710. 
          
          
                if i == 0
        
      711. 
      
        
    711. 
          
          
                  if !cmd_opts.include?(:in)
        
      712. 
      
        
    712. 
          
          
                    if pipeline_opts.include?(:in)
        
      713. 
      
        
    713. 
          
          
                      cmd_opts[:in] = pipeline_opts[:in]
        
      714. 
      
        
    714. 
          
          
                    end
        
      715. 
      
        
    715. 
          
          
                  end
        
      716. 
      
        
    716. 
          
          
                else
        
      717. 
      
        
    717. 
          
          
                  cmd_opts[:in] = r
        
      718. 
      
        
    718. 
          
          
                end
        
      719. 
      
        
    719. 
          
          
                if i != cmds.length - 1
        
      720. 
      
        
    720. 
          
          
                  r2, w2 = IO.pipe
        
      721. 
      
        
    721. 
          
          
                  cmd_opts[:out] = w2
        
      722. 
      
        
    722. 
          
          
                else
        
      723. 
      
        
    723. 
          
          
                  if !cmd_opts.include?(:out)
        
      724. 
      
        
    724. 
          
          
                    if pipeline_opts.include?(:out)
        
      725. 
      
        
    725. 
          
          
                      cmd_opts[:out] = pipeline_opts[:out]
        
      726. 
      
        
    726. 
          
          
                    end
        
      727. 
      
        
    727. 
          
          
                  end
        
      728. 
      
        
    728. 
          
          
                end
        
      729. 
      
        
    729. 
          
          
                pid = spawn(*cmd, cmd_opts)
        
      730. 
      
        
    730. 
          
          
                wait_thrs << Process.detach(pid)
        
      731. 
      
        
    731. 
          
          
                r&.close
        
      732. 
      
        
    732. 
          
          
                w2&.close
        
      733. 
      
        
    733. 
          
          
                r = r2
        
      734. 
      
        
    734. 
          
          
              }
        
      735. 
      
        
    735. 
          
          
              result = parent_io + [wait_thrs]
        
      736. 
      
        
    736. 
          
          
              child_io.each(&:close)
        
      737. 
      
        
    737. 
          
          
              if defined? yield
        
      738. 
      
        
    738. 
          
          
                begin
        
      739. 
      
        
    739. 
          
          
                  return yield(*result)
        
      740. 
      
        
    740. 
          
          
                ensure
        
      741. 
      
        
    741. 
          
          
                  parent_io.each(&:close)
        
      742. 
      
        
    742. 
          
          
                  wait_thrs.each(&:join)
        
      743. 
      
        
    743. 
          
          
                end
        
      744. 
      
        
    744. 
          
          
              end
        
      745. 
      
        
    745. 
          
          
              result
        
      746. 
      
        
    746. 
          
          
            end
        
      747. 
      
        
    747. 
          1
          
            module_function :pipeline_run
        
      748. 
      
        
    748. 
          1
          
            class << self
        
      749. 
      
        
    749. 
          1
          
              private :pipeline_run
        
      750. 
      
        
    750. 
          
          
            end
        
      751. 
      
        
    751. 
          
          
          
        
      752. 
      
        
    752. 
          
          
          end
        
      753.

            include Enumerable

            # The "sync mode" of the SSLSocket.

      29.

            attr_accessor :sync

            BLOCK_SIZE = 1024*16
        
      36.

            ##
        
      38.

            # Creates an instance of OpenSSL's buffering IO module.
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
          
        
      40.

          1
          
            def initialize(*)
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
              super
        
      42.

              @eof = false
        
      43.

              @rbuffer = ""

            #
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
            # for reading.
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
            #
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          1
          
            private
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
          
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
            ##
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
            # Fills the buffer from the underlying SSLSocket
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
          
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          1
          
            def fill_rbuff
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
              begin
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                @rbuffer << self.sysread(BLOCK_SIZE)
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
              rescue Errno::EAGAIN
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                retry
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
              rescue EOFError
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                @eof = true
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
              end
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
            end
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
          
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
            ##
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
            # Consumes _size_ bytes from the buffer
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
          
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          1
          
            def consume_rbuff(size=nil)
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
              if @rbuffer.empty?
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                nil
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
              else
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                size = @rbuffer.size unless size
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                ret = @rbuffer[0, size]
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                @rbuffer[0, size] = ""
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                ret
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
              end
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
            end
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
          
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          1
          
            public
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
          
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
            ##
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
            # Reads _size_ bytes from the stream.  If _buf_ is provided it must
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
            # reference a string which will receive the data.
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
            #
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
            # See IO#read for full details.
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
          
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          1
          
            def read(size=nil, buf=nil)
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
              if size == 0
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                if buf
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                  buf.clear
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                  return buf
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                else
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                  return ""
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                end
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
              end
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
              until @eof
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                break if size && size <= @rbuffer.size
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                fill_rbuff
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
              end
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
              ret = consume_rbuff(size) || ""
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
              if buf
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                buf.replace(ret)
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                ret = buf
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
              end
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
              (size && ret.empty?) ? nil : ret
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
            end
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
          
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
            ##
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
            # Reads at most _maxlen_ bytes from the stream.  If _buf_ is provided it
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
            # must reference a string which will receive the data.
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
            #
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
            # See IO#readpartial for full details.
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
          
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          1
          
            def readpartial(maxlen, buf=nil)
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
              if maxlen == 0
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                if buf
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                  buf.clear
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                  return buf
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                else
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                  return ""
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                end
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
              end
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
              if @rbuffer.empty?
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                begin
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                  return sysread(maxlen, buf)
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                rescue Errno::EAGAIN
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                  retry
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                end
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
              end
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
              ret = consume_rbuff(maxlen)
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
              if buf
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                buf.replace(ret)
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                ret = buf
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
              end
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
              ret
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
            end
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
          
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
            ##
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
            # Reads at most _maxlen_ bytes in the non-blocking manner.
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
            #
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
            # When no data can be read without blocking it raises
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
            # OpenSSL::SSL::SSLError extended by IO::WaitReadable or IO::WaitWritable.
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
            #
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
            # IO::WaitReadable means SSL needs to read internally so read_nonblock
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
            # should be called again when the underlying IO is readable.
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
            #
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
            # IO::WaitWritable means SSL needs to write internally so read_nonblock
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
            # should be called again after the underlying IO is writable.
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
            #
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
            # OpenSSL::Buffering#read_nonblock needs two rescue clause as follows:
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
            #
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
            #   # emulates blocking read (readpartial).
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
            #   begin
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
            #     result = ssl.read_nonblock(maxlen)
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
            #   rescue IO::WaitReadable
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
            #     IO.select([io])
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
            #     retry
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
            #   rescue IO::WaitWritable
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
            #     IO.select(nil, [io])
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
            #     retry
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
            #   end
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
            #
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
            # Note that one reason that read_nonblock writes to the underlying IO is
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
            # when the peer requests a new TLS/SSL handshake.  See openssl the FAQ for
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
            # more details.  http://www.openssl.org/support/faq.html
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
            #
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
            # By specifying a keyword argument _exception_ to +false+, you can indicate
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
            # that read_nonblock should not raise an IO::Wait*able exception, but
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
            # return the symbol +:wait_writable+ or +:wait_readable+ instead. At EOF,
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
            # it will return +nil+ instead of raising EOFError.
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
          
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          1
          
            def read_nonblock(maxlen, buf=nil, exception: true)
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
              if maxlen == 0
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                if buf
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                  buf.clear
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                  return buf
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                else
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
                  return ""
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                end
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
              end
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
              if @rbuffer.empty?
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
                return sysread_nonblock(maxlen, buf, exception: exception)
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
              end
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
              ret = consume_rbuff(maxlen)
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
              if buf
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                buf.replace(ret)
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                ret = buf
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
              end
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
              ret
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
            end
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
          
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
            ##
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
            # Reads the next "line" from the stream.  Lines are separated by _eol_.  If
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
            # _limit_ is provided the result will not be longer than the given number of
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
            # bytes.
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
            #
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
            # _eol_ may be a String or Regexp.
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
            #
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
            # Unlike IO#gets the line read will not be assigned to +$_+.
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
            #
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
            # Unlike IO#gets the separator must be provided if a limit is provided.
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
          
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          1
          
            def gets(eol=$/, limit=nil)
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
              idx = @rbuffer.index(eol)
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
              until @eof
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
                break if idx
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
                fill_rbuff
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
                idx = @rbuffer.index(eol)
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
              end
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
              if eol.is_a?(Regexp)
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
                size = idx ? idx+$&.size : nil
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
              else
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
                size = idx ? idx+eol.size : nil
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
              end
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
              if size && limit && limit >= 0
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
                size = [size, limit].min
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
              end
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
              consume_rbuff(size)
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
            end
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
          
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
            ##
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
            # Executes the block for every line in the stream where lines are separated
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
            # by _eol_.
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
            #
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
            # See also #gets
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
          
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          1
          
            def each(eol=$/)
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
              while line = self.gets(eol)
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
                yield line
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
              end
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
            end
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          1
          
            alias each_line each
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
          
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
            ##
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
            # Reads lines from the stream which are separated by _eol_.
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
            #
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
            # See also #gets
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
          
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          1
          
            def readlines(eol=$/)
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
              ary = []
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
              while line = self.gets(eol)
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
                ary << line
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
              end
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
              ary
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
            end
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
          
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
            ##
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
            # Reads a line from the stream which is separated by _eol_.
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
            #
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
            # Raises EOFError if at end of file.
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
          
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          1
          
            def readline(eol=$/)
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
              raise EOFError if eof?
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
              gets(eol)
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
            end
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
          
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
            ##
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
            # Reads one character from the stream.  Returns nil if called at end of
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
            # file.
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
          
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          1
          
            def getc
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
              read(1)
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
            end
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
          
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
            ##
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
            # Calls the given block once for each byte in the stream.
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
          
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          1
          
            def each_byte # :yields: byte
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
              while c = getc
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
                yield(c.ord)
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
              end
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
            end
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
          
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
            ##
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
            # Reads a one-character string from the stream.  Raises an EOFError at end
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
            # of file.
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
          
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          1
          
            def readchar
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
              raise EOFError if eof?
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
              getc
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
            end
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
          
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
            ##
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
            # Pushes character _c_ back onto the stream such that a subsequent buffered
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
            # character read will return it.
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
            #
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
            # Unlike IO#getc multiple bytes may be pushed back onto the stream.
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
            #
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
            # Has no effect on unbuffered reads (such as #sysread).
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
          
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          1
          
            def ungetc(c)
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
              @rbuffer[0,0] = c.chr
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
            end
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
          
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
            ##
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
            # Returns true if the stream is at file which means there is no more data to
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
            # be read.
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
          
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          1
          
            def eof?
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
              fill_rbuff if !@eof && @rbuffer.empty?
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
              @eof && @rbuffer.empty?
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
            end
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          1
          
            alias eof eof?
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
          
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
            #
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          
          
            # for writing.
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
            #
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          1
          
            private
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
          
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
            ##
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
            # Writes _s_ to the buffer.  When the buffer is full or #sync is true the
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
            # buffer is flushed to the underlying socket.
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
          
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          1
          
            def do_write(s)
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
              @wbuffer = "" unless defined? @wbuffer
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
              @wbuffer << s
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
              @wbuffer.force_encoding(Encoding::BINARY)
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
              @sync ||= false
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
              if @sync or @wbuffer.size > BLOCK_SIZE
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
                until @wbuffer.empty?
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
                  begin
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
                    nwrote = syswrite(@wbuffer)
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
                  rescue Errno::EAGAIN
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
                    retry
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
                  end
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
                  @wbuffer[0, nwrote] = ""
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
                end
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
              end
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
            end
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
          
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          1
          
            public
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
          
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
            ##
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
            # Writes _s_ to the stream.  If the argument is not a String it will be
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
            # converted using +.to_s+ method.  Returns the number of bytes written.
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
          
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          1
          
            def write(*s)
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
              s.inject(0) do |written, str|
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
                do_write(str)
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
                written + str.bytesize
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
              end
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
            end
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
          
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
            ##
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
            # Writes _s_ in the non-blocking manner.
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
            #
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          
          
            # If there is buffered data, it is flushed first.  This may block.
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
            #
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
            # write_nonblock returns number of bytes written to the SSL connection.
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
            #
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
            # When no data can be written without blocking it raises
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
            # OpenSSL::SSL::SSLError extended by IO::WaitReadable or IO::WaitWritable.
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
            #
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
            # IO::WaitReadable means SSL needs to read internally so write_nonblock
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
            # should be called again after the underlying IO is readable.
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          
          
            #
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
            # IO::WaitWritable means SSL needs to write internally so write_nonblock
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
            # should be called again after underlying IO is writable.
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
            #
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
            # So OpenSSL::Buffering#write_nonblock needs two rescue clause as follows.
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
            #
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          
          
            #   # emulates blocking write.
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
            #   begin
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          
          
            #     result = ssl.write_nonblock(str)
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          
          
            #   rescue IO::WaitReadable
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
            #     IO.select([io])
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          
          
            #     retry
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
            #   rescue IO::WaitWritable
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
            #     IO.select(nil, [io])
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          
          
            #     retry
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          
          
            #   end
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
            #
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
            # Note that one reason that write_nonblock reads from the underlying IO
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
            # is when the peer requests a new TLS/SSL handshake.  See the openssl FAQ
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
            # for more details.  http://www.openssl.org/support/faq.html
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
            #
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
            # By specifying a keyword argument _exception_ to +false+, you can indicate
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          
          
            # that write_nonblock should not raise an IO::Wait*able exception, but
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
            # return the symbol +:wait_writable+ or +:wait_readable+ instead.
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
          
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          1
          
            def write_nonblock(s, exception: true)
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
              flush
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
              syswrite_nonblock(s, exception: exception)
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          
          
            end
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
          
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          
          
            ##
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
            # Writes _s_ to the stream.  _s_ will be converted to a String using
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          
          
            # +.to_s+ method.
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
          
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          1
          
            def <<(s)
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
              do_write(s)
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
              self
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
            end
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          
          
          
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          
          
            ##
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          
          
            # Writes _args_ to the stream along with a record separator.
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          
          
            #
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
            # See IO#puts for full details.
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          
          
          
        
      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          1
          
            def puts(*args)
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          
          
              s = ""
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          
          
              if args.empty?
        
      403. 
      
        
    403. 
          
          
                s << "\n"
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          
          
              end
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          
          
              args.each{|arg|
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
                s << arg.to_s
        
      407. 
      
        
    407. 
          
          
                s.sub!(/(?<!\n)\z/, "\n")
        
      408. 
      
        
    408. 
          
          
              }
        
      409. 
      
        
    409. 
          
          
              do_write(s)
        
      410. 
      
        
    410. 
          
          
              nil
        
      411. 
      
        
    411. 
          
          
            end
        
      412. 
      
        
    412. 
          
          
          
        
      413. 
      
        
    413. 
          
          
            ##
        
      414. 
      
        
    414. 
          
          
            # Writes _args_ to the stream.
        
      415. 
      
        
    415. 
          
          
            #
        
      416. 
      
        
    416. 
          
          
            # See IO#print for full details.
        
      417. 
      
        
    417. 
          
          
          
        
      418. 
      
        
    418. 
          1
          
            def print(*args)
        
      419. 
      
        
    419. 
          
          
              s = ""
        
      420. 
      
        
    420. 
          
          
              args.each{ |arg| s << arg.to_s }
        
      421. 
      
        
    421. 
          
          
              do_write(s)
        
      422. 
      
        
    422. 
          
          
              nil
        
      423. 
      
        
    423. 
          
          
            end
        
      424. 
      
        
    424. 
          
          
          
        
      425. 
      
        
    425. 
          
          
            ##
        
      426. 
      
        
    426. 
          
          
            # Formats and writes to the stream converting parameters under control of
        
      427. 
      
        
    427. 
          
          
            # the format string.
        
      428. 
      
        
    428. 
          
          
            #
        
      429. 
      
        
    429. 
          
          
            # See Kernel#sprintf for format string details.
        
      430. 
      
        
    430. 
          
          
          
        
      431. 
      
        
    431. 
          1
          
            def printf(s, *args)
        
      432. 
      
        
    432. 
          
          
              do_write(s % args)
        
      433. 
      
        
    433. 
          
          
              nil
        
      434. 
      
        
    434. 
          
          
            end
        
      435. 
      
        
    435. 
          
          
          
        
      436. 
      
        
    436. 
          
          
            ##
        
      437. 
      
        
    437. 
          
          
            # Flushes buffered data to the SSLSocket.
        
      438. 
      
        
    438. 
          
          
          
        
      439. 
      
        
    439. 
          1
          
            def flush
        
      440. 
      
        
    440. 
          
          
              osync = @sync
        
      441. 
      
        
    441. 
          
          
              @sync = true
        
      442. 
      
        
    442. 
          
          
              do_write ""
        
      443. 
      
        
    443. 
          
          
              return self
        
      444. 
      
        
    444. 
          
          
            ensure
        
      445. 
      
        
    445. 
          
          
              @sync = osync
        
      446. 
      
        
    446. 
          
          
            end
        
      447. 
      
        
    447. 
          
          
          
        
      448. 
      
        
    448. 
          
          
            ##
        
      449. 
      
        
    449. 
          
          
            # Closes the SSLSocket and flushes any unwritten data.
        
      450. 
      
        
    450. 
          
          
          
        
      451. 
      
        
    451. 
          1
          
            def close
        
      452. 
      
        
    452. 
          
          
              flush rescue nil
        
      453. 
      
        
    453. 
          
          
              sysclose
        
      454. 
      
        
    454. 
          
          
            end
        
      455. 
      
        
    455. 
          
          
          end
        
      456.

            class Cipher
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          1
          
              %w(AES CAST5 BF DES IDEA RC2 RC4 RC5).each{|name|
        
      18.

          8
          
                klass = Class.new(Cipher){
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          8
          
                  define_method(:initialize){|*args|
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
                    cipher_name = args.inject(name){|n, arg| "#{n}-#{arg}" }
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
                    super(cipher_name.downcase)
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
                  }
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                }
        
      24.

              }

              # Generate a random key with OpenSSL::Random.random_bytes and sets it to
        
      40.

              def random_key

          require 'stringio'

          module OpenSSL

            ##

    18. 
          
          
            # = OpenSSL::Config
        
      19.

            #
        
      20.

            # Configuration for the openssl library.
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
            #
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
            # Many system's installation of openssl library will depend on your system
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
            # configuration. See the value of OpenSSL::Config::DEFAULT_CONFIG_FILE for
        
      24. 
      
        
    24.

      25.

            class Config

          1
          
              include Enumerable
        
      29.

      30.

              class << self
        
      31.

    32. 
          
          
                ##
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                # Parses a given _string_ as a blob that contains configuration for
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                # OpenSSL.
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                #
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                # If the source of the IO is a file, then consider using #parse_config.
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          1
          
                def parse(string)
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                  c = new()
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                  parse_config(StringIO.new(string)).each do |section, hash|
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                    c[section] = hash
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                  end
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                  c
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                end
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
          
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                ##
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                # load is an alias to ::new
        
      47.
