          1
          
                alias load new
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
          
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                ##
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                # Parses the configuration data read from _io_, see also #parse.
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                #
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                # Raises a ConfigError on invalid configuration data.
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          1
          
                def parse_config(io)
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                  begin
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                    parse_config_lines(io)
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                  rescue ConfigError => e
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                    e.message.replace("error in line #{io.lineno}: " + e.message)
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                    raise
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                  end
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                end
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
          
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          1
          
                def get_key_string(data, section, key) # :nodoc:
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                  if v = data[section] && data[section][key]
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                    return v
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                  elsif section == 'ENV'
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                    if v = ENV[key]
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                      return v
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                    end
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                  end
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                  if v = data['default'] && data['default'][key]
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                    return v
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                  end
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                end
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
          
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          1
          
              private
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
          
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          1
          
                def parse_config_lines(io)
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                  section = 'default'
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                  data = {section => {}}
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                  io_stack = [io]
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                  while definition = get_definition(io_stack)
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                    definition = clear_comments(definition)
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                    next if definition.empty?
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                    case definition
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                    when /\A\[/
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                      if /\[([^\]]*)\]/ =~ definition
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                        section = $1.strip
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                        data[section] ||= {}
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                      else
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                        raise ConfigError, "missing close square bracket"
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                      end
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                    when /\A\.include (\s*=\s*)?(.+)\z/
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                      path = $2
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                      if File.directory?(path)
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                        files = Dir.glob(File.join(path, "*.{cnf,conf}"), File::FNM_EXTGLOB)
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                      else
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                        files = [path]
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                      end
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
          
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                      files.each do |filename|
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                        begin
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                          io_stack << StringIO.new(File.read(filename))
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
                        rescue
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                          raise ConfigError, "could not include file '%s'" % filename
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                        end
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                      end
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                    when /\A([^:\s]*)(?:::([^:\s]*))?\s*=(.*)\z/
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                      if $2
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                        section = $1
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                        key = $2
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                      else
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                        key = $1
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                      end
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                      value = unescape_value(data, section, $3)
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                      (data[section] ||= {})[key] = value.strip
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                    else
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                      raise ConfigError, "missing equal sign"
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                    end
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                  end
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                  data
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                end
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
          
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                # escape with backslash
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          1
          
                QUOTE_REGEXP_SQ = /\A([^'\\]*(?:\\.[^'\\]*)*)'/
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                # escape with backslash and doubled dq
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          1
          
                QUOTE_REGEXP_DQ = /\A([^"\\]*(?:""[^"\\]*|\\.[^"\\]*)*)"/
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                # escaped char map
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                ESCAPE_MAP = {
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          1
          
                  "r" => "\r",
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                  "n" => "\n",
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                  "b" => "\b",
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                  "t" => "\t",
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                }
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
          
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          1
          
                def unescape_value(data, section, value)
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                  scanned = []
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                  while m = value.match(/['"\\$]/)
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                    scanned << m.pre_match
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                    c = m[0]
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                    value = m.post_match
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                    case c
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                    when "'"
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                      if m = value.match(QUOTE_REGEXP_SQ)
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
                        scanned << m[1].gsub(/\\(.)/, '\\1')
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                        value = m.post_match
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
                      else
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                        break
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
                      end
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                    when '"'
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                      if m = value.match(QUOTE_REGEXP_DQ)
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                        scanned << m[1].gsub(/""/, '').gsub(/\\(.)/, '\\1')
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                        value = m.post_match
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                      else
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                        break
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                      end
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                    when "\\"
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                      c = value.slice!(0, 1)
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
                      scanned << (ESCAPE_MAP[c] || c)
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                    when "$"
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                      ref, value = extract_reference(value)
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                      refsec = section
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                      if ref.index('::')
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                        refsec, ref = ref.split('::', 2)
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                      end
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                      if v = get_key_string(data, refsec, ref)
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                        scanned << v
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                      else
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                        raise ConfigError, "variable has no value"
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
                      end
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                    else
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
                      raise 'must not reaced'
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                    end
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                  end
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                  scanned << value
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                  scanned.join
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                end
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
          
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          1
          
                def extract_reference(value)
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                  rest = ''
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
                  if m = value.match(/\(([^)]*)\)|\{([^}]*)\}/)
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                    value = m[1] || m[2]
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
                    rest = m.post_match
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                  elsif [?(, ?{].include?(value[0])
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                    raise ConfigError, "no close brace"
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                  end
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                  if m = value.match(/[a-zA-Z0-9_]*(?:::[a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?/)
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                    return m[0], m.post_match + rest
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                  else
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                    raise
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
                  end
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                end
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
          
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          1
          
                def clear_comments(line)
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
                  # FCOMMENT
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
                  if m = line.match(/\A([\t\n\f ]*);.*\z/)
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
                    return m[1]
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
                  end
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
                  # COMMENT
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
                  scanned = []
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
                  while m = line.match(/[#'"\\]/)
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
                    scanned << m.pre_match
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
                    c = m[0]
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
                    line = m.post_match
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
                    case c
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
                    when '#'
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
                      line = nil
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
                      break
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
                    when "'", '"'
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
                      regexp = (c == "'") ? QUOTE_REGEXP_SQ : QUOTE_REGEXP_DQ
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                      scanned << c
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
                      if m = line.match(regexp)
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
                        scanned << m[0]
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
                        line = m.post_match
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
                      else
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
                        scanned << line
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
                        line = nil
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
                        break
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                      end
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
                    when "\\"
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
                      scanned << c
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
                      scanned << line.slice!(0, 1)
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
                    else
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
                      raise 'must not reaced'
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
                    end
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
                  end
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
                  scanned << line
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
                  scanned.join
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                end
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
          
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          1
          
                def get_definition(io_stack)
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
                  if line = get_line(io_stack)
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
                    while /[^\\]\\\z/ =~ line
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
                      if extra = get_line(io_stack)
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
                        line += extra
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
                      else
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
                        break
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
                      end
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
                    end
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
                    return line.strip
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
                  end
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
                end
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
          
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          1
          
                def get_line(io_stack)
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
                  while io = io_stack.last
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
                    if line = io.gets
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
                      return line.gsub(/[\r\n]*/, '')
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
                    end
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
                    io_stack.pop
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
                  end
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
                end
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
              end
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
          
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
              ##
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
              # Creates an instance of OpenSSL's configuration class.
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
              #
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
              # This can be used in contexts like OpenSSL::X509::ExtensionFactory.config=
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
              #
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
              # If the optional _filename_ parameter is provided, then it is read in and
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
              # parsed via #parse_config.
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
              #
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
              # This can raise IO exceptions based on the access, or availability of the
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
              # file. A ConfigError exception may be raised depending on the validity of
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
              # the data being configured.
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
              #
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          1
          
              def initialize(filename = nil)
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
                @data = {}
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
                if filename
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
                  File.open(filename.to_s) do |file|
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
                    Config.parse_config(file).each do |section, hash|
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
                      self[section] = hash
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
                    end
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
                  end
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
                end
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
              end
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
          
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
              ##
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
              # Gets the value of _key_ from the given _section_
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
              #
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
              # Given the following configurating file being loaded:
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
              #
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
              #   config = OpenSSL::Config.load('foo.cnf')
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
              #     #=> #<OpenSSL::Config sections=["default"]>
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
              #   puts config.to_s
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
              #     #=> [ default ]
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
              #     #   foo=bar
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
              #
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
              # You can get a specific value from the config if you know the _section_
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
              # and _key_ like so:
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
              #
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
              #   config.get_value('default','foo')
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
              #     #=> "bar"
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
              #
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          1
          
              def get_value(section, key)
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
                if section.nil?
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
                  raise TypeError.new('nil not allowed')
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
                end
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
                section = 'default' if section.empty?
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
                get_key_string(section, key)
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
              end
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
          
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
              ##
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
              #
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
              # *Deprecated*
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
              #
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
              # Use #get_value instead
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          1
          
              def value(arg1, arg2 = nil) # :nodoc:
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
                warn('Config#value is deprecated; use Config#get_value')
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
                if arg2.nil?
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
                  section, key = 'default', arg1
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
                else
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
                  section, key = arg1, arg2
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
                end
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
                section ||= 'default'
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
                section = 'default' if section.empty?
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
                get_key_string(section, key)
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
              end
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
          
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
              ##
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
              # Set the target _key_ with a given _value_ under a specific _section_.
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
              #
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
              # Given the following configurating file being loaded:
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
              #
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
              #   config = OpenSSL::Config.load('foo.cnf')
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
              #     #=> #<OpenSSL::Config sections=["default"]>
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
              #   puts config.to_s
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
              #     #=> [ default ]
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
              #     #   foo=bar
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
              #
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
              # You can set the value of _foo_ under the _default_ section to a new
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
              # value:
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
              #
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
              #   config.add_value('default', 'foo', 'buzz')
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
              #     #=> "buzz"
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
              #   puts config.to_s
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
              #     #=> [ default ]
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
              #     #   foo=buzz
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
              #
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          1
          
              def add_value(section, key, value)
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
                check_modify
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
                (@data[section] ||= {})[key] = value
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
              end
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
          
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
              ##
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
              # Get a specific _section_ from the current configuration
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
              #
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
              # Given the following configurating file being loaded:
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          
          
              #
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
              #   config = OpenSSL::Config.load('foo.cnf')
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
              #     #=> #<OpenSSL::Config sections=["default"]>
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
              #   puts config.to_s
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
              #     #=> [ default ]
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
              #     #   foo=bar
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
              #
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
              # You can get a hash of the specific section like so:
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
              #
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          
          
              #   config['default']
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
              #     #=> {"foo"=>"bar"}
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
              #
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          1
          
              def [](section)
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
                @data[section] || {}
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
              end
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          
          
          
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
              ##
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          
          
              # Deprecated
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          
          
              #
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
              # Use #[] instead
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          1
          
              def section(name) # :nodoc:
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
                warn('Config#section is deprecated; use Config#[]')
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
                @data[name] || {}
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          
          
              end
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          
          
          
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
              ##
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
              # Sets a specific _section_ name with a Hash _pairs_.
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
              #
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
              # Given the following configuration being created:
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
              #
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
              #   config = OpenSSL::Config.new
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          
          
              #     #=> #<OpenSSL::Config sections=[]>
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
              #   config['default'] = {"foo"=>"bar","baz"=>"buz"}
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
              #     #=> {"foo"=>"bar", "baz"=>"buz"}
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
              #   puts config.to_s
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
              #     #=> [ default ]
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
              #     #   foo=bar
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          
          
              #     #   baz=buz
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
              #
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          
          
              # It's important to note that this will essentially merge any of the keys
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
              # in _pairs_ with the existing _section_. For example:
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          
          
              #
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
              #   config['default']
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
              #     #=> {"foo"=>"bar", "baz"=>"buz"}
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
              #   config['default'] = {"foo" => "changed"}
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
              #     #=> {"foo"=>"changed"}
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
              #   config['default']
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          
          
              #     #=> {"foo"=>"changed", "baz"=>"buz"}
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          
          
              #
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          1
          
              def []=(section, pairs)
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          
          
                check_modify
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
                @data[section] ||= {}
        
      399. 
      
        
    399.

                  self.add_value(section, key, value)
        
      401. 
      
        
    401.

    402.

      403.
