    21. 
          1
          
                  :min_version => OpenSSL::SSL::TLS1_VERSION,
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
                  :verify_mode => OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_PEER,
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                  :verify_hostname => true,
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                  :options => -> {
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          1
          
                    opts = OpenSSL::SSL::OP_ALL
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          1
          
                    opts &= ~OpenSSL::SSL::OP_DONT_INSERT_EMPTY_FRAGMENTS
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          1
          
                    opts |= OpenSSL::SSL::OP_NO_COMPRESSION
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          1
          
                    opts
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                  }.call
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                }
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
          
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          1
          
                if defined?(OpenSSL::PKey::DH)
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          1
          
                  DEFAULT_2048 = OpenSSL::PKey::DH.new <<-_end_of_pem_
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
          -----BEGIN DH PARAMETERS-----
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
          MIIBCAKCAQEA7E6kBrYiyvmKAMzQ7i8WvwVk9Y/+f8S7sCTN712KkK3cqd1jhJDY
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
          JbrYeNV3kUIKhPxWHhObHKpD1R84UpL+s2b55+iMd6GmL7OYmNIT/FccKhTcveab
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
          VBmZT86BZKYyf45hUF9FOuUM9xPzuK3Vd8oJQvfYMCd7LPC0taAEljQLR4Edf8E6
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
          YoaOffgTf5qxiwkjnlVZQc3whgnEt9FpVMvQ9eknyeGB5KHfayAc3+hUAvI3/Cr3
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
          1bNveX5wInh5GDx1FGhKBZ+s1H+aedudCm7sCgRwv8lKWYGiHzObSma8A86KG+MD
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
          7Lo5JquQ3DlBodj3IDyPrxIv96lvRPFtAwIBAg==
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
          -----END DH PARAMETERS-----
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                  _end_of_pem_
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          1
          
                  private_constant :DEFAULT_2048
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
          
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          1
          
                  DEFAULT_TMP_DH_CALLBACK = lambda { |ctx, is_export, keylen| # :nodoc:
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                    warn "using default DH parameters." if $VERBOSE
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                    DEFAULT_2048
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                  }
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
                end
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
          
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          1
          
                if !(OpenSSL::OPENSSL_VERSION.start_with?("OpenSSL") &&
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                     OpenSSL::OPENSSL_VERSION_NUMBER >= 0x10100000)
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                  DEFAULT_PARAMS.merge!(
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                    ciphers: %w{
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
                      ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                      ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                      ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                      ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                      DHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                      DHE-DSS-AES128-GCM-SHA256
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                      DHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                      DHE-DSS-AES256-GCM-SHA384
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                      ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-SHA256
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                      ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA256
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                      ECDHE-ECDSA-AES128-SHA
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                      ECDHE-RSA-AES128-SHA
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                      ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-SHA384
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                      ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA384
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                      ECDHE-ECDSA-AES256-SHA
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                      ECDHE-RSA-AES256-SHA
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                      DHE-RSA-AES128-SHA256
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                      DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA256
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                      DHE-RSA-AES128-SHA
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                      DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                      DHE-DSS-AES128-SHA256
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                      DHE-DSS-AES256-SHA256
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                      DHE-DSS-AES128-SHA
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                      DHE-DSS-AES256-SHA
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                      AES128-GCM-SHA256
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                      AES256-GCM-SHA384
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                      AES128-SHA256
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                      AES256-SHA256
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                      AES128-SHA
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                      AES256-SHA
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                    }.join(":"),
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                  )
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                end
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
          
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          1
          
                DEFAULT_CERT_STORE = OpenSSL::X509::Store.new # :nodoc:
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          1
          
                DEFAULT_CERT_STORE.set_default_paths
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          1
          
                DEFAULT_CERT_STORE.flags = OpenSSL::X509::V_FLAG_CRL_CHECK_ALL
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
          
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                # A callback invoked when DH parameters are required.
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                #
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                # The callback is invoked with the Session for the key exchange, an
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                # flag indicating the use of an export cipher and the keylength
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                # required.
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                #
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                # The callback must return an OpenSSL::PKey::DH instance of the correct
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                # key length.
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
          
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          1
          
                attr_accessor :tmp_dh_callback
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
          
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                # A callback invoked at connect time to distinguish between multiple
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                # server names.
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                #
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                # The callback is invoked with an SSLSocket and a server name.  The
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                # callback must return an SSLContext for the server name or nil.
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          1
          
                attr_accessor :servername_cb
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
          
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                # call-seq:
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                #    SSLContext.new           -> ctx
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                #    SSLContext.new(:TLSv1)   -> ctx
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                #    SSLContext.new("SSLv23") -> ctx
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                #
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                # Creates a new SSL context.
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                #
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                # If an argument is given, #ssl_version= is called with the value. Note
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                # that this form is deprecated. New applications should use #min_version=
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                # and #max_version= as necessary.
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          1
          
                def initialize(version = nil)
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                  self.options |= OpenSSL::SSL::OP_ALL
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                  self.ssl_version = version if version
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                end
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
          
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                ##
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                # call-seq:
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                #   ctx.set_params(params = {}) -> params
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                #
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                # Sets saner defaults optimized for the use with HTTP-like protocols.
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                #
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                # If a Hash _params_ is given, the parameters are overridden with it.
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                # The keys in _params_ must be assignment methods on SSLContext.
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                #
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                # If the verify_mode is not VERIFY_NONE and ca_file, ca_path and
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                # cert_store are not set then the system default certificate store is
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                # used.
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          1
          
                def set_params(params={})
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                  params = DEFAULT_PARAMS.merge(params)
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                  self.options = params.delete(:options) # set before min_version/max_version
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                  params.each{|name, value| self.__send__("#{name}=", value) }
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                  if self.verify_mode != OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                    unless self.ca_file or self.ca_path or self.cert_store
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
                      self.cert_store = DEFAULT_CERT_STORE
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                    end
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
                  end
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                  return params
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
                end
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
          
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                # call-seq:
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                #    ctx.min_version = OpenSSL::SSL::TLS1_2_VERSION
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                #    ctx.min_version = :TLS1_2
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                #    ctx.min_version = nil
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                #
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                # Sets the lower bound on the supported SSL/TLS protocol version. The
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                # version may be specified by an integer constant named
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                # OpenSSL::SSL::*_VERSION, a Symbol, or +nil+ which means "any version".
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
                #
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                # Be careful that you don't overwrite OpenSSL::SSL::OP_NO_{SSL,TLS}v*
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                # options by #options= once you have called #min_version= or
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                # #max_version=.
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                #
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                # === Example
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                #   ctx = OpenSSL::SSL::SSLContext.new
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                #   ctx.min_version = OpenSSL::SSL::TLS1_1_VERSION
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                #   ctx.max_version = OpenSSL::SSL::TLS1_2_VERSION
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                #
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                #   sock = OpenSSL::SSL::SSLSocket.new(tcp_sock, ctx)
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
                #   sock.connect # Initiates a connection using either TLS 1.1 or TLS 1.2
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          1
          
                def min_version=(version)
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
                  set_minmax_proto_version(version, @max_proto_version ||= nil)
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                  @min_proto_version = version
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                end
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
          
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                # call-seq:
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
                #    ctx.max_version = OpenSSL::SSL::TLS1_2_VERSION
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                #    ctx.max_version = :TLS1_2
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
                #    ctx.max_version = nil
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
                #
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
                # Sets the upper bound of the supported SSL/TLS protocol version. See
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                # #min_version= for the possible values.
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          1
          
                def max_version=(version)
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                  set_minmax_proto_version(@min_proto_version ||= nil, version)
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                  @max_proto_version = version
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                end
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
          
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                # call-seq:
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                #    ctx.ssl_version = :TLSv1
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                #    ctx.ssl_version = "SSLv23"
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
                #
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                # Sets the SSL/TLS protocol version for the context. This forces
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
                # connections to use only the specified protocol version. This is
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
                # deprecated and only provided for backwards compatibility. Use
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
                # #min_version= and #max_version= instead.
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
                #
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
                # === History
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
                # As the name hints, this used to call the SSL_CTX_set_ssl_version()
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
                # function which sets the SSL method used for connections created from
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
                # the context. As of Ruby/OpenSSL 2.1, this accessor method is
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
                # implemented to call #min_version= and #max_version= instead.
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          1
          
                def ssl_version=(meth)
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
                  meth = meth.to_s if meth.is_a?(Symbol)
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
                  if /(?<type>_client|_server)\z/ =~ meth
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
                    meth = $`
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
                    if $VERBOSE
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
                      warn "#{caller(1, 1)[0]}: method type #{type.inspect} is ignored"
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
                    end
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
                  end
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
                  version = METHODS_MAP[meth.intern] or
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                    raise ArgumentError, "unknown SSL method `%s'" % meth
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
                  set_minmax_proto_version(version, version)
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
                  @min_proto_version = @max_proto_version = version
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
                end
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
          
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
                METHODS_MAP = {
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          1
          
                  SSLv23: 0,
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
                  SSLv2: OpenSSL::SSL::SSL2_VERSION,
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                  SSLv3: OpenSSL::SSL::SSL3_VERSION,
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
                  TLSv1: OpenSSL::SSL::TLS1_VERSION,
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
                  TLSv1_1: OpenSSL::SSL::TLS1_1_VERSION,
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
                  TLSv1_2: OpenSSL::SSL::TLS1_2_VERSION,
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
                }.freeze
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          1
          
                private_constant :METHODS_MAP
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
          
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
                # The list of available SSL/TLS methods. This constant is only provided
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
                # for backwards compatibility.
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          1
          
                METHODS = METHODS_MAP.flat_map { |name,|
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          6
          
                  [name, :"#{name}_client", :"#{name}_server"]
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
                }.freeze
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          1
          
                deprecate_constant :METHODS
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
              end
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
          
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          1
          
              module SocketForwarder
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          1
          
                def addr
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
                  to_io.addr
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
                end
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
          
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          1
          
                def peeraddr
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
                  to_io.peeraddr
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
                end
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
          
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          1
          
                def setsockopt(level, optname, optval)
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
                  to_io.setsockopt(level, optname, optval)
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
                end
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
          
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          1
          
                def getsockopt(level, optname)
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
                  to_io.getsockopt(level, optname)
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
                end
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
          
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          1
          
                def fcntl(*args)
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
                  to_io.fcntl(*args)
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
                end
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
          
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          1
          
                def closed?
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
                  to_io.closed?
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
                end
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
          
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          1
          
                def do_not_reverse_lookup=(flag)
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
                  to_io.do_not_reverse_lookup = flag
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
                end
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
              end
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
          
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          1
          
              def verify_certificate_identity(cert, hostname)
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
                should_verify_common_name = true
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
                cert.extensions.each{|ext|
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
                  next if ext.oid != "subjectAltName"
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
                  ostr = OpenSSL::ASN1.decode(ext.to_der).value.last
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
                  sequence = OpenSSL::ASN1.decode(ostr.value)
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
                  sequence.value.each{|san|
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
                    case san.tag
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
                    when 2 # dNSName in GeneralName (RFC5280)
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
                      should_verify_common_name = false
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
                      return true if verify_hostname(hostname, san.value)
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
                    when 7 # iPAddress in GeneralName (RFC5280)
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
                      should_verify_common_name = false
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
                      if san.value.size == 4 || san.value.size == 16
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
                        begin
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
                          return true if san.value == IPAddr.new(hostname).hton
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
                        rescue IPAddr::InvalidAddressError
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
                        end
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
                      end
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
                    end
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
                  }
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
                }
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
                if should_verify_common_name
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
                  cert.subject.to_a.each{|oid, value|
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
                    if oid == "CN"
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
                      return true if verify_hostname(hostname, value)
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
                    end
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
                  }
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
                end
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
                return false
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
              end
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          1
          
              module_function :verify_certificate_identity
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
          
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          1
          
              def verify_hostname(hostname, san) # :nodoc:
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
                # RFC 5280, IA5String is limited to the set of ASCII characters
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
                return false unless san.ascii_only?
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
                return false unless hostname.ascii_only?
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
          
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
                # See RFC 6125, section 6.4.1
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
                # Matching is case-insensitive.
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
                san_parts = san.downcase.split(".")
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
          
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
                # TODO: this behavior should probably be more strict
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          
          
                return san == hostname if san_parts.size < 2
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
          
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
                # Matching is case-insensitive.
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
                host_parts = hostname.downcase.split(".")
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
          
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
                # RFC 6125, section 6.4.3, subitem 2.
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
                # If the wildcard character is the only character of the left-most
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
                # label in the presented identifier, the client SHOULD NOT compare
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
                # against anything but the left-most label of the reference
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
                # identifier (e.g., *.example.com would match foo.example.com but
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
                # not bar.foo.example.com or example.com).
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
                return false unless san_parts.size == host_parts.size
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
          
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
                # RFC 6125, section 6.4.3, subitem 1.
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
                # The client SHOULD NOT attempt to match a presented identifier in
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
                # which the wildcard character comprises a label other than the
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
                # left-most label (e.g., do not match bar.*.example.net).
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
                return false unless verify_wildcard(host_parts.shift, san_parts.shift)
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
          
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
                san_parts.join(".") == host_parts.join(".")
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
              end
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          1
          
              module_function :verify_hostname
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
          
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          1
          
              def verify_wildcard(domain_component, san_component) # :nodoc:
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
                parts = san_component.split("*", -1)
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
          
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
                return false if parts.size > 2
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
                return san_component == domain_component if parts.size == 1
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
          
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
                # RFC 6125, section 6.4.3, subitem 3.
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
                # The client SHOULD NOT attempt to match a presented identifier
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
                # where the wildcard character is embedded within an A-label or
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
                # U-label of an internationalized domain name.
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
                return false if domain_component.start_with?("xn--") && san_component != "*"
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
          
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
                parts[0].length + parts[1].length < domain_component.length &&
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
                domain_component.start_with?(parts[0]) &&
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
                domain_component.end_with?(parts[1])
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
              end
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          1
          
              module_function :verify_wildcard
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
          
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          1
          
              class SSLSocket
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          1
          
                include Buffering
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          1
          
                include SocketForwarder
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
          
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          1
          
                attr_reader :hostname
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
          
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
                # The underlying IO object.
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          1
          
                attr_reader :io
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          1
          
                alias :to_io :io
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          
          
          
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
                # The SSLContext object used in this connection.
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          1
          
                attr_reader :context
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
          
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
                # Whether to close the underlying socket as well, when the SSL/TLS
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
                # connection is shut down. This defaults to +false+.
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          1
          
                attr_accessor :sync_close
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
          
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          
          
                # call-seq:
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          
          
                #    ssl.sysclose => nil
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
                #
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          
          
                # Sends "close notify" to the peer and tries to shut down the SSL
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
                # connection gracefully.
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
                #
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          
          
                # If sync_close is set to +true+, the underlying IO is also closed.
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          1
          
                def sysclose
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
                  return if closed?
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
                  stop
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
                  io.close if sync_close
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
                end
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
          
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
                # call-seq:
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          
          
                #   ssl.post_connection_check(hostname) -> true
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
                #
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
                # Perform hostname verification following RFC 6125.
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
                #
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
                # This method MUST be called after calling #connect to ensure that the
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
                # hostname of a remote peer has been verified.
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          1
          
                def post_connection_check(hostname)
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
                  if peer_cert.nil?
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          
          
                    msg = "Peer verification enabled, but no certificate received."
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
                    if using_anon_cipher?
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          
          
                      msg += " Anonymous cipher suite #{cipher[0]} was negotiated. " \
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
                             "Anonymous suites must be disabled to use peer verification."
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
                    end
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
                    raise SSLError, msg
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
                  end
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
          
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          
          
                  unless OpenSSL::SSL.verify_certificate_identity(peer_cert, hostname)
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          
          
                    raise SSLError, "hostname \"#{hostname}\" does not match the server certificate"
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          
          
                  end
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          
          
                  return true
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
                end
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          
          
          
        
      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          
          
                # call-seq:
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          
          
                #   ssl.session -> aSession
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          
          
                #
        
      403. 
      
        
    403. 
          
          
                # Returns the SSLSession object currently used, or nil if the session is
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          
          
                # not established.
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          1
          
                def session
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
                  SSL::Session.new(self)
        
      407. 
      
        
    407. 
          
          
                rescue SSL::Session::SessionError
        
      408. 
      
        
    408. 
          
          
                  nil
        
      409. 
      
        
    409. 
          
          
                end
        
      410. 
      
        
    410. 
          
          
          
        
      411. 
      
        
    411. 
          1
          
                private
        
      412. 
      
        
    412. 
          
          
          
        
      413. 
      
        
    413. 
          1
          
                def using_anon_cipher?
        
      414. 
      
        
    414. 
          
          
                  ctx = OpenSSL::SSL::SSLContext.new
        
      415. 
      
        
    415. 
          
          
                  ctx.ciphers = "aNULL"
        
      416. 
      
        
    416. 
          
          
                  ctx.ciphers.include?(cipher)
        
      417. 
      
        
    417. 
          
          
                end
        
      418. 
      
        
    418. 
          
          
          
        
      419. 
      
        
    419. 
          1
          
                def client_cert_cb
        
      420. 
      
        
    420. 
          
          
                  @context.client_cert_cb
        
      421. 
      
        
    421. 
          
          
                end
        
      422. 
      
        
    422. 
          
          
          
        
      423. 
      
        
    423. 
          1
          
                def tmp_dh_callback
        
      424. 
      
        
    424. 
          
          
                  @context.tmp_dh_callback || OpenSSL::SSL::SSLContext::DEFAULT_TMP_DH_CALLBACK
        
      425. 
      
        
    425. 
          
          
                end
        
      426. 
      
        
    426. 
          
          
          
        
      427. 
      
        
    427. 
          1
          
                def tmp_ecdh_callback
        
      428.

                  @context.tmp_ecdh_callback
        
      429. 
      
        
    429. 
          
          
                end
        
      430.

      431.

          1

      433.

      439.

              ##
        
      441. 
      
        
    441. 
          
          
              # SSLServer represents a TCP/IP server socket with Secure Sockets Layer.
        
      442. 
      
        
    442. 
          1
          
              class SSLServer
        
      443. 
      
        
    443. 
          1
          
                include SocketForwarder
        
      444. 
      
        
    444. 
          
          
                # When true then #accept works exactly the same as TCPServer#accept
        
      445. 
      
        
    445. 
          1
          
                attr_accessor :start_immediately
        
      446. 
      
        
    446. 
          
          
          
        
      447. 
      
        
    447. 
          
          
                # Creates a new instance of SSLServer.
        
      448. 
      
        
    448. 
          
          
                # * _srv_ is an instance of TCPServer.
        
      449. 
      
        
    449. 
          
          
                # * _ctx_ is an instance of OpenSSL::SSL::SSLContext.
        
      450. 
      
        
    450. 
          1
          
                def initialize(svr, ctx)
        
      451. 
      
        
    451. 
          
          
                  @svr = svr
        
      452. 
      
        
    452. 
          
          
                  @ctx = ctx
        
      453. 
      
        
    453. 
          
          
                  unless ctx.session_id_context
        
      454. 
      
        
    454. 
          
          
                    # see #6137 - session id may not exceed 32 bytes
        
      455. 
      
        
    455. 
          
          
                    prng = ::Random.new($0.hash)
        
      456. 
      
        
    456. 
          
          
                    session_id = prng.bytes(16).unpack('H*')[0]
        
      457. 
      
        
    457. 
          
          
                    @ctx.session_id_context = session_id
        
      458. 
      
        
    458. 
          
          
                  end
        
      459. 
      
        
    459. 
          
          
                  @start_immediately = true
        
      460. 
      
        
    460. 
          
          
                end
        
      461. 
      
        
    461. 
          
          
          
        
      462. 
      
        
    462. 
          
          
                # Returns the TCPServer passed to the SSLServer when initialized.
        
      463. 
      
        
    463. 
          1
          
                def to_io
        
      464. 
      
        
    464. 
          
          
                  @svr
        
      465. 
      
        
    465. 
          
          
                end
        
      466. 
      
        
    466. 
          
          
          
        
      467. 
      
        
    467. 
          
          
                # See TCPServer#listen for details.
        
      468. 
      
        
    468. 
          1
          
                def listen(backlog=5)
        
      469. 
      
        
    469. 
          
          
                  @svr.listen(backlog)
        
      470. 
      
        
    470. 
          
          
                end
        
      471. 
      
        
    471. 
          
          
          
        
      472. 
      
        
    472. 
          
          
                # See BasicSocket#shutdown for details.
        
      473. 
      
        
    473. 
          1
          
                def shutdown(how=Socket::SHUT_RDWR)
        
      474. 
      
        
    474. 
          
          
                  @svr.shutdown(how)
        
      475. 
      
        
    475. 
          
          
                end
        
      476. 
      
        
    476. 
          
          
          
        
      477. 
      
        
    477. 
          
          
                # Works similar to TCPServer#accept.
        
      478. 
      
        
    478. 
          1
          
                def accept
        
      479. 
      
        
    479. 
          
          
                  # Socket#accept returns [socket, addrinfo].
        
      480. 
      
        
    480. 
          
          
                  # TCPServer#accept returns a socket.
        
      481. 
      
        
    481. 
          
          
                  # The following comma strips addrinfo.
        
      482. 
      
        
    482. 
          
          
                  sock, = @svr.accept
        
      483. 
      
        
    483. 
          
          
                  begin
        
      484. 
      
        
    484. 
          
          
                    ssl = OpenSSL::SSL::SSLSocket.new(sock, @ctx)
        
      485. 
      
        
    485. 
          
          
                    ssl.sync_close = true
        
      486. 
      
        
    486. 
          
          
                    ssl.accept if @start_immediately
        
      487. 
      
        
    487. 
          
          
                    ssl
        
      488. 
      
        
    488. 
          
          
                  rescue Exception => ex
        
      489. 
      
        
    489. 
          
          
                    if ssl
        
      490. 
      
        
    490. 
          
          
                      ssl.close
        
      491. 
      
        
    491. 
          
          
                    else
        
      492. 
      
        
    492. 
          
          
                      sock.close
        
      493. 
      
        
    493. 
          
          
                    end
        
      494. 
      
        
    494. 
          
          
                    raise ex
        
      495. 
      
        
    495. 
          
          
                  end
        
      496. 
      
        
    496. 
          
          
                end
        
      497. 
      
        
    497. 
          
          
          
        
      498. 
      
        
    498. 
          
          
                # See IO#close for details.
        
      499. 
      
        
    499. 
          1
          
                def close
        
      500. 
      
        
    500. 
          
          
                  @svr.close
        
      501. 
      
        
    501. 
          
          
                end
        
      502. 
      
        
    502. 
          
          
              end
        
      503. 
      
        
    503. 
          
          
            end
        
      504. 
      
        
    504. 
          
          
          end
        
      505.

    /usr/lib/ruby/2.6.0/openssl/x509.rb

    36.8 % covered

    125 relevant lines. 46 lines covered and 79 lines missed.

          # frozen_string_literal: false
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          #--
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
          # = Ruby-space definitions that completes C-space funcs for X509 and subclasses
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
          #
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          # = Info
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
          # 'OpenSSL for Ruby 2' project
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          # Copyright (C) 2002  Michal Rokos <m.rokos@sh.cvut.cz>
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
          # All rights reserved.
        
      9. 
      
        
    9.

      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
          # = Licence
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
          # This program is licensed under the same licence as Ruby.
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          # (See the file 'LICENCE'.)
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
          #++
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
          
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          1
          
          module OpenSSL
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          1
          
            module X509
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          1
          
              class ExtensionFactory
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          1
          
                def create_extension(*arg)
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                  if arg.size > 1
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
                    create_ext(*arg)
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
                  else
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
                    send("create_ext_from_"+arg[0].class.name.downcase, arg[0])
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                  end
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                end
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
          
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          1
          
                def create_ext_from_array(ary)
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
                  raise ExtensionError, "unexpected array form" if ary.size > 3
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
                  create_ext(ary[0], ary[1], ary[2])
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
                end
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
          
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          1
          
                def create_ext_from_string(str) # "oid = critical, value"
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                  oid, value = str.split(/=/, 2)
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                  oid.strip!
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                  value.strip!
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                  create_ext(oid, value)
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                end
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
          
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          1
          
                def create_ext_from_hash(hash)
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                  create_ext(hash["oid"], hash["value"], hash["critical"])
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                end
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
              end
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
          
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          1
          
              class Extension
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          1
          
                def ==(other)
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                  return false unless Extension === other
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                  to_der == other.to_der
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                end
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
          
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          1
          
                def to_s # "oid = critical, value"
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                  str = self.oid
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
                  str << " = "
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                  str << "critical, " if self.critical?
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                  str << self.value.gsub(/\n/, ", ")
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
                end
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
          
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          1
          
                def to_h # {"oid"=>sn|ln, "value"=>value, "critical"=>true|false}
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
                  {"oid"=>self.oid,"value"=>self.value,"critical"=>self.critical?}
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                end
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
          
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          1
          
                def to_a
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                  [ self.oid, self.value, self.critical? ]
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                end
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
              end
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
          
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          1
          
              class Name
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          1
          
                module RFC2253DN
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          1
          
                  Special = ',=+<>#;'
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          1
          
                  HexChar = /[0-9a-fA-F]/
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          1
          
                  HexPair = /#{HexChar}#{HexChar}/
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          1
          
                  HexString = /#{HexPair}+/
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          1
          
                  Pair = /\\(?:[#{Special}]|\\|"|#{HexPair})/
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          1
          
                  StringChar = /[^\\"#{Special}]/
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          1
          
                  QuoteChar = /[^\\"]/
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          1
          
                  AttributeType = /[a-zA-Z][0-9a-zA-Z]*|[0-9]+(?:\.[0-9]+)*/
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          1
          
                  AttributeValue = /
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                    (?!["#])((?:#{StringChar}|#{Pair})*)|
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                    \#(#{HexString})|
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                    "((?:#{QuoteChar}|#{Pair})*)"
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                  /x
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          1
          
                  TypeAndValue = /\A(#{AttributeType})=#{AttributeValue}/
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
          
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          1
          
                  module_function
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
          
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          1
          
                  def expand_pair(str)
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                    return nil unless str
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                    return str.gsub(Pair){
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                      pair = $&
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                      case pair.size
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                      when 2 then pair[1,1]
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                      when 3 then Integer("0x#{pair[1,2]}").chr
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                      else raise OpenSSL::X509::NameError, "invalid pair: #{str}"
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                      end
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                    }
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                  end
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
          
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          1
          
                  def expand_hexstring(str)
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                    return nil unless str
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                    der = str.gsub(HexPair){$&.to_i(16).chr }
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                    a1 = OpenSSL::ASN1.decode(der)
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                    return a1.value, a1.tag
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                  end
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
          
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          1
          
                  def expand_value(str1, str2, str3)
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
                    value = expand_pair(str1)
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                    value, tag = expand_hexstring(str2) unless value
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                    value = expand_pair(str3) unless value
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                    return value, tag
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                  end
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
          
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          1
          
                  def scan(dn)
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                    str = dn
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                    ary = []
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                    while true
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                      if md = TypeAndValue.match(str)
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                        remain = md.post_match
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                        type = md[1]
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                        value, tag = expand_value(md[2], md[3], md[4]) rescue nil
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                        if value
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                          type_and_value = [type, value]
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                          type_and_value.push(tag) if tag
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                          ary.unshift(type_and_value)
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                          if remain.length > 2 && remain[0] == ?,
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                            str = remain[1..-1]
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                            next
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                          elsif remain.length > 2 && remain[0] == ?+
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                            raise OpenSSL::X509::NameError,
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                              "multi-valued RDN is not supported: #{dn}"
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                          elsif remain.empty?
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                            break
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                          end
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                        end
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                      end
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                      msg_dn = dn[0, dn.length - str.length] + " =>" + str
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                      raise OpenSSL::X509::NameError, "malformed RDN: #{msg_dn}"
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                    end
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                    return ary
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                  end
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                end
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
          
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          1
          
                class << self
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          1
          
                  def parse_rfc2253(str, template=OBJECT_TYPE_TEMPLATE)
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                    ary = OpenSSL::X509::Name::RFC2253DN.scan(str)
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                    self.new(ary, template)
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
                  end
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
          
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          1
          
                  def parse_openssl(str, template=OBJECT_TYPE_TEMPLATE)
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                    if str.start_with?("/")
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
                      # /A=B/C=D format
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                      ary = str[1..-1].split("/").map { |i| i.split("=", 2) }
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                    else
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                      # Comma-separated
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                      ary = str.split(",").map { |i| i.strip.split("=", 2) }
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                    end
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                    self.new(ary, template)
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                  end
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
          
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          1
          
                  alias parse parse_openssl
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
                end
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
          
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          1
          
                def pretty_print(q)
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                  q.object_group(self) {
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                    q.text ' '
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                    q.text to_s(OpenSSL::X509::Name::RFC2253)
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                  }
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                end
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
              end
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
          
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          1
          
              class Attribute
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          1
          
                def ==(other)
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                  return false unless Attribute === other
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
                  to_der == other.to_der
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                end
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
              end
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
          
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          1
          
              class StoreContext
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          1
          
                def cleanup
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
                  warn "(#{caller.first}) OpenSSL::X509::StoreContext#cleanup is deprecated with no replacement" if $VERBOSE
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
                end
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
              end
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
          
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          1
          
              class Certificate
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          1
          
                def pretty_print(q)
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                  q.object_group(self) {
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                    q.breakable
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                    q.text 'subject='; q.pp self.subject; q.text ','; q.breakable
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                    q.text 'issuer='; q.pp self.issuer; q.text ','; q.breakable
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                    q.text 'serial='; q.pp self.serial; q.text ','; q.breakable
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                    q.text 'not_before='; q.pp self.not_before; q.text ','; q.breakable
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                    q.text 'not_after='; q.pp self.not_after
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
                  }
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                end
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
              end
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
          
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          1
          
              class CRL
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          1
          
                def ==(other)
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
                  return false unless CRL === other
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
                  to_der == other.to_der
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
                end
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
              end
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
          
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          1
          
              class Revoked
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          1
          
                def ==(other)
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
                  return false unless Revoked === other
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
                  to_der == other.to_der
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
                end
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
              end
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
          
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          1
          
              class Request
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          1
          
                def ==(other)
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                  return false unless Request === other
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
                  to_der == other.to_der
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
                end
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
              end
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
            end
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
          end
        
      216.

    /usr/lib/ruby/2.6.0/optparse.rb

    46.88 % covered

    721 relevant lines. 338 lines covered and 383 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          
          
          # frozen_string_literal: true
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          #
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
          # optparse.rb - command-line option analysis with the OptionParser class.
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
          #
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          # Author:: Nobu Nakada
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
          # Documentation:: Nobu Nakada and Gavin Sinclair.
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          #
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
          # See OptionParser for documentation.
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
          #
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
          
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
          
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          #--
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
          # == Developer Documentation (not for RDoc output)
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
          #
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
          # === Class tree
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
          #
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          # - OptionParser:: front end
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
          # - OptionParser::Switch:: each switches
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
          # - OptionParser::List:: options list
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
          # - OptionParser::ParseError:: errors on parsing
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
          #   - OptionParser::AmbiguousOption
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
          #   - OptionParser::NeedlessArgument
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
          #   - OptionParser::MissingArgument
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
          #   - OptionParser::InvalidOption
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
          #   - OptionParser::InvalidArgument
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
          #     - OptionParser::AmbiguousArgument
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
          #
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
          # === Object relationship diagram
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
          #
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
          #   +--------------+
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
          #   | OptionParser |<>-----+
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
          #   +--------------+       |                      +--------+
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
          #                          |                    ,-| Switch |
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
          #        on_head -------->+---------------+    /  +--------+
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
          #        accept/reject -->| List          |<|>-
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
          #                         |               |<|>-  +----------+
