            def define_tail(*opts, &block)
        
      1525. 
      
        
    1525. 
          
          
              base.append(*(sw = make_switch(opts, block)))
        
      1526. 
      
        
    1526. 
          
          
              sw[0]
        
      1527. 
      
        
    1527. 
          
          
            end
        
      1528. 
      
        
    1528. 
          
          
          
        
      1529. 
      
        
    1529. 
          
          
            #
        
      1530. 
      
        
    1530. 
          
          
            # Add option switch like with #on, but at tail of summary.
        
      1531. 
      
        
    1531. 
          
          
            #
        
      1532. 
      
        
    1532. 
          1
          
            def on_tail(*opts, &block)
        
      1533. 
      
        
    1533. 
          
          
              define_tail(*opts, &block)
        
      1534. 
      
        
    1534. 
          
          
              self
        
      1535. 
      
        
    1535. 
          
          
            end
        
      1536. 
      
        
    1536. 
          1
          
            alias def_tail_option define_tail
        
      1537. 
      
        
    1537. 
          
          
          
        
      1538. 
      
        
    1538. 
          
          
            #
        
      1539. 
      
        
    1539. 
          
          
            # Add separator in summary.
        
      1540. 
      
        
    1540. 
          
          
            #
        
      1541. 
      
        
    1541. 
          1
          
            def separator(string)
        
      1542. 
      
        
    1542. 
          2
          
              top.append(string, nil, nil)
        
      1543. 
      
        
    1543. 
          
          
            end
        
      1544. 
      
        
    1544. 
          
          
          
        
      1545. 
      
        
    1545. 
          
          
            #
        
      1546. 
      
        
    1546. 
          
          
            # Parses command line arguments +argv+ in order. When a block is given,
        
      1547. 
      
        
    1547. 
          
          
            # each non-option argument is yielded.
        
      1548. 
      
        
    1548. 
          
          
            #
        
      1549. 
      
        
    1549. 
          
          
            # Returns the rest of +argv+ left unparsed.
        
      1550. 
      
        
    1550. 
          
          
            #
        
      1551. 
      
        
    1551. 
          1
          
            def order(*argv, into: nil, &nonopt)
        
      1552. 
      
        
    1552. 
          
          
              argv = argv[0].dup if argv.size == 1 and Array === argv[0]
        
      1553. 
      
        
    1553. 
          
          
              order!(argv, into: into, &nonopt)
        
      1554. 
      
        
    1554. 
          
          
            end
        
      1555. 
      
        
    1555. 
          
          
          
        
      1556. 
      
        
    1556. 
          
          
            #
        
      1557. 
      
        
    1557. 
          
          
            # Same as #order, but removes switches destructively.
        
      1558. 
      
        
    1558. 
          
          
            # Non-option arguments remain in +argv+.
        
      1559. 
      
        
    1559. 
          
          
            #
        
      1560. 
      
        
    1560. 
          1
          
            def order!(argv = default_argv, into: nil, &nonopt)
        
      1561. 
      
        
    1561. 
          1
          
              setter = ->(name, val) {into[name.to_sym] = val} if into
        
      1562. 
      
        
    1562. 
          1
          
              parse_in_order(argv, setter, &nonopt)
        
      1563. 
      
        
    1563. 
          
          
            end
        
      1564. 
      
        
    1564. 
          
          
          
        
      1565. 
      
        
    1565. 
          1
          
            def parse_in_order(argv = default_argv, setter = nil, &nonopt)  # :nodoc:
        
      1566. 
      
        
    1566. 
          1
          
              opt, arg, val, rest = nil
        
      1567. 
      
        
    1567. 
          1
          
              nonopt ||= proc {|a| throw :terminate, a}
        
      1568. 
      
        
    1568. 
          1
          
              argv.unshift(arg) if arg = catch(:terminate) {
        
      1569. 
      
        
    1569. 
          1
          
                while arg = argv.shift
        
      1570. 
      
        
    1570. 
          1
          
                  case arg
        
      1571. 
      
        
    1571. 
          
          
                  # long option
        
      1572. 
      
        
    1572. 
          
          
                  when /\A--([^=]*)(?:=(.*))?/m
        
      1573. 
      
        
    1573. 
          
          
                    opt, rest = $1, $2
        
      1574. 
      
        
    1574. 
          
          
                    opt.tr!('_', '-')
        
      1575. 
      
        
    1575. 
          
          
                    begin
        
      1576. 
      
        
    1576. 
          
          
                      sw, = complete(:long, opt, true)
        
      1577. 
      
        
    1577. 
          
          
                    rescue ParseError
        
      1578. 
      
        
    1578. 
          
          
                      raise $!.set_option(arg, true)
        
      1579. 
      
        
    1579. 
          
          
                    end
        
      1580. 
      
        
    1580. 
          
          
                    begin
        
      1581. 
      
        
    1581. 
          
          
                      opt, cb, val = sw.parse(rest, argv) {|*exc| raise(*exc)}
        
      1582. 
      
        
    1582. 
          
          
                      val = cb.call(val) if cb
        
      1583. 
      
        
    1583. 
          
          
                      setter.call(sw.switch_name, val) if setter
        
      1584. 
      
        
    1584. 
          
          
                    rescue ParseError
        
      1585. 
      
        
    1585. 
          
          
                      raise $!.set_option(arg, rest)
        
      1586. 
      
        
    1586. 
          
          
                    end
        
      1587. 
      
        
    1587. 
          
          
          
        
      1588. 
      
        
    1588. 
          
          
                  # short option
        
      1589. 
      
        
    1589. 
          
          
                  when /\A-(.)((=).*|.+)?/m
        
      1590. 
      
        
    1590. 
          
          
                    eq, rest, opt = $3, $2, $1
        
      1591. 
      
        
    1591. 
          
          
                    has_arg, val = eq, rest
        
      1592. 
      
        
    1592. 
          
          
                    begin
        
      1593. 
      
        
    1593. 
          
          
                      sw, = search(:short, opt)
        
      1594. 
      
        
    1594. 
          
          
                      unless sw
        
      1595. 
      
        
    1595. 
          
          
                        begin
        
      1596. 
      
        
    1596. 
          
          
                          sw, = complete(:short, opt)
        
      1597. 
      
        
    1597. 
          
          
                          # short option matched.
        
      1598. 
      
        
    1598. 
          
          
                          val = arg.delete_prefix('-')
        
      1599. 
      
        
    1599. 
          
          
                          has_arg = true
        
      1600. 
      
        
    1600. 
          
          
                        rescue InvalidOption
        
      1601. 
      
        
    1601. 
          
          
                          # if no short options match, try completion with long
        
      1602. 
      
        
    1602. 
          
          
                          # options.
        
      1603. 
      
        
    1603. 
          
          
                          sw, = complete(:long, opt)
        
      1604. 
      
        
    1604. 
          
          
                          eq ||= !rest
        
      1605. 
      
        
    1605. 
          
          
                        end
        
      1606. 
      
        
    1606. 
          
          
                      end
        
      1607. 
      
        
    1607. 
          
          
                    rescue ParseError
        
      1608. 
      
        
    1608. 
          
          
                      raise $!.set_option(arg, true)
        
      1609. 
      
        
    1609. 
          
          
                    end
        
      1610. 
      
        
    1610. 
          
          
                    begin
        
      1611. 
      
        
    1611. 
          
          
                      opt, cb, val = sw.parse(val, argv) {|*exc| raise(*exc) if eq}
        
      1612. 
      
        
    1612. 
          
          
                      raise InvalidOption, arg if has_arg and !eq and arg == "-#{opt}"
        
      1613. 
      
        
    1613. 
          
          
                      argv.unshift(opt) if opt and (!rest or (opt = opt.sub(/\A-*/, '-')) != '-')
        
      1614. 
      
        
    1614. 
          
          
                      val = cb.call(val) if cb
        
      1615. 
      
        
    1615. 
          
          
                      setter.call(sw.switch_name, val) if setter
        
      1616. 
      
        
    1616. 
          
          
                    rescue ParseError
        
      1617. 
      
        
    1617. 
          
          
                      raise $!.set_option(arg, arg.length > 2)
        
      1618. 
      
        
    1618. 
          
          
                    end
        
      1619. 
      
        
    1619. 
          
          
          
        
      1620. 
      
        
    1620. 
          
          
                  # non-option argument
        
      1621. 
      
        
    1621. 
          
          
                  else
        
      1622. 
      
        
    1622. 
          1
          
                    catch(:prune) do
        
      1623. 
      
        
    1623. 
          1
          
                      visit(:each_option) do |sw0|
        
      1624. 
      
        
    1624. 
          9
          
                        sw = sw0
        
      1625. 
      
        
    1625. 
          9
          
                        sw.block.call(arg) if Switch === sw and sw.match_nonswitch?(arg)
        
      1626. 
      
        
    1626. 
          
          
                      end
        
      1627. 
      
        
    1627. 
          1
          
                      nonopt.call(arg)
        
      1628. 
      
        
    1628. 
          
          
                    end
        
      1629. 
      
        
    1629. 
          
          
                  end
        
      1630. 
      
        
    1630. 
          
          
                end
        
      1631. 
      
        
    1631. 
          
          
          
        
      1632. 
      
        
    1632. 
          1
          
                nil
        
      1633. 
      
        
    1633. 
          
          
              }
        
      1634. 
      
        
    1634. 
          
          
          
        
      1635. 
      
        
    1635. 
          1
          
              visit(:search, :short, nil) {|sw| sw.block.call(*argv) if !sw.pattern}
        
      1636. 
      
        
    1636. 
          
          
          
        
      1637. 
      
        
    1637. 
          1
          
              argv
        
      1638. 
      
        
    1638. 
          
          
            end
        
      1639. 
      
        
    1639. 
          1
          
            private :parse_in_order
        
      1640. 
      
        
    1640. 
          
          
          
        
      1641. 
      
        
    1641. 
          
          
            #
        
      1642. 
      
        
    1642. 
          
          
            # Parses command line arguments +argv+ in permutation mode and returns
        
      1643. 
      
        
    1643. 
          
          
            # list of non-option arguments.
        
      1644. 
      
        
    1644. 
          
          
            #
        
      1645. 
      
        
    1645. 
          1
          
            def permute(*argv, into: nil)
        
      1646. 
      
        
    1646. 
          
          
              argv = argv[0].dup if argv.size == 1 and Array === argv[0]
        
      1647. 
      
        
    1647. 
          
          
              permute!(argv, into: into)
        
      1648. 
      
        
    1648. 
          
          
            end
        
      1649. 
      
        
    1649. 
          
          
          
        
      1650. 
      
        
    1650. 
          
          
            #
        
      1651. 
      
        
    1651. 
          
          
            # Same as #permute, but removes switches destructively.
        
      1652. 
      
        
    1652. 
          
          
            # Non-option arguments remain in +argv+.
        
      1653. 
      
        
    1653. 
          
          
            #
        
      1654. 
      
        
    1654. 
          1
          
            def permute!(argv = default_argv, into: nil)
        
      1655. 
      
        
    1655. 
          1
          
              nonopts = []
        
      1656. 
      
        
    1656. 
          1
          
              order!(argv, into: into, &nonopts.method(:<<))
        
      1657. 
      
        
    1657. 
          1
          
              argv[0, 0] = nonopts
        
      1658. 
      
        
    1658. 
          1
          
              argv
        
      1659. 
      
        
    1659. 
          
          
            end
        
      1660. 
      
        
    1660. 
          
          
          
        
      1661. 
      
        
    1661. 
          
          
            #
        
      1662. 
      
        
    1662. 
          
          
            # Parses command line arguments +argv+ in order when environment variable
        
      1663. 
      
        
    1663. 
          
          
            # POSIXLY_CORRECT is set, and in permutation mode otherwise.
        
      1664. 
      
        
    1664. 
          
          
            #
        
      1665. 
      
        
    1665. 
          1
          
            def parse(*argv, into: nil)
        
      1666. 
      
        
    1666. 
          
          
              argv = argv[0].dup if argv.size == 1 and Array === argv[0]
        
      1667. 
      
        
    1667. 
          
          
              parse!(argv, into: into)
        
      1668. 
      
        
    1668. 
          
          
            end
        
      1669. 
      
        
    1669. 
          
          
          
        
      1670. 
      
        
    1670. 
          
          
            #
        
      1671. 
      
        
    1671. 
          
          
            # Same as #parse, but removes switches destructively.
        
      1672. 
      
        
    1672. 
          
          
            # Non-option arguments remain in +argv+.
        
      1673. 
      
        
    1673. 
          
          
            #
        
      1674. 
      
        
    1674. 
          1
          
            def parse!(argv = default_argv, into: nil)
        
      1675. 
      
        
    1675. 
          1
          
              if ENV.include?('POSIXLY_CORRECT')
        
      1676. 
      
        
    1676. 
          
          
                order!(argv, into: into)
        
      1677. 
      
        
    1677. 
          
          
              else
        
      1678. 
      
        
    1678. 
          1
          
                permute!(argv, into: into)
        
      1679. 
      
        
    1679. 
          
          
              end
        
      1680. 
      
        
    1680. 
          
          
            end
        
      1681. 
      
        
    1681. 
          
          
          
        
      1682. 
      
        
    1682. 
          
          
            #
        
      1683. 
      
        
    1683. 
          
          
            # Wrapper method for getopts.rb.
        
      1684. 
      
        
    1684. 
          
          
            #
        
      1685. 
      
        
    1685. 
          
          
            #   params = ARGV.getopts("ab:", "foo", "bar:", "zot:Z;zot option")
        
      1686. 
      
        
    1686. 
          
          
            #   # params["a"] = true   # -a
        
      1687. 
      
        
    1687. 
          
          
            #   # params["b"] = "1"    # -b1
        
      1688. 
      
        
    1688. 
          
          
            #   # params["foo"] = "1"  # --foo
        
      1689. 
      
        
    1689. 
          
          
            #   # params["bar"] = "x"  # --bar x
        
      1690. 
      
        
    1690. 
          
          
            #   # params["zot"] = "z"  # --zot Z
        
      1691. 
      
        
    1691. 
          
          
            #
        
      1692. 
      
        
    1692. 
          1
          
            def getopts(*args)
        
      1693. 
      
        
    1693. 
          
          
              argv = Array === args.first ? args.shift : default_argv
        
      1694. 
      
        
    1694. 
          
          
              single_options, *long_options = *args
        
      1695. 
      
        
    1695. 
          
          
          
        
      1696. 
      
        
    1696. 
          
          
              result = {}
        
      1697. 
      
        
    1697. 
          
          
          
        
      1698. 
      
        
    1698. 
          
          
              single_options.scan(/(.)(:)?/) do |opt, val|
        
      1699. 
      
        
    1699. 
          
          
                if val
        
      1700. 
      
        
    1700. 
          
          
                  result[opt] = nil
        
      1701. 
      
        
    1701. 
          
          
                  define("-#{opt} VAL")
        
      1702. 
      
        
    1702. 
          
          
                else
        
      1703. 
      
        
    1703. 
          
          
                  result[opt] = false
        
      1704. 
      
        
    1704. 
          
          
                  define("-#{opt}")
        
      1705. 
      
        
    1705. 
          
          
                end
        
      1706. 
      
        
    1706. 
          
          
              end if single_options
        
      1707. 
      
        
    1707. 
          
          
          
        
      1708. 
      
        
    1708. 
          
          
              long_options.each do |arg|
        
      1709. 
      
        
    1709. 
          
          
                arg, desc = arg.split(';', 2)
        
      1710. 
      
        
    1710. 
          
          
                opt, val = arg.split(':', 2)
        
      1711. 
      
        
    1711. 
          
          
                if val
        
      1712. 
      
        
    1712. 
          
          
                  result[opt] = val.empty? ? nil : val
        
      1713. 
      
        
    1713. 
          
          
                  define("--#{opt}=#{result[opt] || "VAL"}", *[desc].compact)
        
      1714. 
      
        
    1714. 
          
          
                else
        
      1715. 
      
        
    1715. 
          
          
                  result[opt] = false
        
      1716. 
      
        
    1716. 
          
          
                  define("--#{opt}", *[desc].compact)
        
      1717. 
      
        
    1717. 
          
          
                end
        
      1718. 
      
        
    1718. 
          
          
              end
        
      1719. 
      
        
    1719. 
          
          
          
        
      1720. 
      
        
    1720. 
          
          
              parse_in_order(argv, result.method(:[]=))
        
      1721. 
      
        
    1721. 
          
          
              result
        
      1722. 
      
        
    1722. 
          
          
            end
        
      1723. 
      
        
    1723. 
          
          
          
        
      1724. 
      
        
    1724. 
          
          
            #
        
      1725. 
      
        
    1725. 
          
          
            # See #getopts.
        
      1726. 
      
        
    1726. 
          
          
            #
        
      1727. 
      
        
    1727. 
          1
          
            def self.getopts(*args)
        
      1728. 
      
        
    1728. 
          
          
              new.getopts(*args)
        
      1729. 
      
        
    1729. 
          
          
            end
        
      1730. 
      
        
    1730. 
          
          
          
        
      1731. 
      
        
    1731. 
          
          
            #
        
      1732. 
      
        
    1732. 
          
          
            # Traverses @stack, sending each element method +id+ with +args+ and
        
      1733. 
      
        
    1733. 
          
          
            # +block+.
        
      1734. 
      
        
    1734. 
          
          
            #
        
      1735. 
      
        
    1735. 
          1
          
            def visit(id, *args, &block)
        
      1736. 
      
        
    1736. 
          31
          
              @stack.reverse_each do |el|
        
      1737. 
      
        
    1737. 
          93
          
                el.send(id, *args, &block)
        
      1738. 
      
        
    1738. 
          
          
              end
        
      1739. 
      
        
    1739. 
          
          
              nil
        
      1740. 
      
        
    1740. 
          
          
            end
        
      1741. 
      
        
    1741. 
          1
          
            private :visit
        
      1742. 
      
        
    1742. 
          
          
          
        
      1743. 
      
        
    1743. 
          
          
            #
        
      1744. 
      
        
    1744. 
          
          
            # Searches +key+ in @stack for +id+ hash and returns or yields the result.
        
      1745. 
      
        
    1745. 
          
          
            #
        
      1746. 
      
        
    1746. 
          1
          
            def search(id, key)
        
      1747. 
      
        
    1747. 
          29
          
              block_given = block_given?
        
      1748. 
      
        
    1748. 
          29
          
              visit(:search, id, key) do |k|
        
      1749. 
      
        
    1749. 
          9
          
                return block_given ? yield(k) : k
        
      1750. 
      
        
    1750. 
          
          
              end
        
      1751. 
      
        
    1751. 
          
          
            end
        
      1752. 
      
        
    1752. 
          1
          
            private :search
        
      1753. 
      
        
    1753. 
          
          
          
        
      1754. 
      
        
    1754. 
          
          
            #
        
      1755. 
      
        
    1755. 
          
          
            # Completes shortened long style option switch and returns pair of
        
      1756. 
      
        
    1756. 
          
          
            # canonical switch and switch descriptor OptionParser::Switch.
        
      1757. 
      
        
    1757. 
          
          
            #
        
      1758. 
      
        
    1758. 
          
          
            # +typ+::   Searching table.
        
      1759. 
      
        
    1759. 
          
          
            # +opt+::   Searching key.
        
      1760. 
      
        
    1760. 
          
          
            # +icase+:: Search case insensitive if true.
        
      1761. 
      
        
    1761. 
          
          
            # +pat+::   Optional pattern for completion.
        
      1762. 
      
        
    1762. 
          
          
            #
        
      1763. 
      
        
    1763. 
          1
          
            def complete(typ, opt, icase = false, *pat)
        
      1764. 
      
        
    1764. 
          
          
              if pat.empty?
        
      1765. 
      
        
    1765. 
          
          
                search(typ, opt) {|sw| return [sw, opt]} # exact match or...
        
      1766. 
      
        
    1766. 
          
          
              end
        
      1767. 
      
        
    1767. 
          
          
              raise AmbiguousOption, catch(:ambiguous) {
        
      1768. 
      
        
    1768. 
          
          
                visit(:complete, typ, opt, icase, *pat) {|o, *sw| return sw}
        
      1769. 
      
        
    1769. 
          
          
                raise InvalidOption, opt
        
      1770. 
      
        
    1770. 
          
          
              }
        
      1771. 
      
        
    1771. 
          
          
            end
        
      1772. 
      
        
    1772. 
          1
          
            private :complete
        
      1773. 
      
        
    1773. 
          
          
          
        
      1774. 
      
        
    1774. 
          1
          
            def candidate(word)
        
      1775. 
      
        
    1775. 
          
          
              list = []
        
      1776. 
      
        
    1776. 
          
          
              case word
        
      1777. 
      
        
    1777. 
          
          
              when '-'
        
      1778. 
      
        
    1778. 
          
          
                long = short = true
        
      1779. 
      
        
    1779. 
          
          
              when /\A--/
        
      1780. 
      
        
    1780. 
          
          
                word, arg = word.split(/=/, 2)
        
      1781. 
      
        
    1781. 
          
          
                argpat = Completion.regexp(arg, false) if arg and !arg.empty?
        
      1782. 
      
        
    1782. 
          
          
                long = true
        
      1783. 
      
        
    1783. 
          
          
              when /\A-/
        
      1784. 
      
        
    1784. 
          
          
                short = true
        
      1785. 
      
        
    1785. 
          
          
              end
        
      1786. 
      
        
    1786. 
          
          
              pat = Completion.regexp(word, long)
        
      1787. 
      
        
    1787. 
          
          
              visit(:each_option) do |opt|
        
      1788. 
      
        
    1788. 
          
          
                next unless Switch === opt
        
      1789. 
      
        
    1789. 
          
          
                opts = (long ? opt.long : []) + (short ? opt.short : [])
        
      1790. 
      
        
    1790. 
          
          
                opts = Completion.candidate(word, true, pat, &opts.method(:each)).map(&:first) if pat
        
      1791. 
      
        
    1791. 
          
          
                if /\A=/ =~ opt.arg
        
      1792. 
      
        
    1792. 
          
          
                  opts.map! {|sw| sw + "="}
        
      1793. 
      
        
    1793. 
          
          
                  if arg and CompletingHash === opt.pattern
        
      1794. 
      
        
    1794. 
          
          
                    if opts = opt.pattern.candidate(arg, false, argpat)
        
      1795. 
      
        
    1795. 
          
          
                      opts.map!(&:last)
        
      1796. 
      
        
    1796. 
          
          
                    end
        
      1797. 
      
        
    1797. 
          
          
                  end
        
      1798. 
      
        
    1798. 
          
          
                end
        
      1799. 
      
        
    1799. 
          
          
                list.concat(opts)
        
      1800. 
      
        
    1800. 
          
          
              end
        
      1801. 
      
        
    1801. 
          
          
              list
        
      1802. 
      
        
    1802. 
          
          
            end
        
      1803. 
      
        
    1803. 
          
          
          
        
      1804. 
      
        
    1804. 
          
          
            #
        
      1805. 
      
        
    1805. 
          
          
            # Loads options from file names as +filename+. Does nothing when the file
        
      1806. 
      
        
    1806. 
          
          
            # is not present. Returns whether successfully loaded.
        
      1807. 
      
        
    1807. 
          
          
            #
        
      1808. 
      
        
    1808. 
          
          
            # +filename+ defaults to basename of the program without suffix in a
        
      1809. 
      
        
    1809. 
          
          
            # directory ~/.options.
        
      1810. 
      
        
    1810. 
          
          
            #
        
      1811. 
      
        
    1811. 
          1
          
            def load(filename = nil)
        
      1812. 
      
        
    1812. 
          
          
              begin
        
      1813. 
      
        
    1813. 
          
          
                filename ||= File.expand_path(File.basename($0, '.*'), '~/.options')
        
      1814. 
      
        
    1814. 
          
          
              rescue
        
      1815. 
      
        
    1815. 
          
          
                return false
        
      1816. 
      
        
    1816. 
          
          
              end
        
      1817. 
      
        
    1817. 
          
          
              begin
        
      1818. 
      
        
    1818. 
          
          
                parse(*IO.readlines(filename).each {|s| s.chomp!})
        
      1819. 
      
        
    1819. 
          
          
                true
        
      1820. 
      
        
    1820. 
          
          
              rescue Errno::ENOENT, Errno::ENOTDIR
        
      1821. 
      
        
    1821. 
          
          
                false
        
      1822. 
      
        
    1822. 
          
          
              end
        
      1823. 
      
        
    1823. 
          
          
            end
        
      1824. 
      
        
    1824. 
          
          
          
        
      1825. 
      
        
    1825. 
          
          
            #
        
      1826. 
      
        
    1826. 
          
          
            # Parses environment variable +env+ or its uppercase with splitting like a
        
      1827. 
      
        
    1827. 
          
          
            # shell.
        
      1828. 
      
        
    1828. 
          
          
            #
        
      1829. 
      
        
    1829. 
          
          
            # +env+ defaults to the basename of the program.
        
      1830. 
      
        
    1830. 
          
          
            #
        
      1831. 
      
        
    1831. 
          1
          
            def environment(env = File.basename($0, '.*'))
        
      1832. 
      
        
    1832. 
          
          
              env = ENV[env] || ENV[env.upcase] or return
        
      1833. 
      
        
    1833. 
          
          
              require 'shellwords'
        
      1834. 
      
        
    1834. 
          
          
              parse(*Shellwords.shellwords(env))
        
      1835. 
      
        
    1835. 
          
          
            end
        
      1836. 
      
        
    1836. 
          
          
          
        
      1837. 
      
        
    1837. 
          
          
            #
        
      1838. 
      
        
    1838. 
          
          
            # Acceptable argument classes
        
      1839. 
      
        
    1839. 
          
          
            #
        
      1840. 
      
        
    1840. 
          
          
          
        
      1841. 
      
        
    1841. 
          
          
            #
        
      1842. 
      
        
    1842. 
          
          
            # Any string and no conversion. This is fall-back.
        
      1843. 
      
        
    1843. 
          
          
            #
        
      1844. 
      
        
    1844. 
          1
          
            accept(Object) {|s,|s or s.nil?}
        
      1845. 
      
        
    1845. 
          
          
          
        
      1846. 
      
        
    1846. 
          1
          
            accept(NilClass) {|s,|s}
        
      1847. 
      
        
    1847. 
          
          
          
        
      1848. 
      
        
    1848. 
          
          
            #
        
      1849. 
      
        
    1849. 
          
          
            # Any non-empty string, and no conversion.
        
      1850. 
      
        
    1850. 
          
          
            #
        
      1851. 
      
        
    1851. 
          1
          
            accept(String, /.+/m) {|s,*|s}
        
      1852. 
      
        
    1852. 
          
          
          
        
      1853. 
      
        
    1853. 
          
          
            #
        
      1854. 
      
        
    1854. 
          
          
            # Ruby/C-like integer, octal for 0-7 sequence, binary for 0b, hexadecimal
        
      1855. 
      
        
    1855. 
          
          
            # for 0x, and decimal for others; with optional sign prefix. Converts to
        
      1856. 
      
        
    1856. 
          
          
            # Integer.
        
      1857. 
      
        
    1857. 
          
          
            #
        
      1858. 
      
        
    1858. 
          1
          
            decimal = '\d+(?:_\d+)*'
        
      1859. 
      
        
    1859. 
          1
          
            binary = 'b[01]+(?:_[01]+)*'
        
      1860. 
      
        
    1860. 
          1
          
            hex = 'x[\da-f]+(?:_[\da-f]+)*'
        
      1861. 
      
        
    1861. 
          1
          
            octal = "0(?:[0-7]+(?:_[0-7]+)*|#{binary}|#{hex})?"
        
      1862. 
      
        
    1862. 
          1
          
            integer = "#{octal}|#{decimal}"
        
      1863. 
      
        
    1863. 
          
          
          
        
      1864. 
      
        
    1864. 
          1
          
            accept(Integer, %r"\A[-+]?(?:#{integer})\z"io) {|s,|
        
      1865. 
      
        
    1865. 
          
          
              begin
        
      1866. 
      
        
    1866. 
          
          
                Integer(s)
        
      1867. 
      
        
    1867. 
          
          
              rescue ArgumentError
        
      1868. 
      
        
    1868. 
          
          
                raise OptionParser::InvalidArgument, s
        
      1869. 
      
        
    1869. 
          
          
              end if s
        
      1870. 
      
        
    1870. 
          
          
            }
        
      1871. 
      
        
    1871. 
          
          
          
        
      1872. 
      
        
    1872. 
          
          
            #
        
      1873. 
      
        
    1873. 
          
          
            # Float number format, and converts to Float.
        
      1874. 
      
        
    1874. 
          
          
            #
        
      1875. 
      
        
    1875. 
          1
          
            float = "(?:#{decimal}(?=(.)?)(?:\\.(?:#{decimal})?)?|\\.#{decimal})(?:E[-+]?#{decimal})?"
        
      1876. 
      
        
    1876. 
          1
          
            floatpat = %r"\A[-+]?#{float}\z"io
        
      1877. 
      
        
    1877. 
          1
          
            accept(Float, floatpat) {|s,| s.to_f if s}
        
      1878. 
      
        
    1878. 
          
          
          
        
      1879. 
      
        
    1879. 
          
          
            #
        
      1880. 
      
        
    1880. 
          
          
            # Generic numeric format, converts to Integer for integer format, Float
        
      1881. 
      
        
    1881. 
          
          
            # for float format, and Rational for rational format.
        
      1882. 
      
        
    1882. 
          
          
            #
        
      1883. 
      
        
    1883. 
          1
          
            real = "[-+]?(?:#{octal}|#{float})"
        
      1884. 
      
        
    1884. 
          1
          
            accept(Numeric, /\A(#{real})(?:\/(#{real}))?\z/io) {|s, d, f, n,|
        
      1885. 
      
        
    1885. 
          
          
              if n
        
      1886. 
      
        
    1886. 
          
          
                Rational(d, n)
        
      1887. 
      
        
    1887. 
          
          
              elsif f
        
      1888. 
      
        
    1888. 
          
          
                Float(s)
        
      1889. 
      
        
    1889. 
          
          
              else
        
      1890. 
      
        
    1890. 
          
          
                Integer(s)
        
      1891. 
      
        
    1891. 
          
          
              end
        
      1892. 
      
        
    1892. 
          
          
            }
        
      1893. 
      
        
    1893. 
          
          
          
        
      1894. 
      
        
    1894. 
          
          
            #
        
      1895. 
      
        
    1895. 
          
          
            # Decimal integer format, to be converted to Integer.
        
      1896. 
      
        
    1896. 
          
          
            #
        
      1897. 
      
        
    1897. 
          1
          
            DecimalInteger = /\A[-+]?#{decimal}\z/io
        
      1898. 
      
        
    1898. 
          1
          
            accept(DecimalInteger, DecimalInteger) {|s,|
        
      1899. 
      
        
    1899. 
          
          
              begin
        
      1900. 
      
        
    1900. 
          
          
                Integer(s, 10)
        
      1901. 
      
        
    1901. 
          
          
              rescue ArgumentError
        
      1902. 
      
        
    1902. 
          
          
                raise OptionParser::InvalidArgument, s
        
      1903. 
      
        
    1903. 
          
          
              end if s
        
      1904. 
      
        
    1904. 
          
          
            }
        
      1905. 
      
        
    1905. 
          
          
          
        
      1906. 
      
        
    1906. 
          
          
            #
        
      1907. 
      
        
    1907. 
          
          
            # Ruby/C like octal/hexadecimal/binary integer format, to be converted to
        
      1908. 
      
        
    1908. 
          
          
            # Integer.
        
      1909. 
      
        
    1909. 
          
          
            #
        
      1910. 
      
        
    1910. 
          1
          
            OctalInteger = /\A[-+]?(?:[0-7]+(?:_[0-7]+)*|0(?:#{binary}|#{hex}))\z/io
        
      1911. 
      
        
    1911. 
          1
          
            accept(OctalInteger, OctalInteger) {|s,|
        
      1912. 
      
        
    1912. 
          
          
              begin
        
      1913. 
      
        
    1913. 
          
          
                Integer(s, 8)
        
      1914. 
      
        
    1914. 
          
          
              rescue ArgumentError
        
      1915. 
      
        
    1915. 
          
          
                raise OptionParser::InvalidArgument, s
        
      1916. 
      
        
    1916. 
          
          
              end if s
        
      1917. 
      
        
    1917. 
          
          
            }
        
      1918. 
      
        
    1918. 
          
          
          
        
      1919. 
      
        
    1919. 
          
          
            #
        
      1920. 
      
        
    1920. 
          
          
            # Decimal integer/float number format, to be converted to Integer for
        
      1921. 
      
        
    1921. 
          
          
            # integer format, Float for float format.
        
      1922. 
      
        
    1922. 
          
          
            #
        
      1923. 
      
        
    1923. 
          1
          
            DecimalNumeric = floatpat     # decimal integer is allowed as float also.
        
      1924. 
      
        
    1924. 
          1
          
            accept(DecimalNumeric, floatpat) {|s, f|
        
      1925. 
      
        
    1925. 
          
          
              begin
        
      1926. 
      
        
    1926. 
          
          
                if f
        
      1927. 
      
        
    1927. 
          
          
                  Float(s)
        
      1928. 
      
        
    1928. 
          
          
                else
        
      1929. 
      
        
    1929. 
          
          
                  Integer(s)
        
      1930. 
      
        
    1930. 
          
          
                end
        
      1931. 
      
        
    1931. 
          
          
              rescue ArgumentError
        
      1932. 
      
        
    1932. 
          
          
                raise OptionParser::InvalidArgument, s
        
      1933. 
      
        
    1933. 
          
          
              end if s
        
      1934. 
      
        
    1934. 
          
          
            }
        
      1935. 
      
        
    1935. 
          
          
          
        
      1936. 
      
        
    1936. 
          
          
            #
        
      1937. 
      
        
    1937. 
          
          
            # Boolean switch, which means whether it is present or not, whether it is
        
      1938. 
      
        
    1938. 
          
          
            # absent or not with prefix no-, or it takes an argument
        
      1939. 
      
        
    1939. 
          
          
            # yes/no/true/false/+/-.
        
      1940. 
      
        
    1940. 
          
          
            #
        
      1941. 
      
        
    1941. 
          1
          
            yesno = CompletingHash.new
        
      1942. 
      
        
    1942. 
          4
          
            %w[- no false].each {|el| yesno[el] = false}
        
      1943. 
      
        
    1943. 
          4
          
            %w[+ yes true].each {|el| yesno[el] = true}
        
      1944. 
      
        
    1944. 
          1
          
            yesno['nil'] = false          # should be nil?
        
      1945. 
      
        
    1945. 
          1
          
            accept(TrueClass, yesno) {|arg, val| val == nil or val}
        
      1946. 
      
        
    1946. 
          
          
            #
        
      1947. 
      
        
    1947. 
          
          
            # Similar to TrueClass, but defaults to false.
        
      1948. 
      
        
    1948. 
          
          
            #
        
      1949. 
      
        
    1949. 
          1
          
            accept(FalseClass, yesno) {|arg, val| val != nil and val}
        
      1950. 
      
        
    1950. 
          
          
          
        
      1951. 
      
        
    1951. 
          
          
            #
        
      1952. 
      
        
    1952. 
          
          
            # List of strings separated by ",".
        
      1953. 
      
        
    1953. 
          
          
            #
        
      1954. 
      
        
    1954. 
          1
          
            accept(Array) do |s, |
        
      1955. 
      
        
    1955. 
          
          
              if s
        
      1956. 
      
        
    1956. 
          
          
                s = s.split(',').collect {|ss| ss unless ss.empty?}
        
      1957. 
      
        
    1957. 
          
          
              end
        
      1958. 
      
        
    1958. 
          
          
              s
        
      1959. 
      
        
    1959. 
          
          
            end
        
      1960. 
      
        
    1960. 
          
          
          
        
      1961. 
      
        
    1961. 
          
          
            #
        
      1962. 
      
        
    1962. 
          
          
            # Regular expression with options.
        
      1963. 
      
        
    1963. 
          
          
            #
        
      1964. 
      
        
    1964. 
          1
          
            accept(Regexp, %r"\A/((?:\\.|[^\\])*)/([[:alpha:]]+)?\z|.*") do |all, s, o|
        
      1965. 
      
        
    1965. 
          
          
              f = 0
        
      1966. 
      
        
    1966. 
          
          
              if o
        
      1967. 
      
        
    1967. 
          
          
                f |= Regexp::IGNORECASE if /i/ =~ o
        
      1968. 
      
        
    1968. 
          
          
                f |= Regexp::MULTILINE if /m/ =~ o
        
      1969. 
      
        
    1969. 
          
          
                f |= Regexp::EXTENDED if /x/ =~ o
        
      1970. 
      
        
    1970. 
          
          
                k = o.delete("imx")
        
      1971. 
      
        
    1971. 
          
          
                k = nil if k.empty?
        
      1972. 
      
        
    1972. 
          
          
              end
        
      1973. 
      
        
    1973. 
          
          
              Regexp.new(s || all, f, k)
        
      1974. 
      
        
    1974. 
          
          
            end
        
      1975. 
      
        
    1975. 
          
          
          
        
      1976. 
      
        
    1976. 
          
          
            #
        
      1977. 
      
        
    1977. 
          
          
            # Exceptions
        
      1978. 
      
        
    1978. 
          
          
            #
        
      1979. 
      
        
    1979. 
          
          
          
        
      1980. 
      
        
    1980. 
          
          
            #
        
      1981. 
      
        
    1981. 
          
          
            # Base class of exceptions from OptionParser.
        
      1982. 
      
        
    1982. 
          
          
            #
        
      1983. 
      
        
    1983. 
          1
          
            class ParseError < RuntimeError
        
      1984. 
      
        
    1984. 
          
          
              # Reason which caused the error.
        
      1985. 
      
        
    1985. 
          1
          
              Reason = 'parse error'
        
      1986. 
      
        
    1986. 
          
          
          
        
      1987. 
      
        
    1987. 
          1
          
              def initialize(*args)
        
      1988. 
      
        
    1988. 
          
          
                @args = args
        
      1989. 
      
        
    1989. 
          
          
                @reason = nil
        
      1990. 
      
        
    1990. 
          
          
              end
        
      1991. 
      
        
    1991. 
          
          
          
        
      1992. 
      
        
    1992. 
          1
          
              attr_reader :args
        
      1993. 
      
        
    1993. 
          1
          
              attr_writer :reason
        
      1994. 
      
        
    1994. 
          
          
          
        
      1995. 
      
        
    1995. 
          
          
              #
        
      1996. 
      
        
    1996. 
          
          
              # Pushes back erred argument(s) to +argv+.
        
      1997. 
      
        
    1997. 
          
          
              #
        
      1998. 
      
        
    1998. 
          1
          
              def recover(argv)
        
      1999. 
      
        
    1999. 
          
          
                argv[0, 0] = @args
        
      2000. 
      
        
    2000. 
          
          
                argv
        
      2001. 
      
        
    2001. 
          
          
              end
        
      2002. 
      
        
    2002. 
          
          
          
        
      2003. 
      
        
    2003. 
          1
          
              def self.filter_backtrace(array)
        
      2004. 
      
        
    2004. 
          
          
                unless $DEBUG
        
      2005. 
      
        
    2005. 
          
          
                  array.delete_if(&%r"\A#{Regexp.quote(__FILE__)}:"o.method(:=~))
        
      2006. 
      
        
    2006. 
          
          
                end
        
      2007. 
      
        
    2007. 
          
          
                array
        
      2008. 
      
        
    2008. 
          
          
              end
        
      2009. 
      
        
    2009. 
          
          
          
        
      2010. 
      
        
    2010. 
          1
          
              def set_backtrace(array)
        
      2011. 
      
        
    2011. 
          
          
                super(self.class.filter_backtrace(array))
        
      2012. 
      
        
    2012. 
          
          
              end
        
      2013. 
      
        
    2013. 
          
          
          
        
      2014. 
      
        
    2014. 
          1
          
              def set_option(opt, eq)
        
      2015. 
      
        
    2015. 
          
          
                if eq
        
      2016. 
      
        
    2016. 
          
          
                  @args[0] = opt
        
      2017. 
      
        
    2017. 
          
          
                else
        
      2018. 
      
        
    2018. 
          
          
                  @args.unshift(opt)
        
      2019. 
      
        
    2019. 
          
          
                end
        
      2020. 
      
        
    2020. 
          
          
                self
        
      2021. 
      
        
    2021. 
          
          
              end
        
      2022. 
      
        
    2022. 
          
          
          
        
      2023. 
      
        
    2023. 
          
          
              #
        
      2024. 
      
        
    2024. 
          
          
              # Returns error reason. Override this for I18N.
        
      2025. 
      
        
    2025. 
          
          
              #
        
      2026. 
      
        
    2026. 
          1
          
              def reason
        
      2027. 
      
        
    2027. 
          
          
                @reason || self.class::Reason
        
      2028. 
      
        
    2028. 
          
          
              end
        
      2029. 
      
        
    2029. 
          
          
          
        
      2030. 
      
        
    2030. 
          1
          
              def inspect
        
      2031. 
      
        
    2031. 
          
          
                "#<#{self.class}: #{args.join(' ')}>"
        
      2032. 
      
        
    2032. 
          
          
              end
        
      2033. 
      
        
    2033. 
          
          
          
        
      2034. 
      
        
    2034. 
          
          
              #
        
      2035. 
      
        
    2035. 
          
          
              # Default stringizing method to emit standard error message.
        
      2036. 
      
        
    2036. 
          
          
              #
        
      2037. 
      
        
    2037. 
          1
          
              def message
        
      2038. 
      
        
    2038. 
          
          
                reason + ': ' + args.join(' ')
        
      2039. 
      
        
    2039. 
          
          
              end
        
      2040. 
      
        
    2040. 
          
          
          
        
      2041. 
      
        
    2041. 
          1
          
              alias to_s message
        
      2042. 
      
        
    2042. 
          
          
            end
        
      2043. 
      
        
    2043. 
          
          
          
        
      2044. 
      
        
    2044. 
          
          
            #
        
      2045. 
      
        
    2045. 
          
          
            # Raises when ambiguously completable string is encountered.
        
      2046. 
      
        
    2046. 
          
          
            #
        
      2047. 
      
        
    2047. 
          1
          
            class AmbiguousOption < ParseError
        
      2048. 
      
        
    2048. 
          1
          
              const_set(:Reason, 'ambiguous option')
        
      2049. 
      
        
    2049. 
          
          
            end
        
      2050. 
      
        
    2050. 
          
          
          
        
      2051. 
      
        
    2051. 
          
          
            #
        
      2052. 
      
        
    2052. 
          
          
            # Raises when there is an argument for a switch which takes no argument.
        
      2053. 
      
        
    2053. 
          
          
            #
        
      2054. 
      
        
    2054. 
          1
          
            class NeedlessArgument < ParseError
        
      2055. 
      
        
    2055. 
          1
          
              const_set(:Reason, 'needless argument')
        
      2056. 
      
        
    2056. 
          
          
            end
        
      2057. 
      
        
    2057. 
          
          
          
        
      2058. 
      
        
    2058. 
          
          
            #
        
      2059. 
      
        
    2059. 
          
          
            # Raises when a switch with mandatory argument has no argument.
        
      2060. 
      
        
    2060. 
          
          
            #
        
      2061. 
      
        
    2061. 
          1
          
            class MissingArgument < ParseError
        
      2062. 
      
        
    2062. 
          1
          
              const_set(:Reason, 'missing argument')
        
      2063. 
      
        
    2063. 
          
          
            end
        
      2064. 
      
        
    2064. 
          
          
          
        
      2065. 
      
        
    2065. 
          
          
            #
        
      2066. 
      
        
    2066. 
          
          
            # Raises when switch is undefined.
        
      2067. 
      
        
    2067. 
          
          
            #
        
      2068. 
      
        
    2068. 
          1
          
            class InvalidOption < ParseError
        
      2069. 
      
        
    2069. 
          1
          
              const_set(:Reason, 'invalid option')
        
      2070. 
      
        
    2070. 
          
          
            end
        
      2071. 
      
        
    2071. 
          
          
          
        
      2072. 
      
        
    2072. 
          
          
            #
        
      2073. 
      
        
    2073. 
          
          
            # Raises when the given argument does not match required format.
        
      2074. 
      
        
    2074. 
          
          
            #
        
      2075. 
      
        
    2075. 
          1
          
            class InvalidArgument < ParseError
        
      2076. 
      
        
    2076. 
          1
          
              const_set(:Reason, 'invalid argument')
        
      2077. 
      
        
    2077. 
          
          
            end
        
      2078. 
      
        
    2078. 
          
          
          
        
      2079. 
      
        
    2079. 
          
          
            #
        
      2080. 
      
        
    2080. 
          
          
            # Raises when the given argument word can't be completed uniquely.
        
      2081. 
      
        
    2081. 
          
          
            #
        
      2082. 
      
        
    2082. 
          1
          
            class AmbiguousArgument < InvalidArgument
        
      2083. 
      
        
    2083. 
          1
          
              const_set(:Reason, 'ambiguous argument')
        
      2084. 
      
        
    2084. 
          
          
            end
        
      2085. 
      
        
    2085. 
          
          
          
        
      2086. 
      
        
    2086. 
          
          
            #
        
      2087. 
      
        
    2087. 
          
          
            # Miscellaneous
        
      2088. 
      
        
    2088. 
          
          
            #
        
      2089. 
      
        
    2089. 
          
          
          
        
      2090. 
      
        
    2090. 
          
          
            #
        
      2091. 
      
        
    2091. 
          
          
            # Extends command line arguments array (ARGV) to parse itself.
        
      2092. 
      
        
    2092. 
          
          
            #
        
      2093. 
      
        
    2093. 
          1
          
            module Arguable
        
      2094. 
      
        
    2094. 
          
          
          
        
      2095. 
      
        
    2095. 
          
          
              #
        
      2096. 
      
        
    2096. 
          
          
              # Sets OptionParser object, when +opt+ is +false+ or +nil+, methods
        
      2097. 
      
        
    2097. 
          
          
              # OptionParser::Arguable#options and OptionParser::Arguable#options= are
        
      2098. 
      
        
    2098. 
          
          
              # undefined. Thus, there is no ways to access the OptionParser object
        
      2099. 
      
        
    2099. 
          
          
              # via the receiver object.
        
      2100. 
      
        
    2100. 
          
          
              #
        
      2101. 
      
        
    2101. 
          1
          
              def options=(opt)
        
      2102. 
      
        
    2102. 
          
          
                unless @optparse = opt
        
      2103. 
      
        
    2103. 
          
          
                  class << self
        
      2104. 
      
        
    2104. 
          
          
                    undef_method(:options)
        
      2105. 
      
        
    2105. 
          
          
                    undef_method(:options=)
        
      2106. 
      
        
    2106. 
          
          
                  end
        
      2107. 
      
        
    2107. 
          
          
                end
        
      2108. 
      
        
    2108. 
          
          
              end
        
      2109. 
      
        
    2109. 
          
          
          
        
      2110. 
      
        
    2110. 
          
          
              #
        
      2111. 
      
        
    2111. 
          
          
              # Actual OptionParser object, automatically created if nonexistent.
        
      2112. 
      
        
    2112. 
          
          
              #
        
      2113. 
      
        
    2113. 
          
          
              # If called with a block, yields the OptionParser object and returns the
        
      2114. 
      
        
    2114. 
          
          
              # result of the block. If an OptionParser::ParseError exception occurs
        
      2115. 
      
        
    2115. 
          
          
              # in the block, it is rescued, a error message printed to STDERR and
        
      2116. 
      
        
    2116. 
          
          
              # +nil+ returned.
        
      2117. 
      
        
    2117. 
          
          
              #
        
      2118. 
      
        
    2118. 
          1
          
              def options
        
      2119. 
      
        
    2119. 
          
          
                @optparse ||= OptionParser.new
        
      2120. 
      
        
    2120. 
          
          
                @optparse.default_argv = self
        
      2121. 
      
        
    2121. 
          
          
                block_given? or return @optparse
        
      2122. 
      
        
    2122. 
          
          
                begin
        
      2123. 
      
        
    2123. 
          
          
                  yield @optparse
        
      2124. 
      
        
    2124. 
          
          
                rescue ParseError
        
      2125. 
      
        
    2125. 
          
          
                  @optparse.warn $!
        
      2126. 
      
        
    2126. 
          
          
                  nil
        
      2127. 
      
        
    2127. 
          
          
                end
        
      2128. 
      
        
    2128. 
          
          
              end
        
      2129. 
      
        
    2129. 
          
          
          
        
      2130. 
      
        
    2130. 
          
          
              #
        
      2131. 
      
        
    2131. 
          
          
              # Parses +self+ destructively in order and returns +self+ containing the
        
      2132. 
      
        
    2132. 
          
          
              # rest arguments left unparsed.
        
      2133. 
      
        
    2133. 
          
          
              #
        
      2134. 
      
        
    2134. 
          1
          
              def order!(&blk) options.order!(self, &blk) end
        
      2135. 
      
        
    2135. 
          
          
          
        
      2136. 
      
        
    2136. 
          
          
              #
        
      2137. 
      
        
    2137. 
          
          
              # Parses +self+ destructively in permutation mode and returns +self+
        
      2138. 
      
        
    2138. 
          
          
              # containing the rest arguments left unparsed.
        
      2139. 
      
        
    2139. 
          
          
              #
        
      2140. 
      
        
    2140. 
          1
          
              def permute!() options.permute!(self) end
        
      2141. 
      
        
    2141. 
          
          
          
        
      2142. 
      
        
    2142. 
          
          
              #
        
      2143. 
      
        
    2143. 
          
          
              # Parses +self+ destructively and returns +self+ containing the
        
      2144. 
      
        
    2144. 
          
          
              # rest arguments left unparsed.
        
      2145. 
      
        
    2145. 
          
          
              #
        
      2146. 
      
        
    2146. 
          1
          
              def parse!() options.parse!(self) end
        
      2147. 
      
        
    2147. 
          
          
          
        
      2148. 
      
        
    2148. 
          
          
              #
        
      2149. 
      
        
    2149. 
          
          
              # Substitution of getopts is possible as follows. Also see
        
      2150. 
      
        
    2150. 
          
          
              # OptionParser#getopts.
        
      2151. 
      
        
    2151. 
          
          
              #
        
      2152. 
      
        
    2152. 
          
          
              #   def getopts(*args)
        
      2153. 
      
        
    2153. 
          
          
              #     ($OPT = ARGV.getopts(*args)).each do |opt, val|
        
      2154. 
      
        
    2154. 
          
          
              #       eval "$OPT_#{opt.gsub(/[^A-Za-z0-9_]/, '_')} = val"
        
      2155. 
      
        
    2155. 
          
          
              #     end
        
      2156. 
      
        
    2156. 
          
          
              #   rescue OptionParser::ParseError
        
      2157. 
      
        
    2157. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      2158. 
      
        
    2158. 
          
          
              #
        
      2159. 
      
        
    2159. 
          1
          
              def getopts(*args)
        
      2160. 
      
        
    2160. 
          
          
                options.getopts(self, *args)
        
      2161. 
      
        
    2161. 
          
          
              end
        
      2162. 
      
        
    2162. 
          
          
          
        
      2163. 
      
        
    2163. 
          
          
              #
        
      2164. 
      
        
    2164. 
          
          
              # Initializes instance variable.
        
      2165. 
      
        
    2165. 
          
          
              #
        
      2166. 
      
        
    2166. 
          1
          
              def self.extend_object(obj)
        
      2167. 
      
        
    2167. 
          1
          
                super
        
      2168. 
      
        
    2168. 
          2
          
                obj.instance_eval {@optparse = nil}
        
      2169. 
      
        
    2169. 
          
          
              end
        
      2170. 
      
        
    2170. 
          1
          
              def initialize(*args)
        
      2171. 
      
        
    2171. 
          
          
                super
        
      2172. 
      
        
    2172. 
          
          
                @optparse = nil
        
      2173. 
      
        
    2173. 
          
          
              end
        
      2174. 
      
        
    2174. 
          
          
            end
        
      2175. 
      
        
    2175.

      2178.

            # and DecimalNumeric. See Acceptable argument classes (in source code).
        
      2179.

      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          #
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
          # Example using a Gem::Package
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
          #
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
          # Builds a .gem file given a Gem::Specification. A .gem file is a tarball
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
          # which contains a data.tar.gz and metadata.gz, and possibly signatures.
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          #
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
          #   require 'rubygems'
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
          #   require 'rubygems/package'
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
          #
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
          #   spec = Gem::Specification.new do |s|
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          #     s.summary = "Ruby based make-like utility."
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
          #     s.name = 'rake'
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
          #     s.version = PKG_VERSION
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
          #     s.requirements << 'none'
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
          #     s.files = PKG_FILES
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
          #     s.description = <<-EOF
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
          #   Rake is a Make-like program implemented in Ruby. Tasks
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
          #   and dependencies are specified in standard Ruby syntax.
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
          #     EOF
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
          #   end
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
          #
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
          #   Gem::Package.build spec
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
          #
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
          # Reads a .gem file.
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
          #
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
          #   require 'rubygems'
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
          #   require 'rubygems/package'
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
          #
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
          #   the_gem = Gem::Package.new(path_to_dot_gem)
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
          #   the_gem.contents # get the files in the gem
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
          #   the_gem.extract_files destination_directory # extract the gem into a directory
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
          #   the_gem.spec # get the spec out of the gem
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
          #   the_gem.verify # check the gem is OK (contains valid gem specification, contains a not corrupt contents archive)
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
          #
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
          # #files are the files in the .gem tar file, not the Ruby files in the gem
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
          # #extract_files and #contents automatically call #verify
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
          
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          1
          
          require 'rubygems/security'

          class Gem::Package

            include Gem::UserInteraction
        
      52.

      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          1
          
            class Error < Gem::Exception; end
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
          
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          1
          
            class FormatError < Error
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          1
          
              attr_reader :path
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
          
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          1
          
              def initialize(message, source = nil)
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
                if source
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                  @path = source.path
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
          
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                  message = message + " in #{path}" if path
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                end
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
          
        
      65. 
      
        
    65.

      66. 
      
        
    66.

      68. 
      
        
    68.

            class PathError < Error
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          1
          
              def initialize(destination, destination_dir)
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                super "installing into parent path %s of %s is not allowed" %
        
      73.

                        [destination, destination_dir]
