          1
          
            def self.build(spec, skip_validation = false, strict_validation = false, file_name = nil)
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
              gem_file = file_name || spec.file_name
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
          
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
              package = new gem_file
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
              package.spec = spec
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
              package.build skip_validation, strict_validation
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
          
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
              gem_file
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
            end
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
          
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
            ##
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
            # Creates a new Gem::Package for the file at +gem+. +gem+ can also be
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
            # provided as an IO object.
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
            #
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
            # If +gem+ is an existing file in the old format a Gem::Package::Old will be
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
            # returned.
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
          
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          1
          
            def self.new(gem, security_policy = nil)
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
              gem = if gem.is_a?(Gem::Package::Source)
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                      gem
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                    elsif gem.respond_to? :read
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                      Gem::Package::IOSource.new gem
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
                    else
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                      Gem::Package::FileSource.new gem
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
                    end
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
          
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
              return super unless Gem::Package == self
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
              return super unless gem.present?
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
          
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
              return super unless gem.start
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
              return super unless gem.start.include? 'MD5SUM ='
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
          
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
              Gem::Package::Old.new gem
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
            end
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
          
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
            ##
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
            # Creates a new package that will read or write to the file +gem+.
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
          
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          1
          
            def initialize(gem, security_policy) # :notnew:
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
              @gem = gem
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
          
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
              @build_time      = ENV["SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH"] ? Time.at(ENV["SOURCE_DATE_EPOCH"].to_i).utc : Time.now
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
              @checksums       = {}
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
              @contents        = nil
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
              @digests         = Hash.new { |h, algorithm| h[algorithm] = {} }
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
              @files           = nil
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
              @security_policy = security_policy
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
              @signatures      = {}
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
              @signer          = nil
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
              @spec            = nil
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
            end
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
          
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
            ##
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
            # Copies this package to +path+ (if possible)
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
          
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          1
          
            def copy_to(path)
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
              FileUtils.cp @gem.path, path unless File.exist? path
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
            end
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
          
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
            ##
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
            # Adds a checksum for each entry in the gem to checksums.yaml.gz.
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
          
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          1
          
            def add_checksums(tar)
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
              Gem.load_yaml
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
          
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
              checksums_by_algorithm = Hash.new { |h, algorithm| h[algorithm] = {} }
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
          
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
              @checksums.each do |name, digests|
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
                digests.each do |algorithm, digest|
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
                  checksums_by_algorithm[algorithm][name] = digest.hexdigest
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
                end
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
              end
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
          
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
              tar.add_file_signed 'checksums.yaml.gz', 0444, @signer do |io|
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
                gzip_to io do |gz_io|
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
                  YAML.dump checksums_by_algorithm, gz_io
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
                end
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
              end
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
            end
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
          
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
            ##
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
            # Adds the files listed in the packages's Gem::Specification to data.tar.gz
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
            # and adds this file to the +tar+.
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
          
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          1
          
            def add_contents(tar) # :nodoc:
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
              digests = tar.add_file_signed 'data.tar.gz', 0444, @signer do |io|
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
                gzip_to io do |gz_io|
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
                  Gem::Package::TarWriter.new gz_io do |data_tar|
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
                    add_files data_tar
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
                  end
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
                end
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
              end
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
          
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
              @checksums['data.tar.gz'] = digests
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
            end
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
          
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
            ##
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
            # Adds files included the package's Gem::Specification to the +tar+ file
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
          
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          1
          
            def add_files(tar) # :nodoc:
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
              @spec.files.each do |file|
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
                stat = File.lstat file
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
          
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
                if stat.symlink?
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
                  target_path = File.readlink(file)
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
          
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                  unless target_path.start_with? '.'
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
                    relative_dir = File.dirname(file).sub("#{Dir.pwd}/", '')
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
                    target_path = File.join(relative_dir, target_path)
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
                  end
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
          
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
                  tar.add_symlink file, target_path, stat.mode
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
                end
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
          
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
                next unless stat.file?
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
          
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
                tar.add_file_simple file, stat.mode, stat.size do |dst_io|
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
                  File.open file, 'rb' do |src_io|
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
                    dst_io.write src_io.read 16384 until src_io.eof?
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
                  end
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
                end
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
              end
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
            end
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
          
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
            ##
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
            # Adds the package's Gem::Specification to the +tar+ file
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
          
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          1
          
            def add_metadata(tar) # :nodoc:
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
              digests = tar.add_file_signed 'metadata.gz', 0444, @signer do |io|
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
                gzip_to io do |gz_io|
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
                  gz_io.write @spec.to_yaml
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
                end
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
              end
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
          
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
              @checksums['metadata.gz'] = digests
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
            end
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
          
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
            ##
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
            # Builds this package based on the specification set by #spec=
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
          
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          1
          
            def build(skip_validation = false, strict_validation = false)
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
              raise ArgumentError, "skip_validation = true and strict_validation = true are incompatible" if skip_validation && strict_validation
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
          
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
              Gem.load_yaml
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
              require 'rubygems/security'
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
          
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
              @spec.mark_version
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
              @spec.validate true, strict_validation unless skip_validation
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
          
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
              setup_signer(
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
                signer_options: {
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
                  expiration_length_days: Gem.configuration.cert_expiration_length_days
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
                }
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
              )
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
          
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
              @gem.with_write_io do |gem_io|
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
                Gem::Package::TarWriter.new gem_io do |gem|
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
                  add_metadata gem
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
                  add_contents gem
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
                  add_checksums gem
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
                end
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
              end
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
          
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
              say <<-EOM
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
            Successfully built RubyGem
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
            Name: #{@spec.name}
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
            Version: #{@spec.version}
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
            File: #{File.basename @gem.path}
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
          EOM
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
            ensure
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
              @signer = nil
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
            end
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
          
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
            ##
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
            # A list of file names contained in this gem
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
          
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          1
          
            def contents
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
              return @contents if @contents
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
          
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
              verify unless @spec
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
          
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
              @contents = []
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
          
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
              @gem.with_read_io do |io|
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          
          
                gem_tar = Gem::Package::TarReader.new io
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
          
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
                gem_tar.each do |entry|
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
                  next unless entry.full_name == 'data.tar.gz'
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
          
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
                  open_tar_gz entry do |pkg_tar|
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
                    pkg_tar.each do |contents_entry|
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
                      @contents << contents_entry.full_name
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
                    end
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
                  end
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
          
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
                  return @contents
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
                end
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
              end
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
            end
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
          
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
            ##
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
            # Creates a digest of the TarEntry +entry+ from the digest algorithm set by
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
            # the security policy.
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
          
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          1
          
            def digest(entry) # :nodoc:
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
              algorithms = if @checksums
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
                             @checksums.keys
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
                           else
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
                             [Gem::Security::DIGEST_NAME].compact
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
                           end
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
          
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
              algorithms.each do |algorithm|
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
                digester =
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
                  if defined?(OpenSSL::Digest)
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
                    OpenSSL::Digest.new algorithm
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
                  else
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
                    Digest.const_get(algorithm).new
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
                  end
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
          
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
                digester << entry.read(16384) until entry.eof?
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
          
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
                entry.rewind
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
          
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
                @digests[algorithm][entry.full_name] = digester
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
              end
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          
          
          
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
              @digests
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
            end
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
          
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
            ##
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
            # Extracts the files in this package into +destination_dir+
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
            #
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
            # If +pattern+ is specified, only entries matching that glob will be
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
            # extracted.
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          
          
          
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          1
          
            def extract_files(destination_dir, pattern = "*")
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
              verify unless @spec
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
          
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
              FileUtils.mkdir_p destination_dir, :mode => dir_mode && 0755
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
          
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          
          
              @gem.with_read_io do |io|
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
                reader = Gem::Package::TarReader.new io
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          
          
          
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          
          
                reader.each do |entry|
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
                  next unless entry.full_name == 'data.tar.gz'
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          
          
          
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
                  extract_tar_gz entry, destination_dir, pattern
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
          
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          
          
                  return # ignore further entries
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          
          
                end
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
              end
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
            end
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
          
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
            ##
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
            # Extracts all the files in the gzipped tar archive +io+ into
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
            # +destination_dir+.
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          
          
            #
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
            # If an entry in the archive contains a relative path above
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
            # +destination_dir+ or an absolute path is encountered an exception is
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
            # raised.
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
            #
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
            # If +pattern+ is specified, only entries matching that glob will be
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          
          
            # extracted.
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
          
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          1
          
            def extract_tar_gz(io, destination_dir, pattern = "*") # :nodoc:
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
              directories = [] if dir_mode
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          
          
              open_tar_gz io do |tar|
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
                tar.each do |entry|
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
                  next unless File.fnmatch pattern, entry.full_name, File::FNM_DOTMATCH
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
          
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
                  destination = install_location entry.full_name, destination_dir
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
          
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          
          
                  FileUtils.rm_rf destination
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          
          
          
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          
          
                  mkdir_options = {}
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          
          
                  mkdir_options[:mode] = dir_mode ? 0755 : (entry.header.mode if entry.directory?)
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
                  mkdir =
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          
          
                    if entry.directory?
        
      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          
          
                      destination
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          
          
                    else
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          
          
                      File.dirname destination
        
      403. 
      
        
    403. 
          
          
                    end
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          
          
                  directories << mkdir if directories
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          
          
          
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
                  mkdir_p_safe mkdir, mkdir_options, destination_dir, entry.full_name
        
      407. 
      
        
    407. 
          
          
          
        
      408. 
      
        
    408. 
          
          
                  File.open destination, 'wb' do |out|
        
      409. 
      
        
    409. 
          
          
                    out.write entry.read
        
      410. 
      
        
    410. 
          
          
                    FileUtils.chmod file_mode(entry.header.mode), destination
        
      411. 
      
        
    411. 
          
          
                  end if entry.file?
        
      412. 
      
        
    412. 
          
          
          
        
      413. 
      
        
    413. 
          
          
                  File.symlink(entry.header.linkname, destination) if entry.symlink?
        
      414. 
      
        
    414. 
          
          
          
        
      415. 
      
        
    415. 
          
          
                  verbose destination
        
      416. 
      
        
    416. 
          
          
                end
        
      417. 
      
        
    417. 
          
          
              end
        
      418. 
      
        
    418. 
          
          
          
        
      419. 
      
        
    419. 
          
          
              if directories
        
      420. 
      
        
    420. 
          
          
                directories.uniq!
        
      421. 
      
        
    421. 
          
          
                File.chmod(dir_mode, *directories)
        
      422. 
      
        
    422. 
          
          
              end
        
      423. 
      
        
    423. 
          
          
            end
        
      424. 
      
        
    424. 
          
          
          
        
      425. 
      
        
    425. 
          1
          
            def file_mode(mode) # :nodoc:
        
      426. 
      
        
    426. 
          
          
              ((mode & 0111).zero? ? data_mode : prog_mode) || mode
        
      427. 
      
        
    427. 
          
          
            end
        
      428. 
      
        
    428. 
          
          
          
        
      429. 
      
        
    429. 
          
          
            ##
        
      430. 
      
        
    430. 
          
          
            # Gzips content written to +gz_io+ to +io+.
        
      431. 
      
        
    431. 
          
          
            #--
        
      432. 
      
        
    432. 
          
          
            # Also sets the gzip modification time to the package build time to ease
        
      433. 
      
        
    433. 
          
          
            # testing.
        
      434. 
      
        
    434. 
          
          
          
        
      435. 
      
        
    435. 
          1
          
            def gzip_to(io) # :yields: gz_io
        
      436. 
      
        
    436. 
          
          
              gz_io = Zlib::GzipWriter.new io, Zlib::BEST_COMPRESSION
        
      437. 
      
        
    437. 
          
          
              gz_io.mtime = @build_time
        
      438. 
      
        
    438. 
          
          
          
        
      439. 
      
        
    439. 
          
          
              yield gz_io
        
      440. 
      
        
    440. 
          
          
            ensure
        
      441. 
      
        
    441. 
          
          
              gz_io.close
        
      442. 
      
        
    442. 
          
          
            end
        
      443. 
      
        
    443. 
          
          
          
        
      444. 
      
        
    444. 
          
          
            ##
        
      445. 
      
        
    445. 
          
          
            # Returns the full path for installing +filename+.
        
      446. 
      
        
    446. 
          
          
            #
        
      447. 
      
        
    447. 
          
          
            # If +filename+ is not inside +destination_dir+ an exception is raised.
        
      448. 
      
        
    448. 
          
          
          
        
      449. 
      
        
    449. 
          1
          
            def install_location(filename, destination_dir) # :nodoc:
        
      450. 
      
        
    450. 
          
          
              raise Gem::Package::PathError.new(filename, destination_dir) if
        
      451. 
      
        
    451. 
          
          
                filename.start_with? '/'
        
      452. 
      
        
    452. 
          
          
          
        
      453. 
      
        
    453. 
          
          
              destination_dir = File.expand_path(File.realpath(destination_dir))
        
      454. 
      
        
    454. 
          
          
              destination = File.expand_path(File.join(destination_dir, filename))
        
      455. 
      
        
    455. 
          
          
          
        
      456. 
      
        
    456. 
          
          
              raise Gem::Package::PathError.new(destination, destination_dir) unless
        
      457. 
      
        
    457. 
          
          
                destination.start_with? destination_dir + '/'
        
      458. 
      
        
    458. 
          
          
          
        
      459. 
      
        
    459. 
          
          
              begin
        
      460. 
      
        
    460. 
          
          
                real_destination = File.expand_path(File.realpath(destination))
        
      461. 
      
        
    461. 
          
          
              rescue
        
      462. 
      
        
    462. 
          
          
                # it's fine if the destination doesn't exist, because rm -rf'ing it can't cause any damage
        
      463. 
      
        
    463. 
          
          
                nil
        
      464. 
      
        
    464. 
          
          
              else
        
      465. 
      
        
    465. 
          
          
                raise Gem::Package::PathError.new(real_destination, destination_dir) unless
        
      466. 
      
        
    466. 
          
          
                  real_destination.start_with? destination_dir + '/'
        
      467. 
      
        
    467. 
          
          
              end
        
      468. 
      
        
    468. 
          
          
          
        
      469. 
      
        
    469. 
          
          
              destination.untaint
        
      470. 
      
        
    470. 
          
          
              destination
        
      471. 
      
        
    471. 
          
          
            end
        
      472. 
      
        
    472. 
          
          
          
        
      473. 
      
        
    473. 
          1
          
            def normalize_path(pathname)
        
      474. 
      
        
    474. 
          
          
              if Gem.win_platform?
        
      475. 
      
        
    475. 
          
          
                pathname.downcase
        
      476. 
      
        
    476. 
          
          
              else
        
      477. 
      
        
    477. 
          
          
                pathname
        
      478. 
      
        
    478. 
          
          
              end
        
      479. 
      
        
    479. 
          
          
            end
        
      480. 
      
        
    480. 
          
          
          
        
      481. 
      
        
    481. 
          1
          
            def mkdir_p_safe(mkdir, mkdir_options, destination_dir, file_name)
        
      482. 
      
        
    482. 
          
          
              destination_dir = File.realpath(File.expand_path(destination_dir))
        
      483. 
      
        
    483. 
          
          
              parts = mkdir.split(File::SEPARATOR)
        
      484. 
      
        
    484. 
          
          
              parts.reduce do |path, basename|
        
      485. 
      
        
    485. 
          
          
                path = File.realpath(path) unless path == ""
        
      486. 
      
        
    486. 
          
          
                path = File.expand_path(path + File::SEPARATOR + basename)
        
      487. 
      
        
    487. 
          
          
                lstat = File.lstat path rescue nil
        
      488. 
      
        
    488. 
          
          
                if !lstat || !lstat.directory?
        
      489. 
      
        
    489. 
          
          
                  unless normalize_path(path).start_with? normalize_path(destination_dir) and (FileUtils.mkdir path, mkdir_options rescue false)
        
      490. 
      
        
    490. 
          
          
                    raise Gem::Package::PathError.new(file_name, destination_dir)
        
      491. 
      
        
    491. 
          
          
                  end
        
      492. 
      
        
    492. 
          
          
                end
        
      493. 
      
        
    493. 
          
          
                path
        
      494. 
      
        
    494. 
          
          
              end
        
      495. 
      
        
    495. 
          
          
            end
        
      496. 
      
        
    496. 
          
          
          
        
      497. 
      
        
    497. 
          
          
            ##
        
      498. 
      
        
    498. 
          
          
            # Loads a Gem::Specification from the TarEntry +entry+
        
      499. 
      
        
    499. 
          
          
          
        
      500. 
      
        
    500. 
          1
          
            def load_spec(entry) # :nodoc:
        
      501. 
      
        
    501. 
          
          
              case entry.full_name
        
      502. 
      
        
    502. 
          
          
              when 'metadata' then
        
      503. 
      
        
    503. 
          
          
                @spec = Gem::Specification.from_yaml entry.read
        
      504. 
      
        
    504. 
          
          
              when 'metadata.gz' then
        
      505. 
      
        
    505. 
          
          
                args = [entry]
        
      506. 
      
        
    506. 
          
          
                args << { :external_encoding => Encoding::UTF_8 } if
        
      507. 
      
        
    507. 
          
          
                  Zlib::GzipReader.method(:wrap).arity != 1
        
      508. 
      
        
    508. 
          
          
          
        
      509. 
      
        
    509. 
          
          
                Zlib::GzipReader.wrap(*args) do |gzio|
        
      510. 
      
        
    510. 
          
          
                  @spec = Gem::Specification.from_yaml gzio.read
        
      511. 
      
        
    511. 
          
          
                end
        
      512. 
      
        
    512. 
          
          
              end
        
      513. 
      
        
    513. 
          
          
            end
        
      514. 
      
        
    514. 
          
          
          
        
      515. 
      
        
    515. 
          
          
            ##
        
      516. 
      
        
    516. 
          
          
            # Opens +io+ as a gzipped tar archive
        
      517. 
      
        
    517. 
          
          
          
        
      518. 
      
        
    518. 
          1
          
            def open_tar_gz(io) # :nodoc:
        
      519. 
      
        
    519. 
          
          
              Zlib::GzipReader.wrap io do |gzio|
        
      520. 
      
        
    520. 
          
          
                tar = Gem::Package::TarReader.new gzio
        
      521. 
      
        
    521. 
          
          
          
        
      522. 
      
        
    522. 
          
          
                yield tar
        
      523. 
      
        
    523. 
          
          
              end
        
      524. 
      
        
    524. 
          
          
            end
        
      525. 
      
        
    525. 
          
          
          
        
      526. 
      
        
    526. 
          
          
            ##
        
      527. 
      
        
    527. 
          
          
            # Reads and loads checksums.yaml.gz from the tar file +gem+
        
      528. 
      
        
    528. 
          
          
          
        
      529. 
      
        
    529. 
          1
          
            def read_checksums(gem)
        
      530. 
      
        
    530. 
          
          
              Gem.load_yaml
        
      531. 
      
        
    531. 
          
          
          
        
      532. 
      
        
    532. 
          
          
              @checksums = gem.seek 'checksums.yaml.gz' do |entry|
        
      533. 
      
        
    533. 
          
          
                Zlib::GzipReader.wrap entry do |gz_io|
        
      534. 
      
        
    534. 
          
          
                  Gem::SafeYAML.safe_load gz_io.read
        
      535. 
      
        
    535. 
          
          
                end
        
      536. 
      
        
    536. 
          
          
              end
        
      537. 
      
        
    537. 
          
          
            end
        
      538. 
      
        
    538. 
          
          
          
        
      539. 
      
        
    539. 
          
          
            ##
        
      540. 
      
        
    540. 
          
          
            # Prepares the gem for signing and checksum generation.  If a signing
        
      541. 
      
        
    541. 
          
          
            # certificate and key are not present only checksum generation is set up.
        
      542. 
      
        
    542. 
          
          
          
        
      543. 
      
        
    543. 
          1
          
            def setup_signer(signer_options: {})
        
      544. 
      
        
    544. 
          
          
              passphrase = ENV['GEM_PRIVATE_KEY_PASSPHRASE']
        
      545. 
      
        
    545. 
          
          
              if @spec.signing_key
        
      546. 
      
        
    546. 
          
          
                @signer =
        
      547. 
      
        
    547. 
          
          
                  Gem::Security::Signer.new(
        
      548. 
      
        
    548. 
          
          
                    @spec.signing_key,
        
      549. 
      
        
    549. 
          
          
                    @spec.cert_chain,
        
      550. 
      
        
    550. 
          
          
                    passphrase,
        
      551. 
      
        
    551. 
          
          
                    signer_options
        
      552. 
      
        
    552. 
          
          
                  )
        
      553. 
      
        
    553. 
          
          
          
        
      554. 
      
        
    554. 
          
          
                @spec.signing_key = nil
        
      555. 
      
        
    555. 
          
          
                @spec.cert_chain = @signer.cert_chain.map { |cert| cert.to_s }
        
      556. 
      
        
    556. 
          
          
              else
        
      557. 
      
        
    557. 
          
          
                @signer = Gem::Security::Signer.new nil, nil, passphrase
        
      558. 
      
        
    558. 
          
          
                @spec.cert_chain = @signer.cert_chain.map { |cert| cert.to_pem } if
        
      559. 
      
        
    559. 
          
          
                  @signer.cert_chain
        
      560. 
      
        
    560. 
          
          
              end
        
      561. 
      
        
    561. 
          
          
            end
        
      562. 
      
        
    562. 
          
          
          
        
      563. 
      
        
    563. 
          
          
            ##
        
      564. 
      
        
    564. 
          
          
            # The spec for this gem.
        
      565. 
      
        
    565. 
          
          
            #
        
      566. 
      
        
    566. 
          
          
            # If this is a package for a built gem the spec is loaded from the
        
      567. 
      
        
    567. 
          
          
            # gem and returned.  If this is a package for a gem being built the provided
        
      568. 
      
        
    568. 
          
          
            # spec is returned.
        
      569. 
      
        
    569. 
          
          
          
        
      570. 
      
        
    570. 
          1
          
            def spec
        
      571. 
      
        
    571. 
          
          
              verify unless @spec
        
      572. 
      
        
    572. 
          
          
          
        
      573. 
      
        
    573. 
          
          
              @spec
        
      574. 
      
        
    574. 
          
          
            end
        
      575. 
      
        
    575. 
          
          
          
        
      576. 
      
        
    576. 
          
          
            ##
        
      577. 
      
        
    577. 
          
          
            # Verifies that this gem:
        
      578. 
      
        
    578. 
          
          
            #
        
      579. 
      
        
    579. 
          
          
            # * Contains a valid gem specification
        
      580. 
      
        
    580. 
          
          
            # * Contains a contents archive
        
      581. 
      
        
    581. 
          
          
            # * The contents archive is not corrupt
        
      582. 
      
        
    582. 
          
          
            #
        
      583. 
      
        
    583. 
          
          
            # After verification the gem specification from the gem is available from
        
      584. 
      
        
    584. 
          
          
            # #spec
        
      585. 
      
        
    585. 
          
          
          
        
      586. 
      
        
    586. 
          1
          
            def verify
        
      587. 
      
        
    587. 
          
          
              @files     = []
        
      588. 
      
        
    588. 
          
          
              @spec      = nil
        
      589. 
      
        
    589. 
          
          
          
        
      590. 
      
        
    590. 
          
          
              @gem.with_read_io do |io|
        
      591. 
      
        
    591. 
          
          
                Gem::Package::TarReader.new io do |reader|
        
      592. 
      
        
    592. 
          
          
                  read_checksums reader
        
      593. 
      
        
    593. 
          
          
          
        
      594. 
      
        
    594. 
          
          
                  verify_files reader
        
      595. 
      
        
    595. 
          
          
                end
        
      596. 
      
        
    596. 
          
          
              end
        
      597. 
      
        
    597. 
          
          
          
        
      598. 
      
        
    598. 
          
          
              verify_checksums @digests, @checksums
        
      599. 
      
        
    599. 
          
          
          
        
      600. 
      
        
    600. 
          
          
              @security_policy.verify_signatures @spec, @digests, @signatures if
        
      601. 
      
        
    601. 
          
          
                @security_policy
        
      602. 
      
        
    602. 
          
          
          
        
      603. 
      
        
    603. 
          
          
              true
        
      604. 
      
        
    604. 
          
          
            rescue Gem::Security::Exception
        
      605. 
      
        
    605. 
          
          
              @spec = nil
        
      606. 
      
        
    606. 
          
          
              @files = []
        
      607. 
      
        
    607. 
          
          
              raise
        
      608. 
      
        
    608. 
          
          
            rescue Errno::ENOENT => e
        
      609. 
      
        
    609. 
          
          
              raise Gem::Package::FormatError.new e.message
        
      610. 
      
        
    610. 
          
          
            rescue Gem::Package::TarInvalidError => e
        
      611. 
      
        
    611. 
          
          
              raise Gem::Package::FormatError.new e.message, @gem
        
      612. 
      
        
    612. 
          
          
            end
        
      613. 
      
        
    613. 
          
          
          
        
      614. 
      
        
    614. 
          
          
            ##
        
      615. 
      
        
    615. 
          
          
            # Verifies the +checksums+ against the +digests+.  This check is not
        
      616. 
      
        
    616. 
          
          
            # cryptographically secure.  Missing checksums are ignored.
        
      617. 
      
        
    617. 
          
          
          
        
      618. 
      
        
    618. 
          1
          
            def verify_checksums(digests, checksums) # :nodoc:
        
      619. 
      
        
    619. 
          
          
              return unless checksums
        
      620. 
      
        
    620. 
          
          
          
        
      621. 
      
        
    621. 
          
          
              checksums.sort.each do |algorithm, gem_digests|
        
      622. 
      
        
    622. 
          
          
                gem_digests.sort.each do |file_name, gem_hexdigest|
        
      623. 
      
        
    623. 
          
          
                  computed_digest = digests[algorithm][file_name]
        
      624. 
      
        
    624. 
          
          
          
        
      625. 
      
        
    625. 
          
          
                  unless computed_digest.hexdigest == gem_hexdigest
        
      626. 
      
        
    626. 
          
          
                    raise Gem::Package::FormatError.new \
        
      627. 
      
        
    627. 
          
          
                      "#{algorithm} checksum mismatch for #{file_name}", @gem
        
      628. 
      
        
    628. 
          
          
                  end
        
      629. 
      
        
    629. 
          
          
                end
        
      630. 
      
        
    630. 
          
          
              end
        
      631. 
      
        
    631. 
          
          
            end
        
      632. 
      
        
    632. 
          
          
          
        
      633. 
      
        
    633. 
          
          
            ##
        
      634. 
      
        
    634. 
          
          
            # Verifies +entry+ in a .gem file.
        
      635. 
      
        
    635. 
          
          
          
        
      636. 
      
        
    636. 
          1
          
            def verify_entry(entry)
        
      637. 
      
        
    637. 
          
          
              file_name = entry.full_name
        
      638. 
      
        
    638. 
          
          
              @files << file_name
        
      639. 
      
        
    639. 
          
          
          
        
      640. 
      
        
    640. 
          
          
              case file_name
        
      641. 
      
        
    641. 
          
          
              when /\.sig$/ then
        
      642. 
      
        
    642. 
          
          
                @signatures[$`] = entry.read if @security_policy
        
      643. 
      
        
    643. 
          
          
                return
        
      644. 
      
        
    644. 
          
          
              else
        
      645. 
      
        
    645. 
          
          
                digest entry
        
      646. 
      
        
    646. 
          
          
              end
        
      647. 
      
        
    647. 
          
          
          
        
      648. 
      
        
    648. 
          
          
              case file_name
        
      649. 
      
        
    649. 
          
          
              when "metadata", "metadata.gz" then
        
      650. 
      
        
    650. 
          
          
                load_spec entry
        
      651. 
      
        
    651. 
          
          
              when 'data.tar.gz' then
        
      652. 
      
        
    652. 
          
          
                verify_gz entry
        
      653. 
      
        
    653. 
          
          
              end
        
      654. 
      
        
    654. 
          
          
            rescue => e
        
      655. 
      
        
    655. 
          
          
              message = "package is corrupt, exception while verifying: " +
        
      656. 
      
        
    656. 
          
          
                        "#{e.message} (#{e.class})"
        
      657. 
      
        
    657. 
          
          
              raise Gem::Package::FormatError.new message, @gem
        
      658. 
      
        
    658. 
          
          
            end
        
      659. 
      
        
    659. 
          
          
          
        
      660. 
      
        
    660. 
          
          
            ##
        
      661. 
      
        
    661. 
          
          
            # Verifies the files of the +gem+
        
      662. 
      
        
    662. 
          
          
          
        
      663. 
      
        
    663. 
          1
          
            def verify_files(gem)
        
      664. 
      
        
    664. 
          
          
              gem.each do |entry|
        
      665. 
      
        
    665. 
          
          
                verify_entry entry
        
      666. 
      
        
    666. 
          
          
              end
        
      667. 
      
        
    667. 
          
          
          
        
      668. 
      
        
    668. 
          
          
              unless @spec
        
      669. 
      
        
    669. 
          
          
                raise Gem::Package::FormatError.new 'package metadata is missing', @gem
        
      670. 
      
        
    670. 
          
          
              end
        
      671. 
      
        
    671. 
          
          
          
        
      672. 
      
        
    672. 
          
          
              unless @files.include? 'data.tar.gz'
        
      673. 
      
        
    673. 
          
          
                raise Gem::Package::FormatError.new \
        
      674. 
      
        
    674. 
          
          
                        'package content (data.tar.gz) is missing', @gem
        
      675. 
      
        
    675. 
          
          
              end
        
      676. 
      
        
    676. 
          
          
          
        
      677. 
      
        
    677. 
          
          
              if duplicates = @files.group_by {|f| f }.select {|k,v| v.size > 1 }.map(&:first) and duplicates.any?
        
      678. 
      
        
    678. 
          
          
                raise Gem::Security::Exception, "duplicate files in the package: (#{duplicates.map(&:inspect).join(', ')})"
        
      679. 
      
        
    679. 
          
          
              end
        
      680. 
      
        
    680. 
          
          
            end
        
      681. 
      
        
    681. 
          
          
          
        
      682. 
      
        
    682. 
          
          
            ##
        
      683. 
      
        
    683. 
          
          
            # Verifies that +entry+ is a valid gzipped file.
        
      684. 
      
        
    684. 
          
          
          
        
      685. 
      
        
    685. 
          1
          
            def verify_gz(entry) # :nodoc:
        
      686. 
      
        
    686. 
          
          
              Zlib::GzipReader.wrap entry do |gzio|
        
      687. 
      
        
    687. 
          
          
                gzio.read 16384 until gzio.eof? # gzip checksum verification
        
      688. 
      
        
    688. 
          
          
              end
        
      689. 
      
        
    689. 
          
          
            rescue Zlib::GzipFile::Error => e
        
      690. 
      
        
    690. 
          
          
              raise Gem::Package::FormatError.new(e.message, entry.full_name)
        
      691. 
      
        
    691. 
          
          
            end
        
      692. 
      
        
    692. 
          
          
          
        
      693. 
      
        
    693. 
          
          
          end
        
      694. 
      
        
    694. 
          
          
          
        
      695. 
      
        
    695. 
          1
          
          require 'rubygems/package/digest_io'
        
      696.

            ##
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
            # Wraps +io+ and updates digest for each of the digest algorithms in
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
            # the +digests+ Hash.  Returns the digests hash.  Example:
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
            #
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
            #   io = StringIO.new
        
      22.

      23.

            #     'SHA1'   => OpenSSL::Digest.new('SHA1'),
        
      24.

            #     'SHA512' => OpenSSL::Digest.new('SHA512'),
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
            #   }

    26. 
          
          
            #

      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
            #     digest_io.write "hello"
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
            #   end
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
            #
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
            #   digests['SHA1'].hexdigest   #=> "aaf4c61d[...]"
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
            #   digests['SHA512'].hexdigest #=> "9b71d224[...]"
        
      33. 
      
        
    33.

          1
          
            def self.wrap(io, digests)
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
              digest_io = new io, digests
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
          
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
              yield digest_io
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
          
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
              return digests
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
            end
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
          
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
            ##
        
      43.

      44.

            # ::wrap documentation for documentation of +io+ and +digests+.

            def initialize(io, digests)
        
      47.

              @io = io

    48. 
          
          
              @digests = digests

            end
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
          
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
            ##
        
      52.

            # Writes +data+ to the underlying IO and updates the digests
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
          
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          1
          
            def write(data)
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
              result = @io.write data
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
          
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
              @digests.each do |_, digest|
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
                digest << data
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
              end
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
          
        
      61.

            end

    63. 
          
          
          
        
      64. 
      
        
    64.

          ##
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
          # Supports reading and writing gems from/to a generic IO object.  This is
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
          # useful for other applications built on top of rubygems, such as
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          # rubygems.org.
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
          #
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          # This is a private class, do not depend on it directly. Instead, pass an IO
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
          # object to `Gem::Package.new`.
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
          
        
      10.

          1

                if io.pos > 0

    22. 
          
          
                end

            def read_until_dashes(io) # :nodoc:
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
              while (line = io.gets) && line.chomp.strip != "---" do
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                yield line if block_given?
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
              end
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
            end

          1
          
            def skip_ruby(io) # :nodoc:
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
              loop do
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                line = io.gets
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
          
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                return if line.chomp == '__END__'
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                break unless line
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
              end
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
          
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
              raise Gem::Exception, "Failed to find end of Ruby script while reading gem"
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
            end
        
      129.

      130.

      137.

              yaml = String.new

      144.

      145.

    146. 
          
          
          
        
      147.

      148.

      149.

            # Old format gems cannot be verified as signed.

      161.
