            ##
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
            # Calls +say+ with +msg+ or the results of the block if really_verbose
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
            # is true.
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
          
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          1
          
            def verbose(msg = nil)
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
              say(clean_text(msg || yield)) if Gem.configuration.really_verbose
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
            end
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
          end
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
          
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
          ##
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
          # Gem::StreamUI implements a simple stream based user interface.
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
          
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          1
          
          class Gem::StreamUI
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
          
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          1
          
            extend Gem::Deprecate
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
          
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
            ##
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
            # The input stream
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
          
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          1
          
            attr_reader :ins
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
          
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
            ##
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
            # The output stream
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
          
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          1
          
            attr_reader :outs
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
          
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
            ##
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
            # The error stream
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
          
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          1
          
            attr_reader :errs
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
          
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
            ##
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
            # Creates a new StreamUI wrapping +in_stream+ for user input, +out_stream+
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
            # for standard output, +err_stream+ for error output.  If +usetty+ is true
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
            # then special operations (like asking for passwords) will use the TTY
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
            # commands to disable character echo.
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
          
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          1
          
            def initialize(in_stream, out_stream, err_stream=STDERR, usetty=true)
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
              @ins = in_stream
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
              @outs = out_stream
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
              @errs = err_stream
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
              @usetty = usetty
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
            end
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
          
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
            ##
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
            # Returns true if TTY methods should be used on this StreamUI.
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
          
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          1
          
            def tty?
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
              @usetty && @ins.tty?
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
            end
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
          
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
            ##
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
            # Prints a formatted backtrace to the errors stream if backtraces are
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
            # enabled.
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
          
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          1
          
            def backtrace(exception)
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
              return unless Gem.configuration.backtrace
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
          
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
              @errs.puts "\t#{exception.backtrace.join "\n\t"}"
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
            end
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
          
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
            ##
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
            # Choose from a list of options.  +question+ is a prompt displayed above
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
            # the list.  +list+ is a list of option strings.  Returns the pair
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
            # [option_name, option_index].
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
          
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          1
          
            def choose_from_list(question, list)
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
              @outs.puts question
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
          
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
              list.each_with_index do |item, index|
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
                @outs.puts " #{index+1}. #{item}"
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
              end
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
          
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
              @outs.print "> "
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
              @outs.flush
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
          
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
              result = @ins.gets
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
          
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
              return nil, nil unless result
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
          
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
              result = result.strip.to_i - 1
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
              return list[result], result
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
            end
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
          
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
            ##
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
            # Ask a question.  Returns a true for yes, false for no.  If not connected
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
            # to a tty, raises an exception if default is nil, otherwise returns
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
            # default.
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
          
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          1
          
            def ask_yes_no(question, default=nil)
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
              unless tty?
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
                if default.nil?
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
                  raise Gem::OperationNotSupportedError,
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
                        "Not connected to a tty and no default specified"
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
                else
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
                  return default
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
                end
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
              end
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
          
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
              default_answer = case default
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
                               when nil
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
                                 'yn'
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
                               when true
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
                                 'Yn'
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
                               else
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
                                 'yN'
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
                               end
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
          
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
              result = nil
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
          
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
              while result.nil? do
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
                result = case ask "#{question} [#{default_answer}]"
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
                         when /^y/i then true
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
                         when /^n/i then false
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
                         when /^$/  then default
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
                         else            nil
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
                         end
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
              end
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
          
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
              return result
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
            end
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
          
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
            ##
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
            # Ask a question.  Returns an answer if connected to a tty, nil otherwise.
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
          
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          1
          
            def ask(question)
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
              return nil if not tty?
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
          
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
              @outs.print(question + "  ")
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
              @outs.flush
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
          
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
              result = @ins.gets
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
              result.chomp! if result
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
              result
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
            end
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
          
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
            ##
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
            # Ask for a password. Does not echo response to terminal.
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
          
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          1
          
            def ask_for_password(question)
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
              return nil if not tty?
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
          
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
              @outs.print(question, "  ")
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          
          
              @outs.flush
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
          
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
              password = _gets_noecho
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
              @outs.puts
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
              password.chomp! if password
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
              password
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
            end
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
          
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          1
          
            def require_io_console
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
              @require_io_console ||= begin
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
                begin
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
                  require 'io/console'
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
                rescue LoadError
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
                end
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
                true
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
              end
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
            end
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
          
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          1
          
            def _gets_noecho
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
              require_io_console
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
              @ins.noecho {@ins.gets}
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
            end
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
          
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          
          
            ##
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
            # Display a statement.
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
          
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          1
          
            def say(statement="")
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
              @outs.puts statement
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
            end
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
          
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
            ##
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
            # Display an informational alert.  Will ask +question+ if it is not nil.
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
          
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          1
          
            def alert(statement, question=nil)
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
              @outs.puts "INFO:  #{statement}"
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
              ask(question) if question
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
            end
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
          
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
            ##
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
            # Display a warning on stderr.  Will ask +question+ if it is not nil.
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
          
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          1
          
            def alert_warning(statement, question=nil)
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
              @errs.puts "WARNING:  #{statement}"
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
              ask(question) if question
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
            end
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
          
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
            ##
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          
          
            # Display an error message in a location expected to get error messages.
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
            # Will ask +question+ if it is not nil.
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
          
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          1
          
            def alert_error(statement, question=nil)
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
              @errs.puts "ERROR:  #{statement}"
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
              ask(question) if question
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
            end
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
          
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
            ##
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          
          
            # Display a debug message on the same location as error messages.
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
          
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          1
          
            def debug(statement)
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          
          
              @errs.puts statement
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
            end
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          1
          
            deprecate :debug, :none, 2018, 12
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
          
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
            ##
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          
          
            # Terminate the application with exit code +status+, running any exit
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          
          
            # handlers that might have been defined.
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
          
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          1
          
            def terminate_interaction(status = 0)
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
              close
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
              raise Gem::SystemExitException, status
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
            end
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
          
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          1
          
            def close
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
            end
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
          
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
            ##
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
            # Return a progress reporter object chosen from the current verbosity.
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
          
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          1
          
            def progress_reporter(*args)
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
              case Gem.configuration.verbose
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          
          
              when nil, false
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
                SilentProgressReporter.new(@outs, *args)
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          
          
              when true
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
                SimpleProgressReporter.new(@outs, *args)
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
              else
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
                VerboseProgressReporter.new(@outs, *args)
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
              end
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
            end
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          
          
          
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          
          
            ##
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          
          
            # An absolutely silent progress reporter.
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          
          
          
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          1
          
            class SilentProgressReporter
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          
          
          
        
      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          
          
              ##
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          
          
              # The count of items is never updated for the silent progress reporter.
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          
          
          
        
      403. 
      
        
    403. 
          1
          
              attr_reader :count
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          
          
          
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          
          
              ##
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
              # Creates a silent progress reporter that ignores all input arguments.
        
      407. 
      
        
    407. 
          
          
          
        
      408. 
      
        
    408. 
          1
          
              def initialize(out_stream, size, initial_message, terminal_message = nil)
        
      409. 
      
        
    409. 
          
          
              end
        
      410. 
      
        
    410. 
          
          
          
        
      411. 
      
        
    411. 
          
          
              ##
        
      412. 
      
        
    412. 
          
          
              # Does not print +message+ when updated as this object has taken a vow of
        
      413. 
      
        
    413. 
          
          
              # silence.
        
      414. 
      
        
    414. 
          
          
          
        
      415. 
      
        
    415. 
          1
          
              def updated(message)
        
      416. 
      
        
    416. 
          
          
              end
        
      417. 
      
        
    417. 
          
          
          
        
      418. 
      
        
    418. 
          
          
              ##
        
      419. 
      
        
    419. 
          
          
              # Does not print anything when complete as this object has taken a vow of
        
      420. 
      
        
    420. 
          
          
              # silence.
        
      421. 
      
        
    421. 
          
          
          
        
      422. 
      
        
    422. 
          1
          
              def done
        
      423. 
      
        
    423. 
          
          
              end
        
      424. 
      
        
    424. 
          
          
            end
        
      425. 
      
        
    425. 
          
          
          
        
      426. 
      
        
    426. 
          
          
            ##
        
      427. 
      
        
    427. 
          
          
            # A basic dotted progress reporter.
        
      428. 
      
        
    428. 
          
          
          
        
      429. 
      
        
    429. 
          1
          
            class SimpleProgressReporter
        
      430. 
      
        
    430. 
          
          
          
        
      431. 
      
        
    431. 
          1
          
              include Gem::DefaultUserInteraction
        
      432. 
      
        
    432. 
          
          
          
        
      433. 
      
        
    433. 
          
          
              ##
        
      434. 
      
        
    434. 
          
          
              # The number of progress items counted so far.
        
      435. 
      
        
    435. 
          
          
          
        
      436. 
      
        
    436. 
          1
          
              attr_reader :count
        
      437. 
      
        
    437. 
          
          
          
        
      438. 
      
        
    438. 
          
          
              ##
        
      439. 
      
        
    439. 
          
          
              # Creates a new progress reporter that will write to +out_stream+ for
        
      440. 
      
        
    440. 
          
          
              # +size+ items.  Shows the given +initial_message+ when progress starts
        
      441. 
      
        
    441. 
          
          
              # and the +terminal_message+ when it is complete.
        
      442. 
      
        
    442. 
          
          
          
        
      443. 
      
        
    443. 
          1
          
              def initialize(out_stream, size, initial_message,
        
      444. 
      
        
    444. 
          
          
                             terminal_message = "complete")
        
      445. 
      
        
    445. 
          
          
                @out = out_stream
        
      446. 
      
        
    446. 
          
          
                @total = size
        
      447. 
      
        
    447. 
          
          
                @count = 0
        
      448. 
      
        
    448. 
          
          
                @terminal_message = terminal_message
        
      449. 
      
        
    449. 
          
          
          
        
      450. 
      
        
    450. 
          
          
                @out.puts initial_message
        
      451. 
      
        
    451. 
          
          
              end
        
      452. 
      
        
    452. 
          
          
          
        
      453. 
      
        
    453. 
          
          
              ##
        
      454. 
      
        
    454. 
          
          
              # Prints out a dot and ignores +message+.
        
      455. 
      
        
    455. 
          
          
          
        
      456. 
      
        
    456. 
          1
          
              def updated(message)
        
      457. 
      
        
    457. 
          
          
                @count += 1
        
      458. 
      
        
    458. 
          
          
                @out.print "."
        
      459. 
      
        
    459. 
          
          
                @out.flush
        
      460. 
      
        
    460. 
          
          
              end
        
      461. 
      
        
    461. 
          
          
          
        
      462. 
      
        
    462. 
          
          
              ##
        
      463. 
      
        
    463. 
          
          
              # Prints out the terminal message.
        
      464. 
      
        
    464. 
          
          
          
        
      465. 
      
        
    465. 
          1
          
              def done
        
      466. 
      
        
    466. 
          
          
                @out.puts "\n#{@terminal_message}"
        
      467. 
      
        
    467. 
          
          
              end
        
      468. 
      
        
    468. 
          
          
          
        
      469. 
      
        
    469. 
          
          
            end
        
      470. 
      
        
    470. 
          
          
          
        
      471. 
      
        
    471. 
          
          
            ##
        
      472. 
      
        
    472. 
          
          
            # A progress reporter that prints out messages about the current progress.
        
      473. 
      
        
    473. 
          
          
          
        
      474. 
      
        
    474. 
          1
          
            class VerboseProgressReporter
        
      475. 
      
        
    475. 
          
          
          
        
      476. 
      
        
    476. 
          1
          
              include Gem::DefaultUserInteraction
        
      477. 
      
        
    477. 
          
          
          
        
      478. 
      
        
    478. 
          
          
              ##
        
      479. 
      
        
    479. 
          
          
              # The number of progress items counted so far.
        
      480. 
      
        
    480. 
          
          
          
        
      481. 
      
        
    481. 
          1
          
              attr_reader :count
        
      482. 
      
        
    482. 
          
          
          
        
      483. 
      
        
    483. 
          
          
              ##
        
      484. 
      
        
    484. 
          
          
              # Creates a new progress reporter that will write to +out_stream+ for
        
      485. 
      
        
    485. 
          
          
              # +size+ items.  Shows the given +initial_message+ when progress starts
        
      486. 
      
        
    486. 
          
          
              # and the +terminal_message+ when it is complete.
        
      487. 
      
        
    487. 
          
          
          
        
      488. 
      
        
    488. 
          1
          
              def initialize(out_stream, size, initial_message,
        
      489. 
      
        
    489. 
          
          
                             terminal_message = 'complete')
        
      490. 
      
        
    490. 
          
          
                @out = out_stream
        
      491. 
      
        
    491. 
          
          
                @total = size
        
      492. 
      
        
    492. 
          
          
                @count = 0
        
      493. 
      
        
    493. 
          
          
                @terminal_message = terminal_message
        
      494. 
      
        
    494. 
          
          
          
        
      495. 
      
        
    495. 
          
          
                @out.puts initial_message
        
      496. 
      
        
    496. 
          
          
              end
        
      497. 
      
        
    497. 
          
          
          
        
      498. 
      
        
    498. 
          
          
              ##
        
      499. 
      
        
    499. 
          
          
              # Prints out the position relative to the total and the +message+.
        
      500. 
      
        
    500. 
          
          
          
        
      501. 
      
        
    501. 
          1
          
              def updated(message)
        
      502. 
      
        
    502. 
          
          
                @count += 1
        
      503. 
      
        
    503. 
          
          
                @out.puts "#{@count}/#{@total}: #{message}"
        
      504. 
      
        
    504. 
          
          
              end
        
      505. 
      
        
    505. 
          
          
          
        
      506. 
      
        
    506. 
          
          
              ##
        
      507. 
      
        
    507. 
          
          
              # Prints out the terminal message.
        
      508. 
      
        
    508. 
          
          
          
        
      509. 
      
        
    509. 
          1
          
              def done
        
      510. 
      
        
    510. 
          
          
                @out.puts @terminal_message
        
      511. 
      
        
    511. 
          
          
              end
        
      512. 
      
        
    512. 
          
          
            end
        
      513. 
      
        
    513. 
          
          
          
        
      514. 
      
        
    514. 
          
          
            ##
        
      515. 
      
        
    515. 
          
          
            # Return a download reporter object chosen from the current verbosity
        
      516. 
      
        
    516. 
          
          
          
        
      517. 
      
        
    517. 
          1
          
            def download_reporter(*args)
        
      518. 
      
        
    518. 
          
          
              if [nil, false].include?(Gem.configuration.verbose) || !@outs.tty?
        
      519. 
      
        
    519. 
          
          
                SilentDownloadReporter.new(@outs, *args)
        
      520. 
      
        
    520. 
          
          
              else
        
      521. 
      
        
    521. 
          
          
                ThreadedDownloadReporter.new(@outs, *args)
        
      522. 
      
        
    522. 
          
          
              end
        
      523. 
      
        
    523. 
          
          
            end
        
      524. 
      
        
    524. 
          
          
          
        
      525. 
      
        
    525. 
          
          
            ##
        
      526. 
      
        
    526. 
          
          
            # An absolutely silent download reporter.
        
      527. 
      
        
    527. 
          
          
          
        
      528. 
      
        
    528. 
          1
          
            class SilentDownloadReporter
        
      529. 
      
        
    529. 
          
          
          
        
      530. 
      
        
    530. 
          
          
              ##
        
      531. 
      
        
    531. 
          
          
              # The silent download reporter ignores all arguments
        
      532. 
      
        
    532. 
          
          
          
        
      533. 
      
        
    533. 
          1
          
              def initialize(out_stream, *args)
        
      534. 
      
        
    534. 
          
          
              end
        
      535. 
      
        
    535.

            # A progress reporter that behaves nicely with threaded downloading.

            class ThreadedDownloadReporter

          1
          
              MUTEX = Mutex.new
        
      563. 
      
        
    563. 
          
          
          
        
      564.

              ##
        
      565. 
      
        
    565. 
          
          
              # The current file name being displayed
        
      566.

          1
          
              attr_reader :file_name

    569.

      570. 
      
        
    570. 
          
          
              # Creates a new threaded download reporter that will display on
        
      571. 
      
        
    571. 
          
          
              # +out_stream+.  The other arguments are ignored.
        
      572. 
      
        
    572. 
          
          
          
        
      573.

          1
          
              def initialize(out_stream, *args)

    574. 
          
          
                @file_name = nil
        
      575. 
      
        
    575. 
          
          
                @out = out_stream
        
      576. 
      
        
    576. 
          
          
              end
        
      577. 
      
        
    577. 
          
          
          
        
      578. 
      
        
    578. 
          
          
              ##
        
      579. 
      
        
    579. 
          
          
              # Tells the download reporter that the +file_name+ is being fetched.
        
      580. 
      
        
    580. 
          
          
              # The other arguments are ignored.
        
      581. 
      
        
    581. 
          
          
          
        
      582. 
      
        
    582. 
          1
          
              def fetch(file_name, *args)
        
      583. 
      
        
    583. 
          
          
                if @file_name.nil?
        
      584. 
      
        
    584. 
          
          
                  @file_name = file_name
        
      585. 
      
        
    585. 
          
          
                  locked_puts "Fetching #{@file_name}"
        
      586. 
      
        
    586. 
          
          
                end
        
      587. 
      
        
    587. 
          
          
              end
        
      588. 
      
        
    588. 
          
          
          
        
      589. 
      
        
    589.

      592.

              def update(bytes)
        
      593.

      594. 
      
        
    594. 
          
          
              end
        
      595. 
      
        
    595.

              def done
        
      600.

                # Do nothing.

              private
        
      604.

              def locked_puts(message)
        
      605. 
      
        
    605. 
          
          
                MUTEX.synchronize do
        
      606. 
      
        
    606. 
          
          
                  @out.puts message
        
      607. 
      
        
    607. 
          
          
                end
        
      608. 
      
        
    608. 
          
          
              end
        
      609. 
      
        
    609. 
          
          
            end
        
      610. 
      
        
    610. 
          
          
          end

          1
          
          class Gem::SilentUI < Gem::StreamUI

    631. 
          
          
          
        
      632. 
      
        
    632. 
          
          
            ##

      634.

          1
          
            def initialize
        
      636. 
      
        
    636. 
          
          
              reader, writer = nil, nil
        
      637. 
      
        
    637. 
          
          
          
        
      638. 
      
        
    638. 
          
          
              reader = File.open(IO::NULL, 'r')
        
      639. 
      
        
    639. 
          
          
              writer = File.open(IO::NULL, 'w')
        
      640. 
      
        
    640. 
          
          
          
        
      641. 
      
        
    641. 
          
          
              super reader, writer, writer, false
        
      642. 
      
        
    642. 
          
          
            end
        
      643. 
      
        
    643. 
          
          
          
        
      644. 
      
        
    644. 
          1
          
            def close
        
      645. 
      
        
    645. 
          
          
              super
        
      646. 
      
        
    646. 
          
          
              @ins.close
        
      647. 
      
        
    647. 
          
          
              @outs.close
        
      648. 
      
        
    648. 
          
          
            end
        
      649. 
      
        
    649. 
          
          
          
        
      650. 
      
        
    650. 
          1
          
            def download_reporter(*args) # :nodoc:
        
      651. 
      
        
    651. 
          
          
              SilentDownloadReporter.new(@outs, *args)
        
      652. 
      
        
    652. 
          
          
            end
        
      653. 
      
        
    653. 
          
          
          
        
      654. 
      
        
    654. 
          1

      655. 
      
        
    655. 
          
          
              SilentProgressReporter.new(@outs, *args)
        
      656. 
      
        
    656. 
          
          
            end
        
      657. 
      
        
    657. 
          
          
          end
        
      658.

    /usr/lib/ruby/2.6.0/securerandom.rb

    21.35 % covered

    89 relevant lines. 19 lines covered and 70 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          
          
          # -*- coding: us-ascii -*-
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          # frozen_string_literal: true
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
          
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
          # == Secure random number generator interface.
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          #
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
          # This library is an interface to secure random number generators which are
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          # suitable for generating session keys in HTTP cookies, etc.
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
          #
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
          # You can use this library in your application by requiring it:
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
          #
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
          #   require 'securerandom'
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          #
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
          # It supports the following secure random number generators:
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
          #
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
          # * openssl
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
          # * /dev/urandom
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          # * Win32
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
          #
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
          # === Examples
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
          #
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
          # Generate random hexadecimal strings:
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
          #
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
          #   require 'securerandom'
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
          #
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
          #   SecureRandom.hex(10) #=> "52750b30ffbc7de3b362"
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
          #   SecureRandom.hex(10) #=> "92b15d6c8dc4beb5f559"
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
          #   SecureRandom.hex(13) #=> "39b290146bea6ce975c37cfc23"
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
          #
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
          # Generate random base64 strings:
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
          #
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
          #   SecureRandom.base64(10) #=> "EcmTPZwWRAozdA=="
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
          #   SecureRandom.base64(10) #=> "KO1nIU+p9DKxGg=="
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
          #   SecureRandom.base64(12) #=> "7kJSM/MzBJI+75j8"
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
          #
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
          # Generate random binary strings:
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
          #
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
          #   SecureRandom.random_bytes(10) #=> "\016\t{\370g\310pbr\301"
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
          #   SecureRandom.random_bytes(10) #=> "\323U\030TO\234\357\020\a\337"
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
          #
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
          # Generate alphanumeric strings:
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
          #
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
          #   SecureRandom.alphanumeric(10) #=> "S8baxMJnPl"
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
          #   SecureRandom.alphanumeric(10) #=> "aOxAg8BAJe"
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
          #
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
          # Generate UUIDs:
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
          #
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
          #   SecureRandom.uuid #=> "2d931510-d99f-494a-8c67-87feb05e1594"
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
          #   SecureRandom.uuid #=> "bad85eb9-0713-4da7-8d36-07a8e4b00eab"
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
          #
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
          
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          1
          
          module SecureRandom
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          1
          
            @rng_chooser = Mutex.new # :nodoc:
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
          
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          1
          
            class << self
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          1
          
              def bytes(n)
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
                return gen_random(n)
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
              end
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
          
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          1
          
              def gen_random(n)
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                ret = Random.urandom(1)
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                if ret.nil?
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                  begin
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                    require 'openssl'
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                  rescue NoMethodError
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                    raise NotImplementedError, "No random device"
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                  else
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                    @rng_chooser.synchronize do
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                      class << self
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                        remove_method :gen_random
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                        alias gen_random gen_random_openssl
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                        public :gen_random
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                      end
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                    end
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                    return gen_random(n)
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                  end
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                else
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                  @rng_chooser.synchronize do
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                    class << self
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                      remove_method :gen_random
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                      alias gen_random gen_random_urandom
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                      public :gen_random
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                    end
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                  end
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                  return gen_random(n)
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                end
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
              end
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
          
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          1
          
              private
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
          
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          1
          
              def gen_random_openssl(n)
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                @pid = 0 unless defined?(@pid)
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                pid = $$
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                unless @pid == pid
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
                  now = Process.clock_gettime(Process::CLOCK_REALTIME, :nanosecond)
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                  OpenSSL::Random.random_add([now, @pid, pid].join(""), 0.0)
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                  seed = Random.urandom(16)
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                  if (seed)
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                    OpenSSL::Random.random_add(seed, 16)
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                  end
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                  @pid = pid
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
                end
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
                return OpenSSL::Random.random_bytes(n)
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
              end
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
          
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          1
          
              def gen_random_urandom(n)
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                ret = Random.urandom(n)
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
                unless ret
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                  raise NotImplementedError, "No random device"
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                end
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                unless ret.length == n
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                  raise NotImplementedError, "Unexpected partial read from random device: only #{ret.length} for #{n} bytes"
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                end
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                ret
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
              end
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
            end
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
          end
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
          
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          1
          
          module Random::Formatter
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
          
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
            # SecureRandom.random_bytes generates a random binary string.
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
            #
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
            # The argument _n_ specifies the length of the result string.
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
            #
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
            # If _n_ is not specified or is nil, 16 is assumed.
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
            # It may be larger in future.
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
            #
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
            # The result may contain any byte: "\x00" - "\xff".
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
            #
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
            #   require 'securerandom'
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
            #
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
            #   SecureRandom.random_bytes #=> "\xD8\\\xE0\xF4\r\xB2\xFC*WM\xFF\x83\x18\xF45\xB6"
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
            #   SecureRandom.random_bytes #=> "m\xDC\xFC/\a\x00Uf\xB2\xB2P\xBD\xFF6S\x97"
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
            #
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
            # If a secure random number generator is not available,
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
            # +NotImplementedError+ is raised.
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          1
          
            def random_bytes(n=nil)
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
              n = n ? n.to_int : 16
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
              gen_random(n)
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
            end
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
          
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
            # SecureRandom.hex generates a random hexadecimal string.
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
            #
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
            # The argument _n_ specifies the length, in bytes, of the random number to be generated.
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
            # The length of the resulting hexadecimal string is twice of _n_.
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
            #
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
            # If _n_ is not specified or is nil, 16 is assumed.
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
            # It may be larger in the future.
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
            #
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
            # The result may contain 0-9 and a-f.
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
            #
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
            #   require 'securerandom'
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
            #
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
            #   SecureRandom.hex #=> "eb693ec8252cd630102fd0d0fb7c3485"
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
            #   SecureRandom.hex #=> "91dc3bfb4de5b11d029d376634589b61"
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
            #
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
            # If a secure random number generator is not available,
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
            # +NotImplementedError+ is raised.
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          1
          
            def hex(n=nil)
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
              random_bytes(n).unpack("H*")[0]
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
            end
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
          
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
            # SecureRandom.base64 generates a random base64 string.
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
            #
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
            # The argument _n_ specifies the length, in bytes, of the random number
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
            # to be generated. The length of the result string is about 4/3 of _n_.
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
            #
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
            # If _n_ is not specified or is nil, 16 is assumed.
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
            # It may be larger in the future.
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
            #
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
            # The result may contain A-Z, a-z, 0-9, "+", "/" and "=".
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
            #
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
            #   require 'securerandom'
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
            #
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
            #   SecureRandom.base64 #=> "/2BuBuLf3+WfSKyQbRcc/A=="
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
            #   SecureRandom.base64 #=> "6BbW0pxO0YENxn38HMUbcQ=="
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
            #
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
            # If a secure random number generator is not available,
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
            # +NotImplementedError+ is raised.
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
            #
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
            # See RFC 3548 for the definition of base64.
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          1
          
            def base64(n=nil)
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
              [random_bytes(n)].pack("m0")
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
            end
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
          
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
            # SecureRandom.urlsafe_base64 generates a random URL-safe base64 string.
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
            #
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
            # The argument _n_ specifies the length, in bytes, of the random number
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
            # to be generated. The length of the result string is about 4/3 of _n_.
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
            #
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
            # If _n_ is not specified or is nil, 16 is assumed.
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
            # It may be larger in the future.
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
            #
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
            # The boolean argument _padding_ specifies the padding.
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
            # If it is false or nil, padding is not generated.
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
            # Otherwise padding is generated.
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
            # By default, padding is not generated because "=" may be used as a URL delimiter.
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
            #
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
            # The result may contain A-Z, a-z, 0-9, "-" and "_".
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
            # "=" is also used if _padding_ is true.
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
            #
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
            #   require 'securerandom'
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
            #
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
            #   SecureRandom.urlsafe_base64 #=> "b4GOKm4pOYU_-BOXcrUGDg"
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
            #   SecureRandom.urlsafe_base64 #=> "UZLdOkzop70Ddx-IJR0ABg"
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
            #
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
            #   SecureRandom.urlsafe_base64(nil, true) #=> "i0XQ-7gglIsHGV2_BNPrdQ=="
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
            #   SecureRandom.urlsafe_base64(nil, true) #=> "-M8rLhr7JEpJlqFGUMmOxg=="
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
            #
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
            # If a secure random number generator is not available,
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
            # +NotImplementedError+ is raised.
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
            #
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
            # See RFC 3548 for the definition of URL-safe base64.
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          1
          
            def urlsafe_base64(n=nil, padding=false)
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
              s = [random_bytes(n)].pack("m0")
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
              s.tr!("+/", "-_")
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
              s.delete!("=") unless padding
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
              s
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
            end
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
          
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
            # SecureRandom.uuid generates a random v4 UUID (Universally Unique IDentifier).
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
            #
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
            #   require 'securerandom'
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
            #
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
            #   SecureRandom.uuid #=> "2d931510-d99f-494a-8c67-87feb05e1594"
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
            #   SecureRandom.uuid #=> "bad85eb9-0713-4da7-8d36-07a8e4b00eab"
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
            #   SecureRandom.uuid #=> "62936e70-1815-439b-bf89-8492855a7e6b"
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
            #
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
            # The version 4 UUID is purely random (except the version).
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
            # It doesn't contain meaningful information such as MAC addresses, timestamps, etc.
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
            #
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
            # The result contains 122 random bits (15.25 random bytes).
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
            #
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
            # See RFC 4122 for details of UUID.
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
            #
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          1
          
            def uuid
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
              ary = random_bytes(16).unpack("NnnnnN")
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
              ary[2] = (ary[2] & 0x0fff) | 0x4000
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
              ary[3] = (ary[3] & 0x3fff) | 0x8000
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
              "%08x-%04x-%04x-%04x-%04x%08x" % ary
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
            end
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
          
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          1
          
            private def gen_random(n)
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
              self.bytes(n)
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
            end
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
          
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
            # SecureRandom.choose generates a string that randomly draws from a
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
            # source array of characters.
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
            #
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
            # The argument _source_ specifies the array of characters from which
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
            # to generate the string.
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
            # The argument _n_ specifies the length, in characters, of the string to be
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
            # generated.
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
            #
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
            # The result may contain whatever characters are in the source array.
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
            #
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
            #   require 'securerandom'
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
            #
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
            #   SecureRandom.choose([*'l'..'r'], 16) #=> "lmrqpoonmmlqlron"
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          
          
            #   SecureRandom.choose([*'0'..'9'], 5)  #=> "27309"
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
            #
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
            # If a secure random number generator is not available,
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
            # +NotImplementedError+ is raised.
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          1
          
            private def choose(source, n)
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
              size = source.size
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
              m = 1
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
              limit = size
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
              while limit * size <= 0x100000000
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
                limit *= size
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
                m += 1
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          
          
              end
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
              result = ''.dup
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
              while m <= n
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
                rs = random_number(limit)
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
                is = rs.digits(size)
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
                (m-is.length).times { is << 0 }
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
                result << source.values_at(*is).join('')
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
                n -= m
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
              end
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
              if 0 < n
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
                rs = random_number(limit)
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          
          
                is = rs.digits(size)
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
                if is.length < n
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
                  (n-is.length).times { is << 0 }
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
                else
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
                  is.pop while n < is.length
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
                end
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
                result.concat source.values_at(*is).join('')
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
              end
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
              result
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
            end
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
          
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          1
          
            ALPHANUMERIC = [*'A'..'Z', *'a'..'z', *'0'..'9']
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
            # SecureRandom.alphanumeric generates a random alphanumeric string.
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
            #
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
            # The argument _n_ specifies the length, in characters, of the alphanumeric
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
            # string to be generated.
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
            #
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
            # If _n_ is not specified or is nil, 16 is assumed.
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
            # It may be larger in the future.
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
            #
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
            # The result may contain A-Z, a-z and 0-9.
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
            #
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
            #   require 'securerandom'
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
            #
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
            #   SecureRandom.alphanumeric     #=> "2BuBuLf3WfSKyQbR"
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          
          
            #   SecureRandom.alphanumeric(10) #=> "i6K93NdqiH"
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
            #
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
            # If a secure random number generator is not available,
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
            # +NotImplementedError+ is raised.
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          1
          
            def alphanumeric(n=nil)
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
              n = 16 if n.nil?
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
              choose(ALPHANUMERIC, n)
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
            end
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
          end
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
          
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          1
          
          SecureRandom.extend(Random::Formatter)
        
      317.

    /usr/lib/ruby/2.6.0/socket.rb

    19.34 % covered

    305 relevant lines. 59 lines covered and 246 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          
          
          # frozen_string_literal: true
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          1
          
          require 'socket.so'
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          1
          
          require 'io/wait'
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          1
          
          class Addrinfo
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
            # creates an Addrinfo object from the arguments.
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
            #
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
            # The arguments are interpreted as similar to self.
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
            #
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
            #   Addrinfo.tcp("0.0.0.0", 4649).family_addrinfo("www.ruby-lang.org", 80)
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
            #   #=> #<Addrinfo: 221.186.184.68:80 TCP (www.ruby-lang.org:80)>
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
            #
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
            #   Addrinfo.unix("/tmp/sock").family_addrinfo("/tmp/sock2")
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
            #   #=> #<Addrinfo: /tmp/sock2 SOCK_STREAM>
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
            #
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          1
          
            def family_addrinfo(*args)
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
              if args.empty?
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                raise ArgumentError, "no address specified"
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
              elsif Addrinfo === args.first
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
                raise ArgumentError, "too many arguments" if args.length != 1
        
      22. 
      
        
    22.
