          module Minitest
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
            ##
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
            # Minitest Assertions.  All assertion methods accept a +msg+ which is
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
            # printed if the assertion fails.
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
            #
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
            # Protocol: Nearly everything here boils up to +assert+, which
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
            # expects to be able to increment an instance accessor named
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
            # +assertions+. This is not provided by Assertions and must be
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
            # provided by the thing including Assertions. See Minitest::Runnable
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
            # for an example.
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          1
          
            module Assertions
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          1
          
              UNDEFINED = Object.new # :nodoc:
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
          
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          1
          
              def UNDEFINED.inspect # :nodoc:
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
                "UNDEFINED" # again with the rdoc bugs... :(
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
              end
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
          
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
              ##
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
              # Returns the diff command to use in #diff. Tries to intelligently
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
              # figure out what diff to use.
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
          
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          1
          
              def self.diff
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
                return @diff if defined? @diff
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
          
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                @diff = if (RbConfig::CONFIG["host_os"] =~ /mswin|mingw/ &&
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                            system("diff.exe", __FILE__, __FILE__)) then
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                          "diff.exe -u"
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                        elsif system("gdiff", __FILE__, __FILE__)
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                          "gdiff -u" # solaris and kin suck
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                        elsif system("diff", __FILE__, __FILE__)
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                          "diff -u"
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
                        else
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                          nil
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                        end
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
              end
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
          
        
      44.

              ##
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
              # Set the diff command to use in #diff.
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
          
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          1
          
              def self.diff= o
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                @diff = o
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
              end
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
          
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
              ##
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
              # Returns a diff between +exp+ and +act+. If there is no known
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
              # diff command or if it doesn't make sense to diff the output
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
              # (single line, short output), then it simply returns a basic
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
              # comparison between the two.
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
              #
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
              # See +things_to_diff+ for more info.
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
          
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          1
          
              def diff exp, act
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
                result = nil
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
          
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                expect, butwas = things_to_diff(exp, act)
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
          
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                return "Expected: #{mu_pp exp}\n  Actual: #{mu_pp act}" unless
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                  expect
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
          
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                Tempfile.open("expect") do |a|
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                  a.puts expect
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                  a.flush
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
          
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
                  Tempfile.open("butwas") do |b|
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                    b.puts butwas
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                    b.flush
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
          
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                    result = `#{Minitest::Assertions.diff} #{a.path} #{b.path}`
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                    result.sub!(/^\-\-\- .+/, "--- expected")
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                    result.sub!(/^\+\+\+ .+/, "+++ actual")
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
          
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                    if result.empty? then
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                      klass = exp.class
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                      result = [
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                                "No visible difference in the #{klass}#inspect output.\n",
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                                "You should look at the implementation of #== on ",
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                                "#{klass} or its members.\n",
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                                expect,
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                               ].join
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                    end
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                  end
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                end
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
          
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                result
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
              end
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
          
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
              ##
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
              # Returns things to diff [expect, butwas], or [nil, nil] if nothing to diff.
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
              #
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
              # Criterion:
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
              #
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
              # 1. Strings include newlines or escaped newlines, but not both.
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
              # 2. or:  String lengths are > 30 characters.
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
              # 3. or:  Strings are equal to each other (but maybe different encodings?).
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
              # 4. and: we found a diff executable.
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
          
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          1
          
              def things_to_diff exp, act
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
                expect = mu_pp_for_diff exp
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
                butwas = mu_pp_for_diff act
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
          
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
                e1, e2 = expect.include?("\n"), expect.include?("\\n")
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                b1, b2 = butwas.include?("\n"), butwas.include?("\\n")
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
          
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                need_to_diff =
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                  (e1 ^ e2                  ||
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                   b1 ^ b2                  ||
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                   expect.size > 30         ||
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                   butwas.size > 30         ||
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                   expect == butwas)        &&
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                  Minitest::Assertions.diff
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
          
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                need_to_diff && [expect, butwas]
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
              end
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
          
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
              ##
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
              # This returns a human-readable version of +obj+. By default
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
              # #inspect is called. You can override this to use #pretty_inspect
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
              # if you want.
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
              #
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
              # See Minitest::Test.make_my_diffs_pretty!
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
          
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          1
          
              def mu_pp obj
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                s = obj.inspect
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
          
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                if defined? Encoding then
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                  s = s.encode Encoding.default_external
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
          
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
                  if String === obj && (obj.encoding != Encoding.default_external ||
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                                        !obj.valid_encoding?) then
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                    enc = "# encoding: #{obj.encoding}"
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                    val = "#    valid: #{obj.valid_encoding?}"
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                    s = "#{enc}\n#{val}\n#{s}"
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                  end
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                end
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
          
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                s
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
              end
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
          
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
              ##
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
              # This returns a diff-able more human-readable version of +obj+.
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
              # This differs from the regular mu_pp because it expands escaped
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
              # newlines and makes hex-values (like object_ids) generic. This
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
              # uses mu_pp to do the first pass and then cleans it up.
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
          
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          1
          
              def mu_pp_for_diff obj
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
                str = mu_pp obj
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
          
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                # both '\n' & '\\n' (_after_ mu_pp (aka inspect))
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                single = !!str.match(/(?<!\\|^)\\n/)
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                double = !!str.match(/(?<=\\|^)\\n/)
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
          
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                process =
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                  if single ^ double then
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                    if single then
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                      lambda { |s| s == "\\n"   ? "\n"    : s } # unescape
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
                    else
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                      lambda { |s| s == "\\\\n" ? "\\n\n" : s } # unescape a bit, add nls
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                    end
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                  else
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                    :itself                                     # leave it alone
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                  end
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
          
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
                str.
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
                  gsub(/\\?\\n/, &process).
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                  gsub(/:0x[a-fA-F0-9]{4,}/m, ":0xXXXXXX") # anonymize hex values
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
              end
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
          
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
              ##
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
              # Fails unless +test+ is truthy.
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
          
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          1
          
              def assert test, msg = nil
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          43
          
                self.assertions += 1
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          43
          
                unless test then
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
                  msg ||= "Expected #{mu_pp test} to be truthy."
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
                  msg = msg.call if Proc === msg
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
                  raise Minitest::Assertion, msg
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          
          
                end
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          43
          
                true
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
              end
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
          
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          1
          
              def _synchronize # :nodoc:
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
                yield
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
              end
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
          
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
              ##
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
              # Fails unless +obj+ is empty.
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
          
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          1
          
              def assert_empty obj, msg = nil
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) { "Expected #{mu_pp(obj)} to be empty" }
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
                assert_respond_to obj, :empty?
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
                assert obj.empty?, msg
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
              end
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
          
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          1
          
              E = "" # :nodoc:
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
          
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
              ##
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
              # Fails unless <tt>exp == act</tt> printing the difference between
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
              # the two, if possible.
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
              #
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
              # If there is no visible difference but the assertion fails, you
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
              # should suspect that your #== is buggy, or your inspect output is
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
              # missing crucial details.  For nicer structural diffing, set
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
              # Minitest::Test.make_my_diffs_pretty!
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
              #
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
              # For floats use assert_in_delta.
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
              #
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
              # See also: Minitest::Assertions.diff
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
          
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          1
          
              def assert_equal exp, act, msg = nil
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          1
          
                msg = message(msg, E) { diff exp, act }
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          1
          
                result = assert exp == act, msg
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
          
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          1
          
                if nil == exp then
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
                  if Minitest::VERSION =~ /^6/ then
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
                    refute_nil exp, "Use assert_nil if expecting nil."
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
                  else
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
                    where = Minitest.filter_backtrace(caller).first
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
                    where = where.split(/:in /, 2).first # clean up noise
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
          
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
                    warn "DEPRECATED: Use assert_nil if expecting nil from #{where}. This will fail in Minitest 6."
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                  end
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
                end
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
          
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          1
          
                result
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
              end
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
          
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
              ##
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
              # For comparing Floats.  Fails unless +exp+ and +act+ are within +delta+
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
              # of each other.
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
              #
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
              #   assert_in_delta Math::PI, (22.0 / 7.0), 0.01
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
          
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          1
          
              def assert_in_delta exp, act, delta = 0.001, msg = nil
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
                n = (exp - act).abs
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) {
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
                  "Expected |#{exp} - #{act}| (#{n}) to be <= #{delta}"
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
                }
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
                assert delta >= n, msg
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
              end
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
          
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
              ##
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
              # For comparing Floats.  Fails unless +exp+ and +act+ have a relative
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
              # error less than +epsilon+.
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
          
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          1
          
              def assert_in_epsilon exp, act, epsilon = 0.001, msg = nil
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
                assert_in_delta exp, act, [exp.abs, act.abs].min * epsilon, msg
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
              end
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
          
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
              ##
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
              # Fails unless +collection+ includes +obj+.
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
          
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          1
          
              def assert_includes collection, obj, msg = nil
        
      260. 
      
        
    260. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) {
        
      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
                  "Expected #{mu_pp(collection)} to include #{mu_pp(obj)}"
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
                }
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          
          
                assert_respond_to collection, :include?
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
                assert collection.include?(obj), msg
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
              end
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
          
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
              ##
        
      268. 
      
        
    268. 
          
          
              # Fails unless +obj+ is an instance of +cls+.
        
      269. 
      
        
    269. 
          
          
          
        
      270. 
      
        
    270. 
          1
          
              def assert_instance_of cls, obj, msg = nil
        
      271. 
      
        
    271. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) {
        
      272. 
      
        
    272. 
          
          
                  "Expected #{mu_pp(obj)} to be an instance of #{cls}, not #{obj.class}"
        
      273. 
      
        
    273. 
          
          
                }
        
      274. 
      
        
    274. 
          
          
          
        
      275. 
      
        
    275. 
          
          
                assert obj.instance_of?(cls), msg
        
      276. 
      
        
    276. 
          
          
              end
        
      277. 
      
        
    277. 
          
          
          
        
      278. 
      
        
    278. 
          
          
              ##
        
      279. 
      
        
    279. 
          
          
              # Fails unless +obj+ is a kind of +cls+.
        
      280. 
      
        
    280. 
          
          
          
        
      281. 
      
        
    281. 
          1
          
              def assert_kind_of cls, obj, msg = nil
        
      282. 
      
        
    282. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) {
        
      283. 
      
        
    283. 
          
          
                  "Expected #{mu_pp(obj)} to be a kind of #{cls}, not #{obj.class}" }
        
      284. 
      
        
    284. 
          
          
          
        
      285. 
      
        
    285. 
          
          
                assert obj.kind_of?(cls), msg
        
      286. 
      
        
    286. 
          
          
              end
        
      287. 
      
        
    287. 
          
          
          
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
              ##
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
              # Fails unless +matcher+ <tt>=~</tt> +obj+.
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          
          
          
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          1
          
              def assert_match matcher, obj, msg = nil
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) { "Expected #{mu_pp matcher} to match #{mu_pp obj}" }
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
                assert_respond_to matcher, :"=~"
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
                matcher = Regexp.new Regexp.escape matcher if String === matcher
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
                assert matcher =~ obj, msg
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
              end
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
          
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
              ##
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
              # Fails unless +obj+ is nil
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
          
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          1
          
              def assert_nil obj, msg = nil
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) { "Expected #{mu_pp(obj)} to be nil" }
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
                assert obj.nil?, msg
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
              end
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
          
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          
          
              ##
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
              # For testing with binary operators. Eg:
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
              #
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
              #   assert_operator 5, :<=, 4
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
          
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          1
          
              def assert_operator o1, op, o2 = UNDEFINED, msg = nil
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
                return assert_predicate o1, op, msg if UNDEFINED == o2
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) { "Expected #{mu_pp(o1)} to be #{op} #{mu_pp(o2)}" }
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
                assert o1.__send__(op, o2), msg
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          
          
              end
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
          
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
              ##
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
              # Fails if stdout or stderr do not output the expected results.
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          
          
              # Pass in nil if you don't care about that streams output. Pass in
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          
          
              # "" if you require it to be silent. Pass in a regexp if you want
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
              # to pattern match.
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          
          
              #
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
              #   assert_output(/hey/) { method_with_output }
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
              #
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
              # NOTE: this uses #capture_io, not #capture_subprocess_io.
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
              #
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
              # See also: #assert_silent
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          
          
          
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          1
          
              def assert_output stdout = nil, stderr = nil
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
                flunk "assert_output requires a block to capture output." unless
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
                  block_given?
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
          
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          
          
                out, err = capture_io do
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
                  yield
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          
          
                end
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
          
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
                err_msg = Regexp === stderr ? :assert_match : :assert_equal if stderr
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          
          
                out_msg = Regexp === stdout ? :assert_match : :assert_equal if stdout
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
          
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          
          
                y = send err_msg, stderr, err, "In stderr" if err_msg
        
      341. 
      
        
    341. 
          
          
                x = send out_msg, stdout, out, "In stdout" if out_msg
        
      342. 
      
        
    342. 
          
          
          
        
      343. 
      
        
    343. 
          
          
                (!stdout || x) && (!stderr || y)
        
      344. 
      
        
    344. 
          
          
              rescue Assertion
        
      345. 
      
        
    345. 
          
          
                raise
        
      346. 
      
        
    346. 
          
          
              rescue => e
        
      347. 
      
        
    347. 
          
          
                raise UnexpectedError, e
        
      348. 
      
        
    348. 
          
          
              end
        
      349. 
      
        
    349. 
          
          
          
        
      350. 
      
        
    350. 
          
          
              ##
        
      351. 
      
        
    351. 
          
          
              # Fails unless +path+ exists.
        
      352. 
      
        
    352. 
          
          
          
        
      353. 
      
        
    353. 
          1
          
              def assert_path_exists path, msg = nil
        
      354. 
      
        
    354. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) { "Expected path '#{path}' to exist" }
        
      355. 
      
        
    355. 
          
          
                assert File.exist?(path), msg
        
      356. 
      
        
    356. 
          
          
              end
        
      357. 
      
        
    357. 
          
          
          
        
      358. 
      
        
    358. 
          
          
              ##
        
      359. 
      
        
    359. 
          
          
              # For testing with predicates. Eg:
        
      360. 
      
        
    360. 
          
          
              #
        
      361. 
      
        
    361. 
          
          
              #   assert_predicate str, :empty?
        
      362. 
      
        
    362. 
          
          
              #
        
      363. 
      
        
    363. 
          
          
              # This is really meant for specs and is front-ended by assert_operator:
        
      364. 
      
        
    364. 
          
          
              #
        
      365. 
      
        
    365. 
          
          
              #   str.must_be :empty?
        
      366. 
      
        
    366. 
          
          
          
        
      367. 
      
        
    367. 
          1
          
              def assert_predicate o1, op, msg = nil
        
      368. 
      
        
    368. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) { "Expected #{mu_pp(o1)} to be #{op}" }
        
      369. 
      
        
    369. 
          
          
                assert o1.__send__(op), msg
        
      370. 
      
        
    370. 
          
          
              end
        
      371. 
      
        
    371. 
          
          
          
        
      372. 
      
        
    372. 
          
          
              ##
        
      373. 
      
        
    373. 
          
          
              # Fails unless the block raises one of +exp+. Returns the
        
      374. 
      
        
    374. 
          
          
              # exception matched so you can check the message, attributes, etc.
        
      375. 
      
        
    375. 
          
          
              #
        
      376. 
      
        
    376. 
          
          
              # +exp+ takes an optional message on the end to help explain
        
      377. 
      
        
    377. 
          
          
              # failures and defaults to StandardError if no exception class is
        
      378. 
      
        
    378. 
          
          
              # passed. Eg:
        
      379. 
      
        
    379. 
          
          
              #
        
      380. 
      
        
    380. 
          
          
              #   assert_raises(CustomError) { method_with_custom_error }
        
      381. 
      
        
    381. 
          
          
              #
        
      382. 
      
        
    382. 
          
          
              # With custom error message:
        
      383. 
      
        
    383. 
          
          
              #
        
      384. 
      
        
    384. 
          
          
              #   assert_raises(CustomError, 'This should have raised CustomError') { method_with_custom_error }
        
      385. 
      
        
    385. 
          
          
              #
        
      386. 
      
        
    386. 
          
          
              # Using the returned object:
        
      387. 
      
        
    387. 
          
          
              #
        
      388. 
      
        
    388. 
          
          
              #   error = assert_raises(CustomError) do
        
      389. 
      
        
    389. 
          
          
              #     raise CustomError, 'This is really bad'
        
      390. 
      
        
    390. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      391. 
      
        
    391. 
          
          
              #
        
      392. 
      
        
    392. 
          
          
              #   assert_equal 'This is really bad', error.message
        
      393. 
      
        
    393. 
          
          
          
        
      394. 
      
        
    394. 
          1
          
              def assert_raises *exp
        
      395. 
      
        
    395. 
          
          
                flunk "assert_raises requires a block to capture errors." unless
        
      396. 
      
        
    396. 
          
          
                  block_given?
        
      397. 
      
        
    397. 
          
          
          
        
      398. 
      
        
    398. 
          
          
                msg = "#{exp.pop}.\n" if String === exp.last
        
      399. 
      
        
    399. 
          
          
                exp << StandardError if exp.empty?
        
      400. 
      
        
    400. 
          
          
          
        
      401. 
      
        
    401. 
          
          
                begin
        
      402. 
      
        
    402. 
          
          
                  yield
        
      403. 
      
        
    403. 
          
          
                rescue *exp => e
        
      404. 
      
        
    404. 
          
          
                  pass # count assertion
        
      405. 
      
        
    405. 
          
          
                  return e
        
      406. 
      
        
    406. 
          
          
                rescue Minitest::Assertion # incl Skip & UnexpectedError
        
      407. 
      
        
    407. 
          
          
                  # don't count assertion
        
      408. 
      
        
    408. 
          
          
                  raise
        
      409. 
      
        
    409. 
          
          
                rescue SignalException, SystemExit
        
      410. 
      
        
    410. 
          
          
                  raise
        
      411. 
      
        
    411. 
          
          
                rescue Exception => e
        
      412. 
      
        
    412. 
          
          
                  flunk proc {
        
      413. 
      
        
    413. 
          
          
                    exception_details(e, "#{msg}#{mu_pp(exp)} exception expected, not")
        
      414. 
      
        
    414. 
          
          
                  }
        
      415. 
      
        
    415. 
          
          
                end
        
      416. 
      
        
    416. 
          
          
          
        
      417. 
      
        
    417. 
          
          
                exp = exp.first if exp.size == 1
        
      418. 
      
        
    418. 
          
          
          
        
      419. 
      
        
    419. 
          
          
                flunk "#{msg}#{mu_pp(exp)} expected but nothing was raised."
        
      420. 
      
        
    420. 
          
          
              end
        
      421. 
      
        
    421. 
          
          
          
        
      422. 
      
        
    422. 
          
          
              ##
        
      423. 
      
        
    423. 
          
          
              # Fails unless +obj+ responds to +meth+.
        
      424. 
      
        
    424. 
          
          
          
        
      425. 
      
        
    425. 
          1
          
              def assert_respond_to obj, meth, msg = nil
        
      426. 
      
        
    426. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) {
        
      427. 
      
        
    427. 
          
          
                  "Expected #{mu_pp(obj)} (#{obj.class}) to respond to ##{meth}"
        
      428. 
      
        
    428. 
          
          
                }
        
      429. 
      
        
    429. 
          
          
                assert obj.respond_to?(meth), msg
        
      430. 
      
        
    430. 
          
          
              end
        
      431. 
      
        
    431. 
          
          
          
        
      432. 
      
        
    432. 
          
          
              ##
        
      433. 
      
        
    433. 
          
          
              # Fails unless +exp+ and +act+ are #equal?
        
      434. 
      
        
    434. 
          
          
          
        
      435. 
      
        
    435. 
          1
          
              def assert_same exp, act, msg = nil
        
      436. 
      
        
    436. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) {
        
      437. 
      
        
    437. 
          
          
                  data = [mu_pp(act), act.object_id, mu_pp(exp), exp.object_id]
        
      438. 
      
        
    438. 
          
          
                  "Expected %s (oid=%d) to be the same as %s (oid=%d)" % data
        
      439. 
      
        
    439. 
          
          
                }
        
      440. 
      
        
    440. 
          
          
                assert exp.equal?(act), msg
        
      441. 
      
        
    441. 
          
          
              end
        
      442. 
      
        
    442. 
          
          
          
        
      443. 
      
        
    443. 
          
          
              ##
        
      444. 
      
        
    444. 
          
          
              # +send_ary+ is a receiver, message and arguments.
        
      445. 
      
        
    445. 
          
          
              #
        
      446. 
      
        
    446. 
          
          
              # Fails unless the call returns a true value
        
      447. 
      
        
    447. 
          
          
          
        
      448. 
      
        
    448. 
          1
          
              def assert_send send_ary, m = nil
        
      449. 
      
        
    449. 
          
          
                where = Minitest.filter_backtrace(caller).first
        
      450. 
      
        
    450. 
          
          
                where = where.split(/:in /, 2).first # clean up noise
        
      451. 
      
        
    451. 
          
          
                warn "DEPRECATED: assert_send. From #{where}"
        
      452. 
      
        
    452. 
          
          
          
        
      453. 
      
        
    453. 
          
          
                recv, msg, *args = send_ary
        
      454. 
      
        
    454. 
          
          
                m = message(m) {
        
      455. 
      
        
    455. 
          
          
                  "Expected #{mu_pp(recv)}.#{msg}(*#{mu_pp(args)}) to return true" }
        
      456. 
      
        
    456. 
          
          
                assert recv.__send__(msg, *args), m
        
      457. 
      
        
    457. 
          
          
              end
        
      458. 
      
        
    458. 
          
          
          
        
      459. 
      
        
    459. 
          
          
              ##
        
      460. 
      
        
    460. 
          
          
              # Fails if the block outputs anything to stderr or stdout.
        
      461. 
      
        
    461. 
          
          
              #
        
      462. 
      
        
    462. 
          
          
              # See also: #assert_output
        
      463. 
      
        
    463. 
          
          
          
        
      464. 
      
        
    464. 
          1
          
              def assert_silent
        
      465. 
      
        
    465. 
          
          
                assert_output "", "" do
        
      466. 
      
        
    466. 
          
          
                  yield
        
      467. 
      
        
    467. 
          
          
                end
        
      468. 
      
        
    468. 
          
          
              end
        
      469. 
      
        
    469. 
          
          
          
        
      470. 
      
        
    470. 
          
          
              ##
        
      471. 
      
        
    471. 
          
          
              # Fails unless the block throws +sym+
        
      472. 
      
        
    472. 
          
          
          
        
      473. 
      
        
    473. 
          1
          
              def assert_throws sym, msg = nil
        
      474. 
      
        
    474. 
          
          
                default = "Expected #{mu_pp(sym)} to have been thrown"
        
      475. 
      
        
    475. 
          
          
                caught = true
        
      476. 
      
        
    476. 
          
          
                catch(sym) do
        
      477. 
      
        
    477. 
          
          
                  begin
        
      478. 
      
        
    478. 
          
          
                    yield
        
      479. 
      
        
    479. 
          
          
                  rescue ThreadError => e       # wtf?!? 1.8 + threads == suck
        
      480. 
      
        
    480. 
          
          
                    default += ", not \:#{e.message[/uncaught throw \`(\w+?)\'/, 1]}"
        
      481. 
      
        
    481. 
          
          
                  rescue ArgumentError => e     # 1.9 exception
        
      482. 
      
        
    482. 
          
          
                    raise e unless e.message.include?("uncaught throw")
        
      483. 
      
        
    483. 
          
          
                    default += ", not #{e.message.split(/ /).last}"
        
      484. 
      
        
    484. 
          
          
                  rescue NameError => e         # 1.8 exception
        
      485. 
      
        
    485. 
          
          
                    raise e unless e.name == sym
        
      486. 
      
        
    486. 
          
          
                    default += ", not #{e.name.inspect}"
        
      487. 
      
        
    487. 
          
          
                  end
        
      488. 
      
        
    488. 
          
          
                  caught = false
        
      489. 
      
        
    489. 
          
          
                end
        
      490. 
      
        
    490. 
          
          
          
        
      491. 
      
        
    491. 
          
          
                assert caught, message(msg) { default }
        
      492. 
      
        
    492. 
          
          
              rescue Assertion
        
      493. 
      
        
    493. 
          
          
                raise
        
      494. 
      
        
    494. 
          
          
              rescue => e
        
      495. 
      
        
    495. 
          
          
                raise UnexpectedError, e
        
      496. 
      
        
    496. 
          
          
              end
        
      497. 
      
        
    497. 
          
          
          
        
      498. 
      
        
    498. 
          
          
              ##
        
      499. 
      
        
    499. 
          
          
              # Captures $stdout and $stderr into strings:
        
      500. 
      
        
    500. 
          
          
              #
        
      501. 
      
        
    501. 
          
          
              #   out, err = capture_io do
        
      502. 
      
        
    502. 
          
          
              #     puts "Some info"
        
      503. 
      
        
    503. 
          
          
              #     warn "You did a bad thing"
        
      504. 
      
        
    504. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      505. 
      
        
    505. 
          
          
              #
        
      506. 
      
        
    506. 
          
          
              #   assert_match %r%info%, out
        
      507. 
      
        
    507. 
          
          
              #   assert_match %r%bad%, err
        
      508. 
      
        
    508. 
          
          
              #
        
      509. 
      
        
    509. 
          
          
              # NOTE: For efficiency, this method uses StringIO and does not
        
      510. 
      
        
    510. 
          
          
              # capture IO for subprocesses. Use #capture_subprocess_io for
        
      511. 
      
        
    511. 
          
          
              # that.
        
      512. 
      
        
    512. 
          
          
          
        
      513. 
      
        
    513. 
          1
          
              def capture_io
        
      514. 
      
        
    514. 
          
          
                _synchronize do
        
      515. 
      
        
    515. 
          
          
                  begin
        
      516. 
      
        
    516. 
          
          
                    captured_stdout, captured_stderr = StringIO.new, StringIO.new
        
      517. 
      
        
    517. 
          
          
          
        
      518. 
      
        
    518. 
          
          
                    orig_stdout, orig_stderr = $stdout, $stderr
        
      519. 
      
        
    519. 
          
          
                    $stdout, $stderr         = captured_stdout, captured_stderr
        
      520. 
      
        
    520. 
          
          
          
        
      521. 
      
        
    521. 
          
          
                    yield
        
      522. 
      
        
    522. 
          
          
          
        
      523. 
      
        
    523. 
          
          
                    return captured_stdout.string, captured_stderr.string
        
      524. 
      
        
    524. 
          
          
                  ensure
        
      525. 
      
        
    525. 
          
          
                    $stdout = orig_stdout
        
      526. 
      
        
    526. 
          
          
                    $stderr = orig_stderr
        
      527. 
      
        
    527. 
          
          
                  end
        
      528. 
      
        
    528. 
          
          
                end
        
      529. 
      
        
    529. 
          
          
              end
        
      530. 
      
        
    530. 
          
          
          
        
      531. 
      
        
    531. 
          
          
              ##
        
      532. 
      
        
    532. 
          
          
              # Captures $stdout and $stderr into strings, using Tempfile to
        
      533. 
      
        
    533. 
          
          
              # ensure that subprocess IO is captured as well.
        
      534. 
      
        
    534. 
          
          
              #
        
      535. 
      
        
    535. 
          
          
              #   out, err = capture_subprocess_io do
        
      536. 
      
        
    536. 
          
          
              #     system "echo Some info"
        
      537. 
      
        
    537. 
          
          
              #     system "echo You did a bad thing 1>&2"
        
      538. 
      
        
    538. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      539. 
      
        
    539. 
          
          
              #
        
      540. 
      
        
    540. 
          
          
              #   assert_match %r%info%, out
        
      541. 
      
        
    541. 
          
          
              #   assert_match %r%bad%, err
        
      542. 
      
        
    542. 
          
          
              #
        
      543. 
      
        
    543. 
          
          
              # NOTE: This method is approximately 10x slower than #capture_io so
        
      544. 
      
        
    544. 
          
          
              # only use it when you need to test the output of a subprocess.
        
      545. 
      
        
    545. 
          
          
          
        
      546. 
      
        
    546. 
          1
          
              def capture_subprocess_io
        
      547. 
      
        
    547. 
          
          
                _synchronize do
        
      548. 
      
        
    548. 
          
          
                  begin
        
      549. 
      
        
    549. 
          
          
                    require "tempfile"
        
      550. 
      
        
    550. 
          
          
          
        
      551. 
      
        
    551. 
          
          
                    captured_stdout, captured_stderr = Tempfile.new("out"), Tempfile.new("err")
        
      552. 
      
        
    552. 
          
          
          
        
      553. 
      
        
    553. 
          
          
                    orig_stdout, orig_stderr = $stdout.dup, $stderr.dup
        
      554. 
      
        
    554. 
          
          
                    $stdout.reopen captured_stdout
        
      555. 
      
        
    555. 
          
          
                    $stderr.reopen captured_stderr
        
      556. 
      
        
    556. 
          
          
          
        
      557. 
      
        
    557. 
          
          
                    yield
        
      558. 
      
        
    558. 
          
          
          
        
      559. 
      
        
    559. 
          
          
                    $stdout.rewind
        
      560. 
      
        
    560. 
          
          
                    $stderr.rewind
        
      561. 
      
        
    561. 
          
          
          
        
      562. 
      
        
    562. 
          
          
                    return captured_stdout.read, captured_stderr.read
        
      563. 
      
        
    563. 
          
          
                  ensure
        
      564. 
      
        
    564. 
          
          
                    captured_stdout.unlink
        
      565. 
      
        
    565. 
          
          
                    captured_stderr.unlink
        
      566. 
      
        
    566. 
          
          
                    $stdout.reopen orig_stdout
        
      567. 
      
        
    567. 
          
          
                    $stderr.reopen orig_stderr
        
      568. 
      
        
    568. 
          
          
          
        
      569. 
      
        
    569. 
          
          
                    orig_stdout.close
        
      570. 
      
        
    570. 
          
          
                    orig_stderr.close
        
      571. 
      
        
    571. 
          
          
                    captured_stdout.close
        
      572. 
      
        
    572. 
          
          
                    captured_stderr.close
        
      573. 
      
        
    573. 
          
          
                  end
        
      574. 
      
        
    574. 
          
          
                end
        
      575. 
      
        
    575. 
          
          
              end
        
      576. 
      
        
    576. 
          
          
          
        
      577. 
      
        
    577. 
          
          
              ##
        
      578. 
      
        
    578. 
          
          
              # Returns details for exception +e+
        
      579. 
      
        
    579. 
          
          
          
        
      580. 
      
        
    580. 
          1
          
              def exception_details e, msg
        
      581. 
      
        
    581. 
          
          
                [
        
      582. 
      
        
    582. 
          
          
                 "#{msg}",
        
      583. 
      
        
    583. 
          
          
                 "Class: <#{e.class}>",
        
      584. 
      
        
    584. 
          
          
                 "Message: <#{e.message.inspect}>",
        
      585. 
      
        
    585. 
          
          
                 "---Backtrace---",
        
      586. 
      
        
    586. 
          
          
                 "#{Minitest.filter_backtrace(e.backtrace).join("\n")}",
        
      587. 
      
        
    587. 
          
          
                 "---------------",
        
      588. 
      
        
    588. 
          
          
                ].join "\n"
        
      589. 
      
        
    589. 
          
          
              end
        
      590. 
      
        
    590. 
          
          
          
        
      591. 
      
        
    591. 
          
          
              ##
        
      592. 
      
        
    592. 
          
          
              # Fails after a given date (in the local time zone). This allows
        
      593. 
      
        
    593. 
          
          
              # you to put time-bombs in your tests if you need to keep
        
      594. 
      
        
    594. 
          
          
              # something around until a later date lest you forget about it.
        
      595. 
      
        
    595. 
          
          
          
        
      596. 
      
        
    596. 
          1
          
              def fail_after y,m,d,msg
        
      597. 
      
        
    597. 
          
          
                flunk msg if Time.now > Time.local(y, m, d)
        
      598. 
      
        
    598. 
          
          
              end
        
      599. 
      
        
    599. 
          
          
          
        
      600. 
      
        
    600. 
          
          
              ##
        
      601. 
      
        
    601. 
          
          
              # Fails with +msg+.
        
      602. 
      
        
    602. 
          
          
          
        
      603. 
      
        
    603. 
          1
          
              def flunk msg = nil
        
      604. 
      
        
    604. 
          
          
                msg ||= "Epic Fail!"
        
      605. 
      
        
    605. 
          
          
                assert false, msg
        
      606. 
      
        
    606. 
          
          
              end
        
      607. 
      
        
    607. 
          
          
          
        
      608. 
      
        
    608. 
          
          
              ##
        
      609. 
      
        
    609. 
          
          
              # Returns a proc that will output +msg+ along with the default message.
        
      610. 
      
        
    610. 
          
          
          
        
      611. 
      
        
    611. 
          1
          
              def message msg = nil, ending = nil, &default
        
      612. 
      
        
    612. 
          1
          
                proc {
        
      613. 
      
        
    613. 
          
          
                  msg = msg.call.chomp(".") if Proc === msg
        
      614. 
      
        
    614. 
          
          
                  custom_message = "#{msg}.\n" unless msg.nil? or msg.to_s.empty?
        
      615. 
      
        
    615. 
          
          
                  "#{custom_message}#{default.call}#{ending || "."}"
        
      616. 
      
        
    616. 
          
          
                }
        
      617. 
      
        
    617. 
          
          
              end
        
      618. 
      
        
    618. 
          
          
          
        
      619. 
      
        
    619. 
          
          
              ##
        
      620. 
      
        
    620. 
          
          
              # used for counting assertions
        
      621. 
      
        
    621. 
          
          
          
        
      622. 
      
        
    622. 
          1
          
              def pass _msg = nil
        
      623. 
      
        
    623. 
          
          
                assert true
        
      624. 
      
        
    624. 
          
          
              end
        
      625. 
      
        
    625. 
          
          
          
        
      626. 
      
        
    626. 
          
          
              ##
        
      627. 
      
        
    627. 
          
          
              # Fails if +test+ is truthy.
        
      628. 
      
        
    628. 
          
          
          
        
      629. 
      
        
    629. 
          1
          
              def refute test, msg = nil
        
      630. 
      
        
    630. 
          
          
                msg ||= message { "Expected #{mu_pp(test)} to not be truthy" }
        
      631. 
      
        
    631. 
          
          
                not assert !test, msg
        
      632. 
      
        
    632. 
          
          
              end
        
      633. 
      
        
    633. 
          
          
          
        
      634. 
      
        
    634. 
          
          
              ##
        
      635. 
      
        
    635. 
          
          
              # Fails if +obj+ is empty.
        
      636. 
      
        
    636. 
          
          
          
        
      637. 
      
        
    637. 
          1
          
              def refute_empty obj, msg = nil
        
      638. 
      
        
    638. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) { "Expected #{mu_pp(obj)} to not be empty" }
        
      639. 
      
        
    639. 
          
          
                assert_respond_to obj, :empty?
        
      640. 
      
        
    640. 
          
          
                refute obj.empty?, msg
        
      641. 
      
        
    641. 
          
          
              end
        
      642. 
      
        
    642. 
          
          
          
        
      643. 
      
        
    643. 
          
          
              ##
        
      644. 
      
        
    644. 
          
          
              # Fails if <tt>exp == act</tt>.
        
      645. 
      
        
    645. 
          
          
              #
        
      646. 
      
        
    646. 
          
          
              # For floats use refute_in_delta.
        
      647. 
      
        
    647. 
          
          
          
        
      648. 
      
        
    648. 
          1
          
              def refute_equal exp, act, msg = nil
        
      649. 
      
        
    649. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) {
        
      650. 
      
        
    650. 
          
          
                  "Expected #{mu_pp(act)} to not be equal to #{mu_pp(exp)}"
        
      651. 
      
        
    651. 
          
          
                }
        
      652. 
      
        
    652. 
          
          
                refute exp == act, msg
        
      653. 
      
        
    653. 
          
          
              end
        
      654. 
      
        
    654. 
          
          
          
        
      655. 
      
        
    655. 
          
          
              ##
        
      656. 
      
        
    656. 
          
          
              # For comparing Floats.  Fails if +exp+ is within +delta+ of +act+.
        
      657. 
      
        
    657. 
          
          
              #
        
      658. 
      
        
    658. 
          
          
              #   refute_in_delta Math::PI, (22.0 / 7.0)
        
      659. 
      
        
    659. 
          
          
          
        
      660. 
      
        
    660. 
          1
          
              def refute_in_delta exp, act, delta = 0.001, msg = nil
        
      661. 
      
        
    661. 
          
          
                n = (exp - act).abs
        
      662. 
      
        
    662. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) {
        
      663. 
      
        
    663. 
          
          
                  "Expected |#{exp} - #{act}| (#{n}) to not be <= #{delta}"
        
      664. 
      
        
    664. 
          
          
                }
        
      665. 
      
        
    665. 
          
          
                refute delta >= n, msg
        
      666. 
      
        
    666. 
          
          
              end
        
      667. 
      
        
    667. 
          
          
          
        
      668. 
      
        
    668. 
          
          
              ##
        
      669. 
      
        
    669. 
          
          
              # For comparing Floats.  Fails if +exp+ and +act+ have a relative error
        
      670. 
      
        
    670. 
          
          
              # less than +epsilon+.
        
      671. 
      
        
    671. 
          
          
          
        
      672. 
      
        
    672. 
          1
          
              def refute_in_epsilon a, b, epsilon = 0.001, msg = nil
        
      673. 
      
        
    673. 
          
          
                refute_in_delta a, b, a * epsilon, msg
        
      674. 
      
        
    674. 
          
          
              end
        
      675. 
      
        
    675. 
          
          
          
        
      676. 
      
        
    676. 
          
          
              ##
        
      677. 
      
        
    677. 
          
          
              # Fails if +collection+ includes +obj+.
        
      678. 
      
        
    678. 
          
          
          
        
      679. 
      
        
    679. 
          1
          
              def refute_includes collection, obj, msg = nil
        
      680. 
      
        
    680. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) {
        
      681. 
      
        
    681. 
          
          
                  "Expected #{mu_pp(collection)} to not include #{mu_pp(obj)}"
        
      682. 
      
        
    682. 
          
          
                }
        
      683. 
      
        
    683. 
          
          
                assert_respond_to collection, :include?
        
      684. 
      
        
    684. 
          
          
                refute collection.include?(obj), msg
        
      685. 
      
        
    685. 
          
          
              end
        
      686. 
      
        
    686. 
          
          
          
        
      687. 
      
        
    687. 
          
          
              ##
        
      688. 
      
        
    688. 
          
          
              # Fails if +obj+ is an instance of +cls+.
        
      689. 
      
        
    689. 
          
          
          
        
      690. 
      
        
    690. 
          1
          
              def refute_instance_of cls, obj, msg = nil
        
      691. 
      
        
    691. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) {
        
      692. 
      
        
    692. 
          
          
                  "Expected #{mu_pp(obj)} to not be an instance of #{cls}"
        
      693. 
      
        
    693. 
          
          
                }
        
      694. 
      
        
    694. 
          
          
                refute obj.instance_of?(cls), msg
        
      695. 
      
        
    695. 
          
          
              end
        
      696. 
      
        
    696. 
          
          
          
        
      697. 
      
        
    697. 
          
          
              ##
        
      698. 
      
        
    698. 
          
          
              # Fails if +obj+ is a kind of +cls+.
        
      699. 
      
        
    699. 
          
          
          
        
      700. 
      
        
    700. 
          1
          
              def refute_kind_of cls, obj, msg = nil
        
      701. 
      
        
    701. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) { "Expected #{mu_pp(obj)} to not be a kind of #{cls}" }
        
      702. 
      
        
    702. 
          
          
                refute obj.kind_of?(cls), msg
        
      703. 
      
        
    703. 
          
          
              end
        
      704. 
      
        
    704. 
          
          
          
        
      705. 
      
        
    705. 
          
          
              ##
        
      706. 
      
        
    706. 
          
          
              # Fails if +matcher+ <tt>=~</tt> +obj+.
        
      707. 
      
        
    707. 
          
          
          
        
      708. 
      
        
    708. 
          1
          
              def refute_match matcher, obj, msg = nil
        
      709. 
      
        
    709. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) { "Expected #{mu_pp matcher} to not match #{mu_pp obj}" }
        
      710. 
      
        
    710. 
          
          
                assert_respond_to matcher, :"=~"
        
      711. 
      
        
    711. 
          
          
                matcher = Regexp.new Regexp.escape matcher if String === matcher
        
      712. 
      
        
    712. 
          
          
                refute matcher =~ obj, msg
        
      713. 
      
        
    713. 
          
          
              end
        
      714. 
      
        
    714. 
          
          
          
        
      715. 
      
        
    715. 
          
          
              ##
        
      716. 
      
        
    716. 
          
          
              # Fails if +obj+ is nil.
        
      717. 
      
        
    717. 
          
          
          
        
      718. 
      
        
    718. 
          1
          
              def refute_nil obj, msg = nil
        
      719. 
      
        
    719. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) { "Expected #{mu_pp(obj)} to not be nil" }
        
      720. 
      
        
    720. 
          
          
                refute obj.nil?, msg
        
      721. 
      
        
    721. 
          
          
              end
        
      722. 
      
        
    722. 
          
          
          
        
      723. 
      
        
    723. 
          
          
              ##
        
      724. 
      
        
    724. 
          
          
              # Fails if +o1+ is not +op+ +o2+. Eg:
        
      725. 
      
        
    725. 
          
          
              #
        
      726. 
      
        
    726. 
          
          
              #   refute_operator 1, :>, 2 #=> pass
        
      727. 
      
        
    727. 
          
          
              #   refute_operator 1, :<, 2 #=> fail
        
      728. 
      
        
    728. 
          
          
          
        
      729. 
      
        
    729. 
          1
          
              def refute_operator o1, op, o2 = UNDEFINED, msg = nil
        
      730. 
      
        
    730. 
          
          
                return refute_predicate o1, op, msg if UNDEFINED == o2
        
      731. 
      
        
    731. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) { "Expected #{mu_pp(o1)} to not be #{op} #{mu_pp(o2)}" }
        
      732. 
      
        
    732. 
          
          
                refute o1.__send__(op, o2), msg
        
      733. 
      
        
    733. 
          
          
              end
        
      734. 
      
        
    734. 
          
          
          
        
      735. 
      
        
    735. 
          
          
              ##
        
      736. 
      
        
    736. 
          
          
              # Fails if +path+ exists.
        
      737. 
      
        
    737. 
          
          
          
        
      738. 
      
        
    738. 
          1
          
              def refute_path_exists path, msg = nil
        
      739. 
      
        
    739. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) { "Expected path '#{path}' to not exist" }
        
      740. 
      
        
    740. 
          
          
                refute File.exist?(path), msg
        
      741. 
      
        
    741. 
          
          
              end
        
      742. 
      
        
    742. 
          
          
          
        
      743. 
      
        
    743. 
          
          
              ##
        
      744. 
      
        
    744. 
          
          
              # For testing with predicates.
        
      745. 
      
        
    745. 
          
          
              #
        
      746. 
      
        
    746. 
          
          
              #   refute_predicate str, :empty?
        
      747. 
      
        
    747. 
          
          
              #
        
      748. 
      
        
    748. 
          
          
              # This is really meant for specs and is front-ended by refute_operator:
        
      749. 
      
        
    749. 
          
          
              #
        
      750. 
      
        
    750. 
          
          
              #   str.wont_be :empty?
        
      751. 
      
        
    751. 
          
          
          
        
      752. 
      
        
    752. 
          1
          
              def refute_predicate o1, op, msg = nil
        
      753. 
      
        
    753. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) { "Expected #{mu_pp(o1)} to not be #{op}" }
        
      754. 
      
        
    754. 
          
          
                refute o1.__send__(op), msg
        
      755. 
      
        
    755. 
          
          
              end
        
      756. 
      
        
    756. 
          
          
          
        
      757. 
      
        
    757. 
          
          
              ##
        
      758. 
      
        
    758. 
          
          
              # Fails if +obj+ responds to the message +meth+.
        
      759.
