    759. 
          
          
          
        
      760. 
      
        
    760. 
          1
          
              def refute_respond_to obj, meth, msg = nil
        
      761. 
      
        
    761. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) { "Expected #{mu_pp(obj)} to not respond to #{meth}" }
        
      762. 
      
        
    762. 
          
          
          
        
      763. 
      
        
    763. 
          
          
                refute obj.respond_to?(meth), msg
        
      764. 
      
        
    764. 
          
          
              end
        
      765. 
      
        
    765. 
          
          
          
        
      766. 
      
        
    766. 
          
          
              ##
        
      767. 
      
        
    767. 
          
          
              # Fails if +exp+ is the same (by object identity) as +act+.
        
      768. 
      
        
    768. 
          
          
          
        
      769. 
      
        
    769. 
          1
          
              def refute_same exp, act, msg = nil
        
      770. 
      
        
    770. 
          
          
                msg = message(msg) {
        
      771. 
      
        
    771. 
          
          
                  data = [mu_pp(act), act.object_id, mu_pp(exp), exp.object_id]
        
      772. 
      
        
    772. 
          
          
                  "Expected %s (oid=%d) to not be the same as %s (oid=%d)" % data
        
      773. 
      
        
    773. 
          
          
                }
        
      774. 
      
        
    774. 
          
          
                refute exp.equal?(act), msg
        
      775. 
      
        
    775. 
          
          
              end
        
      776. 
      
        
    776. 
          
          
          
        
      777. 
      
        
    777. 
          
          
              ##
        
      778. 
      
        
    778. 
          
          
              # Skips the current run. If run in verbose-mode, the skipped run
        
      779. 
      
        
    779. 
          
          
              # gets listed at the end of the run but doesn't cause a failure
        
      780. 
      
        
    780. 
          
          
              # exit code.
        
      781. 
      
        
    781. 
          
          
          
        
      782. 
      
        
    782. 
          1
          
              def skip msg = nil, bt = caller
        
      783. 
      
        
    783. 
          
          
                msg ||= "Skipped, no message given"
        
      784. 
      
        
    784. 
          
          
                @skip = true
        
      785. 
      
        
    785. 
          
          
                raise Minitest::Skip, msg, bt
        
      786. 
      
        
    786. 
          
          
              end
        
      787. 
      
        
    787. 
          
          
          
        
      788. 
      
        
    788. 
          
          
              ##
        
      789. 
      
        
    789. 
          
          
              # Skips the current run until a given date (in the local time
        
      790. 
      
        
    790. 
          
          
              # zone). This allows you to put some fixes on hold until a later
        
      791. 
      
        
    791. 
          
          
              # date, but still holds you accountable and prevents you from
        
      792. 
      
        
    792. 
          
          
              # forgetting it.
        
      793. 
      
        
    793. 
          
          
          
        
      794. 
      
        
    794. 
          1
          
              def skip_until y,m,d,msg
        
      795. 
      
        
    795. 
          
          
                skip msg if Time.now < Time.local(y, m, d)
        
      796. 
      
        
    796. 
          
          
                where = caller.first.split(/:/, 3).first(2).join ":"
        
      797. 
      
        
    797. 
          
          
                warn "Stale skip_until %p at %s" % [msg, where]
        
      798. 
      
        
    798. 
          
          
              end
        
      799. 
      
        
    799. 
          
          
          
        
      800. 
      
        
    800. 
          
          
              ##
        
      801. 
      
        
    801. 
          
          
              # Was this testcase skipped? Meant for #teardown.
        
      802. 
      
        
    802. 
          
          
          
        
      803. 
      
        
    803. 
          1
          
              def skipped?
        
      804. 
      
        
    804. 
          
          
                defined?(@skip) and @skip
        
      805. 
      
        
    805. 
          
          
              end
        
      806. 
      
        
    806. 
          
          
            end
        
      807. 
      
        
    807. 
          
          
          end
        
      808.

    /usr/lib/ruby/gems/2.6.0/gems/minitest-5.14.0/lib/minitest/autorun.rb

    100.0 % covered

    7 relevant lines. 7 lines covered and 0 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          
          
          begin
        
      2.

          1
          
            require "rubygems"
        
      3.

          1
          
            gem "minitest"
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
          rescue Gem::LoadError
        
      5.

            # do nothing
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
          end
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          1
          
          require "minitest"
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          1
          
          require "minitest/spec"
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          1
          
          require "minitest/mock"
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          1
          
          require "minitest/hell" if ENV["MT_HELL"]
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          
        
      13.

          1
          
          Minitest.autorun
        
      14.

    /usr/lib/ruby/gems/2.6.0/gems/minitest-5.14.0/lib/minitest/expectations.rb

    100.0 % covered

    33 relevant lines. 33 lines covered and 0 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
    1. 
          
          
          ##
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          # It's where you hide your "assertions".
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          
          
          #
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
          # Please note, because of the way that expectations are implemented,
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
          # all expectations (eg must_equal) are dependent upon a thread local
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
          # variable +:current_spec+. If your specs rely on mixing threads into
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
          # the specs themselves, you're better off using assertions or the new
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
          # _(value) wrapper. For example:
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
          #
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          
          
          #     it "should still work in threads" do
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          
          
          #       my_threaded_thingy do
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          #         (1+1).must_equal 2                  # bad
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
          #         assert_equal 2, 1+1                 # good
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          
          
          #         _(1 + 1).must_equal 2               # good
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
          #         value(1 + 1).must_equal 2           # good, also #expect
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
          #         _ { 1 + "1" }.must_raise TypeError  # good
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
          #       end
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
          #     end
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
          
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          1
          
          module Minitest::Expectations
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
          
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
            ##
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
            # See Minitest::Assertions#assert_empty.
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
            #
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
            #    collection.must_be_empty
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          
          
            #
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          
          
            # :method: must_be_empty
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
          
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          1
          
            infect_an_assertion :assert_empty, :must_be_empty, :unary
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          
          
          
        
      31.

      169.

      170.

    1. 
          1
          
          class MockExpectationError < StandardError; end # :nodoc:
        
      2. 
      
        
    2. 
          
          
          
        
      3. 
      
        
    3. 
          1
          
          module Minitest # :nodoc:
        
      4. 
      
        
    4. 
          
          
          
        
      5. 
      
        
    5. 
          
          
            ##
        
      6. 
      
        
    6. 
          
          
            # A simple and clean mock object framework.
        
      7. 
      
        
    7. 
          
          
            #
        
      8. 
      
        
    8. 
          
          
            # All mock objects are an instance of Mock
        
      9. 
      
        
    9. 
          
          
          
        
      10. 
      
        
    10. 
          1
          
            class Mock
        
      11. 
      
        
    11. 
          1
          
              alias :__respond_to? :respond_to?
        
      12. 
      
        
    12. 
          
          
          
        
      13. 
      
        
    13. 
          
          
              overridden_methods = %w[
        
      14. 
      
        
    14. 
          1
          
                ===
        
      15. 
      
        
    15. 
          
          
                class
        
      16. 
      
        
    16. 
          
          
                inspect
        
      17. 
      
        
    17. 
          
          
                instance_eval
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          
          
                instance_variables
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          
          
                object_id
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          
          
                public_send
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
                respond_to_missing?
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
                send
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                to_s
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
              ]
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
          
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          1
          
              instance_methods.each do |m|
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          92
          
                undef_method m unless overridden_methods.include?(m.to_s) || m =~ /^__/
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          
          
              end
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          
          
          
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          1
          
              overridden_methods.map(&:to_sym).each do |method_id|
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          10
          
                define_method method_id do |*args, &b|
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                  if @expected_calls.key? method_id then
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                    method_missing(method_id, *args, &b)
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                  else
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                    super(*args, &b)
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                  end
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                end
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
              end
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
          
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          1
          
              def initialize delegator = nil # :nodoc:
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                @delegator = delegator
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
                @expected_calls = Hash.new { |calls, name| calls[name] = [] }
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
                @actual_calls   = Hash.new { |calls, name| calls[name] = [] }
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
              end
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
          
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
              ##
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
              # Expect that method +name+ is called, optionally with +args+ or a
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
              # +blk+, and returns +retval+.
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
              #
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
              #   @mock.expect(:meaning_of_life, 42)
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
              #   @mock.meaning_of_life # => 42
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
              #
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
              #   @mock.expect(:do_something_with, true, [some_obj, true])
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
              #   @mock.do_something_with(some_obj, true) # => true
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
              #
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
              #   @mock.expect(:do_something_else, true) do |a1, a2|
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
              #     a1 == "buggs" && a2 == :bunny
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
              #   end
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
              #
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          
          
              # +args+ is compared to the expected args using case equality (ie, the
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
              # '===' operator), allowing for less specific expectations.
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
              #
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
              #   @mock.expect(:uses_any_string, true, [String])
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
              #   @mock.uses_any_string("foo") # => true
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
              #   @mock.verify  # => true
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
              #
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
              #   @mock.expect(:uses_one_string, true, ["foo"])
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
              #   @mock.uses_one_string("bar") # => raises MockExpectationError
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
              #
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
              # If a method will be called multiple times, specify a new expect for each one.
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
              # They will be used in the order you define them.
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
              #
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
              #   @mock.expect(:ordinal_increment, 'first')
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
              #   @mock.expect(:ordinal_increment, 'second')
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
              #
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
              #   @mock.ordinal_increment # => 'first'
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
              #   @mock.ordinal_increment # => 'second'
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
              #   @mock.ordinal_increment # => raises MockExpectationError "No more expects available for :ordinal_increment"
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
              #
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
          
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          1
          
              def expect name, retval, args = [], &blk
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                name = name.to_sym
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
          
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
                if block_given?
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
                  raise ArgumentError, "args ignored when block given" unless args.empty?
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
                  @expected_calls[name] << { :retval => retval, :block => blk }
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
                else
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
                  raise ArgumentError, "args must be an array" unless Array === args
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
                  @expected_calls[name] << { :retval => retval, :args => args }
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                end
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                self
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
              end
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
          
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          1
          
              def __call name, data # :nodoc:
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
                case data
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          
          
                when Hash then
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                  "#{name}(#{data[:args].inspect[1..-2]}) => #{data[:retval].inspect}"
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
                else
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
                  data.map { |d| __call name, d }.join ", "
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
                end
        
      101. 
      
        
    101. 
          
          
              end
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
          
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
              ##
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
              # Verify that all methods were called as expected. Raises
        
      105. 
      
        
    105. 
          
          
              # +MockExpectationError+ if the mock object was not called as
        
      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          
          
              # expected.
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          
          
          
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          1
          
              def verify
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          
          
                @expected_calls.each do |name, expected|
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                  actual = @actual_calls.fetch(name, nil)
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                  raise MockExpectationError, "expected #{__call name, expected[0]}" unless actual
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                  raise MockExpectationError, "expected #{__call name, expected[actual.size]}, got [#{__call name, actual}]" if
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                    actual.size < expected.size
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                end
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
                true
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
              end
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
          
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          1
          
              def method_missing sym, *args, &block # :nodoc:
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                unless @expected_calls.key?(sym) then
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                  if @delegator && @delegator.respond_to?(sym)
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                    return @delegator.public_send(sym, *args, &block)
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
                  else
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                    raise NoMethodError, "unmocked method %p, expected one of %p" %
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                      [sym, @expected_calls.keys.sort_by(&:to_s)]
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                  end
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
                end
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
          
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                index = @actual_calls[sym].length
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
                expected_call = @expected_calls[sym][index]
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
          
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
                unless expected_call then
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
                  raise MockExpectationError, "No more expects available for %p: %p" %
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
                    [sym, args]
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
                end
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
          
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
                expected_args, retval, val_block =
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                  expected_call.values_at(:args, :retval, :block)
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
          
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                if val_block then
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                  # keep "verify" happy
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                  @actual_calls[sym] << expected_call
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
          
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                  raise MockExpectationError, "mocked method %p failed block w/ %p" %
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
                    [sym, args] unless val_block.call(*args, &block)
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
          
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
                  return retval
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
                end
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
          
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
                if expected_args.size != args.size then
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
                  raise ArgumentError, "mocked method %p expects %d arguments, got %d" %
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
                    [sym, expected_args.size, args.size]
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
                end
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          
          
          
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                zipped_args = expected_args.zip(args)
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                fully_matched = zipped_args.all? { |mod, a|
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                  mod === a or mod == a
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                }
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
          
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                unless fully_matched then
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                  raise MockExpectationError, "mocked method %p called with unexpected arguments %p" %
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
                    [sym, args]
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
                end
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          
          
          
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                @actual_calls[sym] << {
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
                  :retval => retval,
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
                  :args => zipped_args.map! { |mod, a| mod === a ? mod : a },
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          
          
                }
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
          
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
                retval
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
              end
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          
          
          
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          1
          
              def respond_to? sym, include_private = false # :nodoc:
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                return true if @expected_calls.key? sym.to_sym
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                return true if @delegator && @delegator.respond_to?(sym, include_private)
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
                __respond_to?(sym, include_private)
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
              end
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
            end
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
          end
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
          
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          1
          
          module Minitest::Assertions
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
            ##
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
            # Assert that the mock verifies correctly.
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
          
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          1
          
            def assert_mock mock
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
              assert mock.verify
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
            end
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
          end
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
          
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
          ##
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
          # Object extensions for Minitest::Mock.
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
          
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          1
          
          class Object
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
          
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
            ##
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
            # Add a temporary stubbed method replacing +name+ for the duration
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
            # of the +block+. If +val_or_callable+ responds to #call, then it
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
            # returns the result of calling it, otherwise returns the value
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          
          
            # as-is. If stubbed method yields a block, +block_args+ will be
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
            # passed along. Cleans up the stub at the end of the +block+. The
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
            # method +name+ must exist before stubbing.
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
            #
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
            #     def test_stale_eh
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
            #       obj_under_test = Something.new
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
            #       refute obj_under_test.stale?
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
            #
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
            #       Time.stub :now, Time.at(0) do
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
            #         assert obj_under_test.stale?
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
            #       end
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
            #     end
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
            #
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
          
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          1
          
            def stub name, val_or_callable, *block_args
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
              new_name = "__minitest_stub__#{name}"
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
          
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
              metaclass = class << self; self; end
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          
          
          
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
              if respond_to? name and not methods.map(&:to_s).include? name.to_s then
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
                metaclass.send :define_method, name do |*args|
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
                  super(*args)
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
                end
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
              end
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
          
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
              metaclass.send :alias_method, new_name, name
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
          
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
              metaclass.send :define_method, name do |*args, &blk|
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
                if val_or_callable.respond_to? :call then
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
                  val_or_callable.call(*args, &blk)
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                else
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
                  blk.call(*block_args) if blk
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
                  val_or_callable
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
                end
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
              end
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
          
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
              yield self
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
            ensure
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
              metaclass.send :undef_method, name
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
              metaclass.send :alias_method, name, new_name
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
              metaclass.send :undef_method, new_name
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
            end
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          
          
          end
        
      241.

                def initialize size
        
      18. 
      
        
    18. 
          1
          
                  @size  = size
        
      19. 
      
        
    19. 
          1
          
                  @queue = Queue.new
        
      20. 
      
        
    20. 
          1
          
                  @pool  = nil
        
      21. 
      
        
    21. 
          
          
                end
        
      22. 
      
        
    22. 
          
          
          
        
      23. 
      
        
    23. 
          
          
                ##
        
      24. 
      
        
    24. 
          
          
                # Start the executor
        
      25. 
      
        
    25. 
          
          
          
        
      26. 
      
        
    26. 
          1
          
                def start
        
      27. 
      
        
    27. 
          1
          
                  @pool  = size.times.map {
        
      28. 
      
        
    28. 
          2
          
                    Thread.new(@queue) do |queue|
        
      29. 
      
        
    29. 
          2
          
                      Thread.current.abort_on_exception = true
        
      30. 
      
        
    30. 
          4
          
                      while (job = queue.pop)
        
      31. 
      
        
    31. 
          
          
                        klass, method, reporter = job
        
      32. 
      
        
    32. 
          
          
                        reporter.synchronize { reporter.prerecord klass, method }
        
      33. 
      
        
    33. 
          
          
                        result = Minitest.run_one_method klass, method
        
      34. 
      
        
    34. 
          
          
                        reporter.synchronize { reporter.record result }
        
      35. 
      
        
    35. 
          
          
                      end
        
      36. 
      
        
    36. 
          
          
                    end
        
      37. 
      
        
    37. 
          
          
                  }
        
      38. 
      
        
    38. 
          
          
                end
        
      39. 
      
        
    39. 
          
          
          
        
      40. 
      
        
    40. 
          
          
                ##
        
      41. 
      
        
    41. 
          
          
                # Add a job to the queue
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
          
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          1
          
                def << work; @queue << work; end
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
          
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
                ##
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
                # Shuts down the pool of workers by signalling them to quit and
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
                # waiting for them all to finish what they're currently working
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
                # on.
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
          
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          1
          
                def shutdown
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          3
          
                  size.times { @queue << nil }
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          1
          
                  @pool.each(&:join)
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
                end
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
              end
        
      55.

              # Start an escape sequence
        
      40.

          1
          
              ESC = "\e["
        
      41.

      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
              # End the escape sequence
        
      43.

          1
          
              NND = "#{ESC}0m"
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
          
        
      45. 
      
        
    45.

              def initialize io # :nodoc:
        
      49.

                @io = io
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
                # stolen from /System/Library/Perl/5.10.0/Term/ANSIColor.pm
        
      51.

                # also reference http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ANSI_escape_code
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
                @colors ||= (31..36).to_a
        
      53.

                @size   = @colors.size

                @index  = 0

              end

      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
              ##
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
              # Wrap print to colorize the output.
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
          
        
      60. 
      
        
    60. 
          1
          
              def print o
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
                case o
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
                when "." then
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
                  io.print pride o
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
                when "E", "F" then
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          
          
                  io.print "#{ESC}41m#{ESC}37m#{o}#{NND}"
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          
          
                when "S" then
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
                  io.print pride o
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          
          
                else
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                  io.print o
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          
          
                end
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          
          
              end
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
          
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          1
          
              def puts *o # :nodoc:
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                o.map! { |s|
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                  s.to_s.sub(/Finished/) {
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                    @index = 0
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
                    "Fabulous run".split(//).map { |c|
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
                      pride(c)
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                    }.join
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                  }
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                }
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
          
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
                io.puts(*o)
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
              end
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
          
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
              ##
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
              # Color a string.
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
          
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          1
          
              def pride string
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
                string = "*" if string == "."
        
      91. 
      
        
    91. 
          
          
                c = @colors[@index % @size]
        
      92. 
      
        
    92. 
          
          
                @index += 1
        
      93. 
      
        
    93. 
          
          
                "#{ESC}#{c}m#{string}#{NND}"
        
      94. 
      
        
    94. 
          
          
              end
        
      95. 
      
        
    95. 
          
          
          
        
      96. 
      
        
    96. 
          1
          
              def method_missing msg, *args # :nodoc:
        
      97. 
      
        
    97. 
          
          
                io.send(msg, *args)
        
      98. 
      
        
    98. 
          
          
              end
        
      99. 
      
        
    99. 
          
          
            end
        
      100. 
      
        
    100. 
          
          
          
        
      101.

            ##
        
      102. 
      
        
    102. 
          
          
            # If you thought the PrideIO was colorful...
        
      103. 
      
        
    103. 
          
          
            #
        
      104. 
      
        
    104. 
          
          
            # (Inspired by lolcat, but with clean math)
        
      105.

      106. 
      
        
    106. 
          1
          
            class PrideLOL < PrideIO
        
      107. 
      
        
    107. 
          1
          
              PI_3 = Math::PI / 3 # :nodoc:
        
      108. 
      
        
    108. 
          
          
          
        
      109. 
      
        
    109. 
          1
          
              def initialize io # :nodoc:
        
      110. 
      
        
    110. 
          
          
                # walk red, green, and blue around a circle separated by equal thirds.
        
      111. 
      
        
    111. 
          
          
                #
        
      112. 
      
        
    112. 
          
          
                # To visualize, type this into wolfram-alpha:
        
      113. 
      
        
    113. 
          
          
                #
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
                #   plot (3*sin(x)+3), (3*sin(x+2*pi/3)+3), (3*sin(x+4*pi/3)+3)
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
          
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
                # 6 has wide pretty gradients. 3 == lolcat, about half the width
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
                @colors = (0...(6 * 7)).map { |n|
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
                  n *= 1.0 / 6
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
                  r  = (3 * Math.sin(n           ) + 3).to_i
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
                  g  = (3 * Math.sin(n + 2 * PI_3) + 3).to_i
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          
          
                  b  = (3 * Math.sin(n + 4 * PI_3) + 3).to_i
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
          
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
                  # Then we take rgb and encode them in a single number using base 6.
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
                  # For some mysterious reason, we add 16... to clear the bottom 4 bits?
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
                  # Yes... they're ugly.
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
          
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
                  36 * r + 6 * g + b + 16
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
                }
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
          
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
                super
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
              end
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
          
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
              ##
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
              # Make the string even more colorful. Damnit.
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
          
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          1
          
              def pride string
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
                c = @colors[@index % @size]
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
                @index += 1
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          
          
                "#{ESC}38;5;#{c}m#{string}#{NND}"
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
              end
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
            end
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
          end

    41. 
          
          
            # Describe a series of expectations for a given target +desc+.
        
      42. 
      
        
    42. 
          
          
            #
        
      43. 
      
        
    43. 
          
          
            # Defines a test class subclassing from either Minitest::Spec or
        
      44. 
      
        
    44. 
          
          
            # from the surrounding describe's class. The surrounding class may
        
      45. 
      
        
    45. 
          
          
            # subclass Minitest::Spec manually in order to easily share code:
        
      46. 
      
        
    46. 
          
          
            #
        
      47. 
      
        
    47. 
          
          
            #     class MySpec < Minitest::Spec
        
      48. 
      
        
    48. 
          
          
            #       # ... shared code ...
        
      49. 
      
        
    49. 
          
          
            #     end
        
      50. 
      
        
    50. 
          
          
            #
        
      51. 
      
        
    51. 
          
          
            #     class TestStuff < MySpec
        
      52. 
      
        
    52. 
          
          
            #       it "does stuff" do
        
      53. 
      
        
    53. 
          
          
            #         # shared code available here
        
      54. 
      
        
    54. 
          
          
            #       end
        
      55. 
      
        
    55. 
          
          
            #       describe "inner stuff" do
        
      56. 
      
        
    56. 
          
          
            #         it "still does stuff" do
        
      57. 
      
        
    57. 
          
          
            #           # ...and here
        
      58. 
      
        
    58. 
          
          
            #         end
        
      59. 
      
        
    59. 
          
          
            #       end
        
      60. 
      
        
    60.

      63.

            def describe desc, *additional_desc, &block # :doc:
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
              stack = Minitest::Spec.describe_stack
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
              name  = [stack.last, desc, *additional_desc].compact.join("::")
        
      78. 
      
        
    78. 
          
          
              sclas = stack.last || if Class === self && kind_of?(Minitest::Spec::DSL) then
        
      79. 
      
        
    79. 
          
          
                                      self
        
      80. 
      
        
    80. 
          
          
                                    else
        
      81. 
      
        
    81. 
          
          
                                      Minitest::Spec.spec_type desc, *additional_desc
        
      82. 
      
        
    82. 
          
          
                                    end
        
      83. 
      
        
    83. 
          
          
          
        
      84. 
      
        
    84. 
          
          
              cls = sclas.create name, desc
        
      85. 
      
        
    85. 
          
          
          
        
      86. 
      
        
    86. 
          
          
              stack.push cls
        
      87. 
      
        
    87. 
          
          
              cls.class_eval(&block)
        
      88. 
      
        
    88. 
          
          
              stack.pop
        
      89. 
      
        
    89. 
          
          
              cls
        
      90. 
      
        
    90. 
          
          
            end

            module DSL
        
      114. 
      
        
    114. 
          
          
              ##
        
      115. 
      
        
    115. 
          
          
              # Contains pairs of matchers and Spec classes to be used to
        
      116. 
      
        
    116. 
          
          
              # calculate the superclass of a top-level describe. This allows for
        
      117. 
      
        
    117. 
          
          
              # automatically customizable spec types.
        
      118. 
      
        
    118. 
          
          
              #
        
      119. 
      
        
    119. 
          
          
              # See: register_spec_type and spec_type
        
      120. 
      
        
    120. 
          
          
          
        
      121. 
      
        
    121. 
          1
          
              TYPES = [[//, Minitest::Spec]]
        
      122. 
      
        
    122. 
          
          
          
        
      123. 
      
        
    123. 
          
          
              ##
        
      124. 
      
        
    124. 
          
          
              # Register a new type of spec that matches the spec's description.
        
      125. 
      
        
    125. 
          
          
              # This method can take either a Regexp and a spec class or a spec
        
      126. 
      
        
    126. 
          
          
              # class and a block that takes the description and returns true if
        
      127. 
      
        
    127. 
          
          
              # it matches.
        
      128. 
      
        
    128. 
          
          
              #
        
      129. 
      
        
    129. 
          
          
              # Eg:
        
      130. 
      
        
    130. 
          
          
              #
        
      131. 
      
        
    131. 
          
          
              #     register_spec_type(/Controller$/, Minitest::Spec::Rails)
        
      132. 
      
        
    132. 
          
          
              #
        
      133. 
      
        
    133. 
          
          
              # or:
        
      134. 
      
        
    134. 
          
          
              #
        
      135. 
      
        
    135. 
          
          
              #     register_spec_type(Minitest::Spec::RailsModel) do |desc|
        
      136. 
      
        
    136. 
          
          
              #       desc.superclass == ActiveRecord::Base
        
      137. 
      
        
    137. 
          
          
              #     end
        
      138. 
      
        
    138. 
          
          
          
        
      139. 
      
        
    139. 
          1
          
              def register_spec_type *args, &block
        
      140. 
      
        
    140. 
          
          
                if block then
        
      141. 
      
        
    141. 
          
          
                  matcher, klass = block, args.first
        
      142. 
      
        
    142. 
          
          
                else
        
      143. 
      
        
    143. 
          
          
                  matcher, klass = *args
        
      144. 
      
        
    144. 
          
          
                end
        
      145. 
      
        
    145. 
          
          
                TYPES.unshift [matcher, klass]
        
      146. 
      
        
    146. 
          
          
              end
        
      147. 
      
        
    147. 
          
          
          
        
      148. 
      
        
    148. 
          
          
              ##
        
      149. 
      
        
    149. 
          
          
              # Figure out the spec class to use based on a spec's description. Eg:
        
      150. 
      
        
    150. 
          
          
              #
        
      151. 
      
        
    151. 
          
          
              #     spec_type("BlahController") # => Minitest::Spec::Rails
        
      152. 
      
        
    152. 
          
          
          
        
      153. 
      
        
    153. 
          1
          
              def spec_type desc, *additional
        
      154. 
      
        
    154. 
          
          
                TYPES.find { |matcher, _klass|
        
      155. 
      
        
    155. 
          
          
                  if matcher.respond_to? :call then
        
      156. 
      
        
    156. 
          
          
                    matcher.call desc, *additional
        
      157. 
      
        
    157. 
          
          
                  else
        
      158. 
      
        
    158. 
          
          
                    matcher === desc.to_s
        
      159. 
      
        
    159. 
          
          
                  end
        
      160. 
      
        
    160. 
          
          
                }.last
        
      161. 
      
        
    161. 
          
          
              end
        
      162. 
      
        
    162. 
          
          
          
        
      163. 
      
        
    163. 
          1
          
              def describe_stack # :nodoc:
        
      164. 
      
        
    164. 
          
          
                Thread.current[:describe_stack] ||= []
        
      165. 
      
        
    165. 
          
          
              end
        
      166. 
      
        
    166. 
          
          
          
        
      167. 
      
        
    167. 
          1
          
              def children # :nodoc:
        
      168. 
      
        
    168. 
          
          
                @children ||= []
        
      169. 
      
        
    169. 
          
          
              end
        
      170. 
      
        
    170. 
          
          
          
        
      171. 
      
        
    171. 
          1
          
              def nuke_test_methods! # :nodoc:
        
      172. 
      
        
    172. 
          
          
                self.public_instance_methods.grep(/^test_/).each do |name|
        
      173. 
      
        
    173. 
          
          
                  self.send :undef_method, name
        
      174. 
      
        
    174. 
          
          
                end
        
      175. 
      
        
    175. 
          
          
              end
        
      176. 
      
        
    176. 
          
          
          
        
      177. 
      
        
    177. 
          
          
              ##
        
      178. 
      
        
    178. 
          
          
              # Define a 'before' action. Inherits the way normal methods should.
        
      179. 
      
        
    179. 
          
          
              #
        
      180. 
      
        
    180. 
          
          
              # NOTE: +type+ is ignored and is only there to make porting easier.
        
      181. 
      
        
    181. 
          
          
              #
        
      182. 
      
        
    182. 
          
          
              # Equivalent to Minitest::Test#setup.
        
      183. 
      
        
    183. 
          
          
          
        
      184. 
      
        
    184. 
          1
          
              def before _type = nil, &block
        
      185. 
      
        
    185. 
          
          
                define_method :setup do
        
      186. 
      
        
    186. 
          
          
                  super()
        
      187. 
      
        
    187. 
          
          
                  self.instance_eval(&block)
        
      188. 
      
        
    188. 
          
          
                end
        
      189. 
      
        
    189. 
          
          
              end
        
      190. 
      
        
    190. 
          
          
          
        
      191. 
      
        
    191. 
          
          
              ##
        
      192. 
      
        
    192. 
          
          
              # Define an 'after' action. Inherits the way normal methods should.
        
      193. 
      
        
    193. 
          
          
              #
        
      194. 
      
        
    194. 
          
          
              # NOTE: +type+ is ignored and is only there to make porting easier.
        
      195. 
      
        
    195. 
          
          
              #
        
      196. 
      
        
    196. 
          
          
              # Equivalent to Minitest::Test#teardown.
        
      197. 
      
        
    197. 
          
          
          
        
      198. 
      
        
    198. 
          1
          
              def after _type = nil, &block
        
      199. 
      
        
    199. 
          
          
                define_method :teardown do
        
      200. 
      
        
    200. 
          
          
                  self.instance_eval(&block)
        
      201. 
      
        
    201. 
          
          
                  super()
        
      202. 
      
        
    202. 
          
          
                end
        
      203. 
      
        
    203. 
          
          
              end
        
      204. 
      
        
    204. 
          
          
          
        
      205. 
      
        
    205. 
          
          
              ##
        
      206. 
      
        
    206. 
          
          
              # Define an expectation with name +desc+. Name gets morphed to a
        
      207. 
      
        
    207. 
          
          
              # proper test method name. For some freakish reason, people who
        
      208. 
      
        
    208. 
          
          
              # write specs don't like class inheritance, so this goes way out of
        
      209. 
      
        
    209. 
          
          
              # its way to make sure that expectations aren't inherited.
        
      210. 
      
        
    210. 
          
          
              #
        
      211. 
      
        
    211. 
          
          
              # This is also aliased to #specify and doesn't require a +desc+ arg.
        
      212. 
      
        
    212. 
          
          
              #
        
      213. 
      
        
    213. 
          
          
              # Hint: If you _do_ want inheritance, use minitest/test. You can mix
        
      214. 
      
        
    214. 
          
          
              # and match between assertions and expectations as much as you want.
        
      215. 
      
        
    215. 
          
          
          
        
      216. 
      
        
    216. 
          1
          
              def it desc = "anonymous", &block
        
      217. 
      
        
    217. 
          
          
                block ||= proc { skip "(no tests defined)" }
        
      218. 
      
        
    218. 
          
          
          
        
      219. 
      
        
    219. 
          
          
                @specs ||= 0
        
      220. 
      
        
    220. 
          
          
                @specs += 1
        
      221. 
      
        
    221. 
          
          
          
        
      222. 
      
        
    222. 
          
          
                name = "test_%04d_%s" % [ @specs, desc ]
        
      223. 
      
        
    223. 
          
          
          
        
      224. 
      
        
    224. 
          
          
                undef_klasses = self.children.reject { |c| c.public_method_defined? name }
        
      225. 
      
        
    225. 
          
          
          
        
      226. 
      
        
    226. 
          
          
                define_method name, &block
        
      227. 
      
        
    227. 
          
          
          
        
      228. 
      
        
    228. 
          
          
                undef_klasses.each do |undef_klass|
        
      229. 
      
        
    229. 
          
          
                  undef_klass.send :undef_method, name
        
      230. 
      
        
    230. 
          
          
                end
        
      231. 
      
        
    231. 
          
          
          
        
      232. 
      
        
    232. 
          
          
                name
        
      233. 
      
        
    233. 
          
          
              end
        
      234. 
      
        
    234. 
          
          
          
        
      235. 
      
        
    235. 
          
          
              ##
        
      236. 
      
        
    236. 
          
          
              # Essentially, define an accessor for +name+ with +block+.
        
      237. 
      
        
    237. 
          
          
              #
        
      238. 
      
        
    238. 
          
          
              # Why use let instead of def? I honestly don't know.
        
      239. 
      
        
    239. 
          
          
          
        
      240. 
      
        
    240. 
          1
          
              def let name, &block
        
      241. 
      
        
    241. 
          
          
                name = name.to_s
        
      242. 
      
        
    242. 
          
          
                pre, post = "let '#{name}' cannot ", ". Please use another name."
        
      243. 
      
        
    243. 
          
          
                methods = Minitest::Spec.instance_methods.map(&:to_s) - %w[subject]
        
      244. 
      
        
    244. 
          
          
                raise ArgumentError, "#{pre}begin with 'test'#{post}" if
        
      245. 
      
        
    245. 
          
          
                  name =~ /\Atest/
        
      246. 
      
        
    246. 
          
          
                raise ArgumentError, "#{pre}override a method in Minitest::Spec#{post}" if
        
      247. 
      
        
    247. 
          
          
                  methods.include? name
        
      248. 
      
        
    248. 
          
          
          
        
      249. 
      
        
    249. 
          
          
                define_method name do
        
      250. 
      
        
    250. 
          
          
                  @_memoized ||= {}
        
      251. 
      
        
    251. 
          
          
                  @_memoized.fetch(name) { |k| @_memoized[k] = instance_eval(&block) }
        
      252. 
      
        
    252. 
          
          
                end
        
      253. 
      
        
    253. 
          
          
              end
        
      254. 
      
        
    254. 
          
          
          
        
      255. 
      
        
    255. 
          
          
              ##
        
      256. 
      
        
    256. 
          
          
              # Another lazy man's accessor generator. Made even more lazy by
        
      257. 
      
        
    257. 
          
          
              # setting the name for you to +subject+.
        
      258. 
      
        
    258. 
          
          
          
        
      259. 
      
        
    259. 
          1
          
              def subject &block
        
      260. 
      
        
    260.

      261. 
      
        
    261. 
          
          
              end
        
      262. 
      
        
    262. 
          
          
          
        
      263. 
      
        
    263. 
          1
          
              def create name, desc # :nodoc:
        
      264. 
      
        
    264. 
          
          
                cls = Class.new(self) do
        
      265. 
      
        
    265. 
          
          
                  @name = name
        
      266. 
      
        
    266. 
          
          
                  @desc = desc
        
      267. 
      
        
    267. 
          
          
          
        
      268.

                  nuke_test_methods!
        
      269.

      275.

              def name # :nodoc:

      278. 
      
        
    278.

      279.

      281.

                name # Can't alias due to 1.8.7, not sure why

              ##
        
      288. 
      
        
    288. 
          
          
              # Rdoc... why are you so dumb?
        
      289. 
      
        
    289. 
          
          
          
        
      290. 
      
        
    290. 
          1
          
              module InstanceMethods
        
      291. 
      
        
    291. 
          
          
                ##
        
      292. 
      
        
    292. 
          
          
                # Takes a value or a block and returns a value monad that has
        
      293. 
      
        
    293. 
          
          
                # all of Expectations methods available to it.
        
      294. 
      
        
    294. 
          
          
                #
        
      295. 
      
        
    295. 
          
          
                #   _(1 + 1).must_equal 2
        
      296. 
      
        
    296. 
          
          
                #
        
      297. 
      
        
    297. 
          
          
                # And for blocks:
        
      298. 
      
        
    298. 
          
          
                #
        
      299. 
      
        
    299. 
          
          
                #   _ { 1 + "1" }.must_raise TypeError
        
      300. 
      
        
    300. 
          
          
                #
        
      301. 
      
        
    301. 
          
          
                # This method of expectation-based testing is preferable to
        
      302. 
      
        
    302. 
          
          
                # straight-expectation methods (on Object) because it stores its
        
      303. 
      
        
    303. 
          
          
                # test context, bypassing our hacky use of thread-local variables.
        
      304. 
      
        
    304. 
          
          
                #
        
      305. 
      
        
    305. 
          
          
                # NOTE: At some point, the methods on Object will be deprecated
        
      306. 
      
        
    306. 
          
          
                # and then removed.
        
      307. 
      
        
    307. 
          
          
                #
        
      308. 
      
        
    308. 
          
          
                # It is also aliased to #value and #expect for your aesthetic
        
      309. 
      
        
    309. 
          
          
                # pleasure:
        
      310. 
      
        
    310. 
          
          
                #
        
      311. 
      
        
    311. 
          
          
                #         _(1 + 1).must_equal 2
        
      312. 
      
        
    312. 
          
          
                #     value(1 + 1).must_equal 2
        
      313. 
      
        
    313. 
          
          
                #    expect(1 + 1).must_equal 2
        
      314. 
      
        
    314. 
          
          
          
        
      315. 
      
        
    315. 
          1
          
                def _ value = nil, &block
        
      316. 
      
        
    316. 
          
          
                  Minitest::Expectation.new block || value, self
        
      317. 
      
        
    317. 
          
          
                end
        
      318. 
      
        
    318. 
          
          
          
        
      319. 
      
        
    319. 
          1
          
                alias value _
        
      320. 
      
        
    320. 
          1
          
                alias expect _
        
      321. 
      
        
    321. 
          
          
          
        
      322. 
      
        
    322. 
          1
          
                def before_setup # :nodoc:
        
      323. 
      
        
    323. 
          
          
                  super
        
      324. 
      
        
    324. 
          
          
                  Thread.current[:current_spec] = self
        
      325. 
      
        
    325. 
          
          
                end
        
      326. 
      
        
    326. 
          
          
              end
        
      327. 
      
        
    327. 
          
          
          
        
      328. 
      
        
    328. 
          1
          
              def self.extended obj # :nodoc:
        
      329. 
      
        
    329. 
          1
          
                obj.send :include, InstanceMethods
        
      330. 
      
        
    330. 
          
          
              end
        
      331. 
      
        
    331. 
          
          
            end
        
      332. 
      
        
    332. 
          
          
          
        
      333. 
      
        
    333. 
          1
          
            extend DSL
        
      334. 
      
        
    334. 
          
          
          
        
      335. 
      
        
    335. 
          1
          
            TYPES = DSL::TYPES # :nodoc:
        
      336. 
      
        
    336. 
          
          
          end
        
      337. 
      
        
    337. 
          
          
          
        
      338. 
      
        
    338. 
          1
          
          require "minitest/expectations"
        
      339. 
      
        
    339. 
          
          
          
        
      340. 
      
        
    340. 
          1
          
          class Object # :nodoc:
        
      341.

          1

      342. 
      
        
    342.

      53. 
      
        
    53.

              def self.parallelize_me!

      60.

              ##
        
      61. 
      
        
    61. 
          
          
              # Returns all instance methods starting with "test_". Based on
        
      62. 
      
        
    62. 
          
          
              # #test_order, the methods are either sorted, randomized
        
      63. 
      
        
    63. 
          
          
              # (default), or run in parallel.
        
      64. 
      
        
    64. 
          
          
          
        
      65. 
      
        
    65. 
          1
          
              def self.runnable_methods
        
      66. 
      
        
    66. 
          31
          
                methods = methods_matching(/^test_/)
        
      67. 
      
        
    67. 
          
          
          
        
      68. 
      
        
    68. 
          31
          
                case self.test_order
        
      69. 
      
        
    69. 
          
          
                when :random, :parallel then
        
      70. 
      
        
    70. 
          31
          
                  max = methods.size
        
      71. 
      
        
    71. 
          37
          
                  methods.sort.sort_by { rand max }
        
      72. 
      
        
    72. 
          
          
                when :alpha, :sorted then
        
      73. 
      
        
    73. 
          
          
                  methods.sort
        
      74. 
      
        
    74. 
          
          
                else
        
      75. 
      
        
    75. 
          
          
                  raise "Unknown test_order: #{self.test_order.inspect}"
        
      76. 
      
        
    76. 
          
          
                end
        
      77. 
      
        
    77. 
          
          
              end
        
      78. 
      
        
    78.

              module LifecycleHooks
